By Analysing both side,Zoos are remarkable ground but it cant justify pleasant atmosphere which is prioritized matter to have quality life for species.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'People believe that Generation Z (1997-2007) are more dishonest than previous generations. What is the reasons for this? Is this a positive or a negative development?' 
 'Text': 'Many people convey that honesty has degraded among Generation Z (1997-2007) compared to the earlier generations. This has been occuring due to current condition whereby integrity is not regarded as important as accomplishment and thus, this development can be considered as negative.

Younger generations born within a decade after 1997 tend to have distinctive needs to achieve certain level of competencies. To exemplify, instead of only graduating from school, those who have specific ability are likely to be chosen by employer or recruiter and to attain that position, they can justify any means. Additionally, the advancement of technology has enabled today's people to cheat without being caught off-guard along related selection process.

This phenomenon is definitely backwards for human character. Decades ago, some authoritative figures in morality like Nelson Mandela and Mahatma Gandhi have emphasized the importance of being generous and truthful. Irrespective the cherised condition, without integrity it all will be useless at the end of the day. Many scientific studies have also proven that honest people have more tendency to be successful compared to those who grow a habit to cheat. It is clear that the more dishonest a generation, the less their chance to succeed. 

To reiterate, there is a belief whereby Generation Z tends to be more dishonest than previous generation as they are forced by current challenges. Entering spiral condition, making dishonesty as drawback for their own development.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people around the world use social media everyday to keep in touch with other people and get news events.Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Various individuals around the globe use social media to contact with diffrent people and update on news event.This author believes that the advantages of using a wide and flexible form of communication media outweighs the disadvantage which are the risks of cyberware and fraud.

Social media provide plenty of benefits to its users.Specifically, it allow user to chat and view social events online.As an useful form of communication, users can contat people nearly everywhere and save them time and money.Therefore, they are able to be more flexible in any situation that require world wide scale communication or in a hurry of informing somebody something

In contrast to this, using an online form of communication can face the risk of cyberware.Online media is an easily accessable forms of communication which can attract unwanted individual to leak private chats, phising and cyber attacks.In addition, many social news can be faked in order to distract people to fulfill the needs of the people who fake the news.

In conclusion, while using social media could likely to encounter cyberware and fraud as drawbacks it is outweighed by the advantages of the flexibility and wide rage that social media can assist people with.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Write about the advantages and disadvantages of independent learning' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, most high school and university students tend to study on their own. Self study is a kind of independent learning in which students learn at home without a teacher. However it has many pros and cons that need to be considered 

First of all, self-study gives learners more freedom and their own study space which makes them comfortable and easier to absorb more knowledge. Secondly, self-study might be a good chance to help students to be responsible as they have to set particular goals and detailed plans for their achievement. Besides, it makes them believe that they can complete tasks given.

On the other hand, learners may face some problems. First, almost students got used to having teachers provide them with knowledge. Therefore, when they are self-studying, it will be quite time-consuming as they have to find suitable learning methods to follow. Second, just studying through books or on the Internet leads  learners to lack a chance to apply practical skills to their life.

In conclusion, independent learning has both advantages and disadvantages. Learners should understand them clearly in order to minimise the drawbacks. In that way, their learning progress will be better and their horizons will be broadened.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people around the world use social media everyday to keep in touch with other people and get new events. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages ?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, many individuals all over the world keep in touch with other people and get new events by using social medias every day . Despite the rise of social medias, the benefits of using social transports outweigh the disadvantages.

On the one hand, social media offers a platform for self-expression and creativity through sharing of content such as articles, videos, and photos. This means that people can access to many kind of social platforms like Facebook, Messenger and Zalo, so they can easily share the enjoyable moment by images or talking with their friends online. 

 On the other hand, It also potential for addiction and overuse, leading to issues like decreased productivity, sleep disturbances, and negative impacts on mental health. This is because, there are too much information in the global community, therefore some people spend the whole time of their life to update social problems in the internet. For example, many young people are using too much social platforms to chat or discuss but they don’t want to go outside and enjoy the life.

In conclusion, social medias can help people to keep in touch with others and update information swiftly. However, governments should encourage them not to overuse.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.

Furthermore, the children_whose not enter upon take care from their parents in their growing up, will have detrimental effects when they reach adulthood. In conclusion, the advantages when send children to boarding school are not negative, the disadvantages have more repercussions make people worry.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many museums charge for admission while others are free.

Do you think the advantages of charginig poeple for admission to museums outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Museums obtain the valuable history items from our ancestors. Some individuals argue that it should be free for the citizens to enter museums and it is unethicak to charge poeple for aiming to learb about history. Whilst, others believe that it is appropriate to pay fees to visit it due to the retaining of all those valuable items.

From the view of people who are againist the museum charges have the rights to gaih knowledge about the past without having pressure to pay.

On the other hand, museums are not only a display of history, but a big source of economic development. Furthermore, in well-known travel destinations it is commin for them to have high fees for entry to the museums. In recent years, especially after pandemic, the number of tourists are expanding constantly every year. Since the main goal of the travelers is to understand the country's culture and traditions, museum is the primary factor that will offer them that. For visitors taking photos or videos and sharing it to the internet will be a free advertisement for the country to attract more tourists.

In conclusion, I believe that even though its is vital for the citizens to have freedom to visit museums amd learn the history, the benefits of the museum that can have, outweighs the drawbacks'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think in order to continually improve the quality of education, high school students should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers. Others feel that this would result in a loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion' 
 'Text': 'In recent days, improving the quality of education can culminate in a loss of reliabilty and direction in the class. However, some others believw otherwise, which l completely agree with. This essay will discuss both the challenges and the benefits of improving the educational quality followed by a resoned conclusion thereafter.

Those on the other side of the argument say that the continuous academic enhancements can intrude  their self-esteem and self- awarness. In the classroom. students learn how to live our life efficiently by communicating with peers and teachers, while concentrating only in continually enhancing the educational quality and comparing between high-score and low-score can decline the courage of convictions and self-cognitive thinking. 

l agree with this argument because it can evaluate life lessons. teachers are professionals to indicate students how you go through in the future and offer exquisitive lessons. they have been regarded as role models in terms of ensuring students' living skills as well as indication skills. Moreover, being taught with them can help to avoid criticism and pessimistic thinking. aware of what is a good way to improve their personal skills. Take, For example, A Francehigh school survey incated that encouraging of teachers and indications of life-lessons wide their cognitive skills and reach full potential.

In conclusion, high school students should be encouraged their teachers in order to evaluate their cognitive skills, l believe it is best to grant them the improving quality because thet are more likely to affect teachers' help.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays many people choose to be self-employed, rather than to wor for a company or organistaion.

 'Text': 'These days many people may prefer to work or be self-employed instead of working for companys or organistaions,this step have some disadvantages and advantages.In this essay i will put forward some of the advantages and disadvantages of being self-employed these days.

    many people started to choose to be self-employed due to some reasons.However,this step have it is own disadvantages.Being self-employed means that you do not have stable income.For example artists or freelancers,for a period of time they might have 0 income or low income.That will affect them in many ways.For example, if they have families or rent to pay,in that period of time they will struggle with their financial situation.

     On the other hand, people choose to be self employed due to their freedom and time.they prefer to be in control and be bosses their own work.for example, many atrists like to work at night or for short time without any reponspilities.Furthermore, they might prerfer spend much time on other things such as families,hoppies,sports.

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:

 'Text': 'In the recent year lots of economical expenditure using to study on space project in yearly. most of the individual presenting their thought that  all expenditure  can  utilize in  the development of living life of human being in this planet. behalf of this statement, I am standing on the part of agree and my discussion  explaining my opinion with an example.

firstmost in this planet lots of countries where people donot afford one time food for their families due to the poverty,if we take example of African region ,lots of people is strugling to arrange two times food to feed their children ,because country government has not  sufficient budget to improve their life or help them, so instead of expending finance to space project study that amount can be elavate their life if we suppport or donate that money for their government for the peple of Africa.

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people around the world use social media everyday to keep in touch with other people and get news events. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'In today's digital age, social media plays an important of individuals's life all over the world to contact with other people and get news events. This author argues that the benefits of communication and getting news events outweigh the drawback of internet distraction.

The most advantageous factor of social media is that it allows people to communicate with other people such as family members, friends or some guys that regardless of geographical distances. Social media platforms provide convenient communication, From the mentioned knowledge, the attraction of Facebook and Instagram has increased and had a great impact on people all over the world. They can stay in touch with their friends and make friends with strangers.

Another point of view just also be considered that social media serves as a powerful tool for staying informed about new events. With the ability to follow new outlets and journalists, user can access a constant stream of updates on current events. Additionally, social media allows for the rapid dissemination of information, enabling users to share news articles and important updates with their networks.

However, one of the fears is the internet distraction. Because of the attraction and entertainment of social sites that people can be addicted . This may be true, but by entertaining it will encourage them to relax and refresh their mind. Consequently, people should use it in a healthy and balanced way.

Taking all points into account, the communication and getting new events is outweigh the internet distraction.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Describe your home

When you write, you can mention the following:

Where is it

Different kinds of rooms

Details of each room

Choose the below set of words while writing the essay.

Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room, Hall, Kitchen, Toilet, Basement, Lift, Garden, Study, Dining Table, Wardrobe, Cupboard, Sofa, Bookcase, Shower, Dishwasher, Washing Machine.' 
 'Text': 'Most of us have a home and we like to decorate our homes according to our taste. A home unlike a house contains feelings, emotions, love and care.

My home is located in the Port Louis which is the capital of Mauritius. It is situated near a range of Mountains and we have access to various facilities and amenities in the area. My home consists of one master bedroom, one living room, a kitchen, study room and toilet and bathroom. The master bedroom contains lots of space and includes a bed and a wardrobe. In addition, it contains a sofa bed which I use when my families come to stay at my place. The master bedroom also consists of laminated flooring which is very important in winter seasons. My living room includes a set of sofa and a television set. It is used to welcome guest and also during my resting time. It also includes the dining table because I like to take my diner and watch television at the same time. Moreover, i have an American kitchen which is connected with my living room. My kitchen contains a fridge, an oven, a dish washer and cupboard to keep my provisions. Finally, I have a small sized toilet and a bathroom. The bathroom includes my washing machine, bathtub and shower.

We all like our home'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Plastic bags, plastic bottles and plastic packaging are bad for the environment.What damage does plastic do to the environment? What can be done by government and individuals to solve this problem?' 
 'Text': 'Plastic instruments, bottles, bags, packaging damage a lot for the environment. Nowadays, we have a lot of manufacturing farms. Besides, garbage is everywhere surrounding us and it causes to air more polluted.

To begin with, the plastic products are impacting dangerously to the nature.The plastic is made of glass so the plastic can last long like years even decades and this impact to our surrounding hazardously, as well as, causing less effecient for living. The prime example of how this scheme work work is when plastic is burn, air will contaminated with toxic oxygen also animals and water too.In fact, plastic manafucture causes overconsumption and people determined to burn debris of plastic in 2018 putting a new record of pollution.

Currently, population have to understand these global conserns that causing health problems such as lung cancer or headaches.In addition to prevent this schemes in cities, government should put an punishment or fines for throwing rubbish in the streets,if ministry confirm this rule our world would be better and less polluted.As an example Tashkent is a city where rate of air quality worse to breathe due to the car conjection or green house gas.If we utilize this sort of method it will enhance environmental well-being.

In my conception,items which involved with plastic should be abandoned,in this case government put a strict laws for decluttering plastic from areas where people live as well as lower manafucturing plastic bags'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Smoking is a major cause of serious illness and death throughout the world today. In the interest of the public health, goverentments should ban cigarettes and other tobacco products

To what extend do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, smoking is global problem in the world and this is very unhealthy for humans' body.Smoking is a vital issue of sickness and dangerous illness now. Besides, ministry ought to forbid cigarettes and baccy goods.In the following statement, governments should  ban tobacco produces and we will not use cigarettes. 

   On the one hand, I partly agree. There are several good points smoking cigarettes. It can be resistant to brain's cancer also other serious illness. The prime example of how this scheme work my uncle. He is cancer and he has been suffering for 4 years. Because of this, smoking cigars for him become daily usage of product and this habit decrease to increase the cancer.

Moreover, my uncle takes this advice from exprerienced doctors. Nonetheless, smoking tobacco is do not stop develop cancer only reduce this illnesses. 

   On the other hand,I partly disagree. Nicotine is very dangeruos for people's body. Smoking causes cancer, heart disease, stroke, lung diseases, diabetes,chronic obstructive pulmonary disease,insomnia. Sometimes nicotine decrease memory. In fact,every year,more than 480000 people die in the United States America, due to,tobacco-related  diseases around 1 in 5 of all deaths according to the American Cancer Society. Also smoking can increase the likelihood of having a stroke by 2-4 times. Strokes can cause brain damage and death.

   To sum up, there are much bad points than good points. So, I disagree. In addition to, nicotine reduces cancer, however, its drawbacks a lot and we must do not use tobacco products.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that study is the best way to get news while others think that hang out is better for this purpose. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Reading and watching the news is better to keep themselves up to date about the surroundings. A portion of the society thinks that reading is the best way to ware about news. However, others believe that having discussion with friends about current affairs is more affective Way. In my perception,  not only Reading is a good way for in depth knowledge, but casual discussion with friends is also a one of the good ways for getting news. 

 To begin with,  No doubt Reading is a way to keep themselves abreast about everyday happening, as it not only assists in enhancing our reading skills, but also helps in getting the in-depth knowledge about news.  Studying is no doubt involves engaging with a structured manners. It also involves information from different sources. 

On the other hand, Hanging out with friends, familiy makes us able to have casual discussion, Hence, everyone can share different perspective. Also, Some people think that, studying is a time consuming. Sometimes, it doesn't capture the immediacy of current events. 

In my opinion,  only Reading is not enough for keeping ourselves up-to-date about happening, but discussing current events with family or friends is also a affective Way.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'With the technological development, some people think technology reduce crime, but some people think it encourage crime. To what extent do you agree or disagree and give your own opinion' 
 'Text': 'it is widely accepted that due to the technological developmet, there is a tremendous consequences to contribute to decline the rate of crime. some people insist that high advanced devices such as laptops, smartphones as well as 24 hours security camera conducive to decreasing the crime trend, while othes illustrate that highly devised procedures can encroach persons' private lives. ln this resources, there are plausible arguments that technological advancements lead to ilegal.

on top of that, accrding to a poll by Center for survellience of technological device, the majority of respondents ranked the dreadness over protectness when asked about the things that brought the most satisfaction to their personal security. Also, when asked separately whether being with 24 hours survellience cameras brings about an invasion of personal rights, an overwhelming 78% claimed to experience more stress than pleasure when it comes to technological devices absolutely  intrude their whole lives.

Furthermore, people depict that it could encourage bad effects to supervise their personal apperance and self-awarness. Take France for example, where some cities undergo a serious problem, which some people hide their hidden dimunitive cameras in womens' toilet to take a pictures for women's body parts,while preservation of personal privacy indicated in constitution. 

To sum up, while there ate some advantages to reducing crime, it is imperative to recognize that the dtawbacks of invasion outweigh the benefits.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the fight against crime, police forces and governments are increaseasingly using security cameras in public places. Some people are opposed to this, saying that it invades our privacy' 
 'Text': 'Currently, crime among individuals are significantly increased in many countries. The society and police forces are utilising special cameras a lot. Many people dare to demand that this against their personal rights. I am going to discuss both views with many relevant examples.

From one perspective, I think that using special cameras in local places is beneficial for finding the person that commetital crime because great deal of people know that criminalism are increased rapidly in well-rounded and cuttung-edge countries. As a result, the police and government are obleged to user cameras for solving this problem. Such as, when the criminals stole the items in a shop, they are getting on a camera. Therefore, I believe that utilising a lot of cameras in local areas can be  usefull from one angle.

On the other hand, I regard this using security cameras in local places are effected their personal rights because criminals can not steal things everywhere. But, in the popular places, in the huge supermarkets and other prominent places are crucial for cameras to be fixed instead of setting the cameras everywhere. For instance, If you meet with your friends or your relatives secretively, the cameras monitore yourselves. As a result, the police can monitor your action. Moreover, they may save it into the computers memory. So, I think that using cameras at the local areas can be invading our privacy.

To conclude, I hope that utilising great deal of special cameras can be against our personal rights'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many countries have embraced tourisma as a way to boost their economies and create jobs for local residents. However, some argue that tourism can have negative impacts on the environment and local cultures.

What are the advantages and disadvantages of tourism for a country?' 
 'Text': 'Tourism in many countries have grown for several years and this is as a great way to develop their nation's economies, whereas  some believe that it can damage local cultures and the environment. While there are some advantages of this, I believe that negatives should be taken into account. 

On the one hand, there several advantages of tourism. One of the main advantages can provide a popular leisure activity and people enrich experience with travelling opens our minds. If you have some ideas. For example, you can see different animals, landscape and visit to special place  such as mountain, beach, overseas. Moreover, you may be able to go to the museum and begin the growth of your mind. 

On the other hand, although mentioned positives, there are several disadvantages of tourism. One of the major disadvantages of it is that tourism can have a negatives  effects on the natural environment. For instance, tourists may be damaged local sites with rubbing of different things. Moreover, one of the most major negatives is that our local cultures are affected by tourists.

In conclusion, I believe that there are several benefits of tourism. However,           advantages of this may be able to outweigh the disadvantages. In other words, government should develop tourism as a income source to improve financial problems. Nonetheless, government do not have to harm to natural environment and local cultures.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people choose the travel abroad to learn a foreign language instead of studying in their home town .

What are the advantages and disadvantages of this?' 
 'Text': 'Some people are leaving their cities and the reason for this is that they are leaving in order to learn a foreign language. While there are some benefits of this learning, we should not forget about its potential disadvantages. 

On the one hand, many people are leaving to abroad because learn to other languages. Definitely, this is good improvement because they bring good experience other cities. If many people learn a foreign language, it is a benefit for their country. It can also be good experience for the young generation. By traveling and studying abroad, they can easily understand the people of other countries. For instance, my friend studied at the abroad also she is easily speaking the people of other countries. Besides that, foreign languages have many benefits for life. 

On the other hand, there are disadvantages to learning a language while traveling . In this case they have to leave their home town for learning. If they like there and stay, it is large loss for their country. That is , number of people will decrease. It can also cause their family members to stay alone. For example,my neighbor leaved to abroad for learning then his family members remained alone. However he isn't come to home town.

In conclusion, some people travel to another country to study a foreign language instead of studying in their home town. Nevertheless most people could not tell whether this was good or bad.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'How do changes in population growth and urbanisation relate to the industrial revolution' 
 'Text': 'Industrial Revolution is the process of change from traditional economy to one dominated by industry and machine manufacturing. These technological changes introduced novel ways of working and living and fundamentally transformed society. 

Industrial revolution impacts economies whereby mass production and assembly lines replace manual and specialized labourers. This process has historically led to urbanization by creating economic growth and job opportunities that draw people to cities. When there is economic growth, the standard of living of people rises and this attracts people to come and work in cities. For example, I live in the City of Mauritius, and we have witnessed revolution in the textiles industry where modern equipments are being used. Thus, people are tempted to come and work in this industry and they are given on the job training to work with new machines and they also receive an interesting package in terms of salary and other benefits. For example, my city has seen a considerable increased in workers coming to work from different regions as they receive a good pay, enjoy a good working environment and it is easier for them to work on machines in order to increase productivity. However, this process has led to a population growth and people have started to live in the City. This means that there is more pollution, heavy traffic and sewerage problems. Furthermore, these industries dumped their waste in rivers causing problems to marine life.

Induatr'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'How do changes in population growth and urbanisation relate to the industrial revolution.' 
 'Text': 'The Industrial Revolution is wholly responsible for population growth and urbanisation.

This urbanisation occurred because of the new factories that were developing and being built and these factories needed a labour force to allow then to produce their commodities, which in turn saw people migrating from the rural areas to the towns and cities.

The job opportunities the factories created as well as the higher wages they offered,  plus healthier diets due to the affordability, saw more and more people melding together to create these larger urban communities.

However, all these new bigger communities being created didn’t come without its problems.

Such huge industrial expansion and population growth created a massive and radical change to these new bigger urban areas, with noise from increased traffic and traffic jams, which in turn created air pollution and health issues. Poor sanitation and slum living also became commonplace.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'An increasing number of people are buying what they need online. What are the advantages and disadvantages for both individual and companies shopping online .' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays the trend of shopping online is more interested. The pros and cons of buying online will be illustrated in the following parragraph from both point of view consist of an individual and companies.

           To begin with, there have several discount ,which they got from application. For example , Lazada app alway gives 50 percent discount coupoun to their customers in each months and in some months they give a free deliver counpon as well.These campaigns encourage buyer to purchase more goods.

           On the other hand, customers can be cheated more easily from buying online. The advertisement usually fake because the source of it is not be verified properly. The scammer often scams elder ,child and adolescent who is they favourite prey.

           The next point of view, the companies also have convenience from this invention. Producers can promote their product more easily such as in the TV and in the page advertisement.

           Although, the convenient from selling online is several,  the deliver to all of the variety ccustomers is much harder. The sellers ,who do not get some attention from app, get a higher capital thus a price is getting higher than compaines who use the application.Since applications help sellers handle with this problem.If the price is high, the demand of customers will be declined.

           When coronavirus pandemic occurs both customers and sellers likely to use online as a tool to buy what they need.The easily from online help people from both point of view.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'some people say that parents should place restrictions on the hours of their children spend watching TV and playing computer games, and encourage them to spend this time reading books instead' 
 'Text': 'It would be better if folks put an effort to prevent their children from wasting their valuabe time on watching animations or playing video gamesand encourage them to keep in touch with books where they can get knowledge.In the following statement, i will get my point more further on.

To begin with .I completely agreewith consemptions about educaion rather than consuming time on TV programmes, because as a result of envolving on games youngesters usually harm their eyesight, staying away from social world, as well as, lose contact between their relatives. Another pros sides are they may face difficulties in case of improving social and acedemic development, also there are some possibilities to get engaged in cyber crimes.

Neverthless, it is true that reading books has some benefits for people, mostly young ones.Within reading book adults can extend their horizon of mindfulness simultaneously enhance critical imginations.Furthermore, there is a belief that teens who screw themselves with reading books are usually overtake their peers and they are more active in society.

In my conclusion, our social atmosphere improves if teenagers and young children get involved with reading novels compare to TV or virtual games, they an aso achieve their destiny in future and beuld successful career and live with meaningful life'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Education is not a luxury,but a basic human right and as such should be free for everyone irrespective of personal wealth. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'The pursuit of knowledge is the most generic thing for mankind in the 21st century. Therefore, it must be of no cost regardless of the monetary status of the individuals.I strongly advocate with the view that study should be free for all.

To commence with, it will aid poor children to pursue their studies till the time they want to. For example, many adolescents tend to leave they schools at a young age as their parents cannot afford their expenses. Furthermore, learning without any cost can lead students to improve their family conditions by securing a decent a job.Lastly, everybody in the nation will have certain basic human manners which inturn will help the society in long run.

On the other hand, some members claim that education is only for those having good income levels. But,it cannot be denied that only a minority of people are interested in this as knowledge is the basic epitome of community since ages. For example, most community members are worried about the future of the nation and are assuming the consequences which can be faced in future due to not acquiring adequate education.Thus, the authority should treat everyone on the same scale and provide free educational facilities to all.

To conclude, in my opinion,I believe that world will be a better place to live, free from crimes if everybody is educated without spending a single penny of their owns.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is true that senior management positions are highly paid compared to other employees in business establishments. I belive that it is essential to be paid more salary for senior positions as they are play a vital  role for business development. This essay will delve into my viewpoints with relevant illustrations.' 
 'Text': 'It is true that senior management positions are highly paid compared to other employees in business establishments. I belive that it is essential to be paid more salary for senior positions as they are play a vital  role for business development. This essay will delve into my viewpoints with relevant illustrations.

First and foremost, one of the obvious reasons to be paid high salary for senior positions is the resposibilities and risks of the position what they are holding into. In other words, senior positions  in companies have responsbility for sustaining the company in the high-competative business world. For example, top management is formulating business and marketing strategies, therefore, they should be highly efficient and alert about the market fluctuations. For example, the famous entertainment company BlockBluster bankrupted due to the ineffcientcy of the senior management.

Furthermore, senior leaders have more personal expenses to run business compared to other employees. For example, they should wear expensive suits for business meetings and conferences which would not compensated by business establishments. Similarly, top managment people are the glamour faces of a business organisations, therfore, they should be paid more to attract more potential leaders to the organisation. Moreover, other employees in the oragnisation will be motivated  and they would work hard to achieve senior management positions. 

In conclusion, senior management positions have more responsbilities and risk compared to ordinary employees. Ergo, I believe that they have to be paid more remuneration to motivate others to reach top positions.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.

Some countries achieve international sports by building specialised facilities to train top athletes, instead of providing sports facilities that everyone can use. Do you think this is positive or negative development?

Discuss both views and give your opinion.

You should write at least 250 words.' 
 'Text': 'Undoubtedly , nations has changed the whole perspective towards athletes by offering advance sports facilities to top class players, whereas, other argued about not providing same condition to ordinary group. The essay will critically analyzed both perspective before presenting by owned opinion .

To commence, it is indisputable that providing advanced sports infrastructure will be proved more favourable to any country. First reason is elite players brings enormous pride to a nation and equipping them with best resources will encourage them to perform their best. . Adding here the seond point , the complex conditions can put these top individuals in a habit of delievering great results. This is because , tough conditions can instill one's courage, make players to face their fear , excel all techniques and in result delivering best scores in real time.

On the other hand, normal citizen can be benifitted in terms of great health. More sports centre nearby motivates everyone to indulge themselves in physical activity . Consequently, results in healthier surroundings. For instance, TOI survey revealed, 40% people agreed that practising a sport in everyday routine has offered them greater health results. In addition to this, this will foster more socialized environment. If more people participates in games they can stimulate friendlier and cooperative environment.

To conclude with , constructing better games complex will favour normal as well elite players, However , In my opinion, government should emphasize more on alotting these advanced tracks to world class players.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people nowadays live in societies where consumer goods are relatively cheap

Do you thing the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, many people choose do not spend money in expensive consumer goods in their societies live. I belive that there are more benifits than backdraws of this topic, there is my opinion below.

Firstly, there are some stuffs as clothes or bags cost high price due to the ingredients made by animals such as flu. Some people choose to buy these types of goods, because these goods make them looks richer and in a higher level than other normal people. But this choice damages other lives which may also impect the earth. Secondly, buying items in store normally charge higher price than buying online, because store need spend more money on rental or satff's salary.

On the other hand, there are more and more items what designer made by recycle ingredents as plastic bottol, glass and can. The function is same with the stuff which is not made by recycle ingredents, but the price is quite cheap. In addition, it is easy to shopping online and apply cheaper price. Also, younth people follow quick fashion now, so they can choose buying cheap goods and recycle or donate items after they do not need them. 

It is true that luxery items let us feel we are different with other people. But there are many goods with lower price bring the same feeling to us. The life you hold is not offer from items, it depend by yourself.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The plans below show a public park when it first opened in 1920 and the same park today.' 
 'Text': 'The pictures compare the development of Grange Park in 1920 to present times. 

Overall, there are dramatic changes at the area  throughout the time period. It has gone from public facilities to commercial area. 

Additonally, in the middle of the area in past time, there was a fountain which had removed and changed to rose garden surrounding with benchs. Moreover, in the southeast, the glasshouse had replaced with water feature. 

In the Northeast, the rose plants and pond for water plants were converted to cafe and children's play garden. The seats in most every corner had cleared. Furthermore, from the South entrance, in the left, there was a rose garden but now it have cleared. Also, the stage for musicians had reconstructured to be Amphitheatre for concerts which have increased in size. 

Although those are many evolutions, there is a field still remain. For example, the rose area next to the theatre still same throughout the times.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Do you think consumers should be responsible for their poor nutritional choices, or do

food manufacturers need to be more honest about the potential dangers in eating

certain foods which are high in salt, sugar and fat?' 
 'Text': 'Dietary habits have sparked considerable debate between consumers and manufacturers. While the perspectives vary widely among the two groups, I agree that both parties bear responsability for subpar food intake, as I would argue in this essay.

Firstly, a nutritious diet is often overlooked by consumers. This is because the majority of them prioritises the monetary aspect of food over nutrition and chooses cheap alternatives which are devoid of fundamental nutrients. These consumer's choices lead to obesity, diabetis or heart diseases, resulting in the low quality of lifestyle. Notably, the ratio of people choosing low-quality food covers a large segment of the adult population, as demonstrated by numerous studies.

The lack of adequate dietary choices is exagerbated by weak regolation oversigh. The manufacturers indeed fail to effectively communicate the amount of deleterious elements in foods and the deceptive labelling creates additional confusion among consumers. The excess of sugar or salt, used as preservatives in numerous foods, is often omitted from labelling; the same holds for fat and oils. The issue has created a controversial situation when, for example, several managerial personas have been arrested for fraud because of lack of transparency in their labelling system, which in turn created several cases of malnoutrition in the United States.

In conclusion, the lack of committment from consumers and the misleading labelling are jointly the major causes for malnoutrition among the adult population. Overall, I suggest reinforcing policies to labelling control and providing consumers with adequate information about dietary'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some socieries the number of crimes committed by teenagers is growing. Some people think that regardless of age, teenagers who commit major crimes should receive adilt punishment. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In recent years, juvenile crimes has been a topic of concern. A school of thought holds that punishment should be similar for all criminals who perpetrate a major crime, no matter of age. Personally, I totally disagree with this perspective for the rationale that follows. 

To begin with, it is a fact beyond dispute that youth crimes often commit a crime because of impilsive actions. In other worlds, juvenile crimes do not fully develop awareness that lead to lack of knowledge about the consequence. Acordingly, it can be inferred that majority of youth muder perpetrate because of negative influence from family and friends. Consequently, it is possible to juvenile crimes to be rehabilitated and changed way of thinking.

Another point is that there is no gain saying that using rehalibitation programmes to renovate youth crimes has more possitive approach. To be more specigic, rehalibitation programmes have many way that can educate young criminals. These methods can help teenagers who commit a crime reintegrate to the community and boarden oppotunity to . For example, counselling, vocational training are some ways that can be utilized to rehalibitate these teenagers. As a result, juvenile crimes will have a potential future.

   In view of the aforementioned arguments, my unshakable conviction is that juvenile offending who perpetrate a major crime should not receive as similar punishment as mature crime.'

input:

Do you agree and disagree?' 
 'Text': 'As you know, English is most widely used language in the world. There is a view that learning English is vital. While this initiative may be expensive to acquire and may be difficult people who live in countrysides, I believe the benefits - open doors living and studying and see the world. 

One concern regarding learning a second language can be an arm and a leg people that from low- income backgrounds. Therefore, they do not have enough funds for payment.

Another issue that people can not attend the courses, due to lack of public transport who live in out-of-towners. It is also impossible to work on the internet there if you want to make an effort online courses.

From my perspective, acquiring English brings about a number of advantages in your life . It will be cause you become more and more successfully. After receive International certificate such as IELTS gives a opportunity to pursue higher education an abroad. Furthermore, it helps getting a well-paid job at prestigious company.

In addition, you can travel anywhere you want . For instance, America, Canada, European and Asian countries and others. But most of the people choose European cities to go sightseeing, due to the engrossing scenery and also ancient monuments. And also English can help you communicate with people who are living there. By doing so , you broaden your horizons.

In conclusion , English is very significant and also it can open many door of opportunities in everyone's life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'as the world becomes technologically advanced, computers are replacing more and more jobs.

Describe some job positions that may be lost because of computers, and disciss at least one problem that may result' 
 'Text': 'As science and technology developed shaply, increasing number of job positions have been replaced by computers. Many social issues have risen due to lack of jobs.

Firstly, jobs that would be altenated most likely are repeated and falt types, like production line of factories. Computers can check every product swift and repeat checking without mistakes compared with humans. Secondly, jobs need magnificant energy and calculating ability could be replaced. It may take much time for humans to analyze massive numbers and complex mathmatics, while computer can do this in few minutes. Thirdly, some jobs have typical patterns can be learned by artifical intelegence such as translation. In the past translator played a significant role in communication among people come from different countries. Now, people can travel all over the world without the translator because of the computer.

Although it is a good thing that computer makes people's life more convinient and fast, some bad influences did happen. Lacking of jobs lead to lots of unemployed people who do not have salary for living and medical care, which would resulting in increasing death rate. Besides, large amount of unemployed people would trigger social chaos even violent events like robbing. Finally, the whole society would fall down.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The increasing popularity of online learning has led some to believe that traditional classroom learning will become obsolete. 

Do you agree with this view? Discuss both sides of the argument and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Online learning has becoming a big trend in today's society, hence it creates an argument whether old method of teaching in classroom will be outdated. In my point of view, I agree that virtual classrooms will eventually replace real ones. This essay will cover positives and negatives of online learning.

Studying through online platforms gives more opportunities to people that has limited access to current form of education. For example, those who need to work full-time are forced to apply for special program of bachelor degree that costs more, so distance learning on platforms allows them to have more choices in study. 

Moreover, it also provides an access to intructors and courses from various institutions around the world, which widen the perspectives and experiences of students by inter-cultural sharing in classes. 

However, the main drawback of learning online is the minimum requirement on devices to be used. Electronics, such as computers, headphones, internet, may cost a lot of money, while using lower quality devices may caused an inconvenient in studying, i.e. unstable connection during live sessions. 

In conclusion, the online studying provides more flexible style of studying, enable more people to learn, but it also need devices.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:

Finally,a computer in a young child's hand will be a stress-reducing engine that significantly prevents them from being overloaded.To put it simply,after an exhausting day,the children already sacrificed the whole day just to absorb the new ability to adjust their life with better soft and hard skills which drained their mental state.Thus,this will cause offspring to just want to relax and computers can greatly reduce the risk of this.

well great enough that having  technology in a child's hand can help them to create more and increase their mental life'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would be benefit both the individual teenagers and society as awhole. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, most of work is paid and teenagers do work in their days off or after scool, also, in the summer. However, I noticed that some teenagers do works which is unpaid. 

Actually, I do not think that adolescents must be required to do unpaid labour. By the reason of our country is free, they can do what they want, all population their own right to vote. Additionally, by being volunteer they do not have any profit and I guess, that majority of adolescents get to the certain job, due to they need some pocket money or even for supporting a family. In addition to this, most teenagers do not have enough time just for thier study. In my opinion, teenage time is the best period for studying, learning something new, improve your knowledge in certain sphere. 

By contrast, while teenagers do unpaid work, they can find their own way and future profession. By this point, I think, that volunteering is really useful activity for young people. Even, it will not be their future job, they would have exciting experience, furthermore, they understand that earning money is hard. In addition, most young people, find volunteering is fascinating. Moreover, having internship can be beneficial for getting to university. 

In conclusion, I would like to say that, having probation period is do useful in individualistic and society way. Likewise, I can say that there are more benefits that opposite.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The diagram showa how plastic bottles are recycled' 
 'Text': 'The process explains the way in which plastic bottles are recycled.

Overall, what stands out from the diagram is that the recycling of plastic bottles is a linear process that consists of several main stages,including use,sorting,cutting,washing,drying,boiling ,straining,weavening,rolling and reuse.

The procedure commences when plastic bottles are transferred to factories after they are used for some purposes.To subsequent this step, used bottles are sorted and those that can be recycled are cut into small pieces in the next stage.This is followed by washing these pieces to remove any residue after which clean bottle pieces are dried in the sun for 10 hours to remove moisture.After that,they are boiled high temperatures ,which concentrates it into liquid form and once boiling stage is over,they are poured into special pots in straining step.Next,yarn is produced through the use of liquid in pots before they are knitted using a special weavening machine.Finally,they are rolled and clothes are manufactured by means of them.After these products are reused,they go through the recycling procedure all over again.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The most important aim of science should be to improve people's lives. To what extent do you agree or disgaree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'It is debatable whether the most prominent aim of science is improving the lives of individuals or not. I generally agree with this point of view; however, its effect on nature should be taken into account. 

As humans are the most advanced species, their lives matter the most between other creatures and attending to their needs in a more comfortable way is paramount. With an aim to cause improvements, useful machinery can be produced to ensure the tranquility of people’s lives, this can be done by carrying out various experiments involving the creation of cutting-edge technology. 

However, prior statements do not take away the importance of the lives of other living beings which live in nature. In fact, various scientifical procedures carried out by scientists might be harmful to nature; one particular outcome is deforestation, coming hand in hand with soil erosion. Being an impactful source of materials, nature’s health is of major importance and should not be taken for granted.

In conclusion, as important is the improvement of people’s lives, the safety of nature is also of great importance. In fact taking care of nature by using science in a correct way can also lead to improvements regarding day-to-day life'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The efficientfunctioning o f society is based on rules and laws. Society would not function well if individuals were free to do whatever they wanted. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Society functions well if the individuals are free and do what they want to do is right up to some extent whereas it is important to impose strict rules and laws if government wants to make it a better place to live. Although, it is every citizen's responsibility to follow rules and regulations to run their surroundings smoothly. People claiming that the benefits it offers are no match for its drawbacks. 

I agree to the given notion as government has to impose stringent orders to make this world a better place.

Firstly, human rights are essential up to some extent as if pupils are not free, they will not be able to grow as in some countries humans do not have freedom to speech as we can take an example of Gaza where everything is ruined and public is surviving alot due to terrorist attacks. So, freedom is also necessary.

Secondly, some countries has very strict laws and this actually shaped people into good human beings. For instance, in Dubai if you are leaving your car windows open, nobody will steal your goods even if it costs millions of dollars as they cut hands of theives. So, I agree that it is important for the administration to force masses to follow legal codes.

To sum up, I agree that it is important for every country to land with some sort of harsh acts so that masses do not take benefit to hurt others.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, birth rates are falling and experts say that by 2050 these countries will have far more adults aged 65 and over than children under 15.

What problem might this cause in the future?

 'Text': 'Birth rates are falling down in some countries and experts forecast that in 2050 aged people far more than children under 15. This essay firstly say that population fall will might be a problem in future and then state that population growth is the probable solution. 

In the beginning, population fall might be show as a problem in future. If the population growth stop, the future will scarry. It will impact the population, in future the population growth may decrease dramatically, lack of young generation may be there are shortage of willpower and worker . Besides, the work field or job sector falling the shortage of working power and hire worker from other countries which give impact on financial sector as many currency goes out from country . For instance: A survey conduct with Human birth organization they found that lack of population growth may destroyed a nation in future. Uganda cast and it's population is a great example for everyone. 

However, population growth is the probable solution for this problem. Mother encourage to give birth children and this is the only one solution. Nowadays modern generation not interested to give birth more children than one but it is dangerous for population rate . If everyone should encourage to give birth more children the rate increase gradually and may fill-up the desire rate in future.

In conclusion, while the population rate face the problem as decreased population rate but the primary solution is that giving birth more children than one and it help to over come the problem.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.

to what extent do you agree od disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Technology has affeted the lives of human being in various ways, that is why, some masses commence that in upcoming era there will be more reliability on online news and it print media is going to extinct. I agree with this statement upto large extent but old generation may keep the printed newspapers alive.

To begin with, online news are trending in nowdays as it is quickly available to every individual beacuse everyone has mobile phone as well as laptop by which people get connected to internet. Moreover, every type of news is available on social media so everyone no longer bother to buy newspaper for current affairs. Also, Online news apps are created by news agencies to provide fresh update to individuals regarding the activities happening all aroung the world. For instance, iphone has top stories feature which provide news of all the channels.

However, there is a generation of people who has habbit of reading printed newspapers and magazines which makes a hope for print media to survive. additionally, newspapers are spending a lot to make their material interesting so that more people get attracted, such efforts may revive the printed media in furture.

In conclusion, no doubt that online news are going to rule over the minds in future but, grey hair generation will be habitual to convention news media.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries there are more young people choosing to enrol in work-based training instead of attending university.

Do the advantages of this situation outweigh the disadvantages?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, there are plenty of way to master a skill either by pursuing a degree or practice trainings. Both of it has their own strengths and weakness for future career. I personally would rather choose to study in university if compare to on job  hands on trainings.

First and foremost, bachelor degree provide a wide ranges oppourtunity to students. Company tend to give more salary to people who hold a degree. Freshgraduate will have career acceleration with their major since they will hold management position, such as supervisor or middle-management levels. However, disciples should take 4 years to finish their college which is a little longer than hands-on training.

On other side, to become a specialize in spesific tools or division, work-coaching based is more effective.  Pupils who dealing with an equipment directly generally will have a deep understanding on it. Nevertheless, these type learning methods have a narrow career path and low wage paid. Even the learning duration is shorter, work-based student will be located in blue collar positions by the company which hinder their career growth.

To sum up, university students take more time to study, but have a wider career opportunity. While coaching based-pupils is resembled to have a shorter duration, they blue colar positions have smaller career growth. At the end of the day, companies need freshgraduate as well as  hands on-based pupils to collaborate together in order to achieve company goals.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some students decide early in life to pursue vocational careers that involve cooking or baking. For them, it is better to study their chosen occupations in high school rather than regular subjects.

To what extent do you agree of disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, after leaving school some like to go to university, while others enjoy going to vocational school because of the following benefits. the most important advantage is that vocational education provides a shorter of study. For example, if you are keen on vocational training, you will have the job sooner than the university. Another strength is that vocational school helps us develop practical skills. For instance, while we study at a vocational academy, we will do apprenticeship many times. It is very useful because it helps us gain experience and develop our practical skills. The final strength is that vocational education costs less than university. All in all, vocational training is the way which has many benefits.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive and negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'The development in AI and robots fields are altering almost work of humans in most of the big company. It is the writer of this essay who contends that this is a adverse influence in the near future due to the significant changes in amount of jobless people in all fields.

One of the core reasons as to why humans are highly replaced by the robots and artificial intelligence that the demanding for a massive amount of production from the industry. In the light of this, the productivity of robots and AI is always much for than this of humans. Moreover, the modern machines occupy the process of goods anytime under the control and without their broken down. Take recent article by a number of German workplaces as an example where pople made workplace without humans in all fields, they chose to replace with the developed AI tool to production to produce more and more efficient products. They also believed that the robots could complete abundance demands from the customers in their country if the demand is accounted for massive amount.

Another arguement considering is that it is negative development when AI and robots work all day instead of activity of humans. It can be seen that the percentage of unployment around the world is higher when the robots and artificial intelligence fields are more developed. It is so challenging and difficult for people to apply for mordern companies because of their weaker than the machines. Futhermore, alomost individuals strongly believe that the risk of industry is less happen when the robots do lieu of the humans. According to the latest news in America, there are a plethora of jobless people who do not have enough money for their life such as renting house, demanding food and drinking, . . . because their company is improved by a large amount of robots and automatic machines to produce and join in the proccess of their workplace anytime. They also hope to find a job notwithstanding their low-paid. By the reason they think the AI engine system is the pressing issue on around the world when it is increasing trend of unemployment.

Taking all points into account, there are some negative elements than beneficial as the development in robots and aritificial intelligence may be altered completely have significant impact on the ability of work in industry of humans in the near future.'

Futhermore, alomost individuals strongly believe that the risk of industry is less happen when the robots do lieu of the humans. According to the latest news in America, there are a lot of jobless people who do not have enough money for their life  such as renting house, demanding food and drinking, ... because their company is improved by a large amount of robots and automatic machines to produce and join in the proccess of their workplace anytime. They also hope to find a job in spite of their low-paid. By the reason they think the AI machine system is the pressing issue on around the world when it is increasing trend of unemployment.

     Taking all points into account, there are some negative elements than positive as the development  in robots and aritificial intelligence may be altered completely have significant impact on the ability of work in industry of humans in the near future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, some employers think that formal academic qualifications are more important than life experience or personal qualities when they look for new employees. Why is it the case? To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In recent years,some argue that a formal academic qualification owns the higher state when they recruit a new staff.In my opinion,I completely disagree with this point of view  and I believe that  life experience and personal qualities are more important which can be supported by the reasons as follows.

First and foremost,as a candidate,they often coming from different University or college,and often learn a  string of professional skills as well as knowledge in various departments.It is hard to definite whether one of them is excellent.The best way is to ask or investigate their life or work experience,thus,can tell if they are suited for the company or even bring huge financial potential to the team.Secondly,as an employer, it is undeniable that they can pick up anyone they want or just based on  academic qualifications. However, you can never know the ability of participants,which could take a huge disaster for your organization.For example, a student or a postgraduate has a hard communicate 

skills and can even not cooperate with his colleagues,which would cause stagnant in whole the working procedure.Therefore, life experience is very important for a staff.

On the other hand , personal qualities are have ultimate importance, also. it is obvious that  bad personal qualities may have a potential impact on the company. For instance,a staff's dishonour would influent not only themselves, but also  the whole team or even the whole company's fame.In this regard, we should make good use of the chance of recruiting meet and the interview to get in touch with each other to realise its value.

with all the points above,the conclusion can be made that life or career experience and personal qualities are important to the employer.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:

 'Text': 'Environmental concerns have affected worlwide leading serious outputs such as global warming, massive destruction of the atmosphere, etc. Although many solutions have been proposed, many people argue that these should be executed by governments, while many other suggests that both counterparts should apply some techniques in order to decelerate the rate of environmental destruction.

To start with, it is well-known that big companies, industries, or factories, have the highest production of pollution annualy. Then, some laws have to set up to establish control and change resources that are used by them. For instance, McDonalds, Nestle, or Cocacola must be under regulations in which they have to use renovable energies by reducing the usage lower quantities of fuel or coal. Besides, deforestation and harvesting trees must be controlled owing to millions kilometers of forests have been burnt, especially between Colombia and Brazil in a specific location called \'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The responsibility to prevent global environmental damage is on politicians rather than individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, environmental problem is the bigger issue than any other issue all the world struggles with them. Some people believe that is only responsibility of the government rather than individuals. I agree with this statement. In this essay, I will explain the reason with specific examples.

To begin with, why this is responsibility of politicians because they are easily controlling these types of activities in their own country. They can easily discuss with other countries on the global level to control and make the new strategies. For example, In the last decades, the administrations are more focused on an electric vehicle rather than petrol or diesel Vehicle and provided some subsides on that, so that people can easily buy.

On the other sides, the governments passed some rules related to the environment issues and asked to people follow these rules strictly. If they not follow this rule then set the high penalty cost.  The governments only make the rules but follow by people. For instance, the Indore City has won the first prize in India for first cleanness city from the last four years. Such as, if we understand their own responsibilities than de-solve any issues without any damages.

In conclusion, I believe that the governments are responsible for this, but people are equally responsible without people they do not easily so that both are understand their own responsibilities. 

`'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in workplace.

Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a positive?' 
 'Text': 'In this digital age, as there are developments of artificial intelligence and robots to replace human in working places is a consequence of the improvement of technologies and the accuracy and efficiency that such things offer. From my view point, this is a positive development because robots and AI can replace human to do dangerous jobs and also help them to in some particular jobs like doctor or etc.

It is recognizable that a lot of jobs that require strength and endurance like working in construction sites and other similar jobs. Those such work might contain potential accident and cause a lot of deaths to the workers, but can be reduce the rate by adding robots to deal with the hard and dangerous work. For example, the mobile robots that can be added to construction size will have more effective progress and invulnerable in some cases.

Another factor that support this idea is that some jobs which can involve with the latest technology to withstand some circumstances, and the outcomes are worthwhile and the progress will be way more effective. The doctor can use robots to support their work for instance, as they can use it to do help their patience to drink pills on time.

 

In conclusion, the developments of artificial intelligence and robots to replace human in working places is a positive development because it offers huge of efficiency and accuracy and also can replace humans in dangerous jobs to reduce the potential accident.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
