instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Today's school should teach their students how to survive financially in the world today. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is believed that in todays rapidly changing world, the importance of teaching financial literacy in educational organisations cannot be overstated. I strongly agree with the given opinion, as students will learn how to be financially stable throughout their lives and make effective financial choices.

First of all, individuals, who are aware of money management skills, tend to have less complexities with finances. Those lessons inform learners about saving, investing and budgeting, and the stated skills are essential in the modern world, since people with skills are more productive members of the workforce. Furthermore, by providing all students, regardless of their backgorund, with acceess to fiscal education, the number of financially excluded people can be reduced significantly. Thus, the general economic situation in the world can be altered. For instance, people in Canada, where those lessons are held, work and save their money better.

Additionally, financial literacy can foster the culture of responsible and accountable people. Most of the time, the absence of required knowledge causes debts and poverty. For example, there are 600 million poor people around the planet and by incorporating wealth management lessons into educational system governments can reduce this number by 200 million. By gaining needed information, the current generation will shape more sustainable society with people who make efficient economic decisions.

Taking everything into account, the idea of integrating financial literacy into educational curriculum ensures more stable society and increases economic well-being of future generations.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some university students want to learn about other subjects in addition to their main subjects. Others believe it is more important to give all their time and attention to studying for a qualification.

Discuss both view and give your opinion' 
 'Text': 'İn today's education systems students are taking range of different subjects many univeraity students are willing to derive knowledge from other subjects which are not the major ones. However other individuals consider that they should be fully focused on their main subjects for a qualification.I believe that students can learn about additional subjects if they want.

  On the one side of the argument in universities competition and difficulty of education is now more complicated than ever before.So ,it makes even harder for students to allot  their time to learn additional subjects.They already have time restrictions and limitations and it can lead to them not to give enough attention and time to their main subjects.Furthermore, students'  the most significant purpose in university is being qualified on their majors.Therefore they should be more attentive on their lessons and ensure that they make all efforts just to broaden their knowledge on main subjects

  On the other side of the argument, it's commonly believed that learning information from other subjects apart from the most important ones can have numerous beneficial consequences for students.Sometimes students can get bored studying similar subjects for months and it can adversely affect their productivity.Due  to this reason, to investigate new topics can be helpful for Learners and to avoid such an annoying circumstance by delving into the topic which they are interested in.Moreover having knowledge about other the subjects can provide them comprehensive abilities in their future life which are extremely crucial.For example after graduating from University they will be applying for a job and their wide range of knowledge will be an advantage for them.

 İn conclusion although many students have desire for learning about non-qualification subjects some people think that it's a waste of time and their attention should be on improving themselves in their majors.I once again assert that they should learn about whatever they want because it can give them many advantages especially in future employment race'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace

Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In digital era,most people believe that their jobs are being replaces by the development of robots and artificial intelligence in many workplaces.The writer has a strong concept about benefits which bring for human when use robots to do hard work instead human and these measures can increase the rate of producing efficiently.

To begin with the reason when use artificial intelligence to replace human can be supported by many positive researchs.The vitual thing can be known that reduce damage to human.Nowadays many hard jobs are being appeared and person who need money will do these jobs to serve their own,but these jobs also have some danger to their health and body.Due to we need to address with these hide dangers people will be replaced by robots or intelligence machines.This is one of positive method which bring for human when applied robots to support their work.

To consider another benefit , it can be known that the applianceof robots and artificial intelligence in producing line and create high efficiency.This benefit can be known that robots or intelligence devices can calculate datas and figuresexactly.For instance,human who work in workplace deal with numbers and figures,spend all time to handle carefully.Therefore,we use artificial intelligence to replace us in workplace it not only increase efficiency but also bring many positve things for us.

In conclusion,the importantthing that humanis replaced by machines .It not only reduce damages and accidents to human but also bring as much as positive thing such as increase efficiency in producing line.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is important for people to take risks, in both their professional lives and personal lives. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?' 
 'Text': 'It is prevalently witnessed that taking dangers in both their professional lives and personal lives. From this aspect, questions about whether this phenomenon is a positive or negative development are raised. In my opinion, taking risks in both their professional lives and personal lives is optimal.

Irrefutably, employees can be promoted to advanced positions. This is because  plenty of employees are fiercely competitive with coworkers and strive to make a success results for their careers. This obviously leads to overworking and exhaustion and this in turn allows workers to gain high careers.

What is more, although unthinkable failures are existence, individuals can experience success and failure. In actual fact, studies undertaken by experts have revealed that several students who struggling study conquer various difficulties such as high performances, tight schedules, and a lack of sleep, so they learn about tolerances and opportunities.

Nevertheless, taking alarmings involves an amount of time and effort. In other words, since an increase in risks has a negative influence on personal status, individuals wait for the ideal results for a long time and attempt to find various ways for their goals.

To conclude, taking alarmings involves an amount of time and effort but employees can promote advanced positions and individuals can experience success and failure. Thus taking risks in both their professional lives and personal lives is optimal.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that children should be thought How to cook at school, Others argue that it is a waste of time for writing ielts' 
 'Text': 'Some supporter of cooking skills education asserts that schools should educate students on how to whip up food, while others put forward that is not beneficial for them.

It goes without saying that learning to cook is a vital life skill and has many benefits for students, meaning learning  how to cook not only promotes healthy eating habits, but also self-sufficiency, independence, and more. Because the children choose a healthy lifestyle, they avoid eating unhealthy foods. Furthermore, they learn how to work in multi-person groups share responsibility  share their views and strengthen bonds through shared meals.

On the other hand, although practical skills like cooking can have a positive impact on students, instructors pay more attention to academic subjects at school. Because of this, students may no longer the necessary attention to their main courses. In fact, there are several other ways that children can learn how to cook such as cooking classes and online resources. 

In conclusion, despite the fact that learning cooking skills gives a hand to students in terms of developing social skills and well-being , it will have inevitable consequences on their education, I would argue.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that it is more beneficial to take part in sports which are played in teams, like football. While other people think that taking part in individual sports is better, like tennis or swimming. Discuss both views and give your own 

opinion' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary society , the methods of doing physical games is widely debated. It’s argued that joining team sports bring residents several benefits participate in individual physical activities . The following article will clarify there statement 

 On the one hand, crew sports plays a crucial role to develop teamwork spirits and expand social network the fist pros is that players might strengthen their abilities to work in a team . In this day and age it cannot be denied that sports plays help me can have a good health and will being , some people argue the it is more critical to have an enjoyable  in le job than to earn a lot of physical exercises In order to maintain bodily. Another advantage is that it is a key factor to boost their relationships is society help residents have more communicate with many ages for example physical activities and bodily games this can be explained by the fact movies have been considered to be fashionable and entertaining 

  On the flip side some games choose to do personal games for primary reasons flexibility and independence that beside participation in sports games As if walking , jogging or Do Yoga help physical mental, stay healthy sometime daily sports it is very necessary with every human be guaranteed and maintained get shaped and have a good healthy 

  In conclusion selecting the ways to plays sports depends too much on each person’s personality some want to join a physical team to increase their social imagines . However it seems to me that playing private sports is also powerful for those who are busy and prioritize the freedom'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that violence on television and in computer games has a damaging effect on the society. Others deny that these factors have any significant influence on people's behaviour. What is your opinion?' 
 'Text': 'These days the amount of violence in media is grown. While some people argued that Violence on both television and in computer games has uneffectiveness factors on the community, others believe that there are on drawbacks of this on the characterstics and behaviours of people. In this essay, I will discuss the negative effects of media on people. In my point of view, I am strongly agree with the first part of the arrgument. 

Taking a near glance at the impact of watching violence in different types of media such as television and computer games, It has several negative effects on all categories of society. Firstly, people often copy action that they see on TV. In other words, alot of people esspeciaaly youth and children immitiate TV shows without thinking to its bad effect on their behaviour or society.For instance, Children who watch Tom and Jerry chasing each other nd using fire can do this with their friends. Moreover, it will leads to more violence and problems in society owing to just do the same actions on others. 

Another negative impcat is that violent video games teach people that aggressiveness is normal in everyday life.In other words, Watching violence in the games lead to more familiar with this type of actions and make people not affect with this actions as it is normal. As aresult, people used to the violence and wish to see it at any place without taking any action. For example, young people spend long hours on playing war video game could practice these deals with their friends and classmate without thinking.As aconsquence to all of this, a tided connection is between violence and media would affect the whole society. 

To sum up, violence is a result of immitation of watching programs or playing video games. In addition, there is a significant relationship between media and growing viollence in society.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that having sports in schools is a waste of time and resources, while others believe that sports in school are a vital part of education. Discuss both of these views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'We have been discussing this issue, whether physical education is needed in the school system or not. 

First of all, opponents of this issue contend that physical subjects like music and sports are not related to entering university, so it doesn't matter to vanquish those in the school system. 

They believe that students need more study in subjects like math, languages, and science related to entering university. 

However, advocates believe that the body and mental health are not different parts of human beings. As strong bodies follow their mental health,. They think that the school's violence is related to this imbalance. If there is no chance to acquire physical subjects in the education system, it might happen. 

In conclusion, from my perspective, it is crucial for children to learn sports in their school system because it promotes a healthy body and mental health. So, we should make an effort to strengthen physical education's role in our education system.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the current society, many people are struggling with obesity.

What are the main causes of this?

What are the effects?' 
 'Text': 'These days a number of people are facing problems with fat and gaining weight around the world. In the upcoming paragraph, I will discuss  the cause of this problem and its effects.

To begin with, eating junk and unhygienic foodstuff is the biggest route cause of obesity in crowd as well as in children. To elaborate , there are numerous high-fat dishes  available in the market which contain a lot of calories and after eating that kind of junky bread people become fat. For example, if individuals  go to restaurants they would prefer to eat pizza and other fatty snack rather than healthy and vegetable meals. Moreover, pupils usually avoid exercise and manual activities such as walking, cycling and outdoor games which also help to get fat to the body.

Furthermore, there are various effects of eating unhealthy cuisine and ignoring physical performance. Firstly, it affects  community's health and lifestyle which provides them with many diseases such as coronary heart disease, liver failure and many more health issues. Secondly, humans become lazy and tired. Due to this, they lose their interest in exercise. 

Overall, If folk will never quit  eating junky food and never try to do physical exercise they would face health issues and get obese day by day.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'A rise in the standard of living in a country often only seems to benefit cities rather than rural areas. What problems can this cause? How migth these problems be reduced?' 
 'Text': 'There has been quite an obvious discussion around the topic of the living standard and few people believe that the outskirt areas would get less benefit than CBD field. This essay will discuss the causes and find some solutions to tackle this issue.

To begin with, there is no doubt that central where is most businesses are running could get more benefit from rise in the standard of living. This is because the city field need more facilities to support those businesses. For instance, there are more public transportation routes around the city than rural areas due to socialization needs. Moreover, the population of people around central are significantly higher than countryside areas, so most of the services would establish nearby consumers. As a result, we can find living life in the city is far more convenience. For example, there are numerous number of shopping centers around the city, In contrast, there are just a few ones in the outskirt areas. 

However, there are some solutions to tackle this issue. Firstly, government should promote other lands as a business location due to spreading civilization to the countryside. For instance, reducing tax rates for some businesses in some locations can build up financial also labour needs in some locations. In addition, government should considerably improving more facilities in rural locations to spread the population from the city area then other services will be established along with people.

To sum up, it cannot be said that the standard of living in rural areas is less rising than in city areas. this is because the population of people and also demand for service are significantly difference, but, fortunately, this problem seem to be solved by support from government.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many university students live with their families while others live away from home because their universities are in different places.       

What are the advantages and disadvantages of both situations' 
 'Text': 'Some education institutions pupils live together their parents while others live away from house because their education institutions are in kind of places. There are a lot of advantages and disadvantages of both conditions.

From one perspective, students live together their families. It is very good for pupils because they have not miss suffer difficult challenges,  lack from money, hungry, anxiety from their parents. They will be health , especially parents do not worry from children and be care, carefully to offspring at house . Besides that, students think only education knowledge, have not hazardous , bad hurt ideology, notion because mothers and fathers gives adrenaline, strong motivation , big care for children. Others do not live with families because will not be might university in their   country or further to university their home , in this situation , many students live in flats. They have very much leisure time and doing homework . This place be quite  and pupils concentrate. In their free time,  go to the student centred education. 

From another angle, if students live  their mothers and fathers while have not time for homework,  go to the add subjects. Meanwhile do not continue private interests. Pupils live further from parents , they pay extremely much money their flats  and will be might sick , ill because in currently, has cold, bad flats. Every year all students live this flats so they do not fix , there are vital issue in flat. 

In conclusion,  there are many students today. They live with their parents while others live away from house because their universities are in kind of places.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Who is your favourite singer? What do you like about him or her?' 
 'Text': 'Listening to music is apparently one of the relaxed activities that everybody in this world has been doing. By that, one may have his or her own favorite singers. I, myself, also have many singers that I admire. One of them is Toon Bodyslam. 

Toon is a lead singer for Bodyslam band, one of the most famous rock band from Thailand. He is also known as P'toon. His personalities are calm, polite and generous. On one hand, He become well-known for his distinctive musics and wonderful lyrics. In addition, He always give 100 percent to every performance he contributes, not only the music festivals that he got paid, but also the charity one.

On the other hand, He took advantage of his fame by setting a project called Kao, to encourage Thai people to donate their money to the hospital to help with the poverty patient. He ran from Southern to the Northern part of Thailand in 55 days, at about 2,300 kilometers. He could raised the money approximately around one billion Thai baht. That money could help a lot of hospital and patient. Additionally, this project has led many people to be more concious and careful in their lives. Many people started to do exercise more regularly and eat healthier diets. 

To sum up, for the children to grow up and become a great man, P'toon is the one that they can look up to and take him as a role model.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Question: One problem faced by almost every large city is traffic congestion.

                  What do you think the causes are? What solutions can you suggest?' 
 'Text': 'Many big cities struggle with a common problem: too many cars on the roads, causing traffic jams. This essay will look at why this happens and suggest ways to fix it

One big reason for traffic jams is that there aren't enough buses and trains for people to use. When there aren't good public transportation options, more people drive their own cars, making traffic worse. For instance, in cities where there aren't many buses or trains, rush hour traffic gets really bad because everyone has to drive

To solve this problem, cities need to improve their public transportation systems. They should make buses and trains go to more places, run more often, and be more reliable. Also, encouraging people to walk or bike instead of driving can help reduce traffic jams.

In summary, traffic jams are a big issue in cities, but there are ways to make things better. By investing in better public transportation and promoting other ways to get around, cities can ease traffic congestion and make life easier for everyone'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The only way to improve safety on our roads is to give much stricter punishments for driving offences. What extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In recent years ,it has reported that many  death and injuries  has caused by  negligence by  road users thus drivers. However, to improvise such situations , it is much better to set tough  laws  against such  deed for example  total ban of not driving  and  increase the fine  relating  to an offence. While ,  some times mistakes do happen . In my own opinion ,  setting of  high level  of rules and regulations is the best thing to do to reduces the endanger of roadusers  .

On the one  hand ,  people turn not to like to cause accidents  nevertheless ,   situations are unpredictable  therefore mistakes will do caught up with some one  eventually  or  for instance, robots  may not be working  or the pedestrian  is not paying attention to what is happening around . for example in Lublin  , a lady was rushing to the university institute  and she was  hit by a car  she did not notice that the traffic robots  had changed to red.

on the  other hand ,  individuals turn to be  reckless  unfortunately  when they are driving either car or  cycling hence thats  why   rate of deaths due to accident are increasing day and night  . some human beings are driving whilst they are drug or  they  even race on road especially teenagers.  for example   it is said that  Paul Walker was racing when he died  . Therefore  ,if someone  endangered others , he or she should be banned from driving thus if they are drug , high or racing .  secondly ,  the fine should be increased this will minimise the offences .

In conclusion,  punishment of banning and increasing fine should be implemated  to  road offencers  this will improve  safety to the people , since  other  individuals  are reckless  when using the road  .In my own opinion it is best to  punish the people according to the level of the offence.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative inpact on society?' 
 'Text': 'With the proliferation of technology, some jobs are being worked out by artificial intelligence to reduce mistakes and life-threatening injuries for workers. This writer contends that the advent of AI is a merit as it promotes mass production and the workforce quality.

The key reasons for the arrival of automation are its precision and safety. In fact, thanks to the incessant development in miniaturisation, there are robots that can perform some kinds of bone and brain surgeries with submilimeter accuracy, which is far more precise than what a professional surgeon can achieve with his hand alone. Moreover, using robot arms to carry out laborious tasks  saves blue collar workers from dangers since they no longer need to, for instance, expose to toxic fumes and chemicals in factories.

Artificial intelligence is the right-arm man of human and it has ushered in an era where machines dominate in manufacturing. This paves the way for machinalisation that allows producing in great quantities with up-to-standard commodities. Not only does it exert a positive impact on the product quality but it also encourage labourers to be competent in managing and functioning robots. As a result, the number of skilled workers will increase which affect the national economy possitively. Therefore, workers need to learn to catch up with such an innovation.

In conclusion, machineries boosting work productivity and saving workers from risks are the reasons for the roaring number of robots in factories. Additionally, it promotes higher level workforce.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being eveloped to replace humans in the workplace.

Why is this happening/

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In the digital age, automatic robotics are being employed as substitues to humans in production line industries. This trend emerges due to the necessity to cut manufacturing costs from industries. In spite of putting the job opportunities of humankind as risk, the enhanced efficiency will be the optimistic outlook to the global economy in the long term. 

One of the most evident motivations behind the advancement of automation is cost reduction. Because of the escalating cost of living, inhabitants are requiring higher wages for their work. This may put financial challenges for companies rely on a large workforce of blue-collar workers. Despite the significant initial investment on technology, in the near future, automated machines can operate continuously without breaks or vacations, reducing labor expenses associated with human employees.

It is crucial to recognize that automation in work platforms can substantially benefit the community. Robots excel in performing repetitive tasks much faster than human beings, resulting in enhancing productivity. With the aids of cost reductions, manufacturing companies will optimize the efficiency and maintain competitiveness in the global market. As a consequence, this will have a positive impact on strengthening the worldwide economy.

In conclusion, the requirement of reducing costs in workplace results in the advancement of automated machinery. While this may create unemployment for some people as the productivity of those robots outweigh that of mankind, the profound effect it has on the economy of society is undeniable.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace

Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In recent years, machines and artificial intellects have been expanded  to change citizens in applying employment. This essay will discuss the positive impact on society and happening in the office environment.

Firstly, it can be seen that reduction in human error and zero risks. The decisions taken by the machine in every step are decided by information previously gathered and a certain set of algorithms so that when programmed properly, these errors can be reduced to null. Furthermore, when apply scientists explore apply space or the ocean do not have accidents or can survive atmospheres. It can eliminate the risks of human error and injury in environments.

Similarly, one of the biggest benefits of the machine is that it can be used in medical and daily applications. It has also made significant contributions to the field of medicine, with applications ranging from treatment to drug discovery and trials. It can help doctors and researchers to identify potential health risks and develop personalized treatments. This can lead to better health outcomes for patients and the development of new medical treatments and technologies.

In conclusion, in my view, there are more positives as there are clear benefits to individuals who will be doing with the machine. However, it can support and help humans to reduce time to work and stress.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robotics and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace . Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed all around the world to replace workers with machines. The author will discuss the reasons behind this and whether they are good or bad. 

First off, there is no denying that increased demands for the construction of financial structures in primarily metropolitan regions are placing a great deal of strain on constructive machinery. In addition, humans have been learning more about artificial engineering and developing a specialty in cutting-edge robots to help with heavy lifting in the workplace. Because of this, people are being substituted by helpful technology to advance a nation ‘s specific financial development. Using the USA as an example, a recent survey revealed that over 80% of industrial enterprises are utilizing technology applications to increase their profitability. 

This is a summary of the differences between artificial and robotic intelligence. Job displacement holds that when automotion rises, certain jobs will unavoidably go, resulting in hardship on the job market and unemployment. It might not even be distributed, which could cause the gap to grow between rich and poor.

In conclusion, there will be a variety of effects from robots and AI on society. Automation has intriguing opportunities to boost output, safety, and job creation. It will be important to navigate this technological shift properly in order to create a better future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays many people choose to be self employed rather than to work for a company or organization. Why might this be the case?  What could be the disadvantage of bring self employed?' 
 'Text': 'One of the well-known issue nowadays is that majority of people prefer to work for themselves instead of being employed by any workplaces. In my opinion, the first option is better than another one. The main pros is a management of their resources personally and cons is instability of work.

On the one hand self-employed person decide self about his labour points. It includes timetable, some rules and last but not least salary issues. This means self-providing individuals have opportunities as earning unlimited money, to sort out their work-time which suits on them and create likely own rules. For example, according to local statistics businessmen engaged in small business able to have wage starting from 500.000 tenge to infinite sum monthly meanwhile others are restricted in this case. Futhermore, it is the main reason why I choose becoming self-employed. 

On the another hand there is a drawback touching this question such as absence of quarantee. This means jobs of self-employed people are not always stable. Nobody has not an assurance against bankrupt or fully-stop of work. Furhermore, amount of salary also can be not stable all time. For example, In 2020 most of small and middle offline corporation’s activities had stopped and been replaced to online organisations. 

  In conclusion, being self-employed is a good experience for self-progression with pleasure advantages. Nevertheless you should be ready for risks in your professional way.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'With the increasing demand for energy sources of oil and gas, people should look for sources of oil and gas in remote and untouched natural places. Do the advantages outweigh disadvantages of damaging such areas ?' 
 'Text': 'There is a school of thought advocate for the exploration of oil and gas in remote and untouched natural habitats due to the ever-increasing demand of energy sources of oil and gas. Despite these products serve numerous aspect of human life, they also cause environment damge, I believe that the advantages do not outweigh the drawbacks.

On one hand, exploring more gas and oil resources is found several benifits such as a industrial revolution and tackle various fanancial and employment issues. Firstly, gas and oil industry necessitates a large amount of labour to explore the resources. Thus, it will provide a variety opportunities to work for unemployed individuals. Secondly, new abundant resources bring economical value for the nations which own these resources to export broadly. In addition, resident of nation's resource are served these resources with afordable cost. 

On the other hand, new gasoline and oil resources exploitation also encounter various downsides. Firstly, human exploit the natural resources obviously damage environment such as deforestation and result in the destruction of habitats and the lost of biodiversity. Moreover, deforestation contribute to the loss of habitats, threatening many plant and animal species. In addition, according to recent reports, discovering and exploiting resoures exacerbate climate change problems, especially the green house effect. Lastly, gas and oil resousces are limited resources so overwhelming exploitation can threaten or even harm ecoloy of the earth.

With all of the aforementioned theses and explanations, the conclusion is self-evident. I believe that broadening the exploration of additional gas and oil resources has some strengths, however the drawbacks are far more detrimental.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Do you agree or disagree with government giving money to artists, rather than health care system?' 
 'Text': 'In today's globalisation era, art becomes ubiquitous entertainment. In terms of government's point of view, it will earn investments and income tax. The government may argue that it is necessary to give money for the artists, rater than health care system. This essay provides strong disagreement with the government's thinking because giving money to health care system is more essential.

First, health care system is an integral part of public facility in the city. One of the criteria for liveable city is the public facility. It is so crucial for having a well developed health care system because citizen's healthiness can not be neglected. Moreover, the well-being of the society is also when we are able to get a proper health care system such as health insurance, and proper amount of medical practicioners, and health care facility.

Moreover, artist can earn money by themselves. Otherwise, health care system is not looking for any profit. Government's support for funding the health care system is urgently needed. Some people will argue when health care system costs much money, instead of giving a proper service. Thus, we need to urge that health care system is not looking for any profit.

To sum up, government needs to give money to the health care system rather than artists because some reasons. It consists of urgency for hosting proper public facility, and not looking for profits.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The world has many towns and cities constructed in previous centuries that were more  suitable and livable for people in those time than they are now.  What problems will this cause ?  What can be done to solve these problems ?' 
 'Text': 'A vast number if cities and towns were constructed in ancient time . These were best places to live for people . However, these are not longer suitable nowadays. This is due to the fact that these towns and cities lack public transportation and essential modern facilities such as hospitals and schools. Hence , lical governments should release  public transportation vehicles and start to establish necessary facilities . 

To begin with, the main causes of towns and cities are changing for insufficient to live is that these areas are lacking of public transport and necessary modern facilities. Therefore, locals in these places are complaining from those and moving to others parts of the country. For example, Aswan city in Egypt has constructed and developed in old president Nassar in 1900s. Nevertheless, three fifth people moved from the city to Cairo by fearing difficulties lifestyle . Obviously, Aswan do not have any metroes and buses to travel in center city and some important public places namely libraries and public parks. As a result, majority of locals encouraged to move to moden areas .

Some possibilities to solve this problems are creating public transportation vehicles  and  establishing necessary building . For instance, Turkish government developed its city which is Bursa . In fact, Bursa is a very old city that was not good places to live in 2000s. Thus, the government began to establish bridges and roads for transportation and built Bursa university. Consequently , the city is one of beautiful cities today.

In conclusion, although a number of cities and towns were constructed to live people it there , still it is not appropriate areas for locals by lacking public vehicles and modern buildings. But, governments can solve this problem by creating public transportation roads and establishing necessary facilities.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people today are choosing to live and work in another country after graduating from University in their home country. why is this ?do the advantages is turned outweight the disadvantages.' 
 'Text': 'In recent years most  graduates turned  to go and work out of their motherland  due to various reasons such as  lack of jobs in their country , unsatisfactory of salaries . However , these reasons  may leave the state with brain shortage . In my own opinion  advantages  of  leaving the national   outweighs the disadvantages. This essay will discuss further the merits.

 On the one hand , firstly, it is unfair to go and work outside of the country  because  this will leave the  state with shortage of brainstorm since most of  the individuals with degrees migrate to other nations, for example for the past few years  in Zimbambwe  , nurses were   migrating to England  in search of greener pastures thereby,  causing  lack of  proffessional workers  for the specific job .Nonetheless, the vice President had to put  a restriction order for nurses  to block them from leaving the country.Secondly , it  is unacepptable to use the government  resources  such  educational institute  for one to use them in another state.

 On the other hand , unemployment is the  major reasons why people migrate . One  needs to support their families  for example they need fees, to pay bills and food  . Therefore,  they just can not keep their degrees without using it . to sum up in 2008 in Mozambique  people had to evacute to south Africa  for them to earn a living.Moreso,  unsatisfactory pay is also the other  impact which is leading people to  go to other governments for example if  the individual ;s currrency had no power , there will be infalation thereby one will look somewhere else to receive  salary that have value.

In  conclussion,  humanbeings turn to migrate  after graduation  in search of  jobs and satisfactory pays   since their motherland may have a high rate ofunemployment  thereby,  the  benefits of migrating outweighs the  disadvantages.  In my own opinion it is better to migrate'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, more people are migrating to other countries than ever before. In order to become integrated into society in their adopted countries, immigration should abandon their old ways and adapt to local customs and code of behaviour. 

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'As known that immigration one of the most important organizations in any country play part of arrangements of foreigner in order of purpose to live or work even studying abroad. The rules of staying must be set by their own rules to ensure that society will not be affected in any way by people who come from different countries.

  When people immigrate abroad to find new opportunities to achieve their goals that will give idea of what they are going through to succeed.  I agree , that immigration have to come with ways to contribute of development the country by creating guarantee standards structures of country.

 

Firstly , when foreigners travel to countries for sure they have plans to live better life for themselves, so giving them chances to stay with legal status will help them increase income of economic activity in countries where they are, example open source projects will help local businesses build more wealth and improve quality of living . Furthermore, variety of industries will be important for those countries to reduce number of jobseekers means avoid any problems in terms of jobs.

Secondly, most of people who ask to residence they may have high educational background, they will drive knowledgeable and experienced to country. Moreover ,those  kind of people with professional qualifications when they get right to residence as local citizenships will be able to provide their services and support to local community.

Finally , immigration play roles of guide people to follow the rules of country to by legal.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer to live in hot climates, whereas others think it`s better to live in countries with cold climates.' 
 'Text': 'In an era characterised by independence and the freedom of choice, individuals have the right to live wherever they desire.However, there is a significant debate among those who prefer hot climates versus those who prefer cold ones. Personally, I lean towards living in a warm climate due to the abundance of sunny days and the fewer dark days it offers. In this essay, I will outline my perspectives on this matter.

Primarily, equatorial weather has a benefit of 300 and more sunny days each year, which is way better than arctic weather which has up to 90 clear days. Moreover, countries with tropical climates receive a lot of direct sunlight, which increases the clear-sky days.  According to recent statistics, sun warmth releases a big amount of stress and therefore plenty of mankind lean towards deciding this habitat.

Nevertheless, the presence of access to the out-door activities all year round makes life way better. Corresponding to the main concept of the individual types of sports, they require an outdoor environment to practise their skills. In most cases, extreme sport lovers are restricted with the availability of surfing, swimming and others. As a result the mood of mankind rises every single day.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'An increasing number of people are buying what they need online.

What are the advantages and disadvantages for both individuals and companies to shopping online?' 
 'Text': 'It is undeniable that nowadays napid amount of people: are shopping through onaline websites for various reasons.

This Essay will Examine and analyze both advantages and disadvantages with logical statement.

on the one hand, There are various advantages associated with it. The first and foremast is people. are able to save time and utilize it in proper or time taking work. while, the online shops are adversting good brands Which atracts custmers to purchase at high numbers.

Likewise, companies are recieving high wages by selling items through devices In addition, a person who stay susy at work and schools can EaSIN do shopping through apps like Daraz alibaba com which makes them comfortable and relax:

As, every positivity carries some. sorts of negativity. sothere are some demnits also.

on the other hand, the major disadvantages is probably the customers satisfication. Similary companies are selling their product but. at the same time, they are scaming a lot of people which badly Effect the reputation of all honest shops.

Likewise, physical shopping can satisfy more than online.

In conclusion, although there. are. some non-negligible negative impacts of onine. shopping out Still holds the festiurty which outweigh the fil effects.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You want to book a hotel recommended to you for job meeting' 
 'Text': 'Dear Ascot Hotel,

I would like to reserve an accessible single room for two nights with breakfast on the 22 and 23 of April. Could I have a quiet room with a view if possible, please?

I will arrive at about 10 p.m. and I have an early meeting the next morning, so please could you leave an iron and ironing board in the room?

I have a promotional code (MH2219). Please can you confirm that it is £80 per night with breakfast included?

Please could you confirm the booking? Let me know if you need any further information.

Many thanks.

With kind regards,

David Mathews'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that job satisfaction is the most important factor when looking for a job. Others think that having job security is more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Today there is an intensive debate about what is the most important factor for individuals who are looking for a job. However, some argue that job convincing is a essential factor while another invoke that a job must provide sufficient wages, pension, and medical insurance.So, in this article, I am going to discuss both views and what is the best form them.

Firstly, lots of experts discussed that the happiness is connecting with a satisfied career.For example, we witnessed a lot of individuals in varied social media areas like Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and others provided a stunning samples of his businesses because they are like that are doing . Moreover, if person believes in his job he will be creative in their field. For this, those people who are defending about this idea believe that the job satisfaction is the most effective for goals achievement.

On the other hand, another gathering go beyond that any career should be  enables employees to live with his dinghy. For example, everyone needs fees for living, studying and treatment. Furthermore, individuals doing well in his duties by recieving sufficient wages during their contract with his institutions and secure his pensions after retirement. For this, job security is the best ways to achieve creativity according to latter group.

To conclude, both views provided to us sufficient evidence that job satisfying and financial privilege are important. I believe that balance between them is required, and anyone was to perform his work without any of job satisfaction or job security, he would probably awful in his work. So , the complementary between two factors is required.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'While it is Sometimes thought that prison is the best place for criminal, other believe that there are better ways to deal with what is your opinion?' 
 'Text': 'Some people argue that any person committed crime must be punished while others discuss should find a nother alternative to the punishment system. However, I believe that the punishment is the best way to combat crimes because some crimes are serious and lots of people do not respect the law unless there are methods that prevent him from committed crimes. So, in this article, I will discuss these two reasons.

Firstly, I believe punishment is the most effective ways to make people do not think about defy laws. For instance, a lot of people have bad behaviours and annoyed individuals in spite of existing laws. If did not existed rules, it would lead people to committ more crimes.

Moreover, crimes is made today by a lot of awful individuals and this crime is serious and this situation requires to enforce laws. For instance, crimes like kill, fraud and steal is quite difficult to authorities to ignore it and apply smooth punishment.

On the other hand, the second reason is lots of people irresponsible and do not obey the laws without methods prevented him from corruption. For instance, lots of people is scared of rules and thinking a lot before contrary regulations. If the justice is not found that will lead to spread of crimes in the society. Furthermore, lots of crimes was not committed by the various people, because those people terrified of laws. In addition, all the justice combatants like policemans, judges and lawyers is the fully responsible for security of society.

To conclude, apply punishment to achieve justice is unavoidable. Although, there are simple crimes may deal with it by smooth ways.

In addition to exist a lot of governmental institutions for repair persons and also responsible for children who committed crimes.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'In today's world, there is an increasing number of peoplewho are keen on searching for information about theorigin of their living houses or apartments in somenations.

Several reasons cannot be ignored behind thisphenomenon.Firstly, due to social development, peoplegradually begin thinking highly of the domestic history toknow their origins and backgrounds. Secondly,information spreads quickly thanks to the rapid growth oftechnology. People nowadays are exposed to massamounts of articles and videos, which give residents theopportunity to search online using cell phones, laptops.and any other electronic devices. Lastly, moderneducational systems also tend to teach people theimportance of history, which may push people to bemore curious and interested in finding out the historyabout the places they hail from.

To access the history of these buildings, there are plentyof methods.As soon as dwellers search for informationonline by entering keywords on websites, people canfind and scan historical narratives stored online.Moreover, people can also visit libraries to check andread books containing useful information, as librariesusually house numerous books covering extensivehistoric periods. Last but not least, residents may turn tothe older generation to inguire about the history of thedistrict, as the elderly may possess ample knowledgeand be willing to share with the young.

In conclusion, it is reasonable for people to becomecurious about the history of the places they are living in.and websites, libraries, and the older generation can serve as valuable resources to help people gain usefulinformation.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'the number of international conferences in three cities. 1965-2010' 
 'Text': 'The line graph illustrates information about international conferences held in particular cities between 1965 and 2010.

Overall, it can be clearly seen that all three cities experienced fluctuations throughout the period. In 1995,  all the cities had almost the same number of conferences.

To begin with city A, it hosted 35 conferences in 1965. City B had 31 meetings. Interestingly, there was a downward trend for City A for the next decade with about 20 conferences in 1975. In 1985, both City A and B had about 30 conferences on average, this this was followed up by a down and up trend with 20 and 25 conferences respectively until 2010. 

As for City C, it experienced a dramatic increase from zero in 1965 to over 25 conferences in 1995. During this year, all the cities had a similar number of international conferences. Next, City C's number of conferences decreased before reaching its highest point with about 30 conferences in 2010.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people in poor countries die from diseases that are curable because they cannot afford the medication required.

Do you believe that drug companies should make their products available at reduced prices in these countries?' 
 'Text': 'Due to the high prices of drugs, the death rate in third-world countries is high because the underprivileged cannot buy these medicines to treat their issues. I do believe that pharmaceutical companies should reduce their prices of medicines so that poor people can afford them.

Due to high inflation and poverty rates in developing and underdeveloped countries, people with low incomes cannot access basic health opportunities. These medicines are so expensive that low-income people can not afford them. In these countries, unemployment is also increasing day by day leading to economic disparity between people. Moreover, Pharmaceutical companies fixed their prices at high rates making them inaccessible to underprivileged people. For instance, cancer treatment is so expensive that people die from it without getting treatment.

To reduce deaths caused by diseases for which treatment is available, I think, drug companies should make cheap medicines that are easily available to everyone. The government should also invest in the health sector, and keep an eye on these companies so that they cannot increase the prices of these medicines.The basic drugs should be available to poor people for free.

To summarize, government and pharmaceutical companies should provide relief to non-affording people in society so that they can access basic health care to get their treatment.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Companies should provide sports and social fecilities for local communities. To what extent do you agree?' 
 'Text': 'There are belifs that companies should build sports and social enterprises for inhabitants. Some people think that companies should engage with communities, but from my point of view it is the government’s responsibility.

Firstly, from companies point of view, if firms charge an entrance fee for each visitor, the more people attend their place, the more money companies get. As a result, they will earn lots of money from that and even improve their image among the community. For instance, research suggests that proprietors of exclusive establishments frequently generate profits through the sale of merchandise and admission tickets. For some local communities these exclusive areas will often be full of people and the entrance price is not cheap. 

On the other hand, alternatively, governments have to provide their citizens with free sports and social fecilities. These kind of places will help citizens to improve their well-being and health.  As a result, not only the inhabitants’ strength will rise, but the countries’ economies will also grow significantly. For example, that could be a good investment as a tax from every citizen. Thus, governments have to be responsible for building these places instead of particular companies.

In conclusion, while there are arguments for both companies and governments to be involved in providing sports and social facilities for inhabitants, in my opinion,  the responsibility ultimately falls on the government.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'it is important for people take risks, both in their professional lives and their personal lives. Do you think the advantages of taking risks outweigh the disadvantage?' 
 'Text': 'It is important to take risks for people, both in their professional and personal lives. The writer will explain benefits and drawbacks for people to take risks.

Remaining the benefits for people take risks where people can know about new things and get experience.  People can improve their knowledge about new things because they have the courage to take action when they take risks about their choice of life. Additionally, people can get experience when they take risks because they can learn about what they do. For example, people in life have many choices for their future and it can be impacted when they do not have courage to take risks because they do not know if it is correct or incorrect.  

Remaining the drawbacks for people to take risks where they can fail in their lives and they can not learn from their mistakes. People can get failed in their lives because they do not take risks and they can get some failures from what they take risks. In addition, people can not learn from mistakes because they do not try to take risks and it makes them not improve their quality of life. For example, people can not learn from their mistakes because they never take risks. 

Conclusion, the writer believes that there are benefits and drawbacks for people who take risks. The benefits when people take risks are to know about new things and get experience. However, there are drawbacks for people when people take risks to fail in their lives and they can not learn from their mistakes.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'While it is sometimes thought that prison is the best place for criminals, others believe that there are better ways to deal with them. What is your opinion?' 
 'Text': 'Crimes have always been part of societies. Hence, worldwide governments have evaluated the best ways to deal with offenders. Nevertheless, although many people argue that imprisonment has to be the unique punishment, some others believe that different options could have better outcomes. Here, I am going to explain why I think that both, either prision or other penalities, should be considered.  

Firstly, there are many types of crimes as well as lawbreakers. For this reason, characteristics of the illegal act that was commited, such as gravity, consequences, and people were involved on it, must be evaluated. For instance terrorism, murders, human trafficking or child abuse are major crimes, then severe penalizations have to be applied. However, pick pocketting, traffic offences and vandalism are minor offences and its sanctions should be personalized respectively.  

On the other hand, prisons are sponsored by public financial resources and it represents large expenses yearly. Besides, many research have shown that consequences such as mental diseases and recidivism could be outcomes owing to behivours and violence that are lived in jail. For example, in El Salvador, offenders that are in prison are nacked and have been beaten as a punishment. Then, community services, fines, etc, have to be evaluated as a method of penalization.

To sum up, prison is required as a punishment depending on severity and reasons why a transgession was commited. However, there are many ways to stablish penalties that should be contemplate among offenders.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'some people dislike changes in their society and in their lives,and want things to stay  the same.

why do some people want things to stay the same?

why should change be regarded as something positive?' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that, some people don't like changes, because, we couldn't accept something suddenly change when we not already, also,  I used to be same way. but now, I learned how to accept any changes in my life. in this essay, I will explain why people want to stay the same and how people learn embrace the changes.

    Until now, more things all the change, something we can't pretect happen anytime, such as, our workplace situation suddenly change tomorrow, or our friends and relatives suddenly death, I can understand most people can't accept that accidents in life, more uncertainly make people sad or nervious, people want to control anything in life. But in fact, we always can't decide anything in our life,not to mention the society. we always want to same forever, that can make our comfortable everyday, however, that's anable, so, we need learn how to embrace change and the change not necessary bad.

    some changes can make people thinking better, maybe we can find new feels rather than stay the same. Such as, I used to by the bus to work, I keeped on about five years, the traffic jam is too big problem in my city, although I need to consider maybe I will late to work everyday, but I never think I can also by the subway, because I don't like change. But last year, my husband with me went to work same time on that day, also, the road have many cars, and I just want to by bus, at that time, he told me, if you not select, you will always have trouble in your life, so, we by the subway to work. Remarkably, I already find the great way to work, the subway is faster than bus, and I am not afraid I will be late.

    In a nutshell, changes can give our new life or not, since we can‘t control，so， just embrace it， you will know，some questions in your life will be disappear.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think women should be given equal chances to work and excel in their careers.Others believe that a women's role should be limited to taking care of the house and children. Which opinion do you agree with and why? Include specific details and examples to support your choice' 
 'Text': 'In recent years, the world has witnessed a growing advocacy for equal rights from different groups of people including feminists. There are quite a number of people who are standing up for women to get equal opportunities at the work places. However, this view is opposed by the die hard traditional men who pessive women as beings that belong at homes taking care of children and doing common hosehold chores. In this essay, I will explain and give reasons why I agree with the old fashioned community who are agaisnt women pessuing careers at an equal rate with men.

Firstly, women were created to be helpers of men as we learn from the Holy Bible. Therefore, it is taboo to hear that women are competing with men in the work place. Their duty is to support the man, that is the head of the family. These days we are witnessing women leaving new born babies at day care centres or with a hired child minder. Marriages are collapsing due to these over ambitious women, instead of staying at home taking care of children, doing house chores, cooking and providing emotional support to their husbands, they are busy puting effort on how to earn more than a ma. I persive this as an act of defiance of subsimision to men.

Additionaly, females are not as strong as men, be it mentaly or physically. There is no way they can out match their counterparts of the same trade. Yes they are there woman who are talented in certain areas, for example in computer science, but truthfully speaking there is a man twice as good, moreover men have more endurance and higher ability of problem solving, so even if they are employed at the same level their salaries should not be the same. So it is pointelss to appoint a woman on that post. Therefore, women should stick to their domestic value and leave careers for men.

In conclusion, the issue of equal rights is not for the faint hearted, it needs a strong understanding of our calture and traditions. Women should not fight with nature, they should accept their calling of being the heart of the house and stop competing with the heads of the house in the industries and coporate world.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.' 
 'Text': 'Companies around the world know that complaining is a common issue that they get almost every day. There are two types of complaints, complaints by writing and face-to-face. I personally prefer to complain by directly addressing the person in charge directly. 

Some people like to tell their problems by writing in a customer satisfaction survey that had been given to them. The buyers do not have any pressure to write down their badexperiences and tend to give an honest reviews about the product they used.  However, the buyers can not deny that complaining through a survey seems to be hard to get a fast response because the company has to check all of the answers first.

Furthermore, these days, there is a significant increase in a number of customers who do complain by meeting with the customer service staff. They feel more comfortable to tell the real issue that they have. In addition, this schema of complaint is giving faster responses to the buyers especially when the thing that they bought is broken. For example, if there is a phone cannot be restarted the technician will fix it then maybe there are some rules that you have to know directly from the staff. Therefore, it is better to give the feedback in person.

To conclude, my choice of giving a complaint in a face-to-face meeting yields the trust of its clients in the enterprise's performance, even though, the writing schema is great too. Overall, both ways are extremely useful in helping the client's problems be resolved.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You recently organised an all-day meeting for your company, which took place in a local hotel. In their feedback, participants at the meeting said that they liked the hotel, but they were unhappy about the food that was served for lunch.' 
 'Text': 'Dear Sir,

I am writing to express dissapointment of parcticipants with you food.

It and my team would be say that the your hotel is too neat and clean. In your hotel has large whole with one hundred sitting chairs at one time. Which could be loved by participants. They also liked the location of your hotel. Moreover, your reception area is too friendly. 

However, they are not happy with your food which served in lunch because the waiting time is long. Furthermore, what food they willing to eat sometimes it is not available in your menu. 

I wolud like to suggest you that hire more chef and staff so they would  cook on time and serve the meal. In addition, add different types of cousines in your menu for instance italian food. This could probably daunting the heart of participants.

 

I am hoping that the food quality will improve in future. Wishing you a great day.

Yours faithfully, 

Sarb'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'GLOBAL WARMING IS INCREASING DAY BY DAY. WHAT EFFECTS DOES THIS PHENOMENON CAUSES ? WHAT ARE THE SOLUTION' 
 'Text': 'There is no denying the fact the main issues threat our lives is global warming.While it is a commonly held belife that global warming has increased after people discoverd oil during  the last decade.This essay will discuss this problem and the possible soultions.

to begin with,there are many reason of pollution.Firstly,many people claimed after the revolution of manufactories industry the gobal warming has increase rapidlly duo to pollution.In other words,gas emmission and fossil fuel are detrimental not only our health but also wild lives.In addition,many countries lack knowledge to deal with disposable waste product,such as plastic and paper.For example,according to a recent study the majority of develop stand behinde increases gas emmission due to lack knowledge.

On the other hand,many countries starting use alternative method to have friendlly energy such as solar and wind power.It is possible to say that renewable energy has become more prevalent after the global warming institution implement rule to tackle this issues.moreover,the government need to pay more attition to raising public awareness for minimize using plastic and use other items more friendlly with our environment public awareness play a crucial role to reduse gas emission via using public transportation rather than own cars.For instance,china has foster their citizen to get flixible work time when  they using metro.

In conclusion,There are many soultion to reduce carbon dioxide emmission through using eco cars.it is also true to use public transportation.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'When choosing jobs, salary is the most important consideration.To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, job payment is the most significant effect to people' job standard. Vice versa, it is argued that satisfication with job also play an important role in job decision. In my perspective, I partly disagree with the opinion that job should be choose by the salary received, but also should be decided by seeker's happiness.

In one hand, the amount of salary should be put in your job standard. An ill-payed job would not be able for workers to afford their basic needs such as food, beverage, accomodation,... And even find it hard to pay for luxurious interests. Jobs with adequate financial means which can provide you comfortable life should be prioritized. It is even more important for a breadwinner to find a well-payed job for the whole family's expense.

In the other hand, a thoroughly seeker will add job satisfication in their choice. Even if you get a good payment for a job, it is important to ensure that the job requirement is comfortable for your mental health. A job with stress and negative thinking will destrimental effect your health and lead to sickness such add depression, anxiety, obesity,... In contrast, a friendly interrelationship with colleague will give you meaningful experiences while working.

To conclude, the amount of salary is a important consideration. But also, how you satisfy with the job also play an important role in job decision. A mean of good job should also include a resionable salary and happiness while working.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Write about the following topic:

Studying with a group of students in a classroom is more beneficial than learning online at home.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, which is the better option to learn something in a traditional schoolhouse or at home. 

Overall, learning online gives us a feeling of being alone whereas, in a common classroom with a handful of people, we have a support further we could development social abilities which are truly important in our daily routine each day. In my own opinion, I totally agree with study in a public college.

The spotlight of learning online at home, it could be because the speed of the process is faster if the student is highly compromised with the time that dedicated to study throughout a period of 8 hours. However, this way does not provide the knowledge of how socialize with other people, and this is a huge drawback because is a striking feature that each human being needs to know. 

In the other hand, had classmates who are around us and had our ages, gives information about how interact each other, what is had a friend and how ask for help if we need it. Additionaly, explains the value of true friendship that long-lasting our entirely live, besides the importante of share and be for the other.

To sump up, there are differents ways of acquire knowledge but it is truly important to do not forget about prepare our children to the real world, where you have to know how interact.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'All students should study a foreign language in school, starting in their earliest grades. 

 To What extent do you agree or disagree with this statement.' 
 'Text': 'There is no denying the fact that learning a new language has become prevalent to communicate with other people.

To begin,learning a new language in the earliest grade is better than learning adult because child have ability to understand faster than adult.In other words,study foreigen language to kids are really significant because they can help them to enhance knowledge and develop there mind.In addition,learning new language play crucial role to boost child educational attainment and critical thinking.For example,according to a recent study shown children study english in the first school years have high thinking level in their life.

Another point to consider study foreigne language is long journy so it would be better to stating earliar.it is possible to say that this attitude can improve their communication skills 

in the young pupils because they play video games and contact with different people in the world.Moreover,studying other language are benefical to achieve your goals.For instance, if i had time i would learn english since when i was child in order to avoid all feauter mistake on this language.

In conclusion,there are no easy answers to this qustion.On balance,however, i believe learning in early can make you fluent in the feauter.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
