It is more beneficial than trying to stop eating fast food and more carbohydrates. For example, some of them take a advice from a nutrition doctor. They give good advice and give them diet plans too. In addition, people who are be a good healthy and they are don't have noncommunicable diseases.

In conclusion, exercise and diet plans is always needed to combine to the people good healthy life. In my opinion is both are very important for people good healthy life'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say the best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extend do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that some people think team sports activities are the grandous method to enable children working with other people in a group. However, I disagree with that sentiment because of the following reasons. 

To commence with, through team sports, nevertheless, children already design their own strategy to achieve collective purposes. It is because in sports, children deem to be selective when recruit other people to their teams. In other words, the are likely to choose someone who is either already close or reliable to them since the purpose is to win a game, which contradicts with the fundamental aims of working together with other people. Therefore, it deters them to procure essential traits that can be learned through cooperative work such as tolerance and respect, as they think the situation is already under control. It can be seen when boys are likely teaming up with talented students in football match, and left behind some of their peers that cannot support them to win the game. 

Furthermore, there is another activity besides team sports that is more effective to taught children on working as a team. Take, for example, a group project, where children are likely to be united with random people from different background. Referring from Albert Bandura’s research, this method was found to be reliable and prominent among kindergarten students because they were not solely focus to accomplish collective purposes whilst they also learn to unify different personalities and values, which in turn broadens their perspectives. Furthermore, the research also revealed that after involved in the group projects, students were willing to befriend with anyone in the classroom, which eventually alleviate social discrepancies between each student and hinder them from detrimental behaviours such as bullying. 

In conclusion, I disagree with the notion that team sports is the best approach to introduce children in working together. It is because in team sports, children already find their own way to achieve collective purpose. Moreover, I also think another pursuit such as group project is more effective to taught them since children are not only learn to accomplish goals, but also potentially embark several traits that can benefit them in the long run.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries, the quality of life in large cities is becoming worse/

What do you think are the causes of this problem?

What measures could be taken to solve it?' 
 'Text': 'Despite knowing that living in the large urban cities brings plethora of benefits for citizens, leading to degradation in quality of life. This essay will examine the main justification of these problems and possible solutions for addressing them.

  There are two main causes that would lead to less quality of life in the metropolitan cities which are increasing air pollution and crime throughout the cities. To be clear, during recent years, growthing in the proportion of population and using personal mechanical vehicle for commute more than before, emitting a lot of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, increasing air pollution and leading to several diseases for humans and animals. For example, during the recent decade, Tehran has been suffering from heavy traffic which leads to more air pollution and most of its inhabitants deal with lung disease. Furthermore, some studies illustrate that crime is more likely in the big cities. In other words, in the metropolitan cities, having control on all parts of the city can be challenging, thus theft happens even more.

  Some possible solutions for these problems are establishing more public transportation and using electrical vehicles and also nurturing more policemen. To be clear,  the government should improve access to the public transport sectors so people use them more than their own cars. Also using the electrical machines can be more useful due to the fact that they do not consume fossil fuels, so it can help to reduce air pollution. Additionally, fostering more police staff and recognizing more video recorders can improve cities' security from robbers' attacks. 

    To conclude, Although the quality of life in the large cities face risk of degradation by increasing air pollution and crime rate, there are some possible solutions for these problems. The government's strategies for building more transport stations and using  electrical vehicles can be an efficient solution against air pollution and also educating more policemen and considering video recorders, boosting the security of cities.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people argue that spending a lot of money holding birthday parties, wedding parties, and other celebration is waste money. Hoever, others believe such parties are improtant for individuals and for society. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There has been quite an obvious discuss around the topic of using huge amount of money on celebration. While some people believe that having a party is just burn your notes out of your pocket, others argued that there are some benefits behide those occations. I will show both views in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, There is no doubt that, nowadays, a social media obviously influence people around the world and that could make some people use over-budget for their special events. This is because, they tent to impress guestes or  just want to copy what they have seen from the internet. For instance, numerous couples in Thailand copy wedding parties concept from the celebrities, which is cost them arms and legs for it. To sum up, some organizer spend a lot of money on their events just to be impress others, this could lead to financial issues. if they could not afford it.

On the other hand, it is worths pointing out that there are good points of having a party. This is based on the face that some family members are not getting along with each other and this special occation would let them to meet up as well as could help improve a family's relationship. For example, wedding celemony in Thailand usually invites all family member to join, so this is a great opportunity to catch up with the members. 

In my opinion, wasting momey on special events or not? it really depends on the purpose of the parties. If it is happened to meet up with their old friends or family members, it would be worth to spend.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that it’s important to have a lot of money to be happy. To what extent do you agree with this statement? What other things can make you happy?' 
 'Text': 'According to some people, an ample amount of wealth is important to lead a happy and successful life.Though there are many other things, on which happiness of a person depends like love, kindness , frienship, the major source of happiness for a kin is still funds in his bank account, and I will discuss this idea in the following paragraphs.

First of all, due to paper money the wheel of the world is moving, so Yes, In this materialistic world, If  you want to buy something, you need cash. It also brings a sense of propserity in an individual and creates a sense of respect in the society. For example, Industrialists and Wealthy people tends to have greater fame and even their pity matters are boradcast online. They also shares a major chunk of cash in charity, thus creates a positive impact on others.

Secondly, Wealthy Individual can afford all sorts of extravaganza trips and creates memorable moments which lasts forever. For example, My Uncle works tirelessly for his business and we all pity on him, but every year he booked a lavish vacation trip for his family, thus creating lots of unforgettable memories, which could not be possible otherwise.

On the contrary, it is believed by many that a minimalist approach is better as it turns out to be contended and creates a sense of hormony. Also, emotions like empathy, sense of respect, friendliness and positive family values can only be preached in less money approach. For exmple, in a recent survey, It is observed that the children of middle class families have higher moral values and shows greater respect towards elders and siblings, then their following counterpart.

To conclude although a minimalist approach is gaining ample popularity today, It still can't beat the luxuries of life which are only possible through having gaint capital.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Too much money is spent in maintaining and repairing old buildings. Some people think that they should be knocked down and give way to the modern buildings. To what extent do you agree or disagree' 
 'Text': 'The usage of new technology in the education sector has been surged in recent times and prioritized over the conventional method of teaching to the large number of pupils. Contemporary technology in teaching is very convenient and timesaving for students as well as for teachers. The primary advantages and disadvantages of this phenomenon are discussed in the following passages.

On the one hand, there are various benefits of using new technologies for teaching students. Firstly, through the conventional method, it is very difficult for teachers to explain the complex topics to students. But, after the advent of new audio-visual technology, it is very easy to explain the tough topics with the help of animations. Additionally, since most educational institutes have adopted online teaching, students can easily learn from anywhere in the world, which is very convenient and timesaving. 

Despite these advantages, there are many drawbacks of new technologies which not only affect the learning curve of students, but it affects the overall health of pupils. First, it is nearly impossible for teachers to know if students are paying attention while teaching online and as a result, most students can’t score well in exams. Furthermore, new gadgets require pupils to constantly use digital screes which is very harmful for students of all ages. For example, as per a recent study, nearly 50% of children below age of ten, wear spectacles due to excessive use of digital screens.

In conclusion, new technological advancements in education surely increase students’ ability to grasp the complex subjects, and they are far more convenient and timesaving for teachers and students than traditional methods. However, they negatively affect the learning curve of pupils and their eye sights.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Group or team activities can teach more important life skills than those that are done alone. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'There is an ongoing debate regarding the merits of group activities versus individual activities in terms of developing important life skills. In this context, there are proponents who argue that group activities hold more prominence due to their collaborative nature, and I partially concur with this viewpoint. Nevertheless, I presumably believe that personal pursuits can also provide valuable life skills, if not more so.

Admittedly, advocates of activities done in group often highlight their collaborative nature of this endeavour, suggesting that people can mandate teamwork, communication, and leadership skills. In other words, working in a team setting can provide individuals with opportunities to learn how to cooperate, delegate tasks, and resolve conflicts effectively. This is mainly because group activities often simulate real-life scenarios where individuals must learn how to navigate diverse perspectives and work towards their common goals.

However, it is essential to recognise that solo pursuits offer an equal amount of invaluable life lessons. Undertaking such tasks alone renders its participant the ability to foster his self-reliance, independence, and accountability. This is because, while working independently, individuals must rely on their own judgement, problem-solving abilities, and perseverance to overcome challenges when compared to the approach of group activities. Therefore, in my view, this self-reliance not only instills confidence and resilience, but could also empower individuals to tackle obstacles with determination and resourcefulness.

A further advantage, somewhat related to the one mentioned above, is that solo activities will provide their inherent traits in deep introspection and personal growth. When working alone, individuals do have more freedom and pace with their own time to explore their interests, pursue their passions, and discover their strengths as well as weaknesses without a large scale of external influences. This self-discovery is especially integral to developing a strong sense of identity and purpose, which lies the main foundation for personal fulfilment and success in life. In addition to that, individual pursuits often require a high degree of focus and concentration, so honing essential skills such as time management, organisation, and critical thinking is siginificantly crucial in the scenario that if one wants to be an independent learner. 

In summarising up, although group activities undoubtedly offer valuable opportunities for collaboration and interpersonal development, I contend that solo endeavours can teach equally important life skills. Self-reliance, independence, personal growth, and critical thinking are just a few examples of the invaluable skills that individuals can acquire through individual pursuits. Therefore, I disagree with the notion that group activities are superior to imparting essential life skills.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that excessive use of smartphones badly affects a teenager’s literacy skills. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary society, it has been a long debate about smartphone addiction impact to youngsters, whether phone usage give advantage or detrimental result . Some societies have notion that overuse gadget could impact teenager awareness performance, while I do not agree with this opinion wholeheartedly. In forthcoming paragraphs, I will ellaborate the  positive and negative effect of smarphone and provide logical solution to filter the harmful effect of overly use gadget.

First and foremost, Communication devices is ubiquitos rightnow since it become a primary need for everyone and adolescents is no exeption. By using smartphone, we can connect to the world, for instance we can read news easyly, watch a podcast, and catch up with the communites in single touch. If we can use smartphone properly, it can become perfect appliance to learn and improve our knowledge significanly.

On the other hand, a lot of kids today witnessing excessive use of phones to access non-important website. To exemplify, They tend to spend their time by scrolling on instagram or playing game all day. By owing to these reasons, children do not have time anymore to learn or reading a book which badly influenced their literation performance. On top of that,The majority youngsters who became a phone dependence never connect with communities again which make they have a low awareness to the environment.

To sum up, Mobile devices have both advantegeos effects as well as harmful impacts based on the way we use it. As a guardian, parents should teach their child how to use smartphone in the right path, such as implement child mode. In the future, I hope proper mobile phone utilization lesson should be teached in every school to guide the students.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some areas of the US, a ‘curfew’  is imposed, in which teenagers are not allowed to be out of doors after a particular time at night uncles they are accompanied by an adult.

What is your opinion about this?' 
 'Text': 'The importance of curfew for teenagers in US during late night was always debatable, has now become more controversial. With many people claiming that it is beneficial , others rejct this notion. The substantial influence of this stringent law on this age group has sparked the controversy over the potential impact of this trend in recent years. In my opinion, this strict action appears to be more rational. This essay will further elaborate both positive and negative effects of the curfew and thus will reach a logical conclusion.

There are myriad of reasons which will further explain this argument but the most preponderant one stems from the fact of safety concerns as the curfew is necessary for the safety and security of teenagers from potential dangers such as crimes or accidents during late hours. For example, a recent news became very popular in US where a teenager was driving without driver license and killed 2 in crash. In this era, it's hard for the parents to handle their kids at home without these strict laws.

There are some pitfalls, however, that negate this arguments and which can certainly overwhelm the potential influence of this overly restrcition can hinder teenagaers ability to socialize, develop, independecne, and make their own decisions.Approach to deal with these alarms which are numerous but the most effective one is flexibility among these laws which is comprehensive and feasible approach.

In a nutshell one can reach a conclusion that there should be different arrnagements for educational, employment and family emergencies as this highlights the need for a balanced approach that considers individual circumstances.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Fatherhood ought to be emphasized as much as motherhood. The idea that women are solely responsible for deciding whether or not to have babies leads on to the idea that they are also responsible for bringing the children up. To what extent do you agree or disagree with the statement? You should use your own ideas, knowledge and, experience and support your answer with examples and relevant evidence.' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays there is a lot of discussion that the only women have responsible for having whether or not children and also, they have more responsible for taking care of them. In my opinion, I partly agree with this suggestion and I will give some examples in the bellow of this essay.

 Firstly, gender inequality still exists in this modern society. In this kind of issues we can see in the hiring to job. Many companies still prefer men for some type of work rather than women. For example, when I graduated university and went to the interview and the first question of interviewers was the “When I planning to get married?”. This one of the gender inequalities we have in our Uzbek society and this society gives more attention and opportunity for the Manship. So that is why, men give more their forces for their career and they don’t have time for their family.

 I addition to this, the men consist of the breadwinner and this view cannot be change for more time. They have also more duty to breed their family, but not just their children and spouses but also their parents. 

On the other hand, fatherhood play vital role in the developing their offspring’s physically and emotionally. Many researchers have proved that fatherly love is one the important aspects in the healthy family. Child which grows up in healthy conditions don’t have social problems. Besides this they can easily find they spot in the society. For instance, my cousin’s mother is the second wife. Father of my cousin has first family and children. He had tried to spend more his free time with the first family, so my cousin grow up in this condition and her character is little difficult. She always wants to be in the center of the group and require more attention from other people. She became unconfident. 

Overall, fatherhood is vitally important aspects in the child life, so that’s why fathers have to pay more attention for raising and caring their children as equal their mothers.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays people depends on newspapers, radios, television and the internet for news and information. Which in your opinion is the best way for getting news and why?' 
 'Text': 'People often depends on press, media and internet for getting news and other Information.  In my opinion, internet is the best way to getting news and information because it is easily accessible and low prices popular media. 

In the beginning,  internet is easily accessible thing. People getting any information in any places at any time by click a button. If they has a smartphone then it is very easy to find any questions and know what happen on the other side of world while television,  newspaper is not find any places easily. Besides, it is possible to watch TV on smartphone by using internet. For example, in the time of Covid-19,we measure how much important it is to get a easy access as it get the news all time and connected us with other people.

Furthermore,  it is a cheap popular thing.  It means people getting two benefits in one. Usually most of the people find the source which give them more benefits than others as well as in low price range. Especially,  the internt used by the students too musch, so it is budget friendly and thats why they access their learing thing, news in this media.  Moreover, many urban peoples are satisfies to use internet as their busniess purpose, connect with the family memver who lives abroad.  In this instance,  a survey conduct by Daily Star newspaper and found that around 70% people prefer internet than other purpose to access information and many of them said that they use it because they bear its cost easily as it is enough student Budget.

In conclusion, therefore, it is clear that internet is the best way to getting news because it  gets the news and information  so easily and cheap rated popular item.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'children nowadays spend great deal of time watching television.However television cannot replace as learning tool which is why children are less educated today.To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Due to advancement of digital and print media children nowadays spent major chunk of their time watching it.Though television can play a major role in education child through perfomance,some authorities believed that it cannot take place of books and practicals and youth nowadays is less knowledgeable than in past.I personaly agree with it and I will discuss that through examples in following paragraphs.

First of all, The digital media cannot replace the teachings of teachers who educate by spending their precious time on building the skills of the student.For example The Experience gained through studying in schools like recongnition of objects or pencil holding and grip on it cannot be learnt on our screens.Thus most valuable practical lessons are learnt offline.

Furthermore many empathic lessons are only gained in group settings for example sharing,caring for other emotions,respect for elders and social service to society is only practiced physically and though taught online dose'nt have that same impact.Even if a baby see them everday can't understand the concept without experiencing it.Further a child may recognize an object online but may not react to it if seen physically. For example, there is a disesase called screen autisim in which child understand the object or animal or identify colors on t.v but not in front of it.

On th contrary Many objects which are harmful in their natural settings like wild animals or many off season fruits and vegetable can be taught in this way,thus a kin can have a knowledge on it with out its access.It not only save money but also time and also can help parents to focus on their work while the child is watching it on scree. For example many documentry channels like national geographic provide first hand experience to the viewer.

To conclude,I personally believe that in hand expeirence is more resourcful then what taught online and a balance between both is necessory in order for our youth to learn.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Climate change is now an accepted threat to our planet but there is not enough political action to control excessive consumerism and pollution. Do you agree?'' 
 'Text': 'Climate change is indeed a pressing threat to our planet, yet political action to curb excessive consumerism and pollution is lacking. While governments have acknowledged the severity of the situation, their response has been insufficient.

Excessive consumerism, driven by a culture of materialism and economic growth, contributes significantly to climate change. Despite growing awareness, governments have been slow to implement policies that promote sustainable consumption and production. This inertia allows corporations to prioritize profits over environmental concerns, perpetuating the cycle of consumption and pollution.

Pollution, particularly from industrial activities, exacerbates the effects of climate change by emitting greenhouse gases and toxic pollutants. While some governments have introduced measures to reduce emissions, such as carbon pricing, these efforts have often been insufficient due to political inertia and vested interests.

In conclusion, while climate change is recognized as a grave threat, political action to address the root causes of excessive consumerism and pollution is lacking. To effectively combat climate change, governments must prioritize environmental sustainability and implement policies that promote responsible consumption and production. Only through concerted political action can we hope to mitigate the effects of climate change and protect the planet for future generations.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Over the last few decades, the media has promoted the image of young tin women as being ideal. What problems has this caused? What solutions can you suggest to this issue?' 
 'Text': 'there are many poeple believe that thin female is the ideal females which is mainly promoted by the modern media. This essay would delve into the problem caused by this trend and suggest some practical solution to address this issue.

First and foremost, one of the obvious problems caused by this trend is unhealthy dieting is on the increase. In other words, many young females are starving to loose weight and become thin, as a consequence, they are in the clutches of illness. For example, a new young model dead due to the overfasting in several days and loosing protein that is essential for the body maintenance. similarly, fat body women are being insulted and body shamed. The poeple have misconsumption that fat body is due to the intake of over food consumption, in turn, these fat young females are insulted publically and private parties become commonplace.

Nevertheless, there are some practical solution to tackle this issue to a great extend. Firstly, proper guidance should be provided for the young people to diet and loose body weight. In detail, health education should be provided by not only health authorities but also  universitites. The awareness for the proper dieting would reduce this issue. The authorities should be make strict laws and guidance to medias about  body shaming and harassment. By doint this the mental harassment for fat women can be reduced significantly.

In conclusion, unhealthy dieting is one of the main diadavantage of the thin-body fashion concept. similarly, mental harassment is the another negative effect of this trend. Ergo, proper diet education and implementation of strict laws are the practical solutions to address this issues.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is thought by some people that it is better to live in a city while others believe that life is better in the countryside. Discuss both these views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There are opposite views whether it is better to live in urban or rural areas. This essay will discuss both views alongside with my own opinion on each notion. 

On the one hand, living in big cities grants people an easy access to top-tier facilities. It is inevitable that the privilege of urban people lays on the easy accessibility from advanced public facilities such as hospitals that heightens the opportunity of people to live a better life. It can be seen from several cases that can be found in capital cities like Seoul or Jakarta, where people easily perceive detail and comprehensive medical examinations as well as treatments, supported by sophisticated equipment, since to reach those facilities people only require to make an ambulance call, once they suffer from certain symptomps. As a result, it can deter the percentage of people who likely to experience chronic diseases, which in turn increasing life expectancy and decreasing death tolls. Regardless that view; however, I disagree that reside in big cities is a beter option since it can be unsafe as the criminal rates are particularly higher.

On the other hand, having an outskirts live can make people physically and mentally healthy. Notwithstanding with an eminent fact that there is a likelihood its people will be provided with better air quality since there is a scarcity to find gasoline-based vehicles, which being the biggest threat to human’s respiratory systems, rural areas also prompt a condition that support better mental health conditions to human beings because it drift them apart from the typical hustle and bustle conditions in big cities. This notion is supported through a recent survey from NHS that unveil almost 76% of British people are likely live in rural areas compared to big cities because they feel mentally and phsyically better. As a result, it can increase people’s life satisfactions and hinder them from the potential psychological disturbance such as stress or depression. Regarding that notion, I agree with the decision to live in rural areas because it can benefit to the health levels of people in the long run. 

In conclusion, even though reside in big cities gives privilege to easily reach top-tier facilities for a better quality of life, it is not foreshortened the fact that people’s safety is also at risks with the higher rates of criminal activities. Therefore, I deem to agree with the idea to live in a rural area because it can provide both mentally and physically healthy environments, which benefit in the long run.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that it's better to work for a large company Than a small one

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Many individuals believe that it is a big chance to work for immense firms. On the other hand, it is unfortunate to work for small businesses. In my opinion this notion is actually right for many reasons.

    First, large organisations Offer more opportunities for advancement in a large-scale community. That means more opportunities to develop and grow through formal training programs which are often available in these companies. In addition there are a breadth  of roles which makes  the employee be able to make moves and Try different roles. As well as have more promotions. Furthermore, a larger company means a larger pool of talents. That means the worker will learn from people who are experts in their field and achieve  professional and personal development.  Finally, the diversity in workspace helps workers to meet a broad range of people with varied skill-sets. As well as make friends and more social relationships.

Second reason,  large companies often offer competitive salaries and extra perks for employees, that include health Insurance, dental and eye care. In addition, they can offer on-site child care for parent employees, gym memberships, also cafeterias and restaurants. Moreover, sometimes they provide employees with tools such as,  laptop or a company car that can help set the employee up for success. Finally, large companies’  salaries are a considerable  resource because they have big budgets.

  In conclusion, Generally, large companies are structured and organised environments which let employees  survive, thrive, specialise, and develop. Overmore,workers gain more resources and a large social communication network.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, people these days spend very little time with their children. What are the causes of this? Whom does this affect more, parents or children?' 
 'Text': 'Globally, human beings are working every day to support their families, however, this can cause them to stay away from their infants.Therefore, this can result in loneliness and I would like to suggest that many sons and daughters are mostly affected by this situation, although parents will suffer mentally too.Hence, in this essay, I am going to discuss why children are affected more.

Commencing, most of the fathers and mothers are grafting at least six days in a week and taking long shifts such as 12 to 16 hour shifts.Additionally, without doing this, it will be a problem so that they cannot afford to feed their adolescents and not even buy them clothes or electric gadgets.Meanwhile a child is always demanding, others wants to go to vacation and as a parent you have to pay tuitions all the time to keep them growing wisely.Furthermore, mostly juveniles are in trouble, because they are spending most of their time without their parents which can cause loneliness diseases, since parents are always at work.A very good example to mention is that, those who are based in the UK, for a family to survive, they must graft 24/7 to get enough salary which covers bills, transport, insurance as well as food.

Moreover, many teens are always stay without someone who can look after them, this is because some of current parents are studying whilst they are getting old.An example to illustrate that could be  people in my native country Zimbabwe, some of these family members travel to Poland and England to study nursing degree for about three years.Thus, they did this in the  sense that they can support their teenagers in the long run but at the same time children will be alone in Africa.This is clear that a toddler need his or her parent to grow up with discpline and will not suffer from depression while thinking of their parents.

To conclude, in the world, parents are always work and save money for their future lives, however, their chidren are suffering from loneliness due to the fact that they spend less time with their parents.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The best way for employers to make their workforce happy is allow them more flexible working hours?

To what extend do you agree ? What other measures could be effective?' 
 'Text': 'It is a well- known a vast number of employers encourage their employees to more happily in workplaces. Therefore, majority of employers start to create various flexible working hours. In my opinion, flexible working hours is able to give motivation for individuals. Moreover, there are many factors are that companies can start to make their workers satisfaction such as outside programs and extra salary . 

First and foremost, flexible working hours way the best method to give entertainment for workers is that people can live more comfortably. In fact, if employees are able to choose their working hours in variety times , they would spend their time more freely. For example, in 2020, Ziraat Bank in Turkey, giving a gold chance for its workers to start their work in various time. As a result, The Ziraat Bank obtained best company reward from Turkish locals in this years .

Additionally, doing outside programs among colleges and high salary have ability to motivate workers. Obviously, many workers are confused from stressful and hard working. Hence, companies should have organize outside traveling events to enjoy employees each others . For instance, Google company found in a statistic, most of Google company are happy with in this organization. This is light of the fact that the company organize two times outside visiting per month. As a result, it succeed in motivating its workers. Another prominent factor is that giving extra money for workers surprisedly. In other words, money is extremely fundamental element to work individuals today’s world. Hence, adding some amount of salary can feel better for employees. 

In conclusion, creating flexible working hours would be satisfaction employees in their working. I totally agree with this idea. In addition, companies can increase high level of enjoying for workers by giving more salary and organizing outside activities.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Space exploration costs taxpayers an exorbitant amount of money each year. What are the advantages and disadvantage of spending money on space exploration?' 
 'Text': 'In the present age, government annually share funding for space technologies. By this way, they can create great developments on it, like making people's communities easier, which may have negative effects on the economy of the country. 

One significant advantage of spending money on new space technologies is that it lets people have more facilities in their lives. Creating and developing our space area will give citizens valuable knowledge about our planet as well as the universe. By using new space technology, our scientists could have more facilities to see other details on planets and see changes in the universe, just to know and open up new knowledge for our young generation during their study period. Moreover, funding for space exploration has another positive side, that is linked with economic opportunities. Due to space exploration fosters economic growth by creating jobs, stimulating innovation, and driving investment in related industries. It has the potential to spur new industries such as space tourism, asteroid mining, and satellite manufacturing.

On the other hand, it has was negative risk to human life, just because space exploration involves inherent risks to human safety, including exposure to radiation, microgravity effects, and the possibility of accidents during launch, landing, or spacewalks. Astronauts face long-term health risks from extended space missions. Other negative is that environmental impact. For example space missions can have environmental consequences, including pollution from rocket launches and the creation of space debris. Managing space debris is crucial to preventing collisions that could endanger operational satellites and spacecraft. 

In conclusion, space explorations have effects on both sides. Meanwhile, this funding on it make effects on people’s facilities and economic while it also has negative effects on human life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Prevention is better than cure\' 
 'Text': 'Health is the state of physical, mental and social well-being. I agree to the given statement that prevention is better than cure because after treatment the damage done to mental status can not be fully recovered. This essay will shed light why I am in favour of providing health education and prevention measures to people.

To commence with, preventive measures are cost-effective in long run, reducing the overall financial burden on the healthcare system and pockets of common man. For example, in India, more than 70 million people are diagnosed with diabetes which is a non-communicable disease. Therefore, they spend a large amount of money to treat it and sometimes take medicine for their whole life. As a result, they spend a great proportion of their income to get treatment. However; if they would be provided healthcare education and take necessary steps to avert such diseases, they can use their money for productive works. Thus, a proactive approach to healthcare can lead to healthier population, which inturn contributes to the economic productivity of a country.

Moreover, investing in health awareness system can significantly increase public awareness of healthy practices, thereby reducing the incidence of preventable ailments. However, many disorders are genetic and many infections are communicable for which the authorities should have to make prior plans. For example; during Covid pandemic many nations were not able to handle the cases because they did not have necessary plans. Thus, there should be adequate vaccinations and treatment plans to showcase the control of serious illness.

To conclude, the authorities can aware people about the preventive measures to ensure their balanced life along with allocating treatment measures for serious malady for comprehensive healthcare system.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people spend most of their lives living close To where they were born.

 What might be the reasons for this? What are the advantages and disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Most individuals live most of their life In the same area, which they were born and grew up in, because  they feel themselves and their neighbours like one big family. As well as, settling in the hometown has pros and cons.  

To begin, numerous people desire to live and settle in their hometowns because  the neighbours’  and relatives’ existence is a crucial and valuable thing In the life. For example,  when there is a ceremony such as a wedding or a funeral, everyone in the region helps and supports each other. As a result,  neighbours are happy for someone's happiness and they are sad for someone’s sadness. Furthermore, the neighbourhood is the backrock of the relationships and communications. As a result, if you are depressed or need some support, you will find many loyal individuals around you, who advise you faithfully. Although, the reason for living in a birthplace may be property ownership, which decreases the expenses in renting in other places.

 However, growing up in the hometown has many advantages. For example, there are ready Connections and friendships, which serve the time in building new relationships. In addition, there is a supportive and safe environment for parents and children. For example, when we  were children, my mother told us that our home key would be with our neighbour, If she was outside. In contrast, living in the birthplace is terrible because sometimes, neighbours or relatives are nosy. Then they share with you about your personal life, or they visit without a previous appointment. In addition,  living where the individual was born engages them in gossip and rumours. Finally, the dominance  of the traditionals and customs, especially in the rural communities, may impact on the development of life skills. For instance, in rural life it's a shame if you apologise for visiting during  your exams or your children's exams.

In conclusion, people’s hometown is the safe and supportive environment for raising children. On the other hand, some communities where an individual was born have positives.  Also they have drawbacks that may be an obstacle on the road of self-development and lead to bad issues.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many young people are leaving their homes in rural areas to study or work in the cities. What are the reasons? Do the advantages of this develoment outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'One of the widely discussed issues nowadays is that young generation are living their homes in rural areas to study or work in cities. It is undeniable that getting education and experience becomes an essential part of our future. However, there is no absolute agreement as some people find moving to the cities in terms of development beneficial, while others especially their parents consider everything associated with living hometowns negatively. Surely there are both pros and cons about that situation but I believe advantages outweigh disadvantages.

One of the major positives of leaving countryside is that obviously, there are much more opportunities for personal growth and development in cities. For instance, there is no any qualified colleges or universities to become professional. So, in urban areas there are mane such institutions. Furthermore, after graduating young people have more convenience to find a job and gain first experience. Another advantage is that quality of infrastructure there is much higher than in small towns. A good example here is medicine. For instance, a person who has a toothache can easily make an appointment with a dentist and treat it on the same day.

Turning to the other side of the argument, it can lead to the urbanisation problem in whole country. Moreover, there is a risk of devastation of settlements. Yet, it is most likely that young people will return to their native lands after self-development.

Taking everything mentioned into account, we can come to a conclusion that life in cities gives a lot of opportunities for personal growth , but it can also have consequences that need to be taken into account.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that all popular TV programmes should aim to educate viewers about improtant social issues. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays it is very common to hear from people that it is hard for them to get sufficient sleep. As a result, they suffer from a lot of physical health problems as well as mental health issues. Therefore, making people aware of the detrimental effects of the lack of sleep and the importance of following the same sleep routine are the most effective solutions.

To begin with, good night’s sleep is one of the most important factors for maintaining healthy lifestyle. Lack of good quality sleep can cause multiple problems not just in the short run but in the long run as well. Further, it has very harmful effects on the immune system of the body which helps fighting with diseases. Moreover, it increases the amount of stress in the body which in turn reduces the body’s ability to recover itself. Consequently, this stress due to insufficient sleep leads to innumerable incurable diseases.

However, there are many possible solutions available which can help improve the sleep cycle. Among all, the first and foremost is to make people aware of the significance of enough sleep and how it can badly affect the overall health if not taken seriously. For example, most youngsters don’t know about the adverse effects of lack of sleep and as a result, they don’t pay much attention to it. Moreover, as per the study conducted by the Harvard research center, people who have the same sleep routine everyday are less susceptible to stress. Therefore, it is very important to have the same sleep routine.

To conclude, not getting adequate sleep can lead to a number of health problems and decrease the body’s ability to cope up with stress. Spreading awareness about detrimental effects of lack of sleep and developing the sleep routine can definitely help solve the issues caused by it.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many young people are leaving their homes in rural areas to study or work in the cities. What are the reasons?  Do the advantages of this development outweigh its disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'One of the widely discussed issues nowadays is that students leaving rural areas to live in the cities. It is undeniable that urbanisation has become an essential part of our life. However there is no absolute agreement as some people find living in the city beneficial , while others consider everything associated with urban living negatively. Surely, there are both pros and cons to city life but I believe advantages outweigh disadvantages.

One of the main positives of city life is many entertainment options. In other words big cities are packed with museums, theatres, cultural attractions or other options. You can spend your free time as interesting and informative as possible.

Another advantage is the medical assistance in the big cities. Getting good quality medical care is not a problem in urban areas. A good example here is the patient may not always receive the best care at a suburban medical facility, leading visiting doctors to recommend transferring them to a hospital in a city. Due to hospitals are outfitted with cutting-edge technology, a group of elite medical professionals, or first-rate services.

Turning to the other side of the argument, high living cost. Living costs in urban areas can be significantly higher compared to suburban or rural areas due to factors such as higher rent prices, increased cost of goods and services, and greater demand for amenities and conveniences. One clear example is  rent for a small apartment in the city center can easily exceed $3,000 per month, while the same amount may afford a spacious house in a suburban neighborhood.

Another major disadvantage is violence. Examples of violence in major cities in Asia, Africa, and Latin America, such as interfaith clashes in Nairobi, and drug-related crime in Rio de Janeiro, are negative aspects of urban life, highlighting issues of safety and levels of violence that can significantly impact the quality of life and well-being of urban populations.

Having considered all the points mentioned, it is evident that urban living offers numerous advantages over suburban life. You just need to get out of the country as often as possible, visit nature to relax from the stressful rhythm of life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'As the number of private cars has increased, so too has the level of pollution in many cities. What can be done to tackle this increasingly common problem?' 
 'Text': 'One of the widely discussed issues nowadays is utilizing vehicles with fossil and benzol engines , that as a result causing worldwide contamination. It is undeniable that rapid transportation has become an essential part of our life. However, these days such type of transports  are cause several environmental distractions, and nature pollutions.

One of the main aspects of the problem is that cars with environmentally unfriendly motors , substantially damage the earth soil and air wealth. By contrast the modern technologies use engines that made up from the black oil, which unfortunately produces quantity of detrimental gases, afterwards breaking the ozone layer .This type of fuels are  the one of the most undesirable products in the planet. Therefore automobiles provide several global disasters that are impossible to cooperate with. 

To tackle these problems government should restrict the production of these minerals by abandoning and divorcing whole petrol industry. Inhabitants although could shorten the usage of cars, and moving by public transportation, that although more will lift up the city's infrastructure. This may be the easiest and so the best way is to encourage people to purchase water motored and electric cars or at least obtaining vehicles with biodiesels will bring success.

Having weighed everything mentioned up, we can come to a conclusion that governors must stop manufacturing the oil. So it would not be surprising to see some shortages in using the ecological harmful agencies in the near future. Actions must be taken urgently, otherwise we will get the extinction of flora and fauna, another option could be making the earth with no biodiversity and humanity.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many parts of the world today there is a profitable market for products which lighten or whiten people’s skin. Outline the reasons for using such products and discuss what effects they have in terms of health and society.' 
 'Text': 'In the majority of parts of the world there is a profitable store for products which lighten or whiten individuals’ skin. The number of people who buy these products are increasing day by day at an alarming rate. In this essay, I will discuss reasons and their effects.

First of all, lack of self-confidence can cause using products which lighten or whiten people’s skin. To elaborate, especially nowadays some individuals face confidence issues due to their skin of faces. As a result, people try to use some products in order to seemlier beautiful in society. These products can detrimental impact on human’s health. To be more specific, sometimes people’s skin can be allergy to products, and it has the opportunity to affecting human’s health. Moreover, people are capable of suffering from skin diseases due to allergy and this is in the turn can lead other variety consequences.

Another reason is that promoting of products is the key of the success. To be more specific, companies are capable of booming messages about their products for skin and it can cause buying and utilizing products by buyers. With regard to effect, buyers may not even be able to control financial stability and it is in the turn is able to affecting reduction in income in the future. Hence, people are capable of experiencing financial hardship.

In conclusion, in most areas of the world, products that lighten and whiten people’s skin are acquired from a profitable market by individuals. There are the main 2 reasons and their effects to health and society.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Each year, the crime rate increases.

What are the causes of crime and what could be done to prevent this rise in criminal activity?' 
 'Text': 'The number of crimes is increasing day by day at an alarming rate. There is many crimes causes and their solutions. In this essay, I will discuss crime reasons and their solutions.

First of all, crimes can originate many things such as unemployment. To be more specific, people suffer from unemployment, and it is able to be causing crimes. For instance, in some countries, individuals try to rob something, which is money, phones and so on, from people for living. With regard to solution, there is a big issue which is lack of permanent workplaces. The government should provide citizen dwellers with the majority of workplaces. If the government pay attention this factor, most people will have works. Individuals will focus on their works and, the number of crimes more and more will decline in the future.

Another the main reason is that lack of knowledge about laws as well as lack of education. To elaborate, sometimes youngsters are not aware of the results of any criminal activity, and it leads to crimes such as every person can do any kind of harsh action for example kill and slab. Therefore, the government should provide individuals with fundamental rules due to crimes. Moreover, if the government ought to give education, people will have enough information about punishments. As a result, it will prevent crimes.

In conclusion, crimes are more and more rise. There is two main causes and solutions. The above mentioned will decline the number of crimes in the future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Write about the following topic:

In many countries today there are many highly qualified graduates without employment.

What factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opinion, can/should be done about it?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience' 
 'Text': 'Across the globe, unemplyment rate is growing day by day. This eassy argues that there are many literate person available whose graduation level are higher than many average people and yet not getting ant job. The two main reasons of this problem are lack of practical experience and not fulfilling the requirements of job market.

First and foremost, most of the student's target is to get the certificate from the institution just to get a job which is the main reason not getting the real skill by completing graduation that the job market needs. Aditionally, graduation certificate is just a show off for the students nowadays to get some respect in this society which is reallly not valueable if they don't apply the thing they learned in their practical life. For instance, a higher proportion of unemployed peoples blame the government for this problem whereas they are mostly responsible for their own lackings which is like the people who can't dance, but blames the floor for that.

Secondly, major part of unemployed people thinks that just a higher level certificate is needed to get a good job by not researching the job market. Moreover, they just deny the job of lower salary \u0026 the opportunity of having an unpaid internship. However, they are not concerned about their future which makes them to losing the opportunity of gaining experince on their own. For instance, nearlly all of the company with high salary requires minimum 2 years of job experience which is not suitable for the people who aren't eager to gain experience from a low salary providing company.

To conclude, lack of experience in their job field and not matching the profile of the job market required are the main reasons of not getting jobs.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that students in high school should not waste their time studying literature, such as poems and novels. Do you agree?' 
 'Text': 'Literature is one of the main school subjects, and some people think that it should be omitted from the curriculum. Poems and novels are the main parts of literature that students learn at school. I think literature is one ofthe most important lessons for students, and we can't remove it from their subjects.

Literature can be the main part of each lesson. For better understanding in mathematics and even other sciences, students should learn literature. Better reading and writing can be effective in other lessons. For instance, to understand the complicated arches of chemistry, you should be good at reading to understand that long text with many new words. If you have enough vocabulary, you can understand better, which will help you get a better mark and even affect your self-confidence.

Literature helps people understand history better. For a better life, we should know our history, and books and novels are the main source of our culture and history. Studying novels and many fantastic books will help people know themselves better. Literature has a close relationship with our culture and our personal lives. If you are good at language, you can communicate better, and better communication will have a lot of profit, like better job opportunities. Studying novels and poems can help people know their emotions better and even help them control them.

In some cases, maybe literature seems a bit boring, but it is an unseparable part of our study courses, and we should take it into account more than other lessons. Novels and poems are the only real sources that can tie us to our own culture and that of other countries, and this is very valuable.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The pictures show information about average income and spending on food and clothes by an average family in a city in the UK.' 
 'Text': 'The table and pie charts illustrate the average family income and expenditure on food and clothes in a UK city across two different years, 2010 and 2013.

In 2010, the average income of a family was £29,000, which decreased to £25,000 by 2013. Despite this drop in income, spending on food and clothes rose from £14,000 to £15,000 in the same period.

The 2010 pie chart shows that the largest expenditure was on meat and fish, constituting 29% of the spending, followed by other food items at 26%. Dairy products and fruit and vegetables were less significant, comprising 18% and 15%, respectively, while clothing expenses accounted for 12% of the budget.

By 2013, spending patterns shifted slightly. Expenditure on meat and fish remained the highest at 30%, and there was an increase in the proportion spent on clothes, up to 16%. The percentage spent on other food decreased to 23%, while fruit and vegetables accounted for 13%, and dairy product expenses dropped to 18%.

Overall, the family's income decreased over the three-year period, but their spending on food and clothes increased, with the most significant proportion of their expenses consistently devoted to meat and fish. The increased spending on clothes in 2013, despite reduced income, is also noteworthy.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people say that globalisation and the growing number of multinational companies have a negative effection the environment.

To what extent do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that these days globalisation  increasing in many countries, the question is : does the soar numbers also the globalisation of multinational companies have nagative effect on the environment? in this essay l am going to explain my point of view as well as giving reasons and examples related to my opinion.

According to the reasons why do I disagree on that global people does not effect badly on environment,on the contrary believe that positive effects outwight the negatives, however

 in spite of the overseas individuals could take amount of time to Knowing the rules and laws furthermore how things go in another country, they could have benefits to us.

Moreover as I mentioned, the advantages of being in country have a huge

 multinational companies ,firstly engagement with other cultures might decline the racism thus of being talking or warking or studing with these individuals, on the other hand the cooperation our companies with them it will make rapidly progress , sharing ideas along with information would be the causes of great success for example: Space saudi company and the National Eygpt government have cooperation results of that they have fantastic answers for their questions.

In conclusion ,although the rose numbers of multinatinals and globalisation we can solve a lot of issues by suppot and help the forgien humans, and to understand the different is nutural thing in our world.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say History is one of the most important school subjects. Other people think that, in today’s world, subjects like Science and Technology are more important than History.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'Every school subject brings different knowledge, experience and skills to pupils. Some people argue that learning History should be the first and foremost fields at school. Others believe that in nowadays, on this quickly changed modern world there is another subjects, like Science and Technology which pupils should pay attention more than History.

I am agree with the statement that students should be engaged much more with Science and Technology for better future, but I think than there is a several benefits to know about the History as well.

In this essay I will support this view with arguments in the following paragraphs.

There are several reasons why History is one of the most important subject at school.

However when it comes to History everyone should know about his ancestors and what they did to develop a particular country. Many authors pose that people can't build a future and can't live in the present without having a basic knowledge about their pasts. Studying History can provide valuable insights into the development of society and cultures. For instance it is useful to know about what previous people did and how they did, this can lead to a good oportunity for people who live in present to compare and don't make the same mistakes as their predecessor did in the past.

Furthermore we live in an era of technology and everything is changing very fast.

Encourage pupils to pay more attention to Science and Technology fields will be a benefitial for the society as a population we need more and more scientists to work out to find a new technology in case of to improve people's quality of life. 

Moreover schools should engaged students deeply with this important subject and not at least by developing new technology which will be useful for the humanity. 

In conclusion, both fields History and Science/Technology should be provided to pupils with balance between them, because without knowing their past young people cannot build a good future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people believe that using a bicycle as your main form of transport has a lot of advantages whereas others think that it has many disadvantages. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Recently, there have been some debates about whether bicycles should be used as the main vehicle for everyone as a large amount of benefits from that form of transport, but some think it still has a lot of drawbacks. From my perspective, I think bicycles can not replace others . In this essay, I will discuss both views and explain my own opinion. 

To begin with, there is one primary reason why people think bicycles should be regarded as the main transport. That is the avoidance of becoming a pollutant, which as we all know  protecting the environment by reducing a large amount of emissions from vehicles is always a topic that people are concerned about. By riding bicycles as the main transportation, people believe that the earth will be decreased a significant fuel fume each year that burning fuel vehicles are running which actually help our society we are living. In addition to being friendly to the environment, those bikers think that using a bike will not cost too much money, and the insurance for cars, bills for oil or taxes for roads will be saved for other purposes.

 

In spite of enormous advantages, using bicycles as the main vehicle also creates other problems such as taking too much time to move around, which others will be better especially to reach to far destinations. Besides, cycles will not cover entirely the environmental matters as well due to emissions only contributing a small proportion to the whole picture. With  modern technology, there are many new electric cars that are not only able to deal with environmental problems, but also faster and more effective than cycles. 

In conclusion, using bicycles as the main can help people save a large of money for running it and reduce emissions from vehicles, but it takes users too much time to go far points, and also can not tackle completely the environmental issues, which make using electric vehicles wiser.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artifical intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In today digital ear, the development of AI (artificial intelligent) and automatic machine are increasing the replacement in workplace of humankind. The writer believes that this is a positive change due to the public’s requirement about life standard and also the development of human legacy.

It must be understood that the advancement of AI beginning at social enhancement of better living standard. Following the advanced industrialization in many fields of life, the automatic organization of AI supports many procedure process with a sustainable quality. Moreover, the application of robots to daily life supports many works become automated that many tasks are automatically completed quickly like a vending machine. Take Samsung as an exam that this corporation utilizes robots and AI in the industrial process and also in their products that are widely consumed all around the world make it becomes one of the biggest company in the world.

Another argument worth considering is that the advancement of worldwide innovation. In other words, Industrial revolution of human legacy are now developed with the extremely supports of AI due to the rapidly solve many matters in many fields include science. As a result, a number of missions that difficult to handle manually now can be easier finish with the help of AI and robots. Thus, it leads to forward-looking changes in progress of exploring knowledge of people.

In conclusion, the author believes that the evolution of robots and artificial intelligent to replace human jobs occurs by the need of people in enhance living standard. Moreover, this in a positive adjustment due to it supports humankind in many fields of science in global modernization.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that mobile phone conversations should be banned in crowded and social places, while others argue it is okay to be allowed. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Today, there is an argument between people who have a faith in not using cellphones in public areas and people who think that this case is not a serious problem and it should be permitted. This essay agrees that having probation for conversation via digital gadgets in public places should be taking into account.

On the one hand, the vast majority of people in a society are agree that speaking with the phone in crowded places should be banned. These days most of people have a cellphone which has an undeniable role in our daily life, while human is a sociable and needs to have in person conversation rather than virtual one. So, when a lot of people in a small place are starting to talk on mobile phones, not only noise pollution will be raised but also the distance between two companies will be raised too. For instance, because of improvement in new technologies and new smartphones, the rate of divorces between 2018 and 2019 is 60% higher in comparison to 2001 and 2002.

On the other hand, having a public discussion with someone by smart gadgets is preferable by some people. There is a concept that is believed, a lot of our daily tasks, including minor things, are depended to new technologies. So, people should be allowed to use their smartphones wherever they want. However, by rising a noise pollution in public areas, some person can have physical or mental problems. As a consequence, facing these circumstances could be dangerous mentally and physically for them. For example, when a person is suffering from anxiety, it is not preferable for him to be a crowded place where everyone speak in high pitch.

In conclusion, these day by emerging the cutting-edge technologies, people have an argument about using telephone in public place or it should be stopped. Since, having conversation in public places can bring noise, it is vital to not having conversation with phones in public places.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries, children are becoming overweight and unhealthy. Some people think that the government has the responsibility to solve this problem.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In several countries, teenagers are now gaining more weight, which has a negative impact on their health. A group of individuals say that the government needs to  address this issue for some reasons. Although some individuals agree with this matter due to several reasons, I strongly disagree with this statement.

Firstly, parents should be in charge of their children's obesity and their unhealthy. This is because mothers always prepare daily meals for kids or buy materials for families’ meals. For instance, Vietnamese women like cooking with oil and butter, so children’s obesity increased rapidly. Moreover, their fathers buy snacks for them after they go home.                                                                                                                     

Secondly, teenagers must be aware of their obese states. In other words, they lack control of what they eat. For example, American and Vietnamese children love eating fast food and consume too much milk tea after lots of times they need to study at school. Therefore, they have a disease and obesity.

In conclusion, the government does not have a response for these reasons. Therefore, parents need to be careful with this activity and say that their children should eat more clearly. Teenagers just need to eat healthy food because it’s good for their improvement.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people say that globalisation and the growing number of multinational companies have a negative effection the environment.

To what extent do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that these days globalisation  increasing in many countries, the question is : does the soar numbers also the globalisation of multinational companies have nagative effect on the environment? in this essay l am going to explain my point of view as well as giving reasons and examples related to my opinion.

According to the reasons why do I disagree on that global people does not effect badly on environment,on the contrary believe that positive effects outwight the negatives, however

 in spite of the overseas individuals could take amount of time to Knowing the rules and laws furthermore how things go in another country, they could have benefits to us.

Moreover as I mentioned, the advantages of being in country have a huge

 multinational companies ,firstly engagement with other cultures might decline the racism thus of being talking or warking or studing with these individuals, on the other hand the cooperation our companies with them it will make rapidly progress , sharing ideas along with information would be the causes of great success for example: Space saudi company and the National Eygpt government have cooperation results of that they have fantastic answers for their questions.

In conclusion ,although the rose numbers of multinatinals and globalisation we can solve a lot of issues by suppot and help the forgien humans, and to understand the different is nutural thing in our world.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say History is one of the most important school subjects. Other people think that, in today’s world, subjects like Science and Technology are more important than History.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.'
