instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Wealthy nations should assist poorer countries with humanitarian relief during natural disasters' 
 'Text': 'It is a debatable topic that whether developed countries’ role to provide disasters relief with developing countries. This essay strongly agrees this statement because wealthier countries have advanced medical systems that can help many victims from natural catrophy such floods, earthquake and tornado. Another reason is that  natural disasters can happen anywhere and helping each other is a necessary humanilsm trait to create better relationship and bring a peace in the global.

To begin with, wealthy nations tend to have more developed health care systems which include high skilled and knowledgeable professionals. natural disaster can produce a lot of injured people and they often requires quality health care which allows to save so many citizens. For examples, I have joined non-profit organisation which gathers health care professions such as doctors, nurses and physiotherapists from over the world to help people who suffered from the massive floods in Indonesia few years ago. We helped lots of people with complex issues which local doctors could not deal with. our advanced care saved lots of peoples lives.

Secondly, natural disasters are not only happen to particular countries and it can happen anywhere else. Helping each other does not only help ensure our humanilsm but also build a good relationship globaly. Instead of fighting each other like world wars, we should bring peace by supporting each other. For example, there was a devastating flood in philipines in 1988. Japanese goverment sent a lot of army to help the country from such a disaster providing food, medication and sunnitaries. since then, Japan and philipines have created a strong bond which brought our trade better and contract in a peace agreement which ensures not brought up wars.

In concision, providing support from wealthy countries to poor countries is a must agreement in the global because developed countries have advances medical systems which can save victims lives and this brings a peace in the world by improving our relationship.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, owing a home rather than renting one is very important for people.

Why might this be the case? Do you think this is a positive or negative situation?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, in a number of countries, people are willing to buy a house as opposed to rent it. In my opinion economic instability and governmental advertisements contribute to this situation. I am also convinced that home owners are more likely to benefit from privacy and economic success. Therefore, the benefits of purchasing a house override its drawbacks.

From my perspective, in some developing countries which face economic recession and high levels of inflation, citizens are compelled to buy a house. This may provide them with economic stability and prevent from financial issues in the future. For example, in Iran, the rent and price of properties are escalating alarmingly on a regular basis. Consequently, if people do not take steps towards owing a house, they will never afford it. Moreover, the interest rate of bank loans is increasingly going up and taking a loan can be challenging to some extent. On the other hand, since housing is a primary source of revenue for governments, they encourage people to purchase a house as soon as possible.

I further believe that owing a home is able to lift the burden from household’s shoulders. This enables them to tackle other problems and experience economic prosperity. For instance, they are likely to make ends meet and save money for their children’s education. Additionally, home owners are able to take full advantage of privacy and calm. This may result in boosting the quality of life and health levels.

In conclusion, the economic stability and the policy of governments convince people to buy a house instead of renting it. Also, I opine that the economic prosperity and privacy which associate with purchasing a house, it is a positive notion.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many parts of the world there is continuous coverage of sports on television. Some believe this discourages the young from taking part in any sports themselves. Discuss the view and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'The issue of coverage of sports on television is a ubiquitous debate in the society. Some people argue that the coverage of sports on television discourages young people from participating in any sports. Conversely, some argue that it will increase participation of young people in any sports. This essay delves into both perspectives and personal beliefs about them. 

On one hand, the television shows make people become lazy. Television attracts audiences to stare on the screen for some moments. People will tend to watch television rather than being engaged in physical activities such as exercising, walking around on foot, and running. It will make a perception that watching television is already enough for doing exercise. Additionally, watching television is a lack of movement activity. 

On the other hand, some people believe that watching sports on television can shape the perspectives of the audience. It can turn some athletes into idols for the younger generation. For instance, Olympic champions Greysia Polii and Apriyani Rahayu, who won the gold medal in the women's doubles sector of badminton at the Tokyo Olympics 2020. The impact of having athelets into idols is where sports arena are being fully booked by young people. They are attracted by athletes who won olympic gold medal. This means sports channel on television effectively persuade young people to do any sports. 

In conclusion, while some people argue that television shows can make some individuals become lazy, it is essential for considering that sports television shows are also persuading the youth to participate in any sports. Therefore, audiences need to be wise while watching television. They can do some pureposeful physical activity instead of watching television, while also being inspired by athletes featured on television.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the past most working people had only one job, however nowadays more and more people have more than one job at the same time.

 What are the reasons for this development?

 What are the advantages and disadvantages of having more than one job?' 
 'Text': 'Most people today are working in multiple jobs all over the world compared to the past era because they mainly need to get more money or gain more skills. However, working a second job has positive and negative impacts.

To begin, many individuals are choosing to work two jobs for many reasons. The primary reason is boosting their bank accounts or incomes to cope with rising cost of living. Which is becoming high and varies all over the world. Where the present lifestyle is more complex  than in the past. Then  the present industrial based economy changes the concept of life standards, such as education, houses’ styles, clothes and food. As a result, those living standards costs become high according to the rapid economic changes. In addition, some people become jobholders to enhance their resumes because future employers will take note of multiple jobs on their resumes.

 MoreOver, working extra jobs has pros and cons. On the one hand, it enhances income. So it's an awesome way to get more money to satisfy all life aspects, or provide financial security. Besides, engaging in an aside job expands the professional network. Also, it contributes to a sense of stability when the worker feels mental well-being. On the other hand, working two jobs means constant pressure, which leads to exhaustion, lack of enough ordered sleep, and increased risk of stress. As a consequence,it can have serious health issues. Ultimately, working more than one job eats into leisure time, as well as leaves little room for personal life, social life, and hobbies.

  In conclusion, holding extra employment is a way to improve living and supply the incomes. also It helps in developing skills,mental well-being, and experiences. But,  it leads to less self-care and a healthy lifestyle due to time constraints.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Online shopping is increasing dramatically. How could this trend affect our environment and the kinds of jobs required?' 
 'Text': 'It is true that the popularity of online shopping is experiencing a significant surge. This essay will show its far-reaching negative and positive impacts on the environment and on various jobs related to e-commerce.

The increase of online shopping brings both positive and negative impacts on the environment. This trend has helped minimise emissions and fuel consumption by decreasing the number of private vehicles traveling to traditional stores, thereby contributing to improving the air pollution. Nevertheless, remote purchasing also leads to a rise in packaging waste as this method often links with the process of product transportation, which requires careful packaging with multiple layers such as shock-absorbent wraps, cardboard boxes, to protect goods. This perspective is particularly true with the case of To Lich river, located in the heart of Viet Nam’s capital, where numerous plastic bags and cardboard boxes are thrown into the river, causing water pollution and creating an unsightly and foul-smelling environment that significantly impacts on resident’s health and urban skylines. 

The growth of e-shopping also affects human employment in both favorable and unfavorable manners. On the one hand, this trend creates many new opportunities for the labor market. It is because of maintaining an online store, various roles such as customer data administration, consulting staff and delivery drivers, opening up more employment opportunities for workers. On the other hand, as online purchasing becomes increasingly prevalent, traditional brick-and-mortar stores have to face the risk of bankruptcy. The reason for this is consumers tend to buy essential items such as food on online groceries thanks to its convenience, rather than going to nearby stores as before, leading to declines in the revenue of these stores, particularly those owned by older people who may struggle with cutting-edge. Grab is a perfect example for this phenomenon, especially since they offer grocery delivery online, consumers can simply use their mobile phone at home to order various goods including food, medicine, clothing and wait for the delivery drivers to arrive. This significantly reduces the number of customers visiting traditional stores and markets for shopping.

In conclusion, online shopping impacts the environment and the labour market in both positive and negative ways.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many parts of the world, there is not enough food for everyone. What do you think are the causes of this? What solutions can you suggest?' 
 'Text': 'In many places on the earth, food is in shortage. I think this is because the food can not be produced in somewhere, and I will explain in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, plants can not live anywhere. Thus, only the particular areas are good for cultivating them. Places like deserts, volcanoes, north polar, and so on are the locations that you can not grow anything. Therefore, the people there always feel hungry. Most of them are not healthy. They do not have enough food, and not to mention eat healthy. Besides, some nations are in battles, and food producers such as farmers, butchers, fishermen, and so forth are running away from their hometowns. They do not want to work anymore. Hence, food is very expensive there. In those parts of the world, they have to rely on importing food from their neighbors. If their neighbors are not friendly, they will face difficulties.

The remedy I can think of is to use modern technologies to help them grow vegetables and fruits. About meat, meat may be not that important, because nowadays there are so many vegetarians. They do not eat meat, but they are still good in their lives. They are with strong bodies, no sicks, good figures, etc. In my view, developed countries should have to donate their extra food to the poor. Because every year they waste a lot of them, and give them to garbage bins.

In a nutshell, you can not eat food in every country. Because they may have a war or the place they live in is not appropriate for certain plants living. However, I think we can contribute our food to them by donating. Also, we can use the new technologies to improve the conditions there.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays more and more people consume fast food on a regular basis. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?' 
 'Text': '21st Century People live unrealistic busy and fast lives. Developing technology takes place successfully cause who fastly use and occupy information. So, society impacts food culture such as fast food for needs more time.

First of all, there is an advantage it wasn't limited by distance and time. Many fast food brands manage for 24 hours 365 and come out the food in 5 minutes. And then, it doesn't need to learn table manners and meals way, almost all fast food is packaged for easy grab by hands. Also, everyone can enjoy without division of ability and status. Salty sweety a pungent flavor that everyone satisfying fastinate to crowd. 

Nevertheless, the downside is that it's very fatal. fast eating is harmful to physical health and mental health. Do not give enough digestion time, and do not have enough chewing time cause an increasing possibility of indigestion. In addition, having lots of fat or fried ingredients increases blood sugar, and cholesterol levels will increase gradually. that's why people become obese patients. According to many clinical results, cooking slow food helps save the sentiments of humans. also, relieves emotional development and stress through the patience and concentration we get while touching the ingredients we eat and waiting for the completion process. However, fast food is similar to simple avidity and addiction. This is because the first thing to do is to fill your stomach without thinking about the process of making food.

To conclude, even though both options may have advantages and disadvantages.  Everyone can enjoy a meal without conditions but it does not help good health and learning table manners.

In my perspective, people have to try to find slow food than fast food for their physical health and mental health.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'An increasing number of people are choosing cosmetic surgeries. Why do people have operations to change the way they look? Do you think this is a positive or negative development' 
 'Text': 'More and more people are concerned about their outer image these days, some of whom even choose to go to beauty clinics to alter how their faces or bodies look. There are multiple factors that might drive them to make such decisions, which I believe, could be detrimental. In this essay, I will focus on the reasons of this phenomenon before moving on to its effects on both sides.

Such beauty chasers might have two major reasons to make changes to their lookings. First off, they may lack confidence on their appearance. For example, it is quite common for some beauty-lovers to complain about their noses being too big or eyes being too small, although they are actually fine. This is due to the inconfidence, which may facilitate them to make changes to such parts. However, not all patients go for operations are becuase of this. Another possible reason is to simply have a normal life. This particularly means the soldiers who have lost a part in war. Such solders who have been wounded tremendously need such cosmetic methods to have a normal looking and life they deserved.

Despite the fact that such surgery may make people happy and confident, it is harmful for most of the time. To begin with, patients may suffer from post-surgery side effects. This is because of the unknown long-term effects of some new technologies, which could be irreversible and might take years before emerging. Secondly, those operations may empty their pockets and lower their living standards. This means that those returning clients who are addicted to such alternations on their faces may spend hundreds of thousands on fixing and maintaining endlessly, having little budget left for basic needs. Having said that, it is true that such surgery may bring a brighter future for patients such as blind people who would like new eyes.

In conclusion, the growing number of plastic-surgery customers is not a straightforward issue. Perfectionalism and medical need might be the major reasons why people choose to have such operations. As far as I am concerned, it is more of a negative tendency than a possitive one.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Large companies should pay higher salaries to CEOs and executives compared to other workers.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In this competitive era, multinational companies give huge payments to their higher executives to be more active in the market and to get great outcomes of their work. There are split opinions among people because many opine that everyone should be given equal amount of salary. However, I agree with those who reckon that the leaders should be paid more as compared to other workforce.

To commence with, CEOs in every firm are more skilled as well as experienced persons. They know all the ups and downs of market. They have the duty of project management, which is a vast area in every company. Infact, they do the risk evaluation before launching a project in the market. They are more skilled in doing more complex tasks and can take the responsibility of running a firm. For example; many executives after being leaders, open their own businesses and run it successfully. Therefore, they really deserve high salaries because of their experience and skilled administration. 

Moreover, helping juniors and managing large workforce is another responsibility that is carried out on the shoulders of directors. In addition, new employees who are working on a project, need to be trained on a certain pathway. Infact, sometimes they can not operate efficiently rather than getting a proper training determined by their leaders. Hence, every CEO, is responsible for training the future workforce of the firm. Therefare, they deserve to get more payment because they are not only working for the present upliftment of company but for future also.

To Conclude, although some people believe that other workers should be given same salary as managers but I believe that executives should be given more payments due to having more responsibility and complex tasks. However, every firm should have to increase the money of other employees according to their work and experience.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people argue that we should do research into their family history. Others, agree with the view that we should focus on the present and future generations. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?' 
 'Text': 'Some people say that having a deep look into the family history is important, whereas others argue that focusing on the present and the next generation is the top priority. Although having an idea about what happened in the family past is essential, I support the latter view that paying attention to the present and the future of families is more crutial.

Conducting a research about family ancesters is meaningful as this helps members of a family to form a sense of belonging which will greatly boost the unity of the entire household. It would be benefitial for family members to have a thorough investigation about what happened in the past, and gain a deep understanding about where they came from and what their ancesters have been thgouth. For instance, youngsters can learn the past stories by asking their grand parents what happened when they were young or browsing photo albums, so they can form a sense of belonging by doing these. However, a family history cannot continue without the younger generation, therefore, ceasing the present is more practical.

Paying more attention to what happens now and the younger generation is more feasible, as those are more important than the past. Young blood is key of the continuity of the family and what happens now matters as it can shape the family future. For example, Parents invest in a significate amount of money into their children's education, hobbies and health care, as they believe that their offsprings are their top priorit and every cent they spent now will build up a brighter future prospect for their children. Therefore, focusing on now and future is more vital.

In conclusion, eventhough having a deep look into the family past is necessary, I would still support that paying attention to what happens now and the coming future is wiser.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that parents should teach children how to be good members of society. Others, however, believe that school is the place to learn this.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Beyond doubt, there are many discussions revolving around the issue of whether being good person lessons should be given to children by their parents or other people agree with these are taught by schools. From my perspective, I support both ideas. In the next paragraphs, I will delve into the main reasons in their detail.

First of all, why parents should teach their children because they spend a lot of time with their children and take care of their children. It is apparent that parents are idols for most children. For this reason, many children want to resemble their mother or father even sometimes it happens unconsciously. Consequently, good traits which are taught by parents can be very effective. If people take all this into account, parents should try to be careful around their children, and introduce good behaviour. I believe that families have an important influence on their children’s behaviour, therefore, they ought to teach their children to be good person.

On the other hand, school is also an important place which gives significant pieces of knowledge related to good behaviours. Many children listen to their teacher’s advice because they believe their teacher is always right. Furthermore, teachers pass excellent courses about children psychology which they understand the way to teach these. Indirectly, good behaviours can be given productive by teachers because of scientific methods.  In my opinion, schools should support some pieces of knowledge about good behaviours because they have a good methodology about this.

To sum up, I support the idea that good traits should be taught by eighter schools or families because children spend the half time with their parents and other teachers. Both have equal importance on the children learning of good traits. Neglecting one does not mean another one is enough. That is why eighter parents or schools should provide good traits learning, and tightly support each other.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays many people complain that they have difficulties getting enough sleep.

 What problems can lack of sleep cause ?

What can be done about lack of sleep?

Nowadays many people complain that they have difficulties getting enough sleep.

 What problems can lack of sleep cause ?

What can be done about lack of sleep?' 
 'Text': 'In recent days a lot of individuals complain that they are suffering from sleep deprivation and insomnia which cause many problems such as lower performance on the job or at school. In addition, mental health conditions, such as depression, anxiety. Furthermore, increasing the risk  of long-term diseases or conditions, such as high blood pressure and heart disease. But people can eliminate sleep disorders by following some pieces of advice.

   In the beginning, the deprivation of sleep can affect the performance on the job or at school. In other words,  when people do not sleep enough,  they can not concentrate on their duties and tasks as well as they may make some errors  and mistakes which affect their response and productivity. In addition, lack of sleep can cause mental health and  increase the risk  of long-term diseases or conditions,  such as high blood pressure and heart disease as well as depression and anxiety. Furthermore, unordered sleep can slow reaction time while driving and elevate the risk of accidents.

Occasionally,  people can do many things which enhance the sleep process. For example, they should change their pre-sleep behaviour or habits, such as  avoiding misuse of digital devices and not drinking stimulants like coffee and tea  in the evening. In addition, following some sleep-related rituals which led to being relaxed. For instance, taking a shower with warm water and going to bed early at the same time every night as well as reading an interesting book at bedtime . 

In conclusion, lack of sleep impacts our mental health and well-being. As a result, we should take care of our wake and sleep functions by following a daily routine to help us  sleep and wake up  regularly and orderly. Also, we must avoid sleep disorders and conserve our internal peace.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, more people are choosing to socialize online rather than face to face. 

Is this a positive or negative development? 

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'It is true that recently, the number of individuals who prefer to use social networks to be in contact with people has been increasing day by day instead of seeing each other on live. While this situation has some positive effects, there are many drawbacks.

First of all, it is well known the fact that social media is an inseparable part of our lives in these days. People who are in a wide range in terms of their ages use some applications such as Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter on both mobile phones and computers. Therefore, many choose to communicate with their social environment via Internet because of the technological opportunities of these apps. For example, I frequently prefer to chat on WhatsApp with my friends or share some pictures among us easily or I use Facetime call to see my parents who are living in another city. 

On the other hand, there is no doubt that we have experienced not being able to see our closest friends and relatives during the epidemic all over the world in recent years. Due to the fact that there were many restrictions in the countries, people did not go out of their homes in order to meet with somebody in an open-air place even as I did. That’s why, we heard on TV that psychologies of the people were getting worse due to unsocial lifestyles at home and together with only households.

In conclusion, tough social networks have many crucial services to be in contact with people and provide access convenience to end users, it may result in an unsocial and internet-addicted lifestyle. Thus, online communication and meeting up with people face to face should be kept in balance.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people encourage watching sports as a way of learning about teamwork and strategy, while others believe that one can learn these skills only through playing sports.

 Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some people encourage watching sports as a way of learning about teamwork and strategy, while others believe that one can learn these skills only through playing sports. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

Opinions differ regarding whether watching sports is a beneficial method of acquiring teamwork and strategy. Some argue that learning these skills is unattainable unless playing sports. This essay contends that both of these activities have vital roles to play to learn these skills.

On the one hand, some detailed techniques in professional sports can be learnt by analyzing the games using screen equipment off the court. Football games are the prime example of this method in which coaches explain some teamworking and strategies using extensive TVs. Consequently, developing coordinative and collaborative skills, the team can confront with the real football game properly and win the game. It would be inconceivable for a athlete to collaborate with their teammates on the court, specially in team-playing sports either basketball or football, without watching and assessing their team strategies before.

On the other hand, teamworking plans and coordination need to test in real condition to ensure their efficiency. Techniques cannot be learnable solely through watching as they should be practiced and repeated to reach their practical level. If sports players just have some plans written on the paper, they are more likely not make this imagination into reality with any sense of factual experience. There are factors that can change the predefined strategies in reality such as fitness. If a member of a team lacks strong muscles, then they may struggle to implement strategies set before well. This necessitate playing the game to find such disruptive parameters which interfere with efficient teamwork.

On conclusion, there is an inevitable link between playing and watching sports games to learn them deeply and comprehensively. While watching and analyzing the games assists athletes in terms of planning teamwork and strategies, playing games are crucial to make these competencies practical.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people today believe that the world’s increase in population is unsustainable and will eventually lead to a global crisis. Other people believe that world population increase in necessary and beneficial as it creates the growth of the world’s economy and society. Discuss both view and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some would argue that up-going trend of the globe’s population will cause an international crisis, others tend to think that this phenomenon will influence the community and economy. Although, the increase in population lead to the development in distinctive spheres, I believe that it causes a serious depletion of resources and pollution.

 On the one hand, growth in the number of people will enhance the competitiveness. Countries would endeavor to make breakthroughs in different areas, which would have a great impact on economy. Hence, the demand in the market would rise. For example, the most populated country China is one the developed nations in the world, due to the high quantity of people living there allowed them to make advancements in technology. However, I believe that this developments on the Earth related to the increase in birth rate would exacerbate the future of humanity.

 On the other hand, overpopulation will disturb the environment, consuming more resources than they should. This puts a huge threat on the future of Earth, as deprivation of natural materials will cause a global crisis. Furthermore, increase in population impact on pollution level, which puts a huge strain on health service, since the diseases spread faster when the conditions are suitable. For instance, high density of people and contamination in India appeals most bacteria and viruses leading to health problems. I believe disturbance of environment is a bigger dilemma, which deteriorates the planet.

 In conclusion, despite the fact that world population increase enables to develop the communities, leading to the improvements in globe, this causes the overconsumption and spread of illnesses at excessive rate.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the future people will read only online and no one will buy printed newspapers.

to what extent do you agree od disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, we can see everyone around us are tend to read newspaper through website or online portal more than the printed version. This kind of issue affects the prediction about the future, there is a saying that states there are will be no one buy printed newspaper, few years ahead. I personally agree with the statement that I will discuss more in the upcoming paragraphs.

To begin with, in this digital era, it is common to know that books, newspapers, magazines are having their digital versions that can be viewed on the website or other online platforms. This condition leads to the tendency that people be more likely read such readings through their gadgets. Instead of buying the hard copy of those readings, reading the digital copy is more efficient since it is easier to access. The printed version can we get by going to the bookstore first and I think it is such a complicated way to do.

On the other hand, there are minority of people that are still reading newspaper by its hard copy. Although for some youth generation this case is outdated, the older people cannot deny that they feel more comfortable to read newspaper by its printed version. Furthermore, those elders are not usual to operate smartphones, so it is difficult to access digital newspaper.

To conclude, the reason I agree printed newspaper is going to be disappear from future's market is because of the digital one is very acessible to read. In addition, there is also a community that still do not want to change their habit on reading printed newspaper.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many country encourage tourism. Does it bring advantages or disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'In recent times, delays in transportation and long journey times are the most common problems in most big cities. Increased usage of personal vehicles and continuous construction are the biggest causes of this phenomenon, while levying environmental taxes and investing in improving the efficiency of construction sector are the most viable solutions.

To begin with, most people in the big cities prefer buying personal vehicles leading to the significant rise in the traffic problems. As a result, it takes more time to reach to the destination for people using public transport as well as private vehicles. Furthermore, to accommodate the increasing population, the government has to continually invest in construction projects going on in big cities which exacerbate these problems. For example, in big cities like Toronto, there are at least 15 infrastructure projects running at the same time.

However, there are several solutions available to solve these problems. Firstly, since the usage of private vehicles are the biggest reason for traffic congestion, levying environmental taxes on the purchase of the personal vehicles can substantially help dealing this situation. Additionally, although infrastructure development is the necessary for the economy as a whole, the government should start considering its negative effects on the road congestion. Additionally, infrastructure sector should be made more effective by using the revenues generated from environmental taxes.

To conclude, delays in transportation and long journey times indirectly affect the productivity of people, and the increased usage of personal vehicles and continuous construction are the biggest causes for the same. However, levying taxes and making infrastructure sector more efficient can help solving this situation.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that to solve traffic and transportation problems, c To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In the modern world, nowadays traffic congestion and transportation issues play a crucial role in many people's lives. Some arguments believe that should encourage people to live in the rural areas to solve these issues. I strongly disagree with this idea, because if the government improves their policy and innovations can solve these issues.      

There are many solution to address these issues rather than live in rural areas, Firstly the government should encourage people to utilize public transportation, because when people more utilize in public transportation. Due to the number of vehicles in big cities and opportunity of  traffic congestion will decrease. Moreover, Flexible working time and telecomunication can solve these problems, because these method can reduce time of working and transport. For example, some company use work from home stategies for solve transport problems.

Additionally, some government pay attention to improve these problems by included technology. For instance, Telecommunication can improve quality of working time and be crowded when compared with meeting in the office. As a result to reduce opportunity of traffic in rush hours. Furthermore, when the governments concernd about traffic congestion problems they would solve big problems of our world nowadays in global crisis. such as due to when they reduce traffic congestion they will reduce carbon emissions and air pollutions.

To conclude, the traffic congestion problems can be solve by technology and policy to encourage people use public transportation. I disagree, when some people argue live in the rural areas is best practice for solve these issues.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Write about the following topic:

Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies. To what extent do you think are consumers influenced by advertisements? What measures can be taken to protect them?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.' 
 'Text': 'The competing companies usually showcase abundant advertisements which can influence the consumers. In this essay I will explore the influence of advertisements on individuals and also provide some measures to protect people.

A  competition over gaining a good reputation for the prodcust and attracting customers from all around the world can pave the way for increasing number of advertisements. First of all, by advertising they frequently can exhibits the advantages and good qualities of their products by emphasizing the quality and some extraordinary properties of their products. For instance, in my country, there are several diverse advirtisements about the same products, each time trying to show new improvements and some other good qualities of the product. Furthermore, there is nothing more persuasive than advertisement, which can allure people easily to buy the items offered, as it often highlights the positive sides of the products.

There are several possible solutions which can be considered as an effective way of protecting customers. To begin with, governments may implement some strict rules and enhance law enforcement regarding advirtesements and regulations of sales in the country. To cite an example, they can fine the companies which demonstrate their undesirable products as a very good one. Moreover, the laws about the number of advertisement for one product can be retricted and some taxation should be put over the companies that want to advertise. Therefore, due to some expenses, the manufacturers can diminish the number of advertisement they produce.

To sum up, in order to gain reputation and myriad customers it is worth advertising, while it also should not be overlooked that the safety of the people is supervised and ensured'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people argue that all experimentation on animals is bad and should be outlawed. However, others believe that important scientific discoveries can be made from animal experiments.

Can experimentation on animals be justified? Are there any alternatives?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge and experience' 
 'Text': 'Over the last few decades, there have been vast advances in the field of medical science. Scientists have to use animals to some extent to be able to prove the safety of certain medicines or cosmetic products for human use. In my opinion, using animal experiments should be limited to some specific drugs.

I would like to start my argument by writing about the viewpoints of the opponents. Many people claim that  using animals as a tool for human benefit is unacceptable. They believe that animals can feel fear and pain so, they will suffer as much as human beings and unfortunatelly they can not express their pain.

On the other hand, people who are in favour of this method, point out that using animals for proving the safety of a product especially some  drugs is inevitable. Actually, it can not be denied that we owe some of the recent imorovements in medical field to animal experimets. For example, without this method we would not be able to cure most of the fatal ailments such as cancers. Therefore, scientists have no way but using animals to save many human lives.

However, using animals should be limited to certain drug tests and when it is really essential. To clarify, I do not agree with animal testing for cosmetic products because I believe that at worth case scenario those products can cause a mild allergic reaction on humans which is not fatal.

To summarize, based on what is discussed above, animal experiments are inevitable and by using that , scientists will be able to save several human lives. Therefore, it should be used only for essential scientific purposes.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays people have to work for longer hours under stressful conditions.

Do you agree or disagree with this statement? 

Suggest the way by which the job conditions can be improved' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that in this modern world, people have to do their job in an stressful environment for a longer time. Living expenses is increasing day by day as well as the unemployment rate, which makes people to do stressful job to cover all things unwillingly. Following the issue, I think technological advancement and a flexible work hours in the jobs are the best solution.

Firstly, Encouraging the workers getting familiar with advance technology specially with the internet and many office management softwares can lower the stress level in a job by making it remote. Remote works will help workers to complete their works without being present in office as well as giving enough times to their families. Moreover, those job which are physcial based can use advanced machine that make their job mostly automated and time-efficient. For instance, in the recent years, all of the works are engaging in automation by artificial intelligent technology that is making our life easier, however, that system is not yet familier in most of the works.

Secondly, having a flexible hours can make a job less stressful. Flexible hours of time helps a person to improve his thinking ability as well as making their job done. In many european countries, follow this method to balance their private life with work. On the other hand, a recent research published that working in countries like South Korea, Japan are stressful because of no flexible hours available there in more than 65% job field. Time management also helps people to resilience their stress level in works as well as having private life with a good amount of free time.

In conclusion, reducing stress level time management training programs will be much effective to make their life balanced with works.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In spite of the advances made in agriculture, many people around the world still go hungry.

Why is this the case?

What can be done about this problem?' 
 'Text': 'It is evident that although we have a high level of cultivaion, there are still numerous people around the world suffering from the famine. I think the different levels between countries may lead to this and helping the developing stations be rich can be a good solution.

Nowadays human beings are good at agriculture, however, many poor areas such as some African countries are lack of these knowledge, which is responsible for the hungry in those regions. The nations had few knowledge can not cultivate things well and as a result, they do not have enough food to satisfy their people. For instance, some local tribes in Africa still use the method that was abandoned a century ago to cultivate rice and they are unlikely to obtain enough rice. And because of their poverty, they have difficulty buying food from the developed countries such as America either. So the civilians there have to tolerate the hunger.

Helping the poor areas establish their own economy system and be wealthy may contribute to the reduce of famine. Doing such things allows them to purchase food from other states. What is more, when they are rich and do not need struggle for living, they will have time to learn the advanced techniques. For example, China used to lack food, but when we earned considerable money, we soon developed our skill about agriculture and now we do well in cultivating.

To sum up, the reason for hunger may be the poor regions do not have skills which are good enough to feed themselves and the method can be enabling them to found a good economy and be rich.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is important for people to take risks, both in their professional lives and their personal lives.

Do you think the advantages of taking risks outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, the rhythm of life is very fast and during the day people make a lot of different decisions. In some situations their decisions depend on that whether they want to take risks or not. While there are some drawbacks of taking risks, I still believe that these cannot overshadow the benefits.

On the one hand, taking risks can bring out some obvious disadvantages. It is undeniable that taking risks might lead to big consequences that can have a serious impact on the person’s life. For instance, last time I took a risk and decided to open my own coffee shop, it turned out to be not as simple as I thought it would be. I failed and lost a lot of money due to lack of knowledge in finance and business management. It also affected a lot my psychological state, I was burned out and depressed. Also, 

On the other hand, I am concerned that the merits of taking risks outweigh the demerits. Firstly, decisions to risk might lead to success. For example, if a person, working as a simple consultant at some shop, decides to pull himself or herself together and talk with a director about a promotion at work, a person’s request can be approved and he or she will move forward on the career ladder. Secondly, taking risks is usually about getting new experience and knowledge. Moreover, risk taking broadens person’s horizons and helps person to look at the same situation from different sides.

In conclusion, while there are some pros and cons of taking risks, advantages definitely outweigh disadvantages. Not only does it help to move on the career ladder, but also risk taking provides an opportunity to get new experience.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some high schools have a requirement that students must complete a certain amount of volunteer work in order to graduate. What do you think about this type of requirement? Give details to support your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Attachment is what other schools require for students to graduate which will be voluntary work as one will not be paid. In my opinion this requirement is a necessary evil as it equips students for the future. More details will be alluded below.

Volunteer work is very important to students for them to complete their studies as they will be helped attain the skill. Volunteer work means a student will be trained while working but not being paid and the truth is what one is taught in school theoretically needs to be practised before it is offered for payment in the world. A proffession such as nursing is a hands on kind of job so only theoretical training will not really suffice in the actual job hence the need to acquire voluntary training.

Moreso, mandatory voluntary work is essential to the growth of  a nation. Young adults who are still studying have very innovative ideas that can make a country grow in every aspect. Econet a telecommunications company in Zimbabwe got its idea of Ecocash from a student who was still on training which now is one of its biggest cash cows of all time in all telecommunication companies in Zimbabwe. In return of that innovative idea, that student was then employed by that company so it is a win win situation.

However, voluntary work has to be completely voluntary not for it to be attached to the one thing that students want which is to graduate. It being attached as a condition to graduate beats the purpose of it being voluntary.

In conclusion, volunteer work before graduation is most fundamental in the development of a country and also on the skill that a student has acquired theoretically.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the work place.

Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a negative or positive impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'The development of technological devices with their minds is creating several workers instead of people in factories. This writer believes that it is positive in this digital era due to the demand of consumers and a high standard lifestyle.

It must be understood that mass production with high character is necessary because of the large income of  population and serious competition between businesses. Therefore robots and artificial intelligence are very useful tools to upgrade and increase the amount of products because that technology can work with

out any mistakes and fees while human workers need to be paid salaries. Controlling robots is also easier than a large team of people, managers just make programs for those computers or recruit several digital professionals for that field. Consequently, machines with smart minds and work effectively are replacing humans to improve quality of life.

Another argument worth considering the benefits of artificial intelligence can bring to consumers and society. Due to high requirements for health, beauty and quality of all kinds of products, robots are able to satisfy community with the perfect properties. Additionally, customers are also happier and feel that their spending is deserved and companies can sell more leading to stronger finance in a region or a country. As a result, the appearance of robots and artificial intelligence is significant to improve the life quality of citizens.

In conclusion,  developed countries have the idea that updating the features of robots will turn into the main reason for unemployment. Thus, public should use it in the right way and prevent them from depending on it too much.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive and negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'The development in AI and robots fields are altering almost work of humans in most  big companies. It is the writer of this essay who contends that this is an adverse influence in the near future due to the significant changes in the amount of jobless people in all fields.

One of the core reasons  why humans are highly replaced by  robots and artificial intelligence is that they demand a massive amount of production from the industry. In  light of this, the productivity of robots and AI is always much for than that of humans. Moreover,  modern machines occupy the process of goods anytime under  control and without their breaking down. Take a recent article by a number of German workplaces as an example where people made workplaces without humans in all fields, they chose to replace with the developed AI tool to production to produce more and more efficient products. They also believed that the robots could complete an abundance of demands from the customers in their country if the demand  accounted for a massive amount.

Another argument  is that it is a negative development when AI and robots work all day instead of human activity. It can be seen that the percentage of unemployment around the world is higher when the robots and artificial intelligence fields are more developed. It is so challenging and difficult for people to apply for modern companies because of their weaker than the machines. Furthermore, most individuals strongly believe that the risk of the industry is less happen when  robots do in lieu of  humans. According to the latest news in America, there are a plethora of jobless people who do not have enough money for their life such as renting the house, demanding food and drinking, . . . because their company is improved by a large number of robots and automatic machines to produce and join in the process of their workplace anytime. They also hope to find a job notwithstanding their low pay. By the reason they think the AI engine system is a pressing issue  around the world when there is an increasing trend of unemployment.

Taking all points into account, there are some negative elements that are beneficial as the development of robots and artificial intelligence may be altered completely and have a significant impact on the ability to work in the industry of humans in the near future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that the only reason for learning a foreign language is in order to travel to or work in a foreign country. Others say that these are not the only reasons why someone should learn a foreign language. 

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion' 
 'Text': 'Some individuals believe that the acquisition of another speech is only for traveling or getting a job in a foreign country. Whereas others agree that this is not the only reason. I will discuss both views in this essay and I strongly agree with the latter idea because it is also needed for higher education and some businesses.

The first group claimed that learning a foreign language is just needed for a journey or work. This can be easily used when you know another language. For instance, while traveling abroad, if you do not know about the country`s language or an international speech, you will not be able to communicate with people or even you can not find the way back home. Besides, if you work for a foreign company you need to be knowledgeable in a foreign language in order to connect with your colleagues and customers.

The second notion about this issue is that it is more beneficial for learners and its advantages are more than the two mentioned. firstly, it is undeniable that when you know another language it is good for traveling and working. secondly the more of its advantages can be contraversial. For instance, if a person wants to higher education in a develped country such as England, Germany, or france, it is crucial for them to learn that country's tongue. thirdly, when it comes to businesses such as exporting products the knowledge of other languages is needed in order to communicate with people.

To sum up, Although traveling and working could be one of the reasons why people tend to learn another language, I strongly believe that it has more advantages such as highering a degree and some business matters.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace.

Why this is happening?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In digital era, the development of artificial intelligent and robots leads to the replacing of humans in working area. I believe that it is derives from the robots' effective productivity and the lack of humans resources in several jobs. Additionally, I argue that it will help ensuring the safety for people in risk jobs, but it also the major reason for the rising of unemployment.

     It must be acknowledged that robots and artificial intelligent work more effective than humans. To explain, while humans can only working from 8 to 10 hours per day, robots and AI working constantly for several days to meet th large requirement of products. For example, the Shoppee's shipping procedure is all make by automated machines instead of workers like before.

     The lack of employees in some dangerous work is also raise considerable. In order words, young generation now does not willing to work in dangerous conditions, they usually have trend to does office work which have stable salary. It leads to a shortage of workers in risk jobs, so they have to ultilize robots to do those jobs. For instance, currrently, their is a repaired-robot used to fix undersea cables which rare people want to do due to it high water pressure.

     Furthermore, the replacing of robots in dangerous jobs can ensuring the safety for people who do risks jobs. This is because, their still severals things which only can do by people so to keep safe , robots and artificial intellingent is used to support humans in dangerous situations. Take the job of digging underground tunnels as an example, people can using robots to investigate the conditions of soil and oxygen before digging to ensure safety for workers.

     However, the enhancing of robots and AI in workplace also the major reason of the high-unemployed nowadays. Put into works, using robots and AI reduce the demand for staffs because bussiness only need a few of machines' controller. Such as Samsung which has been redunt a large amout of workers last year because of the manpower surplus.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many celebrities are famous for their glamour and wealth rather than their contributions. This is a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'Undoubtedly, with the rapid development of internetm, celebrities are easily to share their luxury lives, and young children following and focusing on celebrities has been becoming a trend in their daily lives. Some people look upon this phenomenon as a negative influence on young children, and I hold an identical opinion toward this statement, which will be thoroughly elaborated on as follows.  

Celebrities are known for their luxurious lifestyle, which could negatively impact children. That is, Children are vulnerable to the influence of celebrities sharing on TV and social media, and it will let children mimic and be distracted by this superficial news. Take myself for example, I was addicted to a Korean youtuber’s channel when I was in middle school. The YouTuber shared lots of luxury bags and brand cosmetics on her channel. To get the same items the Youtuber shared on social media, I took more part-time jobs to purchase a luxury bag, which I barely use daily. During that period, my school grades were declining. Besides, I started to get sick quickly because my body could not afford these works. 

Continuing to share glamorous lives will spread misconceptions that purchasing a luxury lifestyle is the life goal. To be more specific, the priority for young children should be to explore their talents and learn new knowledge rather than spending time on pursuing fancy clothes or competing fancy shose and backpack at school. For example, when teenagers are addicted to these superficial items, they will not care about what is happening in the world and do not care about what new technology is created. After few years, the country will lose talented workforc, and it has a horrible impact to the country.

In conclusion, based on the aforementioned, celebrities who known for the wealth instead of their contribution indeed have negative effects to youth due to spreading misconceptions and concept to young children.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Restoration of old buildings in main cities involves enormous government expenditure. It would be more beneficial to spend this 

money to build new houses and roads. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your own experience.' 
 'Text': 'It is believed that the government should allocate their spending for building new facilities in key urban centers rather than repairing old buildings. I will show my support for this idea in this essay.

The opponents of this viewpoint often exaggerate the advantages that repairing and restoring old buildings offer. This is because demolition and dismantling of old buildings can create a lot of dust and constructive waste released into the environment, causing increasingly worsened environmental pollution in urban centers, especially the air pollution. However, this perspective fails to consider the huge cost of repair and restoration of old buildings which are not a one-time cost, as these activities require constant maintenance costs including structures, designs, and visuals. This is particularly true in the case of a lot of old apartments in Vietnam which need maintenance annually to ensure residents’ safety and these apartments’ visuals, leading to the waste of money but effective not high. 

In addition, the government’s investing in new facilities can offer long-term benefits, as new facilities require less maintenance cost and operating cost with longer life expectancy, offering long-term cost saving for the government and individuals. Moreover, investing in new buildings and new facilities can advance city infrastructure, because this allows for the integration of modern infrastructure including saving-energy systems, smart technologies, and sustainable design methods. This not only improves features and quality of facilities but also contributes to the development of a more resilient and advanced urban infrastructure system. A perfect example for this is Vinhome Ocean Park, a smart urban area in Vietnam, which is designed at modern building standards including energy-saving systems, environment-friendly technologies, creating a safe and sustainable habitat for residents as well as contributing to a modern and flexible urban infrastructure system. 

In conclusion, although repairing and restoring old buildings can benefit the environment, I purposefully advocate that the government should invest in constructing new facilities due to the long-term cost savings and the development of city infrastructure.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Beside a lot of advantages, some people believe that the Internet creates many problems. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'Internet is considered a double-edged weapon. When adults and children use internet, it has to have some limits to bring its benefits and avoid its harm by different meanings. In this essay we will discuss to what extent we can make use of the internet and how we can be away of its bad impacts.  

    It is worth considering the Benefits of being online, first of all, you can know any information you want at any time you need just by a simple touch on your phone screen. If you want to buy anything you need, there are plenty of websites which make a lot of offers and promotions to attract people all over the world. Besides if you want to contact any person you miss because he/she is in another country, you can easily call this person at any time. So, it facilitates social connections, shopping and learning. So that, being online has a lot of benefits we should take the advantages of it. 

     On the other hand, internet may cause different types of problems in our life. while these websites are too open, people can learn and see random things which are not suitable to their religion or their age. Moreover, when we spend too much time scrolling and chatting, that will waste our precious time without any benefits especially if this person is a student and has exams. 

In addition, children became so attracted and attached to any online cartoons, so this harms their eyes and retard their social and mental skills. 

I totally agree with the benefits of any technology especially the internet if it is used in a moderate way. So, we have to set limits and time to ourselves and our beloved children. We can get rid of its problems and avoid it by using it wisely.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The only way to improve road safety is to give much stricter punishments on driving offenses. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is universally admitted that the ever-alarming rate of traffic accidents is one of the thorniest issues concerning governments the world over. Amongst the arguments surrounding how to improve traffic safety, one school of thought claims that this aim could solely be realized by disciplining traffic offenders stricter. While this course of action works to a certain extent, I would not believe that it is the only solution to such a problem, and am going to suggest other measures that are no less viable.

It is understandable why some advocate tightening the punitive sanctions upon traffic violators. The key rationale behind this notion is that doing so would deter traffic participants from breaking road regulations. Deterrent measures, such as levying a hefty fine on traffic light runners or indefinitely confiscating driver's licences of those who drive under the influence, would go a long way in ensuring the culture of safe driving among the masses, contributing to lower rates of traffic-related fatalities and injuries. Therefore, it seems sensible why punishing traffic offenses more aggressively is one of the valid proposals.

However, to say that issuing heavier punishments is the sole solution to the problem of road safety seems rather short-sighted, since there could be other remedies as follows. First, fixing road defects such as potholes, poor-conditioned signage and uneven surface would be effectual in curbing the incidence of traffic accidents occasioned by said road imperfections. Second, and perhaps most importantly, the public's awareness of traffic security should be raised. Since most vehicle crashes arguably stem from poor driving behaviors, educating the populace of how driving safely could spare not only their lives but also others' would directly confront one of the root causes of traffic accidents.

In conclusion, while imposing stricter penalties on traffic law-breakers is indeed one of the approaches that may yield desirable results, I am against the idea that only by adopting this solution could traffic safety improve, since there could still be other effective measures as mentioned above.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that television is useful in education, while others say it is useful only for entertainment.

Discuss both of these views and give your opinion as to the usefulness of television as an educational tool.' 
 'Text': 'The majority of people say that television is advantageous in education. Other people say it is advantageous only for enjoyment. According to myself, it is very enjoyable. In this essay, I will discuss both views and I give you my opinion.

On the one side, nowadays people are used to them for entertainment. They are do not want to go out and they can sit and watch everything all over the ward. Therefore they addict it. There are have variety of entertainment. Such as movies, and video games, all over the ward news and advertisement. Therefore, nowadays, children and adults get addicted to it and they don't want to get good side it. For example, some students after schools watch TV like the cartoon Tom and Jerry they don't want to do anything about another thing.

The other major case is those who start to watch television may not close it. They spend a lot of time with them. it has killed people many times and they do not have time even with families. Therefore, it is family bonding and love is lost. For instance, some family's parents more and more addicted to watching international movies. Even they bring food for out and give it to children so they watch movies. As a result, it is killed family bonds.in this way, people can have more entertainment too.

On the other hand, they can use it for education it can be more beneficial. There are a lot of education programs and there is a lot of titers variety of subjects. For example, these days many videos running for IELTS because it is very interesting these days. In this way, people can take more education side too.

In conclusion, in this way, people are can use television in many ways. In my opinion, people use more entertainment than education.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some cities although more and more people use public transport the roads are still crowded. How can this problem solved? provide specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Today city people use various types of transportation to go to work, grocery shopping, bringing their children to school or college, travel, etc. They used either public transportation or private cars. Although the number of people use public transportation for their commutes has increased, the roads still face lots of vehicles.

First, the reason why the streets are still crowded is the fixed structure and number of streets that can accommodate a fixed number of vehicles, while at the same time increasing the number of private vehicles due to the increasing of city population. Therefore, despite more usage of public transportation, people still suffering from traffic jams. So, the first act I suggest is a government rule to limit the number of vehicles each family holds. Research by Summit University shows that in London, the city suffers from traffic congestion, each family have approximately 1.8 vehicles. So, the government must limit this rate to one by law.

Second, people are comfortable using their own car for their commute. Lack of the number of bus or tramp stations, large distance from the origin to the station and long waiting time are the main reasons that someone prefers to use his private car. Also, most workers are live in suburbs and public transportation in suburbs is not developed properly. I suggest increasing the number of bus stations outside downtown and in suburbs, strengthening the fleets and offering discounts for those are going to or return from school or college specially in the morning traffic peak.

In conclusion, the government rules or development of public transportation may decrease private cars on urban roads, but the traffic problems are solved with urban culture. Despite setting laws to force the people to not use private cars, culture could make using buses and tramps their first choice.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that family has the greatest influence on children's devlopment while others think that other areas such as television  friends have a greater influence. Discuss  both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Children are the powerful assets of a nation . They are the pillar of the future . Children's are pliable and it is upto us to give them right direction and suitable environment to grow up . One of the most conspicuous trends of today's world is a colossal upsurge in the number of people who believe that family play a vital role in children's devlopment while a good number of people who says other sources like tv ,friends , school , newspaper have better influence on child's growth . There is a range of conflicting arguments releted to the assertion . In upcoming paragraphs I'll not only shed light on the matter but also elaborate on my point of view.

To embark on , if we have a deep look at the assertion we will certainly be able to identify myriad reasons why communities believe family has the greatest impact on children's growth . The first and foremost reason is , family is the first school of a child . From the beginning offsprings spend most of the time with their parents therefore they get the primary lessons from their family . Furthermore , children's are good observer . As a result , children observe their parents and adapt their nature and behaviour that's the reason why people believe family play crucial role in child's development . More over , spending time with family not only strengthen their bond but also it help them toh know their roots deeply . 

On the paradoxical side , a good number of people believe that besides family other sources like television or friends have greater influence on child's development . The foremost reason is , television Play a part and parcel role in our lives . Television provides huge range of channels from all over the world which helps them to know about the other cultures and traditions and also lhelp them to leany languages . To elaborate, nowadays children watches cartoons in English which helps them to learn language at very young age . Take example my brother , his first language is Bangla but he used to watch cartoons in English when he was young and from very young age he learnt to speak in English because of the cartoon shows he used to watch. It's really helped him in his academic years . Furthermore , spending time with peees can devlope communications skills, team work , leadership and many more . They get to meet new people at every stage and learn from them which helps them to grow in a successful person . 

To sum up, family and others sources like tv , peers both have their importance . Family plays a crucial role in the initial stages of a child's development, providing emotional support, moral guidance, and shaping early learning experiences.External factors like television and friends begin to exert a greater influence as children grow older, expanding their social circles beyond the family. As far as I can see it can be said that external factors ha the greatest influence on children's devlopment.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'What do you think are the advantages and disadvantages of using art in order to help people with emotional and physical conditions?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays an increasing number of people tend to suffer from physical and mental illnesses.  In this essay, I am going to discuss pros and cons of art therapy as a treatment. 

Some of the most well-known benefits of art treatment are reducing emotional conflicts, raising self-esteem, exploring emotions, and improving social skills. It is a holistic discipline that allows people to experience new way of usual routines and deepen into themselves.
