Firstly, relying on these activities to make a living is not worth the money which can be earned through these sports and second, it is not a wise choice to pursue anything which puts a precious life in danger.

To begin with, most people involved in dangerous sports activity might argue that they can earn a good amount of money, and since they have performed it so many times, they are quite confident that it is safe for them. However, from my point of view, no matter how many times it has been practised, the risk of loosing a life is the same each time. Therefore, even though these activities pay well in terms of money, it not worth a precious life we have got.

Moreover, any wise person who clearly understands the risk and return involved in these sports would never recommend doing them. The reason for that is we can try as many different alternatives as possible, if we are alive to do so. For example, if a person is not earning enough, he/she can upskill and find better options. Therefore, doing life-threatening activities just with the sole purpose of being rich is foolish in my opinion.

To conclude, many individuals choose to engage in dangerous sports to earn a good amount of money, however, life is more precious than any material thing out in the world, and it is totally irrational to do anything for a few dollars where chances of losing a life are significantly high.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some scientists think that computers will soon become more intelligent than humans. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'Today, when computers become a vital part of humans' lives, authoritative experts believe that computers can overtake people in  intelligence. In this essay, I will show why I strongly disagree with the statement.

It is true that computers are better than their creators in many aspects. First of all, because of a process known as \'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': '\' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that numerous methods to prevent disease have appeared in recent years. Some argue that it is better to spend more money to innovate in prevention rather than cure. personally, i believe it will be useful to find a way to foresee the trouble of the body and then stop it,therefore, i completely agree with this point of view, which can be supported by the reasons as follows.

First and foremost, finding a way to detect the trouble which would become an incurable disease,including cancer or diabetes is indispensable for  development of the medical science, otherwise, it can be deadly. In other words,an acute tumour would be deadly once it is detected and no more way or drug can cure it. However, the appearance of  preventive measures can detect it in advance making treating it possible. What's more, it would apparently reduce the pain of some diseases,for example, lung tumour, which makes patients can't breathe and pain.

On the other hand, it is undeniable that investing in this area may have a potential impact on the cure or treatment field,and even spend double the money on it.In this regard,in my word,i believe that would not be a problem if we make good use of the medical research funding to  realise its ultimate value.According to the annual report of the Australian government ,almost 70% of citizens announced that there was a solid relationship between researching reasonably and expanding.

With all the points above,the conclusion can be made that it would be better to invest in preventive measures.In this case,governments and individuals should devote sufficient funding to addressing medical research, and science workers,especially  medical researchers should regulate it reasonably to avoid the misuse of funding.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'With the rise in popularity of the internet, newspapers will soon become a thing of the past.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In last few decades, as a high technology century people tend to surf the internet and get news on their devices, as a result, newspaper becoming the thing called old school. I completely agree with this statement and elaborate on this essay.

On the one hand, new technologies massively changed the speed of news delivery. The invention of television and radio prepared humanity for the upcoming news revolution. Before the 19th century, newspapers were crucial for people. Newspapers, letters and rumours were the only source of information back then. In the 20th century with the help of radio and television, it became possible to hear news upon request right from home at any time of the day.  

To be more specific, the invention of the internet was a real game changer. Soon after the internet, new devices with direct internet connection became reachable and affordable to everyone.Today, a huge percentage of people have personal mobile phones or laptops. Thus, starting from this moment, everyone obtained a chance to create and read content from all possible places on Earth. In addition, it gave an opportunity to create articles and video reviews and share them through the internet at any time and any place. Furthermore, new applications and streaming platforms prove that revolutionary change. More applications for mobile devices appear every day and streaming platforms create more interesting formats for content consumers. 

In conclusion, newspapers has become old school source of information. Therefore, new technology changed the methods of data and content delivery. These techniques have become more easy and suitable for people and the internet today is the main source of information.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries, the level of crime is increasing and crimes are becoming more violent.

Why do you think this is and what can be done about it?' 
 'Text': 'In the contemporary epoch, the rate of crime is observed to be skyrocketing in various nations around the globe. Unemployment and corrupt government officials are the major causes of the significant rise in the crime ratio. It is necessary to make humans aware and make strict regulations for the rulers of the country to protect the economy. 

To begin with, the most predominant extrapolation behind the excessive crime rate is unemployment in most nations. For instance, as per the reports of 2018, approximately 6.7% of the Indian population was living below the poverty line and this situation has been exacerbated in 2019, and 2020. If individuals are not able to earn enough for their living to fulfill their necessities due to the dearth of resources, they usually choose the wrong trajectory and end up becoming criminals. Hence, the lack of jobs is a primary reason that boosts criminal percentage. Another pivotal reason is the presence of some corrupt government leaders in the nation. There are some executives, who only care about money and they do not care for the well-being of their public, and they use black money to promote corrupt practices in the economy to maintain their power. Due to such cases, administration staff members who are already rich are earning well and the poor are suffering relentlessly and get involved in the line of criminals for their family needs.

It is enormously vital that an equal chance should be provided to all to get jobs so that the poor do not suffer due to money pressure from the richer sections of the society and this will help to control the rising crime rate to some extent. Public awareness plays a vital role in improving all the troubles in society, increasing crime rate is no exception. If the public knows about the corrupt government officials they can get together and raise their voices to change them, this will bring unity among the people along with this, it will be a huge step in eliminating the crime ratio. Hence, awareness and unity can work together to control this major issue in the countries.

To conclude, as per the reasons along with the solutions mentioned above, it is clear that unemployment and government policies are contributing to an increase in the crime rate. Thus, the provided solutions can be applied to reduce this problem in the country.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some countries achieve international sports by building specialised facilities to train top athletes, instead of providing sports facilities that everyone can use. Do you think this is positive or negative development?

Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'It is a common fact that being a professional athlete requires consistency in practising. As an effort to support their athletes, some countries build certain sports centers which are specialized only for professional athletes. In this situation I strongly believe that providing these facilities brings more benefits compared to the negatives.

To begin with, there are several advantages of building facilities only for professional athletes to practice. Firstly, it gives more flexibility for the athletes to set their practice schedule since no other strangers will use the facilities. Subsequently, they can have more time to practice and improve their skills. In addition, the use of an exclusive building lets athletes focus more on their practice because their fans will have no access to the facilities.

Beside the positives, using an exclusive building also has some drawbacks. One disadvantage is that coaches will not be able to meet new sportsman in the field. For example, non-professional players will not use the facilities to practice while coaches will spend most of their time in the building. Unfortunately, the possibility for them to meet during practice is reduced. Another drawback is that the government will spend more money on the asset. The expenses are not only used when they build it but also the maintenance of the facilities.

In conclusion, despite the negatives such as giving less chance for new players and gaining more expense, building exclusively facilities for athletes is more important for the country. The importance is due to the development of the athletes' skills as their practice schedule and focus will not be distracted.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer to spend time on team sports, while others like to do single-player sports. In my opinion, as long as they do any sports which is valuable, therefore, people need to choose sports that are suitable for their needs. This essay will delve into both perspectives with my own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some people prefer to spend time on team sports, while others like to do single-player sports. In my opinion, as long as they do any sports which is valuable, therefore, people need to choose sports that are suitable for their needs. This essay will delve into both perspectives with my own opinion. 

Firstly, team sports encourage skills such as leadership and teamwork that are essential in this fast-developing society. This is because most corporate jobs require teamwork skills as they have many workers, such collaboration skills help to be more productive. Additionally, leadership skills can be developed by playing team sports as it requires at least one leader in the team, which is also an essential qualification for  bigger companies. Therefore, some organizations encourage their staff to play team sports. For instance, in Mongolia, bigger corporations organize basketball competitions among their staff annually. As a result, their worker can improve their soft skills while enjoying their free time. 

Secondly, individual sports maintain mental health as people need to spend time with themselves, and push their boundaries while they are training. This is because spending  quality time is almost rare in this fast-growing society, therefore, some people take chances  to release their stress after heavy workloads. For instance, the number of swimmers is  growing  these days because they can spend time with themselves as most people devote their time to work. 

To conclude, in my opinion, doing sport is essential, whether it is team or individual. People can choose  their own preferences, such as corporate workers prefer teamwork sports as it improves their leadership and collaboration skills. Conversely, some people like to do single-player sports as it encourages their mental well-being.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Rich countries often give money to poorer countries, but it does not solve poverty. Therefore, developed countries should give other types of help to poor countries rather than financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, wealthy countries help poorer countries by giving them money. However, it does not help them that much so that rich countries should give other non-financial help to poor countries. This essay will discuss this problem from both views.

  

   Since underdevelopment in some countries is a systematic problem, it is needed to take some action about it. For example,increasing job vacancies to employ more people, therefore the unemployment rate decrease and poor people could be reduced.Moreover, building new schools and kindergartens or sending children to developed countries to educate them. Thus,they can get a job when they grow up because they are taught well. This is the first action that can be taken against financial investment.

   

   Additionally, The economic country makes a project in these places and makes the citizens work on their project so they will get good wages and can have a good rate of living. In addition, the most necessary thing is when the country itself can work hard to give its citizens a high-quality life. Moreover, it can also give important work to people who deserve and make change in the country rather than those who steal and not give anything to the country. They can emphasize volunteer people to give a hand to poor countries. Such as giving food to homeless people to reduce starvation, and donating clothes to keep them warm. Also, giving them free mental care, just in case to detect cancer and illness.

   To conclude, it is good to support every needy country to fulfill their requirements by promoting education and generating alternate ways of generation, However, it will not help them permanently. Developed realms must make poor nations self-dependent to overcome this issue and provide resources for future growth.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer to spend time on team sports, while others like to do single-player sports. In my opinion, as long as they do any sports which is valuable, therefore, people need to choose sports that are suitable for their needs. This essay will delve into both perspectives with my own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some people prefer to spend time on team sports, while others like to do single-player sports. In my opinion, as long as they do any sports which is valuable, therefore, people need to choose sports that are suitable for their needs. This essay will delve into both perspectives with my own opinion. 

Firstly, team sports encourage skills such as leadership and teamwork that are essential in this fast-developing society. This is because most corporate jobs require teamwork skills as they have many workers, such collaboration skills help to be more productive. Additionally, leadership skills can be developed by playing team sports as it requires at least one leader in the team, which is also an essential qualification for  bigger companies. Therefore, some organizations encourage their staff to play team sports. For instance, in Mongolia, bigger corporations organize basketball competitions among their staff annually. As a result, their worker can improve their soft skills while enjoying their free time. 

Secondly, individual sports maintain mental health as people need to spend time with themselves, and push their boundaries while they are training. This is because spending  quality time is almost rare in this fast-growing society, therefore, some people take chances  to release their stress after heavy workloads. For instance, the number of swimmers is  growing  these days because they can spend time with themselves as most people devote their time to work. 

To conclude, in my opinion, doing sport is essential, whether it is team or individual. People can choose  their own preferences, such as corporate workers prefer teamwork sports as it improves their leadership and collaboration skills. Conversely, some people like to do single-player sports as it encourages their mental well-being.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Rich countries often give money to poorer countries, but it does not solve poverty. Therefore, developed countries should give other types of help to poor countries rather than financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, wealthy countries help poorer countries by giving them money. However, it does not help them that much so that rich countries should give other non-financial help to poor countries. This essay will discuss this problem from both views.

  

   Since underdevelopment in some countries is a systematic problem, it is needed to take some action about it. For example,increasing job vacancies to employ more people, therefore the unemployment rate decrease and poor people could be reduced.Moreover, building new schools and kindergartens or sending children to developed countries to educate them. Thus,they can get a job when they grow up because they are taught well. This is the first action that can be taken against financial investment.

   

   Additionally, The economic country makes a project in these places and makes the citizens work on their project so they will get good wages and can have a good rate of living. In addition, the most necessary thing is when the country itself can work hard to give its citizens a high-quality life. Moreover, it can also give important work to people who deserve and make change in the country rather than those who steal and not give anything to the country. They can emphasize volunteer people to give a hand to poor countries. Such as giving food to homeless people to reduce starvation, and donating clothes to keep them warm. Also, giving them free mental care, just in case to detect cancer and illness.

   To conclude, it is good to support every needy country to fulfill their requirements by promoting education and generating alternate ways of generation, However, it will not help them permanently. Developed realms must make poor nations self-dependent to overcome this issue and provide resources for future growth.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say part-time jobs are useful for full-time students because they

not only earn money but also gain career experience. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is common nowadays for students at university or college to undertake part-

time work either for money or to gain some work experience. In my opinion, this has both advantages and disadvantages.

The first obvious advantage is that work can bring in money. In many countries,

 students are independent from their families, or their parents are not wealthy enough to afford their education. Therefore, a part-time job can greatly contribute to the financial position of a student. It may be an essential factor in permitting study in the first place. For example, in Britain, the tuition fees have

increased a lot in recent years, which has kept some of the intelligent but poor

 students from concentrating on their study as they are often in debt and in severeshortage of financial support. As a result, if they want to continue their academic persuit, many students have no choice but to work in addition to their academic duties.

Moreover, a part-time job can help prepare a person for the real world of work, a

 step out of the ivory tower. Many employers nowadays complain that new workers do not appreciate the needs of business, nor can they apply their theoretical study to practice. But some work experience gained during study can facilitate one to develop one’s career. 

To put it simply, the decision of whether or not to take up a part-time job while

 studying depends on individual students’ circumstances – it may be beneficial or financially necessary, but it should never be at the cost of underachieving in academic work.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many cities around the world polution levels have been risen in recent years.

Why are some cities becoming more polluted?

What effects does this have?' 
 'Text': 'An increasing number of people around the world are choosing to live in large cities. This, along with the development of modern industry, has led to higher levels of population in many city. As a result, the local environment and people’s health are being negatively affected.

Cities with a large population are often especially polluted. This is because there is a greater concentration of cars and industry in a small area. Cities with both a large number of cars and a poor public transport system are often in a particularly bad situation as they suffer from high levels of noise and air pollution. Other cities, which have economies that rely on industry, have to deal with problems created by manufacturing. These can include air, water and soil polution, both locally and in a wider area aroung the city.

As a result of these two factors, pollution can have negative effects on both the local environment and people’s well-being. Increased air pollution is often linked to a number of health concerns, particularly breathing problems. Both water and soil pollution can damage or kill a number of plant and animal species, and ultimately, this may affect the quality of the food available for human. Lastly, both transport and industry can increase noise and light pollution in cities. This can mean that people get poor sleep and their health may be affected by this.

In conclusion, some cities are becoming more polluted because they are becoming more populated which leads to growing amount of traffic and industrial production. This has a negative impact on both the local environment and on people’s health.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some expert believe that it is better for children to begin learning a foreign language at primary school rather than secondry school.do the advantages of this outweight the disadvantage?' 
 'Text': 'Many argue that children ought to acquire a foreign language alongside their native tongue from primary school onwards. I wholeheartedly support this notion, as I believe that young minds are more adept at embracing fresh concepts and possess heightened learning capabilities. Furthermore, by the time they reach high school, they are already familiar with foreign languages, alleviating the pressure of additional subjects.

Research confirms that young children exhibit a remarkable capacity for absorbing new information. For instance, a study conducted on students in Iran demonstrated that elementary school pupils excel in acquiring English proficiency at a swifter pace and with greater fluency than their older counterparts. Thus, initiating language studies at an early age is more logical.

Additionally, high schoolers grapple with a demanding curriculum, and the inclusion of a new language course would only add to their academic load, potentially leading to frustration and diminished focus. Consequently, the intended goal of mastering a second language may remain unrealized, necessitating extra time and effort.

In conclusion, the evidence suggests that introducing new subjects, such as a second language, to children at a young age is paramount, given their heightened aptitude for learning and mastering these subjects in comparison to older individuals.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays there is more and more competition for getting into university. Is this a positive or negative development?' 
 'Text': 'A notable development has been growing throughout the countries in recent years – more individuals are aiming for their personal goals and achievements instead of collective interests. Although various opinions stem from this trend, I believe that it is highly disadvantageous. 

To begin with, individualism lets people feel challenged to integrate into society. To be specific, it often results in a lack of togetherness and increased selfishness. Thus, it makes individuals feel lonely. To illustrate, when people solely focus on their own tasks and situations, they are likely to excel in their fields: however, they lack a sense of belonging. Moreover, they do not know how to communicate with others, or how to solve group problems. Hence, only concentrating on their personal rewards or aims is dangerous as it is a driving force behind decreased communication skills and togetherness.

Furthermore, the nation should never neglect the value of collective interests as they are beneficial to mental health. It is undeniable that collective mindset brings a sense of belonging which is a key point of living a harmonized life with others. For example, we are living in a very socialised world with various people and thus, we need to learn how to communicate with each other. Having collective thinking helps to improve social skills and secure emotional stability. Also, a notable study conducted by Korea University revealed that possessing a sense of togetherness is firmly favorable to preventing mental illnesses such as dementia. Therefore, nations should be collective instead of being selfish. 

To conclude, although endeavouring people’s personal goals and ambitions can be positive and negative at the same time, I believe that the bad impacts override the merits. Hence, we should avoid being individualistic.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, parents put too much pressure on their children to succeed. 

Is it a positive or negative development?' 
 'Text': 'It is prevalently witnessed that parents put too much pressure on their children to success. 

In this sense, questions about whether this phenomenon is a positive and negative development are raised. In my opinion, putting too much pressure on children from their parents to succeed brings a devastating blow to their children. 

Irrefutably, children can be dependent on their parents. This is because the parents provide all things related to their children such as making study plans, researching information about homework, and preparing daily meals. This obviously leads them to become passive and this in turn results in negative issues, including anxiety, depression, and loneliness without their parents.

What is more, children who are under too much pressure from their parents struggle with significant stress. In actual fact, studies undertaken by experts have revealed that plenty of children are forced to extremely long hours study for achiving a high-level performance by parents on a daily basis. This, therefore, brings about exhausted physical and mental status. 

Nevertheless, appropriate pressures are significantly beneficial to children. In other words, since having a chance to think about success leads to making life goals, parental guidelines considerably support children’s dreams and goals come true, so those are likely to strive to study for their objectives.

To conclude, appropriate pressures are significantly beneficial to children but children can be dependent on their parents and children struggle with significant stress. Thus, putting too much pressure on children from their parents to succeed brings a devastating blow to their children.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Human activities have negative impacts on plants and animals. Some say it’s too late to do anything about the problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve the situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'The vital role of plants and animals on the Earth is undeniable. It has sparked heated controversies that many people claim consequences which humans do are too late to address, whereas others have the opposite points that humans can use greater valid ways to improve these environmental issues. From my perspective, I agree with the latter. 

Admittedly, the damage which humans create to the natural environment is acceptable. In the process of producing goods for human use, releases a bunch of toxic gas into the air, also a large amount of poisonous liquids are pumped into the river. These problems are hard to solve, particularly in terms of human morality. Besides, awareness of each person plays a key part in recover the nature, for instance, many companies take full  advantage of natural resources to reduce produced costs. So, the natural resources are destroyed and depleted at an alarming rate. In addition, rare plants and rare animals are usually traded at the luxury cost rate which greedy merchants, and authorities are willing to trade illegally, bribe and embezzle. As a result, the proportion of rare animal extinctions is higher, primeval forests are gradually replaced by \'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Countries with a long average working time are more economically successful than those countries which do not have a long working time.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Working culture varied widely all over the world. Western countries such as America and Britain have relatively shorter office hours compared to Asian countries. Some claim economic development is superior in those nations with longer working hours. I wholeheartedly agree with this nation, as I will elaborate the following. 

Longer working hours often can bring higher productivity. Nowadays, economic competition has become more severe. The country which has faster and larger productivity stands up easily. Take Taiwan for example, people there tend to work more than 12 hours a day, along with fewer national holidays in comparison with Western countries, and it is undeniable that Taiwan’s electric industry plays an indispensable role globally. This could be due to Taiwanese hard working characteristics. Additionally, economic stability and prosperity can also result from a long working time. This work pattern brings opportunities for jobs, contributing to the reduction in unemployment rate.  However, it still has certain drawbacks.

Working for a long time may cause potential physical and mental health problems. Worker’s rest and sleep time can be deprived, leading to harmful health outcomes. For instance, Japan is well-known for long work hours. Though it is one of economic successful nations, its suicide rate which is related to work has climbed recently. Consequently, health issues should not be underestimated, especially in those nations that have this long working pattern. 

To conclude, countries with longer office hours enable them to have higher productivity and be more competitive, making them have better economic development. However, sometimes it is at the expense of the employer's health, and people should be more aware of this issue to ensure the country's economic sustainability.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people claim that not enough of the waste from homes is recycled. They say that the only way to increase recycling is for governments to make it a legal requirement. To what extent do you think laws are required to make people recycle more of their waste?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, due to the increase in population, more trash has been produced domestically. Some individuals believe that recycled trash is not as much as it should be. What they suggest is that governments are in charge of implementing some rules to be followed by citizens. I strongly believe that this can lead to a better environment for us and the next generations and setting some rules is the only way to prevent its side effects.

It is believed that the amount of trash produced by houses is not enough recycled and this can be addressed by making some legal requirements. On the one hand, by setting some rules in order to force city duelers to be aware of recycling home waste it is beneficial for them. Firstly, some strict rules should be implemented to encourage society to buy the manufacturers which are made of recycled materials. For instance, people will be able to save more money by purchasing items which are manufactured with recycled materials because of the less expenditure that these products have.  

Another useful law is to implement some fines for people who do not care about separating their recyclable and non-recycleable trash from each other. In this way, it will take less time and money to detach these two kinds of rubbish.

To sum up, domestic trash recycling has been a controversy, some agreed that it is better to set some rules for it. I reckon that it is politics` duty, to make some laws to talk city duelers into obeying these rules.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people argue that the teenage years are the happiest time in a person's life, while others contend that adulthood brings more happiness despite the added responsibilities.

 Both perspectives have their merit.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'In recent years, a part of society believes that teenagers' life is the best time while others say adult life renders more happiness. This trend has sparked contrasting opinions, with advocates and critics each representing valid arguments. This essay will analyze both perspectives and subsequently offer a viewpoint.

To begin with, the primary reason for supporting the teenage as the best life and the prominent one is that this life is stress-free because, at this stage of life, peers do not have any tension on their minds for earning money or livelihood as their guardians are working for them to fulfill their necessities along with their desires. Furthermore, at this stage of life juveniles grow mentally as well as physically and these are the most precious days of their life-span. 

However, in adulthood, individuals get the freedom to make their own decisions for a better future. They do not get any pressure from their parents and are held liable for their actions. Moreover, if they are working and earning good, they do not need to get approval from anyone to buy items for them as they are financially independent. Hence, it is apparent why many people think the adult age is more happiest.

In my opinion, young age is the happiest part of one's life cycle because it not only provides freedom to the person but also helps them to learn new chapters of life every day by meeting new people and this stage assists humans to innovate their minds as well by discovering new trajectory to make their business more lucrative. Ultimately, both age-stages have their merits, and the better approach aligns with the comfort level of the individual. 

To conclude, as per the matrimonials mentioned above teenage is a relaxed age but with the least freedom, but a young age provides financial security along with the right to make decisions. Hence, each approach offers unique benefits, but adulthood is better as in my opinion.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many parts of the world today there is a profitable market for products which lighten or whiten people's skin.

Outline the reasons for using such products and discuss what effects they have in terms of health and society.' 
 'Text': 'In today’s world in order to get more profit most companies choose to sell lightening and brightening products that are applied to humans’ skin. The usage of such substances has some reasons, such as becoming more beautiful or being famous and also consequences on the overall well-being and society,like the loss of natural beauty and health-related issues. This essay will discuss both the causes and effects of the trend.

The foremost cause of this issue is mostly considered a desire to be more appealing and attractive. To be more specific, some individuals accept whiter skin as a symbol of the ideal appearance, so it leads people to buy these creams. Furthermore, today most celebrities opt for using lighting products and participate in endorsement events after which it pulls the attention of the public. Consequently, the figure for the brightening cream usage is increasing day by day due to the promotion of the companies for getting more benefits.

One of the profound and possible consequences behind the problem is related to health concerns. Those who overuse such creams damage their natural appearance. In other words, it results in dermatologic diseases which sometimes make it impossible to return to the initial state of the skin. It has a detrimental impact not only on the skin  but also on overall well-being. To elaborate, if  skin cancer occurs, other diseases will be inevitable. So, all these factors are a danger to both society and the health of individuals.

To sum up, producing creams that lighten and whiten the skin for the sake of gaining more money by companies is a pervasive issue nowadays. This trend has possible reasons, such as looking better and so forth. The health-related results of the issue should be taken into account, as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The development of tourism contributed to English becoming the most prominent language in the world. Some people think this will lead to English becoming the only language to be spoken globally.

What are advantage and disadvantages to having one language In the world?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, English has become essential in many parts of the world due to the increasing number of travellers. Many individuals claim that English will be the one and only language on  earth. This essay will first look at  the benefits before turning to the drawbacks.

To begin with, it is undoubtedly that English offer many conveniences, particularly in communication. The first positive effect of this idea that is people can communicate with people with ease around the world.

Moreover, it will bring positive effects on globalization, certainly, improving educational development and employment opportunities in developing countries. Indeed, most people in poorer nations who have good skills are hesitated applying for jobs abroad due to a lack of English ability and many young adults  are interested in continuing their studies outside the country because they perceive that English is difficult. For instance, many college students in Indonesia have a dream of getting master's in a richer country; however, they change their minds by deciding to apply master's degree in Indonesia in order to IELTS requirement. Therefore,  making English as global English will give many benefits for people , especially in education and job prospects.

Conversely, although it offers many positive benefits, it has many adverse effects. Firstly, domestic cultures in many nations will be extinct potentially and the mother language will be vanished. Bringing English to their areas,  means that they are ready to receive the Western culture in their places. For example, people know that most people in Bali use English in their activities, in fact, these days, English is their primary language in comparison to the local language  Bahasa Indonesia. Additionally,  many parts of Bali, such as restaurants and schools  prefer to use English. 

To sum up, English is a part of people's lives, and it has become crucial for many aspects of activities. Thus, the idea to make English  be one and only language globally people should consider  the benefits and also  drawbacks.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In digital era, the advancement of technology has led to the development of robots and artificial intelligence systems that are increasingly capable of performing tasks traditionally done by humans. This trend is driven by various factors, including the desire for increased efficiency, cost reduction, and the potential to minimize human error. However, while the rise of robots in the workplace promises to revolutionize industries, it also raises significant questions about its impact on society.

One of the primary reasons behind the development of robots and AI in the workplace is the quest for efficiency. Machines can often perform repetitive tasks more quickly and accurately than humans, leading to increased productivity and reduced operational costs for businesses. For example, in manufacturing plants, robots can work around the clock without the need for breaks or rest, leading to higher output levels and decreased production time.

 Another reasons are that robots and AI have the potential to minimize human error, particularly in high-risk industries such as healthcare and transportation. By automating certain processes, these technologies can help prevent accidents and improve safety standards. In healthcare, for instance, AI-powered diagnostic systems can analyze medical images with greater accuracy than human professionals, leading to more precise diagnoses and better patient outcomes.

In conclusion, the development of robots and artificial intelligence in the workplace presents both opportunities and challenges for society. While automation can increase efficiency and productivity, it also raises concerns about job displacement and inequality. To mitigate these challenges, it is essential to invest in education and training programs to prepare workers for the changing labor market and ensure that the benefits of automation are shared equitably across society.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The most important aim of science should be to improve people's lives.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statemtent.' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that science is considered a significant field that mainly positively affects people’s lives. From my perspective, I firmly agree with that statement. This is because, over the years, science has led to various innovations that enhance the quality of life and find solutions to prevent future problems. 

In the past, science contributed to building the necessary knowledge that scientists are required to explore and innovate in many fields, including health, technology, electricity, and others. For example, the experiments conducted by scientists in the health field resulted in the discovery of many medications, such as an antibiotic called penicillin, to treat different types of bacterial infections. Therefore, protect people from serious infections and diseases to maintain public health.

Another reason for the presence of science is not only to facilitate and enhance the quality of daily life but also to find solutions to many struggles in the upcoming years. To illustrate, the electric car is a modern innovation that is environmentally friendly; therefore, it will solve common problems such as air pollution in addition to saving money on fuel.

To sum up, we could say that science is a human power that we should use in a smart way to make life better.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary society, it is widely believed that robots and artificial intelligence are being progressed to stand in for humans in the company. In light of this, I contend that this event takes place due to the increment in efficiency and sales. From my perspective. I think this innovation plays a crucial role in our daily life and have a positive effect on my study and  work in the future.

It must be recognised that robots and artificial intelligence help businesses to improve productivity and work performance. which is really vital for each company to gain more profit. Besides, this technology also limits  time and strength, which helps employees save  time to do  important other things. In other words, AI can automatically conduct  industrial procedures without any human support. For instance, in China's logistics, they prefer to use machines in the period of production instead of labours, which helps them not only s

ave  time but also gain more efficiency. Therefore, the invention of this technology brings various benefits to our life.

In regard to social impact, it is evident that the promotion of global innovation brings to us various positive changes. Firstly, artificial intelligence can increase the efficiency of work which helps employees handle  repetitive tasks across an organization so that the labourers can focus on creative solutions and complex problem-solving. Moreover, robots are very supportive in helping scientists solve some difficult mathematics so that they can get rid of physical limitations better than humans. As a result, robot existence in the workplace not only causes  time consumption but also reinforces scientific progress, which helps produce some global breakthroughs. For example, look at the BioC company which is known by the medical business in France. The scientists here only concentrate on experimenting with the data whereas the other tasks such as identifying a number of cells are completed by robotic factors.

In conclusion,  robots and artificial intelligence have developed in the company. I am deeply convinced that this technology will bring various positive things as it encourages breakthroughs in daily life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. why is this happening 

do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In this era, most people are being replaced in the workplace by robots and artificial intelligence. Among these, the rise of robots and AI is driven by a potent mix of economic and practical factors. Businesses are increasingly turning to automation. However, the impact of robots and AI on society is likely to be mixed while there are significant potential benefits, we need to be prepared for the challenges as well.

Robots can perform repetitive tasks tirelessly and with high precision, something humans can struggle with over long periods. AI can analyze vast amounts of data much faster than humans, making it ideal for tasks like financial trading or scientific research. Thus, robots are being developed to replace humans in the workplace.

It’s a complex issue, here’s a breakdown of robots and artificial. According to ethical concerns, there are ethical considerations around AI, such as bias in algorithms and the potential for job displacement. Besides, as automation increases, some jobs will inevitably be lost, leading to unemployment and economic hardship.

In conclusion, the influence of robots and AI on society will likely be multifaceted while automation offers exciting possibilities for increased productivity, safety, and job creation, we must be prepared to address the challenges of job displacement and ensure equitable distribution of its benefits. Navigating this technological shift responsibly will be crucial for shaping a positive future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. 

Why is this happening? 

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'The promises of incorporating artificial intelligence and automation into human lives are limitless. Thanks to the massive growth in computing power and data available, machine-learning algorithms have become more sophisticated. The automation of tasks that previously required human labour would now be possible. For example, artificial intelligence applications have been used in human resource management to streamline certain aspects of the recruitment process. In the field of education, processes of grading and assessing student's learning abilities can be carried out through automated systems. Most people nowadays have virtual assistants such as Siri from Apple or Google Assistant from Google to arrange schedules, send emails or take notes on their behalf. These transformations can open up new opportunities for society and help the individual better manage their lives. In my individual's views, despite many great advances, artificial intelligence technologies are still very far from possessing an algorithm that is capable of replicating human emotions. The best artificial intelligence devices can do so far is to mimic basic facial expressions and to voice these concerns.  However, this is no different from displaying an error message when there is an obstruction in their pre-programmed workflow. According to research on social behaviours, moral emotions that humans possess include subtle and complex emotional expressions such as empathy, sympathy, and compassion, all of which contain more meanings than any other type of computer programming language. In conclusion, computers and artificial intelligence are not only very important but also have a bit of negative that have to concerns.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace.

Why is this happening?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, people around the world are being replaced by robots and artificial intelligence. This happens because of the development technology and demanding of humans are grown up. This writer believed that replacing humans with robots and artificial intelligence will cause negative effects.

People, nowadays, need more for their lives and lifestyles which cannot be satisfied by just man-made products. Not only food and health exigencies, humans in this era also feel uncomfortable living without any networks and convenient devices which are social media, phones, transportation or electricity. In the very first Industrial Revolution, a team of workers spent months finishing the first car models but now thanks to the devotion of AI and robots  a car will be available for hours. They can work well with dangerous and complicated processes or manage a huge source of information that helps people save money and time.

There are some witnesses who prove that AI and robots’ replacements have a positive effect on social life in the near future, the first establishment of worker-free industries. It is an automatic system that runs continuously without any unyoke also their operating fuel may affordable than paying salaries to a group of professional employees. Predictably, automatic factories will be soon created because there is still the existence of quite a lot of repetitive and time-wasting tasks. Blue-collar workers are being futility-worried about unemployment while governments have  prepared  some confidential policies to cope with the drawbacks.

In conclusion, the extended personal demand leads to  robots and artificial intelligence use in our workplaces. Positively helping workers to save and protect our substances outweighs the possibility of unemployment.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people believe working from home is better than going to an office.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Many people prefer working from their house or apartment instead of an office . I totally agree that it is better to workk from home because it save time and increase productivity.

The main reason, I support working from is that it lead to saving time . In particular , it eliminate the need for a daily commute to an office , which saves most people many hours per week. For example , due to covid  lockdowns , I am now working frome home and i save at least ten hours each week that would otherwise br spent travelling . I also save time on dressing and grooming myself for work as  I can dress more casually when i work frome home unlike when I go to an office and need to put on a suit and tie.

Furthermore , working  frome one 's residence can also lead to higher productivity. This is because it eliminate the distractions that come with working an an office environment like noise . and colleagues interruping .For instance , since i started working from home , I no longer get distracted by my co workers chatting  or stoping by my desk to ask me  unnecessary  questions and this enables me to not only get more  done but also have higher quality outcomes on my projects.

In conclusion , I completely beleive that working from home is better. This is because  it saves time travelling to from an office and lead to higher levels of efficiency. Therefore, employers should try to offer their workers this option whenever possible.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people work long hours, leaving very little time for leisure activities. Does this situation have more advantage or more disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'A large number of citizens spend their time working also they put an insignificant amount of their life to themselves fulfilment.I think this occurrence has catastrophic effects and its cons completely outweigh the pros, i will discuss both views and give relevant examples.

To begin with, nowadays modern life has developed in a dramatic way and it is challenging for the population to reach their goals, additionally, this happening has significant drawbacks.For instance, depression or no occasion to recover and  not having a specific time for family members. Because of this event people especially grown-ups are frustrated gradually.For example, in labour positions staff have to work all weekdays and also they have forced extra hours and if they do not participate in this schedule their job will be in danger so they ignore  their basic needs and families just to be able to keep food on table of the household.

On the other hand, this program has a few benefits that can be beneficial just in the short-term ,such as, for beginner workers and inexperience population they can spend more time  working and grab as much information as possible in a short period of time. However, if this timetable lasts longer it will illustrate its side effects that can be harmful to both the mental and physical aspects of the human body and personal life.

in conclusion, spending more future in the occupation position in the erosion process  can cause a major number of decreases,however, it is good but just for those who are immature and want to do this activity in short length.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Cycling is a healthier and more environmentally friendly form of transport.

Nevertheless, cycling is getting less popular. What are the reasons of this

trend? What can be done to make cycling more popular?' 
 'Text': 'Riding bicycles is known as an efficient form of transportation that has several benefits,although,his method is experiencing a decrease in popularity day by day.I think the change in the form of  living and also the invention of new devices led citizens to handle them less,additionally,it is the government's responsibility to overcome this occurrence.

To begin with,upgrading  all aspects of society led us to a major number of developments,as a result,transportation is no exception.For instance,E-bikes and electric motorcycles  are very convenient to operate also affordable, furthermore, another beneficial point is that a large number of them can be used without a license. So the population that used to live life as simply as possible and in the most effortless way  reduce the amount of time that spending on bicycles because of needs for physical activities.

 To tackle this problem,  governments should start programs that encourage people to practice their bikes instead of other ways ,flexible times for starting their work day and healthy meals for those who service their personal health method. For illustration, they can introduce laws that support bike travellers and give them this opportunity to travel between their home and office in a safe way so  suggesting adaptable starting work hours could help them to finish their journey in the safest way.

 All in all, in my view cycling, is a really advantageous form of transport, however, it is going to be unpopular gradually and the authorities can solve it by introducing some laws and some opportunities for users to power up their motion to handle it.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, more people are migrating to other countries than ever before. In order to

become integrated into society in their adopted countries, immigrants should abandon their

old ways and adapt to local customs and codes of behavior.

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'There is no doubt that these days immigration become increasingly favourable. The question is, is it really important to migrate and what are the costs? In this essay, I am going to discuss the new trend of people being transformed totally into another country as well as the advantages and disadvantages. Moreover, I will draw my own conclusion regarding  this subject.

In order of advantages, the latest research showed that the people of developing countries that are integrated in modern nations have experienced easier lifestyle situations. The main reason given to support this claim is that once the people are involved in the biggest countries, the services presented will be greatly facilitated. In other words, people will avoid time and effort which is more likely to be consumed in their own countries. Therefore, they prefer to leave their places wishing for an easier life.

However, this way of travelling witnessed numerous drawbacks. Firstly, transformed people will be always considered as non-loyal individuals as they leave their original homeland. In other words, despite the comfort of life, they will always experience  homesickness due to the distance from their loved ones and their neighbourhood. Secondly, it is difficult to integrate into a new culture and change your original behaviour and language. For example, people immigrating into China will take a long time to understand the lifestyle and sometimes it might be impossible and risky. 

By way of conclusion, although there are several beneficial aspects regarding  immigration, it is not easy to leave your homeland and there are several problems you will be facing if you decide to take such a huge step. Therefore, governments must increase the awareness of both sides of their people and ease the services to save their population.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, a growing number of people with health problems are trying alternative medicines and treatments instead of visiting their usual doctor.

Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?' 
 'Text': 'It is evident that more and more unhealthy people lose their belief in their visual doctor and choose to try alternative medications and treatments. I think this may pose a threat to their health and waste their time, although people can have opportunities to find useful methods. 

These tests will lead to potential dangers to their bodies. Many people are allergic to something such as nuts, so when they try new medicines, they may be unaware that these goods may cause damage to their health. For instance, if a patient who is allergic to apples takes a medication containing nutritions which comes from apples, he/she will feel uncomfortable and even need an ambulance. In daily lives, their common doctor will prevent them from having these things because they are familiar with their patients. 

This thing may also be responsible for a waste of time for people. Trying new treatments and obtaining the results can cost a lot of time but finally, they may find these treatments are useless. So they fail to cure themselves and lose their valuable time. There are lots of civilians trying times and times, however, they earn nothing and just waste their time. 

On the other hand, trying new things gives people chances to find the right methods. Human beings have magic bodies and nowadays nobody knows everything about our bodies. As a result, no one can make sure that they give the appropriate medicines and treatments to their consumers. So if the one keeps trying different ways, he/she may find what he/she wants at last--if the right method has been invented! 

To sum up, trying different medicines and curations alloww people to be likely to find the ways that are suitable to themselves, but this will present a challenge to their bodies and just be a waste of time.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your locality.

Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community.

Do you support or oppose the factory establishment?

Explain your position.' 
 'Text': 'In modern times, It is probably true that competition is inevitable progress in  education. Competition gives the best outcomes, but sometimes shows the worst results. In this essay, I will examine how this trend brings about both benefits and drawbacks.

 One of the main advantages of trying to be better than compansions is assistance to developing society and personnel. That is to say, The more competitive they are and the more they want to do well, the better their skills will improve. For example, in high school in South Korea, students are graded on the scale of their studies, owing to this, children always compare their scale to peers and have a desire to grow than before. For this reason, they try to study harder.

 However, if everyone in society were eager to beat someone then collaboration, I believe it would have a harmful effect on both individuals and the nation. If they learn only competition throughout the entire study period, it means they don't learn how to interact, care, and cooperate with others, and it will have a negative impact on their social life as  adults. In addition to, they feel blue or have low self-esteem easily because of comparing to peers. For instance, young people feel like they are not good enough because they are always focusing on what others are doing better.

 In conclusion, it is certain people benefit from competing with others. Nevertheless, from my perspective, the negative consequences are too significant to disregard. Thus, it would be a good idea for the school to teach both competition and cooperation so that everyone could learn more balanced thoughts in life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, owning a home rather than renting one is very important for people.

Why might this be the case?

Do you think this is a positive or negative situation?' 
 'Text': 'It is no doubt that possession of a house is often considered to be an essential aspect of life. Therefore some people firmly believe that having their own living places would be more advantageous than renting one. The causes of this tendency will be discussed and the benefits will be argued. 

To begin with, the main reason why owning a home is vital for individuals is because it provides a sense of security and stability. Rental housing can frequently be unpredictable as landlords may raise rental prices and decide to sell property. For instance, a family rents an apartment for several years, in which a comfortable life has been established: children attend schools nearby and parents have installed friendly relations with local residents. However, the landlord unexpectedly bursts with the informing them to vacate the flat since he has decided to live there himself. Therefore, it is much better to have their own residential building due to the fact that homeowners control their houses and are not dependent on the whims of landlords. 

From my point of view, it is a positive trend not only because gives a sense of permanence and belonging but it also can be a good investment. Over time estate becomes more expensive, which means that homeowners can potentially make a profit if they sell their homes later. As an illustration, during the housing boom in the early 2000s, the reality of many people who owned an apartment in attractive locations increased dramatically. Hence, having an own house has many advantages. 

To put it in a nutshell, the economic stability and safety convince individuals to buy a house instead of renting it. Home ownership gives homeowners a sense of security and stability and can also be a good investment. It plays an integral role in citizens’ lives. Moreover, owning a flat is a goal that many people around the world strive for, and it's worth it.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'These days the majority of employers require good social skills. While these social skills could improve employee management and bring effective networking, these could social skills could not determine exact qualification and abilities. 

What extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Recently, more and more people have been paying attention to social skills.There are people who say that social skills are the most important additional qualification for success. I firmly believe that these skills are really necessary to stay in a good position in the workplace. In this essay, I will present my point of view. 

 

Perhaps the main reason I support this phenomenon is that many companies find employees who have good communication skills. such people have a lot of self-confidence to communicate with recipients. For example, in sales and marketing jobs, employees must rely on their own strength to convince customers by advertising their products.After that, their profits will increase when the number of customers increases.Moreover, in multinational jobs, employees have to communicate with foreigners.In such cases, personal contact is more important. 

 

Another reason I agree with this statement is that satisfactory behavior plays an important role in the workplace. In an expanded industry, people work in a team and they have a leader.If the manager and the employees treat each other badly, the project cannot be completed successfully. For example, in an IT-related job, one person cannot complete the entire project in the shortest possible time. Moreover, they solve it with the help of 12 or 14 employees. In this case, acceptable behavior can create good relationships and give energy.In addition, you can share the problem with others if the other person behaves very well. 

 

 To sum up, nowadays people can't do anything well due to a lack of social skills. if people have skills such as communication skills and good behavior, as well as academic skills.they will succeed in their professional life'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people feel that paparazzi should not follow celebrities and invade their privacy by taking pictures of them everywhere, while others believe this is just the price of fame.

Discuss both sides and give your opinion. Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'Celebrities are always surrounded by their fans and followers. While there are the number of individuals who hold the idea that stars should not be constantly followed by the media and to give them privacy, others contend that this is the fame they have earned so there is no harm in doing so. I will discuss both the views in following paragraphs providing my opinion at the end.

On the one hand number of people think that the media should respect the privacy of celebrities and  not follow them to click on their photos wherever they go. Everyone holds a right to have privacy during their personal life movements and the same applies to superstars as well. For instance, when celebrities do not want to reveal  their life events they should be given privacy. Being constantly watched by sometime is sometimes very traumatic, which leads to  unwanted stress in life.  

On the other hand, some argue that their stardom is because of the media’s attention by keeping them always in lime lite. Therefore many think that famous celebrities reach  that level with the support of the media and the love of fans, hence it is righteous to know about their every movement. If favourite star gets married privately, this might leave a negative sentimental effect on fans. 

To sum up, although fans are interested to know about their star’s routine life, in my opinion they deserve to live dignified and respected private lives with their family and loved ones. Thus, media should avoid covering news and capturing photos that they are not comfortable sharing with the public.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'some people prefer to plan all their vacation activities. others prefer to be spontaneous  (decide what to do at the last minute). which  do you prefer? why? give specific reasons for your answer.' 
 'Text': 'It is known that holiday is not only for getting rest. It can be rest, culture, or business because people can do all sometimes with their schedule. Therefore they do not want to change their schedule. On the other hand, others prefer to be spontaneous because they want to only get rest and enjoy. I strongly believe that we can prefer both according to our situation and I going to explain some specific reasons in this essay.

On the one hand, discipline is so important while doing the program because if you change your activity you can be late or lose your real program or job. For example,  some business person travel too much for their job. They join some activities which are interesting if they have time  that travel. Of course, they do not want to change their vacation activities because they go  there for specific reasons if they change their program maybe they can lose their real job. 

On the other hand, some people do not like going on holiday according to any program and love too much spontaneity. The reasons for that are first, it can be so exciting because you do not know what you can do. Second, it can be so fun for people to enjoy without the program. Third, you can meet different people whom you do not know. For instance, one of my friends went from  Gaziantep to Antalya. he went walking and hitchhicking for cars. He told me it was a really amazing trip because I met a lot of different people on the way. Of course, it had a bad side. For example, you can see dangerous people.

To sum up, to stay in the plan or without any plan we can couse both according to our goal. . In my opinion, people choose too much spontaneous travel to enjoy.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer to have temporary jobs, which means they only work a few months in a year and use the rest of the time to do what they want. What is your opinion?' 
 'Text': 'There is a prevailing notion that temporary jobs offer greater flexibility and freedom compared to full-time employment, allowing individuals to allocate their time as they please. While it is true that temporary employment can yield a substantial income, I contend that the stability and security provided by full-time positions outweigh the benefits of temporary work.

To begin with, individuals engaged in temporary jobs enjoy the flexibility to balance work and personal life. However, the unpredictable nature of their earnings often renders saving money challenging, leaving them vulnerable in times of financial need. For instance, in emergencies such as unexpected medical expenses, having a stable income becomes indispensable. According to recent statistics, over 60% of individuals in temporary positions struggle to save money due to fluctuating incomes. In my country, securing loans for significant investments like real estate typically necessitates proof of stable employment and income.

On the contrary, temporary employment can be advantageous for those adept at financial management and time allocation. Despite the fluctuating income, individuals must exercise prudence in budgeting and expenditure. Moreover, the surplus time available can be utilized for self-improvement endeavors, such as acquiring new skills or languages. While additional job opportunities may augment earnings, effective time management becomes paramount. Transitioning between jobs smoothly can also be challenging; however, with proper planning and foresight, individuals can mitigate these challenges.

In light of the aforementioned considerations, the conclusion becomes apparent. While temporary employment facilitates a favorable work-life balance and offers opportunities for personal development, it also entails inherent risks and uncertainties. Therefore, I advocate for full-time employment as it provides a dependable income foundation and greater financial security.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many parts of the world, children and adolescents are spending more and more time indoors. What do you think is the cause of this problem? What best measures can be taken for it' 
 'Text': 'In today’s digital age, many young people regularly spend more of their lives indoors. This essay will first suggest that the biggest problem caused by this phenomenon is the current state of technology and then present advice to limit the overuse of electronic devices. the most feasible solution.

     The foremost problem caused by the development of the technological age is electronic devices with addictive games. millions of people around the world spend too much time playing games when they are at home and most of those games take a lot of time to complete. The consequence is that it affects each person's lifestyle, making them feel lazier and want to stay home and play games instead of going out with some friends. For example, Today's games have online features that allow many people to play together. In an online game, this has increased the number of children or teenagers who want to stay at home and play games with friends but do not want to go out and play with them.

     It's hard to deny that parental advice and action is the best solution currently. To explain, Parents should advise or manage their children to consider using electronic devices for entertainment, limit gaming to no more than three hours a day and convince them with some outdoor activity.
