In actual fact, studies undertaken by experts have revealed that polluted areas rarely find general animals and plants and confusingly convert natural food chains, so this has a fatal influence on endangered species.

Nevertheless, the world faces a wide range of other concerns. The developing countries struggle with poverty and famine and the global strives to prevent deadly world wars in  Europe. this, therefore, the first priority of the world for the next generation can be changed all the time.

To conclude, the world faces a wide range of other concerns but the earth has been destroyed by individuals and a decrease in biodiversity occurs. Thus, protecting the environment is the most significant measure.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is often argued that it is difficult to get children to read. Why do you think this is? What measures could be taken to encourage children to read more?' 
 'Text': 'People claim that it is hard to make children read books because of the easy access to new technology and of how busy parents are in these days. 

I feel that there can be many solutions to encourage children to read more, like reducing time in front of screens, going more to the library or creating rituals to go to bed to create family time. 

To begin with, new technology has become more and more accessible to children like video games, smartphones or even television, which can represent a source of addiction to the youngest. 

For example, nowadays every child wants to have the latest video games for Christmas, which is a lot time-consuming and allows no time left to read. 

Moreover, today, parents and especially mothers are more and more busy with their professional lives. As a result, they have less time to share activities with their children or spend family time .

For example, after a day of work, it is difficult to have time and energy to read a fairy tale before going to bed or to organise a day out to the library when they do not have school . 

I believe that many solutions can encourage children to read books like reducing the time spent in front of screens and instead, proposing books in different genres to make the youngest interested in the reading activity.

For example, teenagers are crazy about mangas like Naruto. So , instead of watching manga cartoons, we need to propose manga books, which are interesting to read, like Japanese do , from the right to the left. 

In addition, parents need to create family rituals like reading fairy tails before going to bed, which can set a habit of reading alone . 

In conclusion, people argue that today, children read less because of new technology and the busy lives of their parents. However, I believe that we need to reduce time spent in front of screens and make books more attractive to the youngest by creating moments shared together.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The government should put a tax on unhealthy food to promote better health. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'One of the most recent trends in today’s world is the upsurge in fast food, which has significantly increased therefore the government should include a tax on that to promote healthy foods. People have a wide sprit of belief that this is a popular subject in debate. I tend to believe that putting a tax on that has more positive impacts than negatives and this essay will demonstrate with reasons.

On the other hand, critics may point out some drawbacks. They might say that it helps people to get rid of the monotonous feelings of having home food always. Human beings love to try out various foods therefore people tend to go out and have food from restaurants. If the government increases the price of junk foods, people have to face difficulties affording food.

As people constantly eat fast food, they suffer from non-communicable diseases such as diabetes, high blood pressure and cholesterol at a young age. For example, nowadays citizens have a hectic lifestyle for that reason they don't have time to cook food every time at home so they think fast food is a convenience. not only that but also do not they have time for physical fitness so easily they are prone to these diseases because of this reason country has to spend more money on people's medicines. Truly, this is the most predominant one and it has many consequences variously. Secondly, Secondly, If the country needs to promote local foods, they can put a tax on processed foods because most unhealthy foods are exported from overseas. Moreover, people lead to try our local recipes using healthy ingredients due to expensive food.

In conclusion, although having some disadvantages, In my perspective, for people to become healthy it is necessary to put a tax on unhealthy foods thereby consumption of unhealthy food can reduce. The first thing in our lives is health and it is wealth as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that it is more beneficial to take part in sports which are played in teams, like football. While other 

people think that taking part in individual sports is better, like tennis or swimming. Discuss both views and give your own 

opinion.' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary society, the methods of playing physical games are widely debated. It’s argued that joining team sports brings residents several benefits to participating in individual physical activities. The following article will clarify their statement 

 On the one hand, crew sports play a crucial role in developing teamwork spirits and expanding social networks the first pro is that players might strengthen their abilities to work in a team. In this day and age it cannot be denied that sports plays help me have good health and well-being, some people argue that it is more critical to have an enjoyable job than to earn a lot of physical exercise In order to maintain bodily. Another advantage is that it is a key factor in boosting their relationships is society helps residents have more communicate with many ages for example physical activities and bodily games this can be explained by the fact movies have been considered to be fashionable and entertaining 

  On the flip side some games choose to do personal games for primary reasons of flexibility and independence, participation in sports games, namely walking, jogging or Doing Yoga helps physical and mental health, and staying healthy is very necessary for every human to be guaranteed and maintained get shaped and have a good healthy 

  In conclusion, selecting the ways to play sports depends too much on each person’s personality some want to join a physical team to increase their social image. However, it seems to me that playing private sports is also powerful for those who are busy and prioritize freedom'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In light of the current socio economic situation of the world do you think this the right time for wild life preservation If yes what are the ways and means you suggest for this?' 
 'Text': 'Wildlife preservation is a debatable issue in the present world. While socio-economic conditions have been demanding more natural resources to address increased population needs, a healthy ecosystem is also needed for continued existence of mankind. I believe that it is always the right time for wildlife conservation. 

To begin with, wildlife preservation is a timeless endeavour, important regardless of the world's socio-economic status. Preserving biodiversity contributes to the health of our planet, which in turn supports human well-being. Healthy ecosystems provide services, such as pollination, clean water, and disease regulation, which are foundational to agriculture and other industries. In addition to this, wildlife conservation can be a strategy for economic development. Eco-tourism, for instance, offers a sustainable income while promoting conservation.

On the flip side, there are various ways to protect wildlife and their habitat. First and foremost, is to support conservation organizations. People should donate to or volunteer with organizations that work to protect wildlife. They often conduct research, implement conservation projects, and raise awareness. Secondly, humans should reduce their ecological footprint and make sustainable choices in their daily lives as well as education ought to be provided about 3R's reduce, reuse and recycle, in order to minimize the waste. By this, they can conserve energy, water, and other useful resources. Furthermore, individuals should promote responsible tourism, when visiting natural areas. Choose eco-friendly tour operators and avoid activities that harm wildlife and their habitats.

In conclusion, wildlife preservation is not just a moral imperative but also a practical one for maintaining the balance of our ecosystem, which is essential for the socio-economic stability of our world.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Using a computer everyday can have more negative than positive effects on your children . Do you agree or disagree. Give reasons for your answers and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience' 
 'Text': 'In today’s technological era the usage of computers and tablets is increasingly popular in children's everyday lives. Whilst acknowledging that there are drawbacks, I will argue that using a computer is far more beneficial than its negatives because it provides more opportunities to learn about things such as science and language at a fast pace.  

Popularity of the computer technology has increased in all sectors worldwide, including education over the past few decades. Some people have seen it as a negative development as nowadays, some children have suffered from addictions to computer games and social media, which lead to not only mental and physical illnesses but also consequences on their performance of education. Without adult supervision, children tend to play online games for long hours and scroll through screens a whole day, which has resulted in negative effects on their eyesight and cognitive development, for example.

On the other hand, if this advanced tool is managed to be used for educational purposes, not for entertainment, it can help boost young mind's academic performance and also broaden their bits of knowledge in any topic and context. For this reason, it brings more benefits to the next generations rather than drawbacks. For instance, learning foreign languages is easier and relatively cheaper than it used to be in the past. Moreover, many apps and platforms that offer a variety type of lessons can easily be installed on the PC is now ubiquity. As a result, everyone can study remotely any subject at their own pace and interest. 

To conclude, although, if these electronic machines and devices are overused by children to entertain themselves, it can have negative effects on them, proper and adequate utilization can bring more advantageous such as expanding children's knowledge and learning something new.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many teachers assign homework to students everyday.

Do you think that daily homework is necessary for students?' 
 'Text': 'Some people claim that homework is mandatory for the children, while others say not. In this essay, we will discuss both points of view and converge on which opinion could be better.

From the point of positive view, home assignments help to grow responsibility, forcing them to complete certain missions. Achieving certain goals could help them to earn a feeling of achievement, build autonomy, and be more independent. Homework guarantees minimum knowledge for everyone due to they are given the same amount and level. Basic math and the alphabet could be a notable example of fundamental knowledge, which is essential for living in the world.

On the other side, some people propose that assignments could be forcing children to achieve in a mixed course. Everyone has different levels, base knowledge, and aptitude, therefore homework could be complex for some classes and some not. The one who can not follow the course could give up, which leads to a deeper knowledge gap. Moreover, pushing someone to achieve a certain goal could provide negative feelings and affect mental health, which has considerable importance in childhood.

To sum up, I agree that excessive tasks could have negative effects on children. However, without difficulty, we could not gain anything. Without fundamental education, our tier of knowledge will diverge gradually. With little forcing, we could grow up our average knowledge, while guaranteeing rock bottom. Therefore, doing homework seems a better choice than not doing it.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The migration of people to cities is one of the biggest problems facing the world’s cities today. 

Discuss the causes. What solutions could be used to tackle the situation?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, people are moving to the cities. Therefore, cities are suffering from this challenge globally. The main problem is the lack of jobs for residents of rural areas. One solution to this problem could be distributing supermarkets and industries to the countryside.

These days, the shortage of jobs obligates individuals to migrate to the cities. Unfortunately, this problem is not only one city but cities across the world suffering this challenge. This problem has been created due to job seekers. For example, those who are living in rural areas are busy working in factories or supermarkets that are located in the cities, in this case for time efficiency they prefer being in the cities.

Distributing industries to the countryside can be one solution for keeping people in rural areas. Most of this problem is due to a large number of people who are looking for jobs. Therefore, the government should make plans or policies to contribute the source of work (supermarkets, industries) to the rural area. It proved the cities without noses, crowed, and air pollution moreover, it led the rural residents to save the money that has been being spent on public transport or private cars oil. Consequently, moving industries to rural areas is the best way to tackle the following problem.

In conclusion, people globally preferred moving town. It faces cities to challenge. It is due to job seekers or lack of work for local residents. The solution to this challenge is that the government should contribute to factories in rural areas.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Children spend a lot of time watching TV and playing computer games however it does not help in improving their mental abilities.Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is claimed that plenty of time, which is used to watch films and enjoy computer games, brings no enhancement to children’s mental conditions. However, the author of this essay disagrees with this statement due to youngsters’ gaining various knowledge and the flexibility of combining studying and playing.

    It is crucial to acknowledge that many programs on TV will make it easier for young people to know more about different aspects of knowledge. This is because lots of diverse educational shows on TV which are specially designed for children will give various important information and provide numerous valuable learning experiences. Likewise, a lot of genres and contents of games which contain historical, scientific or social elements will create a flexible learning environment for teenagers. This will be the place where children can access many useful lessons which they may have not studied at school without being bored and uninterested.

   Another point to take into consideration is the youngsters’ opportunities to entertain and obtain knowledge at the same time. Nowadays, numerous games require active and strategic thinking will need adolescents to develop many necessary skills from dealing with their problems to adapting unexpecting situations while they are taking part in their plays which inadvertently helps children to form their habits of thinking quickly. Moreover, by listening to a great deal of English songs on TV, teenagers will be able to learn a foreign language effectively as they remember what they like to hear. Thus, those devices not only bring entertainment but also help young people to become knowledgeable.

    In conclusion, watching films and playing computers do not always have negative effects on youngsters as they contribute great learning environment and combine relaxing and accessing information. This essay has presented that those activities can benefit children’s cognitive abilities.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'News plays an important part of most people's lives. Why is news so

important to people? Why is so much news dedicated to bad news?

Should the news focus on good news instead?' 
 'Text': 'The issue of news in today's fast-paced world has sparked a heated debate among many. It is widely argued that news could be both important and narrow down to bad things. This essay will explore the significance of news in modern society, examine the reasons behind the focus on adverse events, and discuss the potential benefits of a more balanced approach to news reporting.

The reason for the pivotal role of news is the ability to get access to life-saving information by news. For example, we can get an alert about earthquakes, military invasions, thereby potentially safeguarding our lives. 

However, a strong focus on bad news might lead to anxiety and exponentially increase stress levels. I assume the main cause of concentrating on bad news lies in human mental nature. People easily get scared and start scrolling through the news feed hoping to regain control. 

It is, therefore, imperative to strike a delicate balance in news reporting. Incorporating a more holistic approach that not only highlights the challenges we face but also celebrates human achievements and positive developments can contribute significantly to a healthier societal outlook. By doing so, news media can continue to fulfill their essential role in society while also promoting a more optimistic and resilient community.

Overall,  while the importance of news cannot be overstated, the nature of its content holds profound implications for societal well-being. News organizations should be mindful of their responsibility not just to inform but also to contribute to the cultivation of an informed and hopeful society.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people today are worried about the large quantities of waste produced by ordinary households.

What problems are caused by household waste, and what solutions may be possible in both the short and the long term?' 
 'Text': 'It is inevitable that modern households will produce some waste, but the increasing amounts of refuse over recent years present a challenge for us all. There seem to be two main problems stemming from this situation, and also two steps we could take to address it fully.

Possibly the major problem is the huge question of how to collect, process and dispose of this material. Household waste comprises elements ranging from foodstuffs to metal, paper and plastics, and local authorities sometimes struggle to handle such a diverse mix of material. The historical solution has been incineration or landfill, but the problems of pollution and long-term ground contamination which arise have led to widespread efforts to recycle at least some of the waste. This leads us to the second concern, which is the high cost of disposing of refuse in an ecologically sound manner. We would all wish as much as possible of our rubbish to be recycled (for example by paper pulping or reusing plastics) but the expense involved must be met by higher taxes and charges for households.

Regarding possible solutions, probably the most immediate short-term solution would be to divert far more government funds into waste processing and recycling facilities at a local level. This would reduce the environmental impact of the waste by reducing pollution, and also lower our demand for raw materials, as more recycled products would consequently be produced. A further, longer-term solution might be to raise the level of public understanding for the need to consume less material in households, especially in terms of packaging and wasted food. A campaign of education along these lines would gradually lessen the volume of waste, especially if reinforced by incentives for consuming less and penalties for excessive waste, as we see being trialled in the UK at present.

Overall, the main problems are both environmental and financial. The possible solutions involve more immediate investment in facilities, and also encouraging long-term changes in household behaviour.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'As people's awareness of environmental protection declines, some people think that we need to find a way to live with climate change rather than prevent it. However, I consider that people need to focus on how to prevent climate change.

 First of all, finding a method to live with it could result in a waste of financial and human resources. A wonderful method to enable people to live with adverse weather conditions means that it requires more technological support and economic support, potentially leading to significant financial and manpower resources being expended. Furthermore, it is uncertain whether the method would be successful. It's obvious that technological development is not mature enough now, on this basis, it is difficult to find a perfect solution to tackle this problem. Consequently, there are various negative impacts on finding a way to live with climate rather than preventing it from happening.

 Looking at it from another perspective, there are also some significant effects of climate change, which severely impact society. For example, drought conditions severely impact crop yields, while some stormy weather can cause extensive damage to infrastructure and loss of personal property. Such destruction seriously impacts human lives and economic development. Additionally, due to this decision people don't avoid climate change, which probably leads to more destruction of the environment. The reason is that people's awareness of environmental conservation becomes weaker as they consider that there is always a way to handle the problem rather than they face the problem themselves, though the issue is caused by themselves.

 In conclusion, although some people think that we need to find a way to live with climate change rather than prevent it, I still think that people need to focus on how to prevent climate change.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some university students want to learn about other subjects in addition to their main subjects.Others believe it is more important to give all their time and attention to study for a qualification.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion' 
 'Text': 'There is a trend for some pupils to go the extra mile to read about additional subjects apart from their major books.Other folks think that it  is better to focus on one speciality at a time in order to achieve higher grades.Both schools of thought have their own pros and cons which will be discussed in the subsequent paragraphs.I personally would prefer studying for the qualification rather than wasting hours on non relevant stuff.

             There are numerous merits of learning about diverse subjects.Firstly, reading  a single book can make a person get bored  very early.So, by shifting attention towards other books, the individual gets more energy to concentrate on the syllabus books. Secondly, more knowledge gives more confidence. It is well said that \'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'in order to succeed, people require certain personality traits. what are these traits? what else is needed' 
 'Text': 'There are a couple of fundamental characteristics which lead people to find success in life which can be noted as responsibility along  determination. However, success also requires a fair share of luck combined with some social networking.

In terms of personality, if one is both responsible and ambitious, they should be able to reach triumph in life. In other words, a person who can manage themselves in life is often the same one who finds themselves in a position where success is around the corner due to how they present themselves in their affairs. Being determined, on the other hand, is a passive skill which guides people towards their goals. This trait is one that can be found in any successful individual, from Bill Gates to Elon Musk; people who have set their goals on a certain task, accomplished it and now their lives are in the history books.

To be successful, one cannot rely solely on their character, but also on life’s unfathomable luck and people they interact with. As for  luck, a lot of success stories have a similar factor, simply being a the right place at the right time. This can be seen in a lot of movies, where the stories only make sense when one small piece of luck enables the main character to find their dream. Additionally, the people you know can also influence greatly on where your life ends up. To illustrate, by knowing the right person, and befriending them, one could gain a position in a company based on friendship alone, not necessarily requiring any skills besides their own social ones.

In conclusion, in order to find success, one needs to take charge of their life’s path, by not just waiting for lucky opportune moments, but also getting to know the right people on their desired road to success. If one desires success, one must navigate this world with a clear goal.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'There are many people who go to live in different countries. To what extent should people be allowed to move freely between countries and live where they choose? What are the benefits and drawbacks of this?' 
 'Text': 'Today, more and more people are moving to other countries , which can lead to demographic, economic and ecological issues. 

I do believe, however,  that people are free to travel and move to wherever they want, but under certain conditions like making quotas of immigration in order to preserve the balance of people, jobs and pollution in the country. 

To begin with, thanks to new ways of working and thanks to low-cost plane companies, people are willing to settle down in other countries to make a better living, to try something new and better for them . 

For example, after the Covid crisis, a lot of people wanted to go to live in the countryside or go to live in a sunny area of the planet. 

Likewise, more and more young job seekers try to leave their home country to start a working experience abroad. For instance, after graduating , young workers move to foreign countries like Australia to work as fruit pickers. 

Although moving to another part of the world sounds attractive , it can lead to many issues for the welcoming country ;  More often, people move to big cities in order to find a job easily, which can sometimes, generate overpopulation and fluctuating unemployment rate in the whole nation. 

In addition, the movement of population is mostly made by plane, which is the most polluting way of travel. 

We may need to be careful of these consequences and the solution could be to quantify the amount of people moving. For example, we could just make quotas to reduce the impact on the demography and on  climate.

In conclusion, whilst moving to another country is possible and attractive for more and more people, I do believe that we need to be concerned by the risks that can be generated by this kind of immigration, which can damage  the climate and the demographic balance of the chosen country.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some experts believe that a second language should be taught at an early age. Do the advantages ouyweigh the disadvantages' 
 'Text': 'Many people believe that children should learn a foreign language other than their mother tongue and they should start it at primary school. I completely agree with this proposed idea because I believe that children at much younger ages are more receptive to new subjects and have greater learning ability. In addition, in older age during high school, foreign language has already been introduced to them so they feel less burdened with additional subjects.

It has been proved that children have greater potential to learn new things at a younger age. For example, based on one research that has been carried out on school-age pupils in Iran, researchers compared the learning ability of elementary school children with older students and realized that younger children have a higher ability to learn the English language faster and more fluently than older ones. Therefore, it makes more sense to introduce the language course at an early age.

Moreover, high school students have to study many advanced subjects during their academic years so if a new foreign language course is introduced to their difficult curriculum this means an additional burden on them and as a consequence, they will get frustrated and focus less on that. To be more precise, in this case, the purpose of learning a second language which is the optimal use of it will not be achieved or they will need the extra effort and time to master that language.

To summarize, based on what mentioned above, learning new subjects including a second language needs to be introduced to children in their earlier ages because they have more potential to learn and master that subject compared with the older age.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that dangerous sport should be banned while others believe that people should be free to choose. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some people opine that dangerous sports should be forbidden.  Others state that it is up to you. I am the person who agrees with the second one, and I will elaborate my point of view in following paragraphs.

To start with, banning those sports may result in some problems. For example, diving is a pretty risky sport. If people stop doing that, we will not have that sort of talented people in the future. Why do we need that kind of people? Because they can rescue someone in the ocean, sea, lake, and so on. Firefighters and special force members are trained in many types of serious environments. They are helping people. Therefore, I support that we can choose to do it or not.

Juveniles are easily affected by peers. As a result, they are more likely to do some things which are considered adventures. However, those are the things with lots of hazards, such as speed riding, fighting, parkour, and so forth. Every year, some youngsters pass away because of participating in one sport. I think maybe it is a good idea to limit it for teenagers. All ages could take part in these exercises. However, adolescents are the most serious age group.

In a nutshell, some people like to take risks and do those for fun. Some people became professional players and trainers. And those athletes could be good at saving others from danger. However, young adults are the ages that like to put them in risk. And they are not well prepared for doing those sports. Thus, many of them were gone. I think governments should discuss this and make laws for it.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say History is one of the most important school subjects. Other people think that, in today’s world, subjects like Science and Technology are more important than History.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that history plays a significant role in school subjects while others believe that nowadays subjects such as science and technology are more important than history. while learning history can help students guide their decisions, I believe that studying the latter subjects relating to science and technology sectors is crucial to securing a good job and salary.

The reason why people think history is vital is that history provides invaluable insights into the past, shaping their understanding of the present and guiding their future decisions. By studying history, individuals can learn critical thinking skills, cultural appreciation and civic engagement. For instance, understanding the causes and consequences of past conflicts like World War II not only informs students about global dynamics but also prompts reflection on the importance of diplomacy and peace-building in contemporary society. History empowers students to navigate complexities, appreciate diversity, and contribute meaningfully to a world shaped by its past. However, I believe that mastery of science and technology will hold more initiative.

With more and more repetitive work replaced by machines, people now are living in a creativity-based society. Studying science and technology makes students able to easily find a job that pays high wages. That is to say, working in the majority of modern workspace requires up-to-date technological information aiming to improve the quality of work and to compete with others, and in turn, those employees will earn good remuneration. For instance, many IT graduates from Peking University were able to have high positions and good wages in many renowned business companies.

In conclusion, while the reason for learning history is understandable, I think science and technology are essential for our professional development.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many countries have compulsory military service for young men after they leave school. It would be a good idea for all countries to adopt this system for men, and possibly for women too.

Do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'For the last few decades, a great amount of changes have been made in the army service of almost every nation. Fortunately, the majority of them considered military service as a necessary action for high school graduates. While I agree with the statement that apply each country should prioritize soldier's function as their important policy for males, I argue that females should not join the military inevitably.

First of all, there are some advantages of having an army program for young men in the country. This benefits both youths and the country. On the one hand, new soldiers will be developed physically and possibly widen their circle of acquaintances. Additionally, generally speaking, army circumstances are more likely to help youngsters to mature. On the other hand, it is believed that a sense of patriotism will bloom inside soldiers and this will help governments to ensure the future of their countries.

Although the workforce of the military of the region is one of the most essential parts of the country's security, including women in this field unavoidably is both ethically and historically wrong. Most of the time, males of the country or tribe have been a main force often because of their physical significance compared to females. For example, during World Wars, men fought with invaders at the front and women assisted them with medical support at the back line.

In conclusion, in my opinion, providing the military as an obligatory service for the young men is advantageous for both the region and the youngsters. However, I have an opposing position for involving women in this field.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Digital technology is becoming the main role in our lives. This provides both advantages and disadvantages. To what extent do you agree?' 
 'Text': 'These days, Computers and other digital technologies come with both advantages and disadvantages. There is no doubt that digital technologies and computers produce a lot of good things.

Firstly, computers have been providing useful functions in the form of applications such as Microsoft Office, Google Chrome, and Microsoft Teams which are being used for document work, exploring information, and connecting people around the world. For example, according to Microsoft Corporation's analysis department showed that computer applications can improve the efficiency at work of 3 in 4 citizens around the world by 90 percent compared to the paper base. In addition to that doctors can check and give basic treatment details to patients who live in remote areas. Overall, the efficacy of working people and distance medical treatment has been maximized by computers.

Moreover, computers can deeply analyze more data and learn in a short time because it has an intelligent central processing unit that operates accurately and quickly. For instance, BBC News reports that computers have won a game of chess 100 percent among humans in only one study game. The World Health Organization confirmed that digital technology is being used to diagnose diseases which can provide support for doctors to precisely evaluate. Therefore, with the reliability and agility of computer work, it will be proficient in modern life in terms of human well-being.

To sum up, there are clear advantages of digital technology and computers regarding working perfectly, rapid calculation, improving work productivity, closely remote people, and bringing human life better.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe having a good teacher is the ultimate recipe for a student success. Others think a the desire to succeed is most important. Discuss both sides ad give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There has been quite an obvious discussion around the topic of a recipe for student success. While some people believe that having a good teacher is the key, some would say that having the desire to succeed is more important. This essay will discuss both sides which will be shown in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, there is no doubt that a proper teacher can create an environment of curiosity and engagement, which is essential for meaningful learning. Moreover, the specific teachers can provide deeper and more accurate knowledge than self-study or research from online articles. For instance, In Thailand, many parents hire tutors to teach their children one-on-one at their accommodation after school time, as they can draw personalized attention and also provide lessons to each student's needs.

On the other hand, it is worth pointing out that inner desire can drive students to alternative education opportunities, which is crucial to achieving the target, As there are numerous ways to study these days and enormous useful materials online which could be researched by anyone. In addition, the desire to succeed is inherent and cannot be taught. For example, this is based on the fact that learner who cannot afford personalized tutors spend their free time in library to improve academic skills. The exam result is not significantly different from students who have a tutor.

In my opinion, having a proper teacher is important, as they can build a good environment and draw attention from students, but the eagerness to succeed is also vital as it is Individual and cannot be taught.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': '.Most of the people in the society enjoy watching crime movies and

criminal TV programmes. Why do you think people have more interest

to watch them? What is the impact to the society due to this?' 
 'Text': 'It is believed that many individuals love to watch crime-related shows and TV programmes. Watching crime-related stuff helps them to stay alert and get a chance to stay active in their daily activity. In the upcoming paragraphs, I will discuss the reasons for the community's interest in watching those programmes. After that, I will share my views about their impact on society. Lastly, I will conclude my topic. 

To begin with, as crime rate is increasing day by day. I believe watching crime-related shows helps people  stay alert and the community get an idea of how to deal with crime. As they watched in movies if some crime happened then how to deal with it. Moreover, these programs are interesting as their storyline seems to be connected with a person's life. At some point person can relate the concept in their life. Furthermore, watching these kinds of movies helps to reduce crime rates. For instance, I read in a newspaper article, that an old lady was watching a lot crime crime-related programs on TV. Some strangers get into the house. She already has no idea of what will happen next as she hears the same story on a TV program. She handled the situation very well just because  she had an idea of how to deal with crime. 

In my opinion, this development has both positive and negative impacts on society. In a positive way, one can save their life by getting tips from movies. it makes the person aware. If we talk about the negative aspects, the thieves could already be aware of techniques which people can follow, so they would go for another option. Children can learn bad things by watching movies.

in conclusion, I believe these movies save person's life. People know about the positive and negative outcomes. One can know about outcomes if they do something wrong.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that the best way to reduce the time spent in travelling to work is to replace parks and gardens close to the city center with apartment buildings for commuters, but others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, there is an ongoing issue regarding the abolishment of public parks for commuters. Some people assert that the government has to remove the public parks near the center of a city and instead build public facilities to encourage employment or improve transport systems for commuters because sometimes the shared space for the community between the high-rise buildings interrupts workers' commute. They argue that making room for new workplaces or developing transport is more effective for commuting and it would be helpful to the socio-economy. According to an announcement by the government, the number of people using parks is declining these days because of severe dust in the air. Thus, they argue it is better to establish new spaces for workers rather than disburse the expenditures for managing the parks.

On the other hand, some people presume that the park should be remained for the local people. It is mainly because it is ideal for people to enjoy their leisure time, such as reading a book, playing badminton, and jogging with their pets. A number of children are used to come out to do outdoor activities with their friends or parents. Moreover, it is also good for the workers to release their stress in the park as it is close to workplace.

The park needs to remain in our lives. It would be helpful not only to enjoy the natural habitat but also to refresh people's minds in the hustle and bustle of life.

In my opinion, the park needs to remain in our lives. I believe that it would be helpful not only to enjoy the natural habitat but also to refresh people's minds in the hustle and bustle of life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots aand artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'In this era, human workplaces are being replaced by the development of robots and AI. This writer believes that it is the high productivity and automation that make robots and AI  work better than humans and this is a positive change.

It must be acknowledged that robots and AI can bring better results in performance as they can work productively and automatically. This is because they are programmed to do certain jobs and can deal with complicated tasks accurately. Furthermore, robots and AI do not need to relax so they can work for a long time. As a result, when the robots and AI do a better job than humans. It will replace some jobs in the future such as receptionist. For example, Samsung company has made a redundant and many people run into unemployment situation, because a variety of the manufacturing process are replaced by robots and AI.

Taking the benefits of AI and robots into account, i believe it is true to say that they can bring a positive development to  society. For this reason, applying technology and automatic machines to the industrial process can promote the social economy. As a consequence, many investors will invest in  local companies and help the community become more modern. Take Ho Chi Minh City as an example, it can be seen that the economy of this city has increased rapidly after revolutionizing the way of manufacturing from hand-made to robots.

In conclusion, AI and robots are changing human roles as they can perform productively and automatically. Therefore, using them in the manufacturing process can bring a lot of positive change to  society'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding the changes. Others, however think that changes is always a good thing. Discuss both the views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There seems to be a lack of consensus in the way we live our lives. While some people argue that it is better to do the same activities and ignore drastic changes in your routine, others, including myself, believe that changes in life always come with beneficial improvements. In the following paragraphs, I will discuss both ideas in detail.

There are reasons why some people think that change in life is always beneficial. Firstly, sticking to a monotonous daily schedule can cause many mental problems for the individual. Some psychologists believe that people with a sedentary lifestyle are more likely to suffer from depression than others. Secondly, according to his opinion, people who experience different situations and are ready for change are more successful. For example, a person who has a disorganized occupation that does not match their interests finds themselves depriving themselves of other careers that would give them a sense of satisfaction.

On the other hand, another group claims that incorporating new things into our daily routine would be problematic. 

They emphasize that if people want to be on the safe side, they should avoid change. In this regard, it is more likely that long-term employees receive promotions than workers who change their occupations in a short period of time. Moreover, they know the feeling of peace in their monotonous life rather than living in stressful situations and as a result prefer not to be a risk taker.

In conclusion, in my opinion, quality of life is more valuable than lifespan. Thus, while routines provide comfort, we cannot continue the steps to success and enjoy our lives without being open to change.Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding the changes. Others, however think that changes is always a good thing. Discuss both the views and give your own opinion.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Rich countries often give money to poorer countries, but it does not solve poverty. Therefore, developed countries should give other types of help to the poor countries rather than financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Poverty is a pressing issue faced by a lot of countries in the entire world, especially developing countries. Developed countries usually give money to undeveloped countries, however, it may not solve poverty and I strongly believe there should be transformation to resolve in the ways that give other types of help to the poor countries rather than financial aid.

     Firstly, education is the best key to the growth of any population. If people have training overseas, it will lead to creating employment and they will sell their national products and services.

For instance, in Mongolia, people were sent to China last year for training in making clothes.

However, now they make clothes and export them abroad. Moreover, developed countries can offer expertise and resources to help build infrastructure, improve healthcare systems.

     Secondly, financial aid does not reach the people who need it and often ends up in the hands of corrupt governments or institutions. In many poor countries, corruption and mismanagement are rampant, misallocating wealth and perpetuating poverty. In addition, financial aid often comes with strings attached such as imposing policies that favor the interests of donor countries over those of recipients. This can lead to the exploitation of resources and exploitation of the poor.

      In conclusion, while it is a good-willed gesture, financial aid alone is not the solution to poverty in developing countries. Instead, developed countries should focus on alternative forms of aid that help impoverished countries become self-reliant and address underlying problems such as corruption and dependency.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robot and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'As technology advances, robots and artificial intelligence (AI) are increasingly assuming roles across various industries, providing an efficient solution for tasks demanding precision and accuracy. The author suggests that while this transition may enhance competitiveness in the workplace, it could also have negative implications for human well-being.

Industries reliant on precise procedures and large-scale production find the use of robotic devices for complex tasks to be a logical choice. This allows skilled workers to focus on more intricate responsibilities beyond the capabilities of robots, thereby optimizing workforce potential and business efficiency. A local newspaper documented a significant profit increase for a children's toy manufacturing company following the integration of AI into their production processes.

However, the drawbacks of depending on robots and AI must be acknowledged. Many companies view these technologies as offering superior productivity and mental resilience compared to human workers, leading to a trend of replacing human employees with AI-driven counterparts capable of prolonged, uninterrupted work. This may result in a rise in unemployment, especially among workers lacking specialized skills, who may struggle to find well-paying jobs. Forced to accept low-skilled positions to meet their financial needs, they risk career stagnation and miss out on future advancement opportunities.

In summary, critics argue that the growing adoption of robots and AI in the workplace stems from business leaders aiming to enhance profitability through the utilization of non-human resources. However, this shift could exacerbate unemployment as many workers find it challenging to compete with AI-driven systems.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Increasing number of people are choosing plastic surgery. Why do people want to change the way they look? What are the possible effects?' 
 'Text': 'These days, many people have been inclined to change their appearance with the help of plastic surgery. There are several reasons behind this issue such as the beauty standards of the modern world and improvements in medicine. As a result, individuals can mostly endanger their health in order to look better and waste a lot of money.

There are some factors why people have opted to use esthetic operations in recent years. One main reason is that people’s views about beauty have completely altered, particularly since the 21st century. In the past, most males and females were prone to look simpler and more natural rather than now. Therefore, they were obsessed with the way they appeared to the others. However, now this tendency depends on artificial methods like plastic operations. Secondly, the quality of this type of surgery is increasing every day because technological developments are also observed in medical fields as well as other areas. So, they can take the responsibility of highly developed and perilous operations which might assist people to look natural and beautiful.

Although these surgeries have become more reliable and safer, they have several side effects on the human body and patients’ economic situation. The essential items that doctors use in esthetic operations generally contain toxic chemicals and negatively impact people’s health. For instance, plastic which is used by doctors may pose a threat to human skin and lead to some diseases such as injuries in the skin and even cancer. Moreover, these operations may cost a great amount of money because sometimes subsequent surgeries can be demanded in order to correct previous operations. Therefore, it can have adverse effects on people’s financial condition.

In conclusion, people’s opinions about standards of beauty and cutting-edge technologies used in medicine are the main causes underlying this problem. Consequently, these plastic surgeries can jeopardize human health and the way they expend their money.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace.

Why is this happening?

Do you think his will have a positive or a negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'Artificial intelligence as well as robots are gradually being renovated in order to replace human labor. The main reasons for this phenomenon should be recognized as the merits of energy saving and high efficiency. Additionally, the author believes that this, however, can have an adverse effect on the country due to high costs and rising unemployment.

It should be self-aware that the biggest benefit of utilizing automatic devices in the workplace is the high efficiency that they offer. Since, unlike humans, these machines can work tirelessly with high accuracy as well as quality. Nevertheless, once these things dominate the company entirely, there would be no place for a regular employee. As a result, the unemployment rate would increase significantly and this would pose a dangerous risk to the stability of the society as a whole.

Another point that is worth mentioning is the increasing use of robots stems from the advantage of energy saving. Many people conclude that with the ability to operate, whilst having only a tiny amount of fuel, these robotic machines can help improve not only the business but also the whole city. Nonetheless, the exorbitant cost should not be ignored. It is evident that installing a small printer or projector could cos significantly, not to mention the fortune that will be spent on maintaining and repairing. This, as a consequence, could greatly reduce the income of the whole workplace which then would definitely lead to the breakdown of the society.

In conclusion, there are many disadvantages to using machinery applications in the workplace including the rise of unemployment ratio. Additionally, the high price which lead to the collapse of society should be mentioned as the worst impact and, therefore, robotic devices and artificial intelligence ought not to be used as alternatives to traditional labour.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence re being developed to replace humans in the workplace. Why is this happening? Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'Owing to the development of science, humans now have no work to do when robots and AI dominate. The writer acknowledges this problem is attributed to numerous factors, leading to a negative effect on  society.

There are several reasons causing this issue relating to manufacturing error decrease. By inventing robots, people can apply them for mass products that require  long-term manufacturing, limiting the mistakes or accidents that can occur if using labour. As a result, employers can not only decline the money paying for workers but also the amount for broken products, aiding them in finance sectors. This trend continuously happens all around the world, especially in huge companies relating to cars, motorbikes and other vehicles, where we can solely witness a sign of humans  controlling and adjusting the robots.

Despite providing financial benefits to  employers, the adverse impact of this on the whole society is undeniable. With the appearance of artificial intelligence, there are no more tasks for humans, resulting in  considerable unemployment rates. These people will struggle with financial burdens and end up being in harsh conditions or homeless. Additionally, when receiving  support from robots, individuals can easily overdepend on them, limiting their creativity and the skills they should have gained from work experience. Although robots are generated to assist people’s lives, the situation where unemployment rates and lack of core skills are increasingly high cannot be observed as the pictures of our targeted society.

In brief, the demand of employers for human error avoidance in the manufacturing process is the main cause for the replacement of robots in the workforce. In spite of the advantages for the owners, the negative implications are far more undesirable.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artficial intelligence are being developed to replace humans in the workplace. 

Why is this happening?

Do yo think this will have a positive or negative on society' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, artificial intelligence and robots are being improved to replace workers in the company. This writer believes that because of being tireless is the reason why and this could have a negative effect on human social life.

Robots and artificial intelligence are becoming more and more useful than ever as they provide not just quality but also quantity with high efficiency and do not get tired. Those human-made machines can work for days without complaining about the amount of work they have and could do it more effectively. Those machines are just a combination of several tools and materials with the setting on the computer to make them work perfectly. The main problem of using robots and artificial intelligence is that they might not understand what  humans want so if there is a problem with the robots it will cause the process delayed or even cancelled.

Despite the benefits they might bring to humans in the company, robots can be the primary reason for unemployment. Scientists have created robots to benefit human life. It is true but  take a look at those who are undergraduate university and want to earn money, they have to do the work at the factory. Those automatic machines have been replacing the blue-collar workers in their workplace since they were introduced. This could make the rich wealthier and the poor poorer because they are unemployed. Take the example of Amazon, they now use robots to operate the moving process of goods in the company with a few workers to manage.

In conclusion, being tireless is the prior factor to makes robots and artificial intelligence take the place of workers. This could lead to the social problem of unemployment.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'With the increasing demand for energy sources of oil and gas, people should look for sources of oil and gas in remote and untouched natural places. Do the advantages outweigh disadvantages of damaging such areas?' 
 'Text': 'There is a school of thought that advocates for the exploration of oil and gas in remote and untouched natural habitats due to the ever-increasing demand for energy sources of oil and gas. Despite these products serving numerous aspects of human life, they also cause environmental damage, I believe that the advantages do not outweigh the drawbacks.

On the one hand, exploring more gas and oil resources has found several benefits such as an industrial revolution and tackling various financial and employment issues. Firstly, the gas and oil industry necessitates a large amount of labour to explore the resources. Thus, it will provide a variety of opportunities to work for unemployed individuals. Secondly, new abundant resources bring economic value for the nations which own these resources to export broadly. In addition, residents of the nation's resources are served these resources at affordable cost. 

On the other hand, new gasoline and oil resource exploitation also encounter various downsides. Firstly, humans' exploitation of natural resources obviously damages the environment such as deforestation which results in the destruction of habitats and the loss of biodiversity. Moreover, deforestation contributes to the loss of habitats, threatening many plant and animal species. In addition, according to recent reports, discovering and exploiting resources exacerbate climate change problems, especially the greenhouse effect. Lastly, gas and oil resources are limited resources so overwhelming exploitation can threaten or even harm the ecology of the earth.

With all of the aforementioned theses and explanations, the conclusion is self-evident. I believe that broadening the exploration of additional gas and oil resources has some strengths, however the drawbacks are far more detrimental.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries, paying for things using mobile phones is becoming increasingly common. Does this development have more advantages or disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Payment using mobile phones started from the era of smartphone use. When people are using smartphones, many developers see this as an opportunity to create more convenient ways for smartphone usage, especially in payment. Payment using mobile phones is normally used nowadays. Even though this technology has many advantages, there are also some disadvantages to using this. In this essay, I will explain some of my views on this technology which I believe there are more advantages than disadvantages.

We cannot deny that payment using mobile phones is very convenient, we can pay for something in seconds at any time and anywhere as long we have a connection to the internet. This payment method also makes transactions faster, simpler, and effective. Some of the developers also add extra security features such as one-time passwords, biometrics, or tokens that make users feel safer when doing transactions. With all of these advantages, we can see that businesses nowadays are rapidly increasing in speed, and volume, and also they are also expanding quickly.

On the other hand, cyber crime also increasing lately. Even though payment through mobile phones has many security features, there is also a loophole that many irresponsible people use to take advantage of this technology. One of the common crime that almost happens to everyone is their data leaked. The hacker collects this data and sells it to another company for a database or worse makes a fake account for their own business. The next disadvantage is also we might spend more than we need because of the convenience of payment and the small amounts of things we purchase.

In conclusion, while payment using mobile phones is an effective way for transactions, I think it is also better if the security of payment can be more developed so as users we can use payment safely and make business grow faster and bigger.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Tobacco is a kind of drug. People have been free to use it. Some people think that it should be illegal to use it comparing with other drugs. To what extent do you agree or disagree? What is your opinion?' 
 'Text': 'Individuals have been given the liberty to practice  tobacco drugs but certain demographics of society think that it should be unlawful to use them. I largely agree with the said notion due to increasing  health issues and  loss of youth.

To commence with views of disagreement that drug is used as an herbal  medication for different diseases in small villages as they do not have access to all the company's basic medical stuff so they benefit tobacco for healing. In addition to this, it will affect the agriculture field as well because some of the farmers grow it and export it to different countries that use it to make medication.Banning it will create a huge impact in some fields.

Shifting towards views of agreement, due to high usage of this drug it leads to severe chronic illness like cancer, lung problems and many more.To explain,as it is available without money and people do not know its drawbacks they start getting addicted especially  people who are under the poverty line and low income.For example, according to 'An Indian' 2019 survey there is 75% of  transport drivers have kidney issues and asthma problems and it is also mentioned that they smoke 3 or 4 times a day.Hence,the government should declare the usage of tobacco as lawbreaking.

Further strengthening views due to addiction among youth.In today's competitive era, young minds are always under stress for jobs ,for competitive exams and studies so they start taking drugs in the form of cigarettes, chewing gums and many more.Moreover, they start becoming addicted to it.Even though these days cigars  come smokeless  it is hard for families to find that their children are using drugs.Due to these things young death rates have increased.For instance,according to WHO(World Health Organisation) charts ,it is found that 8 out of 10  kids are addicted to vapes.Thus,declaring it illegal will create a positive impact on pupils.

To conclude,although it has some positive uses yet prohibiting it will save many young lives and I also strongly believe that forbidding it will be beneficial for youth and many people aliveness.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that art lessons such as paintings and drawing lessons should be compulsory in secondary schools. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Integrating art subjects must be mandatory in the school curriculum which is considered by some flux of people and I largely agree with this statement because these lessons lessen stress as well as can unearth hidden talents which bring them towards career development.

To commence with, people who are opposite of above-given view consider that these subjects might consume student's precious time which should be applied on other important subjects such as mathematics and science. To explain it, if children are given time for painting and drawing subjects which get their attention more than another syllabus then they will not be able to concentrate on science subjects due to a lack of interest in these challenging curriculum, thus, they would not opt other career paths except art subjects.

Shifting towards the view of agreement, implementing art lessons not only decreases student's stress but also sharpen their thinking skills. To elaborate , today's younger receive a lot of work from their mathematics and other curriculum instructors which leads them towards depression, therefore, if these subjects are applied in pupil's school curriculum then they will divert their attention towards fun activities and it will assist them to reduce some burden from their mind. For instance, a survey  conducted by Harward University in 2016 found that some schools added art subjects and students are more excited than before as they enjoy painting and drawing along with challenging subjects.

Furthermore, these essential subjects are also  a fact of a successful life as some students show their hidden talents by painting and earn a lot of money by choosing this career. For example, a headline  shown in an international newspaper that in India 55% of people who are disabled draw paintings and earn money for their families, consequently, these subjects become a source of poor and disabled people's income.

In conclusion, applying some interesting syllabus in the school curriculum not only mitigates children's stress but also assists in earning money by showing their hidden talents with the help of painting and drawing.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries around the world young people decide to leave their parents home once they finish school they start living on their own or sharing a house with friends. Is this positive or negative development?' 
 'Text': 'The living lifestyle of today's generation has altered due to the rise of competition in further education after finishing school as they initiate spending their life own or staying with their age groups leaving their parents behind. I believe separation promotes independence, self-reliance as well as personal development and I discuss this in the upcoming paragraphs .

To begin with, living away from family trains people how to live their own life. In other words, the young generation must learn how to manage everything such as financial expenses, bills, fees , grocery budgets and so on which would be beneficial for their successful future. For example, an International survey  has shown that 80% of students migrate for their higher study in different countries and they are brilliant in management rather than others who are living with their parents with no responsibility,consequently, they are at higher risk of failure in their career than those who are experienced in management in their early twenties.

Secondly, parents who agree with their children to shift themselves somewhere else are those who want their children's personal growth as if they independently connected with other people without their parent's support to become more successful in their work career. For instance, interacting with more and more outside people who are successful in their lives assists children to follow their path and socially become sharp-minded and connect with the modern world, as a result, they live up-to-date by joining brilliant people.

In conclusion, living outside of home not only sharpens youngster's mind but also provides them more confidence to interact with prestigious people who guide them on how to be successful as well as aware them of upcoming technology'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many elderly people are no longer looked after by their families but are put in care homes or nursing homes. what are the advantages and disadvtanges of this trend?' 
 'Text': 'Currently, care homes and nursing homes are one of the most common choices for taking care of old-age people, instead of staying with their families. This essay will examine more about what are, benefits and the

drawbacks of this tendency.

The advantage of using care homes alternatively is helping elders to make new friends. In comparison with staying at home, people who live in nursing homes have more activities during the day which are playing chess or basically sitting down and having a cup of tea about their young life together. In addition, the commitment to great health care service is considered by elders' families. Especially, the old-age people can reach not only the careful treatment from friendly staff but also the benefits from public health policy.

Despite this, there are significant disadvantages that can bring sadness to elderly people. Firstly, it means that elders do not have any meaningful moments with their modern families even memorial happiness. All members of the family are supposed to spend quality time taking care of their home, while they just focus on their busy schedules. Even if the old age people already have great assistance services, families are always the most important and indispensable place for old age people.

In conclusion, nursing homes or care homes might be suitable services for elderly people, but staying at home will usually offer a better choice for saving their affordable memorials and showing their families' responsibility as well. Personally, I believe that we need to know exactly what the elders really need before deciding which are the best way to make

 them happy'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Modern medical science has made it possible to combat many diseases. This is one reason that people are living longer lives now than they did in the past. Discuss the effects this might have on society.' 
 'Text': 'In today's fast-paced world, an increase in the length of life expectancy has become a real concern among  society. This essay  will explore the reasons behind it such as improved healthcare systems and some of the effects that can have an impact on countries such as overpopulation. 

To begin with, one of the primary reasons is the sophisticated healthcare systems. Today, many diseases can be treated via cutting-edge technological tools compared to past times. In past days, there were limited numbers of healthcare facilities but today nearly in all cities, hospitals are built and people can access them easily. Another underlying cause of this phenomenon is the high quality of life that many developed countries have. They provide their citizens with wide-ranging opportunities that contribute to a better lifestyle. 

Turning to the effects of longer life expectancies, a major problem is  overpopulation. As people live longer and new generations come, countries suffer from overpopulation. This issue contributes to the depletion of natural resources which is a growing concern for future generations. Another impact that overpopulation gives rise to is the lack of space. As the number of people rises, there will be a need to live in. Based on this reasoning, many green spaces are knocked down and converted into residential areas. 

All in all, the extended life expectancy of the people has become a topic of debate. This issue has its own causes such as developments in medical science and high standards of living that the countries offer. Besides its causes, it has many devastating impacts on  society such as overpopulation and shortage of natural resources.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The Internet has provided great benefits, but at the same time, it has also created new problems and inequalities. it possible to control some of these problems?' 
 'Text': 'In the contemporary era, the landscape of the Internet has witnessed transformative innovation, revolutionizing communication, access to information, and business models. However, it has also engendered new challenges and inequalities. Nonetheless, there are still some solutions available to address them.
