They either create an interaction between teacher and their student or between students and students, for instance, they can get lunch together to socialise and open up to each other, therefore getting in-person interaction. As a result, it promotes the development of social skills through communication.

To sum up, studying with a group of students in a classroom brings more positive benefits to learners than online classes.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'As countries develop, their populations tend to live individually or in small family units. What are the causes of this trend and what are the effects on society?' 
 'Text': 'As our world is continuously evolving, in some countries, the populations tend to choose to live alone or in small nuclear family units. In my opinion, this trend can be attributed to the financial instability among the young, and as this issue continues to develop, it could have some negative effects on society, namely that people will become more distant. 

On one hand, individuals choosing not to live as a large family or choose a solitary life could be the result of financial instability. Simply put, while our living standards are increasing over time, the price for basic needs in life such as electricity and gas bills also skyrocket, to the point one cannot save much money to afford a large apartment. Thus, they have to pick an affordable flat, which normally would not provide enough space for a large family. Taking Hanoi as an example, with the standard salary, rent would accumulate for almost half of it, hence renting or purchasing a large house for an extended family would rarely be considered.

On the other hand, this trend could result in some detrimental impacts on society, such as it could make people become more distant from each other. This is due to the fact that, in order to become financially stable, citizens have to work diligently, which in turn will shorten their free time. As a result, parents have less time to spend with their children and can only do limited work to take care of the elderly. For instance, in many families, the previous generation works day and night to ensure that their kids have a carefree childhood, while kids require attention and affection from their parents. This could create misunderstanding, and in time, a massive rift between the two generations. 

In conclusion, financial instability accounts for many individuals choosing a lone life or small family units, and this could leave a mark on society, as citizens could be prone to be callous and indifferent.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'some people say that in all levels of educations, from primary schools to universities, too much time is spent on learning facts and not enough on learning practical skills. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays most students in all educational institutions are reported to have a lot of theory and not enough practice while studying. I agree with that research because people face a lack of practical skills. Undergraduates should have more practical tasks because it can help to understand some themes of subjects more effectively and apply some approaches to work correctly and beneficially. 

In terms of study processes, students are more likely to understand some theory questions by doing practical tasks. Spending a lot of time on learning facts not always can lead to high results in most subjects. If teachers provided adolescents with practical experience, they would be able to realize how some facts work in reality. As people’s experience shows, it is much easier to understand what they should do, explaining tasks in practice. Indeed, this way they can figure out a lot of things that might come to light while studying the material on subjects.

Furthermore, practical approaches can lead to more correct application knowledge in real life. If students are immediately explained some theory facts in practice, they demonstrate an effective understanding of doing tasks in the future, for example, at work. Many researchers say that students who study by practical methods perform better in their positions. In point of fact, it is much easier to memorise some practical knowledge rather than theory.

In conclusion, people in all educational institutions face the problem of a lack of practical skills. However, practical approaches can lead to deeper understanding of materials and correctly applying students’ knowledge in real life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many teenagers believe becoming social media influencers is a good career choice.

However, others argue that there are some major drawbacks related to an influencer career.  

Which opinion do you agree?' 
 'Text': 'Social media has exploded since 2003. In the modern era, social media sites are platforms for communicating with friends or checking the news in the morning and generating new occupations such as content creators and influencers, one of the most popular vocations. Becoming a social media influencer is considered a good career choice by many teenagers, whereas other people believe it has detrimental effects related to this career path. This article will explore the impact of social media influencers by providing perspectives on the positive aspects. 

A significant amount of evidence supports the notion of social media being a benefit for job opportunities. In Generation Z— people aged 11 – 26— it is undeniable that everyone has an account on many popular platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube. These various channels can give a prospect for gaining income. For example, if you were a famous content creator on TikTok, doing a vlog one day with me at school or a cover dance, you would get contacted by a company asking to promote their product. These can be one way to build money in an account.

Consequently, teenagers can earn money to improve other aspects of their lives, such as studying overseas or having a good quality of life. Moreover, being a content creator improves many skills— creativity, public speaking, communication— and self-discovery through various content— cooking, beauty blogging, and fashion. Social media sites give a lot of opportunities for them to thrive. 

In conclusion, the internet and social media platforms have opened multiple doors in excellent occupation prospects, helping teenagers acquire revenue by being content creators and improving some skills. As a result, these platforms provide youngsters with opportunities for better well-being.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The old generation often hold traditional ideas about the correct way of life, thinking and behavior. However, some people think that these ideas are not helpful for young people to prepare for modern life. To what extent do agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'The elderly population considers traditional beliefs as the right way of living life in all aspects. However, others said that these thoughts are not adequate for this new generation to adapt themselves to the newly developed world. I generally believe that a mix of new experiences and advice from our grandparents could make us more successful.

On one hand, the older population has experienced massive methods, and they have a thoughtful mind so it is convenient to utilize their experience and decide in the way that they have recommended. For example, during negotiations, it is very challenging to cover all possible happens, and for a person who has little knowledge is demanding competition so in this situation it is very positive to use an experienced negotiator and tackle all difficulties without making a mistake. For instance, most of the big companies use their narrator aged between 50 to 60 because they are calm and aware of needs and responsibilities.

On the other hand, this developing world that reforming day by day has created a number of obstacles that have never been excited before. Such as the computer. As a result, fields that are new is essential to solve them with an open-mind view because no one has experienced them before. For illustration, the problems that occur in websites or media areas are new and need new knowledge and skills so having an innovative view can help more.

In conclusion, utilizing our grandparenthood knowledge in a complete way is an outdated method also just relying on the new generation is a risky movement. I think the blend of these two methods will be a massive success because in this world we are struggling with known and unknown challenges daily, so a balanced mix of these two views leads us to happier life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and artificial intelligence are being to replace in the workplace.

Why is thi happening ?

Do you think this will have a positive or negative impact on society ?' 
 'Text': 'In today digital’s era, technological devices are improved strongly and they are possible to replace employees in many fields of the workplace. This writer’s essay will present that these tools are worked by artificial intelligence and play an important role in society.

Firstly, robots and artificial intelligence are the reasons why they can replace people working because they can work automatically and independently when they start to run. Because of this, robots and other technological devices work more effectively, correctly and faster than humans. In addition, these intelligences have the ability to fix problems when they are working. As a result, in many production companies,employees are replaced by technologies to improve the company’s efficiency. This new change helps them improve and raise more profits. Therefore, this equipment is replaced by humans because of its skills and accuracy. 

Secondly, it is helpful and intelligent and helps to work hard on tasks which are dangerous, professionally skilled or need high accuracy. This is because they have enormous experience in some fields so they make some businesses complete more missions and ensure accuracy and efficiency. As a result, when businesses replace their workers with robots, the profits and the growth chances are highly developed in some months. This makes businesses have more turnovers and money for workers and managers. Therefore, artificial intelligence and robots play an important on the companies’s development turnover in the workplace field because of their smart independence and accuracy.

In conclusion, the workers are replaced because technological devices and robots have more experience than them. Additionally, these devices have positive effects on the company’s development.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that music is a good way of bringing people of different cultures and ages together.

To what extend do you agree or disagree with this opinion' 
 'Text': 'One of the great ways to put people from different backgrounds and ages is music. Moreover, it gives us a sense of relief. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, music is such a good motivator for your own business and it connects all of us with the invisible ties.

Music has a therapeutic effect on people so there is already an obscene amount of types of music and people have a huge obsession and passion for them. In addition, it helps to deal with  excessive stress and just charm. It connects all the people around the world by gathering around it. For example, American pop has been cultivated and become very huge among adolescents and day by day it's getting wider.

 The reason why it became so big is that the lyrics and sounds of the music usually attract the listener and give energy.

It's certainly true that music unites humanity. Consequently, in order to integrate humans there are a lot of events and competitions like Eurovision.

Eurovision is a nice occasion where over than 30 countries share their music and talent. It will provide a chance to glorify your culture.

 For instance,  Swish music became popular after ending Eurovision successfully last year, and each year it could vary.

In conclusion, music helps humanity to come together. Despite the variance of music genres, it is still one of the strongest keys in the modern music industry to unite the human species. Therefore, to put them together there is a number of awards and competitions.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'To some people studying the past has little value in the modern world. Why do you think it's important to do so? What will be the effect if children are not taught history?' 
 'Text': 'Some individuals believe that learning about history is not essential in this globalization. This essay will delve into the reason why we need to be aware of the past, and its potential further effect when youths do not consider about importance of history. 

Teaching about the past is important because children need to understand  their ancestors' history and  values. This gives them inspiration that would help them to reach their further achievement successfully when they face challenges. For example, In Mongolia, our older generations suffered from harsh times in the past, such as poverty and wars, even though those heroes inherited this peaceful country that has vast land. Without our ancestors, the country that we live in does not exist. Therefore, children at least need to learn about their ancestor's history and protect their values, as it would be motivation for the youngsters, and it would be a chance gain experience from their past history. 

On the other hand, if children do not know about their history, they cannot be competitive in this modern world. This is because almost every field of social debate is focused on  historical knowledge, which is more important in this fast-developing era. For instance, in Mongolia, many employers ask for historical information when they hire  new staff. It is generally believed that having knowledge about the past means that fundamental education was fulfilled well. 

To conclude, researching  history can lead to understanding  our elders' challenges that faced in the past and it helps to reach achievements when youths meet obstacles. Moreover, having historical knowledge is a basic indicator of a well-knowledged citizen as many companies require this kind of qualified staff.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries, people are now living longer than ever before. Some people say an ageing population creates problems for governments. Other people think there are benefits if society has more elderly people.' 
 'Text': 'One of the most prevalent trends in the contemporary world is the cumulative decreasing death rate due to the modern medical systems available in different countries. While some people argue that seniors are a burden on the Government's infrastructure, others believe that elderly people teach us their experiences. This stance will be proven by carefully analysing why the older population are good for society.

On the one hand, health and economic issues. The main reason is that these people get sick quickly sometimes due to slight changes in weather and it becomes very difficult to carry them to the hospitals. Another factor is that it is an unnecessary burden on the State to organise beds and food. Furthermore, if elders live long they will get a pension, which is an economic loss for the nation. For example, in Australia some seniors are living alone in their houses and Telstra installed panic buttons, even for small health issues they press the button and engage ambulance staff members. As a result, it is evident why Australia’s health system is busy.

On the other hand, guidance and looking after the children. The primary factor is that pensioners  always share their experiences with their children, so they can make the right decisions in the future. In addition, these humans look after their grandchildren and play with them. Furthermore, some families are unable to afford childcare expenses for their juniors so, these people look after them. For instance, in India people live in joint families  working people go to work and seniors look after houses and toddlers. As a consequence, it is apparent why this age group is better for society.

In conclusion, following the analysis of both views, it is clear that we have to respect older people because when they were young never thought burden of their parents. Further, it is predicted that this development for looking after their parents is going to continue in the future as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some countries achieve international success by building specialized facilities to train top athletes instead of providing sports facilities that everyone can use. Do you think it is a positive or negative development ?' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary times, several nations prefer to build various specialised sports infrastructures to train their elite athletes rather than provide public ones to their citizens, which helps them to gain global achievements. This essay attempts to shed light on the merits and demerits of this trend before concluding that I am in favour of the latter notion.

On the one hand, it is understandable why country authorities subscribe to establishing special training centres for their professional athletes. First and foremost, it could enhance countries' images. For example, with carefully prepared practice, skilled sportsmen could take part in international competitions as well as achieve high positions, which could allow the participants to introduce their countries and cultures to the public. Furthermore, investments in modern sports facilities could help the country's economy. This is because they are basic and compulsory requirements to organise famous international sports events such as the Olympics and World Cup, which could attract millions of visitors to travel to that country, thus, earning huge profits from accommodation, transportation, and event tickets.

On the other hand, there are a host of compelling reasons why I am convinced that the government's focus on developing special sports buildings might bring some profound drawbacks to each household and the entire society. One rationale is that it could decrease the quality of inhabitants' lives. For instance, an increase in the budget for expensive projects means a lower allocation for public sports sites, which might lead individuals to lose their workout habits and face serious health problems. Another justification is that the enormous costs incurred to build gigantic facilities could put a strain on government coffers, thereby leading to budget deficits, tax hikes, or reduced social welfare. As a result, ordinary citizens, especially the underprivileged, might struggle even more to make ends meet.

In conclusion, while it is irrefutable that the establishment of professional sports infrastructure might have advantages to certain extents, I would contend that the downsides of this phenomenon are more significant.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that the amount of money spent on library is a waste as new technologies are developing and replacing library functions. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'One of the most prevalent trends in the contemporary world is the cumulative increase in digital libraries all over the globe. While many people argue that the latest technology is easier to accessible anywhere, others believe that it is a waste of cash to spend on physical libraries. It is completely agreed that online libraries are more convenient. This stance will be proven by carefully analyzing why web libraries are better.

Firstly, easy to carry and access. The main reason is that online books are easy to access over the Internet with a small payment, some books are even freely available on the Internet and hardcover books are expensive due to high manufacturing costs. Another factor is that these are easy to carry such as hundreds of books are accessible over the webpage. For example, you can choose different types of books online, which is not possible to carry in the luggage. As a result, people can read at any time.

Secondly, latest and delivery, the primary reason is online books are always up to date; publishers upload books with a single click and same time available to the readers. In addition, hardcover books are not easily available due to transportation from the cities. For instance, physical books take time to reach from Australia to India due to courier issues. As a consequence, it is apparent why book lovers like to read on their gadgets.

In conclusion, following the analysis of hardcover, you cannot ignore it because it contains our cultural values, however, online readings are always good because they are cheap and easily accessible to access such as 24 hours and 7 days. Further, it is predicted that this development of online and offline reading is going to continue in the future as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many graduates want to start their first job in a big corporation. Many others prefer to work for a small company first. What are the different advantages in each decision?' 
 'Text': 'Passionately, school leavers now have the tendency to start their early careers with large companies which are devised by themselves. Unlikely, some others want to begin with small companies. In this essay, I will further discuss how these two biases can be beneficial to youngsters. 

On one hand, starting their first job in a big corporation can positively affect teenagers in various measures. Firstly, they have a chance to encounter working multitasks and a wide scope of experiences. As a result, these factors can boost the ability of being a multitasker in youngsters. Secondly, youngsters can gain enormous experiences. As they proactively take action in creating their company, directly exposed to a broad range of experiences. Mark Zuckerberg, for instance,  once said that before he founded  Facebook, he had made plenty of software that gave Mark experience as well as fostered him to be versed in creating software.

On the other hand, working for a small company also has several advantages. To begin with, youngsters can enhance their agility and flexibility in their work. As small companies mostly have less bureaucracy, they are able to agilely finish their work in certain working conditions. In Addition, it helps people to improve their ability to work in a community or group of people. To cite an example, since youngsters  take orders from the leaders, they have to cooperate on tasks as well as properly implement the work together in order to get the best result. 

To sum up, starting their first job in a big corporation or working in a small company  can be beneficial for teenagers in diverse ways.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays the crime rate among young people is increasing. Why do you think this is happening? What can be done by parents and teachers to reduce it?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, the number of crimes that youngsters are involved in has been increasing, because of violent TV shows and movies which adversely affect the youth’s attitudes and behaviours, and also parents’ attention to their children has flown these days due to their busy work schedules. There are a number of solutions to tackle this problem, including controlling what your kids watch and lessening family time.

Movies and shows that frequently show allegations and fights have become increasingly popular among young people as such adolescents threaten others shown in the movies and bully someone who looks weak. These actions then could lead to a rise of criminal levels within the community. In addition to that, parents no longer pay attention to their youths as they have to make money to cover the costs. In consequence, young folk are surrounded by wrong crowds who persuade them to do illegal actions. 

 

In order the reduce the violations by adolescents, teachers and parents should work together and set sophisticated educational programs and proper communication methods between them to exchange information instantly. Moreover, with applications and other platforms, parents can remotely manage and control the video streams and time that their children are watching which helps their children away from unwelcome influence from third parties. For example, if children behave improperly, helping to let them know their bad attitudes and involving them in community service to assist people are more effective approaches because they acknowledge their positive contribution to people.

 

In conclusion, the number of youngsters who have done illegitimate actions has increased over the several period. This is due to the fact that negative influences of social media and streams and less family time. Limiting their screen time and appropriate encouragement by the teachers and parents can solve this issue.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Money spent on space exploration is a complete waste. Governments could better spend this money on other things to benefit the nation.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Some people believe that investments in space projects are a waste of money. For these people, the money of taxpayers should be spent in other areas to bring more benefits to citizens. I agree with this point of view and this essay will explain the reasons.

It is known that the budget of the government is finite and it is not possible to invest in all fields at the same amount and at the same time. As a consequence, public authorities have to make choices and define priorities. So, in my opinion, investments in subjects such as poverty and health, for example, are more important, from the perspective of the population, than sending a new rocket to the Moon or to Mars. Furthermore, there are several urgent problems like climate change and global warming to be addressed as soon as possible. As the sources of money are limited, the government should make decisions to help more people.

On the other hand, there is no doubt that researches in space exploration bring some improvements in technology and innovations. There are many examples of new products developed due to the massive investments in the exploration of the universe. For instance, we can cite spirographic pens, microwave ovens, and satellite communication. Another good example is the huge evolution of computers in the last decade.

All in all, to conclude, I think that despite the investments in space exploration bringing some advantages, there are other areas much more urgent to invest the money of people. As mentioned before, elimination of poverty and environmental issues should be the priority.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the current society, many people are struggling with obesity.

What are the main causes of this?

What are the effects?' 
 'Text': 'Being overweight is a common issue in today's world. There are several reasons why obesity has happened significantly, especially in recent times. In the upcoming paragraphs, I will discuss in detail the cause and effect of obesity itself.

To begin with, obesity occurs in every part of the world due to the lack of information about some preventive ways to avoid this issue. The main causes of obesity are eating a lot of unhealthy foods including fast and junk foods, drinking sweet drinks, and not exercising regularly. Moreover, another discovery is that many children and teenagers gain excessive weight these days. This case is happening because of the lack of parental attention in terms of what kind of foods and drinks their children consume every day. Additionally, parents are not giving a friendly reminder to their children about the danger of consuming a lot of harmful dishes, as well as sugary drinks.

In consequence, being overweight will make the possibility of a few health diseases bigger than before. For instance, diabetes, heart attack, and even death will happen because of obesity that a person suffers. Besides health problems, there are also mental issues that are caused by gaining too much weight, such as depression, anxiety, overthinking, etc. Both types of problems, I believe, are very important to know for people who are suffering from obesity to pay more attention to them. 

To conclude, being overweight is a common thing that everyone has to be aware of since its effects are very serious and dangerous at the same time.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that it is more beneficial to take part in sports which are played in teams, like football, while other people think that taking part in individual sport, like tennis or swimming, is better. Discuss views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'These days, there are many different types of sports being played. Many of them are played individually and some of them are played in teams. I firmly believe that sports which are played in teams are more beneficial than individual sports. This essay will provide examples and a conclusion to support my opinion.

Firstly, playing in a team excites us in several ways. Team members are always cheerful and supportive throughout the game and we all have experienced that if an individual player from the team scores a goal or hits a home run, the rest of the team members start celebrating that moment. For example, I saw a cricket match recently where one team was not performing well and suddenly, all their team members started cheering each other. In the end, they won that match in an unexpected way! Furthermore, if we talk about spectators, most of them like to watch team sports like baseball or rugby rather than individual sports like tennis or badminton.

However, individual sports on the other side are boring. If a game is tough, it is very difficult for an individual to remain calm and be self-motivated which makes it more difficult for them to concentrate. There is not enough guidance for that individual during the game if they are facing a complex time which makes the game look boring. For example, I was watching a tennis match and I noticed that the person playing the game was frustrated and wasn't able to compete. On the other side, I saw a football match where all the team members celebrated every single goal scored by their fellow team members.

In conclusion, I believe that playing in a team has many benefits like motivation, celebration, constant guidance and fair competition among the team. While on the other side, individual sports are more serious, boring and time-consuming which bores viewers as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say the main way to be happy in life is to have a lot of money.

How might having a lot of money make people happy?

What other things in life can make people happy?' 
 'Text': 'Many people believe that having monetary resources is the key to happiness. This essay discusses some possible reasons why some individuals feel this way and what other aspects of life contribute to one's contentment.

There are two main reasons why people think having monetary power can lead to a happier life. Firstly, wealthy individuals have financial freedom. This is due to them being able to comfortably pay for their basic needs and luxury items without having to worry about their finances all the time. In particular, people who receive higher amounts of money tend to travel more regularly, as well as, purchase the latest goods in the market. Additionally, being wealthy often means having a better life quality. To be more precise, people who have monetary resources in abundance usually have high-quality nutrition, live in safer neighbourhoods, and can afford better health treatments, if necessary.

On the other hand, other aspects are crucial to one's happiness. The first of these is regarding people's relationships. This is because humans are social animals, and therefore, one of society's basic needs is to have constant social interactions. For instance, recent studies have shown that wealthy people are more susceptible to depression due to poor relationships and loneliness, making them in need of constant psychological treatment. Moreover, participating in charity activities is something that increases people's overall life contentment. This is because helping others in poor conditions can bring a sense of usefulness to individuals.

In conclusion, the reasons why owning a lot of money increases people's happiness are due to financial freedom and having better life quality. However, other aspects also contribute to individuals' contentment such as personal bonds and being active in society's charity programs.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many species of animals all around the world are on the verge of extinction. Some say that countries and individuals should protect these animals from dying out, while others say that we should concentrate more on the problems of human beings.

Discuss both viewpoints and give your opinion.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'In today's fast-paced world, endangering most kinds of animals has become a vital concern. Some people believe that protecting animals with the help of countries and individuals would be the best option, whereas others argue that dealing with the main issues of people is more essential rather than animals. Personally, I completely believe that we should preserve and take care of nature, otherwise, the world might be a worse place to inhabit.

   On the one hand, a growing number of people think that they should have several major responsibilities in order to protect the species from danger because they play a significant role in the lives of people. Moreover, some types of animals help people to create and develop the study of medicines. For instance, some burgeoning countries are trying to find a way to alleviate the number of diseases and deaths. Therefore, they need to look after endangered animals and generate specific places such as Zoos to live there. The government is not only supplying animals with a place but also with such environment in which they used to reside here. As an example, polar bears are animals which dwell in cold areas like Antarctica but today, there are some challenges because of changing climate conditions and melting ice caps and glaciers. All human beings should become in one community in order to find better opportunities for such animals.

   On the other hand, approximately 45% of people feel that the problems of human beings should be taken into account by countries and organizations. Nowadays, there are a multitude of people who suffer from deathful illnesses and do not have any cash in order to meet their needs. For this circumstance, improved countries should provide poor countries with an array of treatment and medicines. In addition, the government and wealthy individuals should invest money in study and food. In such a situation, the government should increase awareness of providing financial aid. As you know, there are several large charity organizations which are introduced the society to help those who are really in need. 

In conclusion, opinions may differ as some people focus on the issues of the extinction of animals by providing them with appropriate places and not hunting them, while others feel that it is the better option that concentrate on the concerns of the public by creating charitable organizations.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Wealthy countries should accept more refugees and provide them with basic assistance such as food and housing. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that well-developed countries should provide  a shelter for a larger number of refugees and help them by providing the basics like provisions and accommodations. This essay totally agrees with this statement because nations with strong economies have highly efficient agriculture and expertise in building short-term residences and others.

Rich countries have plenty of institutions specializing in harvesting and machinery that are focused on problems of food production scaling. A huge amount of money is being spent on improving the process of farming and the quality of goods. A technical park involved in this stream is always in a state of evolution as well. Thus, it becomes possible to increase the production of food in each stage smoothly to fulfil demands. For example, Germany accepted more than two million people in the last decade, and food shortages were not noticed by locals.

Alongside harvesting, the experience in construction work is immense as well. To support the dwelling needs of gradual population growth, the government has to be agile in providing accessible housing. The process of building such living areas is constant, and it leads to the invention of new approaches and enhancements by providing affordable facilities quickly. For instance, Poland, the United Kingdom, and others are able to assemble huge territories with corresponding structures in a short period of time to respond as fast as possible to the rapid displaced people flow.

In conclusion, I do believe that mature economies are already capable of helping people deprived of their motherland, whether it is food supply or residence-related issues.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Computers are used more and more in education. Is it an advantage or disadvantage. Discuss both views and give your opinion' 
 'Text': 'In today's technological era, computers are being used for  education.This essay will discuss the advantages along with the disadvantages of this notion in the forthcoming paragraphs.As far as I am concerned I am in favour of the latter point.

To commence with, in today's fast-paced era, data processors play a vital role in the literacy system for saving time.To explicate it,everything is available online like books, reading materials and many more. It not only provides the  materials but saves hours and labour as well.For example,in the traditional method, during  exams , first teachers have to sort out sheets then they have to check sheets individually which consumes so much time for results.On the other hand, with digital machines, instructors just need to scan the sheets and can check and get the results instantly.Hence, electronic devices save a lot of time and energy.

Shifting towards the final view, it cannot teach discipline and can exploit pupils as well.To elaborate on it,machines can teach calculations but not discipline.Only tutors can be taught the regulations and life lessons.In devices, one can only feed data but children cannot share their problems with them.Moreover, there are also fake websites which are not good for young minds and even though pressing one wrong button can lead to those websites.Also, computing devices could  affect eyesight.Spending a lot of hours on screen can make their eyesight weaker.It can be addicting too.For instance, According to a 2022 Indian survey which was conducted by the Education Department it is found that 48% of school-going learners have weak eyesight and it all started during 'The COVID-19 stage when they started studying online.The ratio was increased from 22% to 45%.As a result, electronic machines are not advantageous at certain times.

To conclude,although information processing machine saves hours and energy and provide outcomes fast yet ,I largely believe that professors are an important aspect of the field of teaching.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'How can the government ensure that people save enough money to live on when they are old?' 
 'Text': 'The ever-increasing expectation of people for their quality of life, as well as the yearly surge of inflation as a result of the economic crisis worldwide, has led community members to be in need of money more than ever in history. Presently, it is a major problem to accumulate enough wealth for old age to live in a comfortable condition. I, therefore, attempt to outline some possible solutions that can be measured by the government.

A reduction in tax for those who have less competitive salaries would help them save up more money. Complaining about the high amount of tax payments, people give up a certain percentage of their income to the state. However, it might be fair enough to divide a community into different classes on the basis of their earnings. To be more precise, a tax increase for affluent society members would compensate for any drainage for poor families. For example, the tax policy in the Netherlands works in a way that those who earn more than a certain annual salary should pay more than half of it to the government. This undoubtedly could help impoverished individuals manage their financial difficulties with greater ease or even save some money for their future. 

In addition, education can play a significant role as a game changer in different aspects. Firstly, by improving people's awareness of financial strategies, less money would be spent on unimportant products, which is a result of a prevalent phenomenon among consumers called impulse buying. Also, a knowledgeable society would often invest in shares and assets that could be helpful for them in the future. On the other hand, a noticeable proportion of states' money is spent on jails and prisoners. Having been taught and educated about the moral issues or the retributions of criminals, teenagers tend to maintain law-abiding behaviour throughout their lifetime. As a consequence, there would be fewer people in prison, which subsequently raises the government's wealth and allows it to invest in somewhere else that could be beneficial for those in need.

In conclusion, I would argue that states are capable of taking effective steps to help people make enough money so that they could be able to save funds for the elderly period. Classifying society based on their possession and managing the tax system would be in favour of both the country and destitute people. Moreover, the proliferation of valuable courses teaching individuals, especially children and teenagers, leads to a fall in government spending on unnecessary items.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': '⚪️ People these days watch TV, films and other programmes alone rather than with other people. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages.' 
 'Text': 'Due to technological advancements, many people nowadays prefer to watch television, movies, and other entertainment alone. Certainly, such a predilection has advantages and disadvantages. Though this approach has many advantages, I feel the disadvantages outweigh them. In the forthcoming paragraphs, I will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of the issue and explain why I believe in the latter.

On the one hand, it is evident that insular watching provides the most comfort since you do not have to haggle with anybody to select which film to watch or because you can pause, turn up, or turn down the sound at your leisure. This implies people are more inclined to select programming that is customized to their preferences. Moreover, viewing television alone gives you more flexibility. Also, some introverts find it difficult to conceal their inner feelings in front of large groups of people.

On the other hand, the disadvantages are pertinent to severe social connection interference. Spending more time alone can reduce your communication capacity and weaken your bonds with family members, friends, and acquaintances. We used to watch leisure shows together, critique them, and laugh together in unison. As a result, new spectra are created and made available for future discussion. We are now less inclined to begin a conversation and are becoming unprecedentedly averse to engaging in any discussion. If this problem continues to afflict our contemporary culture in the long run, the consequences will be extremely difficult to predict.

To sum up, while watching films alone can provide individuals with complete ease, the drawbacks it brings are equally horrendous. To prevent this, we should balance personal and social time by replacing family time with alone time.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many companies sponsor sports as a way of advertising themselves. Some people think this is good for the world of sport, while others think it is negative. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There are several physical activities that are very popular across the countries for example, soccer as a group sport or MotoGP as an individual sport. Supported by information technology development nowadays, millions of eyes can watch it through various kinds of electronic devices, such as television that takes the biggest part or mobile phones as individual portable devices. This phenomenon was exposed by businesses to take part in terms as sponsors for certain favourable sports to promote their goods or services through commercial marketing. Collaboration between the enterprises with sports would have mutualistic symbiosis, such as the enterprises could provide funding for specific competition or federation that would improve the sport's quality, in return they can put massive promotions for their business. At the same time, it is possible if the corporations potentially have bargaining power to control specific kinds of sports.

Firstly, sports could offer benefits to the business through promoting their products broadly. It would help the company's performance and also strengthen its brand to the customer. Some sports that aforementioned have a wide range of fanatic supporters or iconic athletes that facilitate the enterprise to sell their products easily. If the corporation gets a higher return from giving certain sponsorship, most likely it will invest more in the long term and potentially become an exclusive partner. Funding  given by the businesses can be used by the association to improve the sport's development.

However, a higher level of dependency between specific types of sports to a certain donor potentially brings out risk, for instance, the sponsor asking for a special request for broadcasting or a monopoly for athlete appliances. It could reduce the sport's exclusivity since they have controlling power to implement specific requirements that are related to their interest. It would create a negative impact if it is not correctly handled, since sports were selling entertainment to the fans and stakeholders.

Finally, I believe that collaboration between sports and corporations could offer higher benefits for each other since the businesses provide funds for sponsorship and sports could bring their supporters as potential customers for the corporations. On the other hand, sports fans and stakeholders need to maintain their independence as entertainment channels even though they were funded by specific parties to keep their inclusivity.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In many countries around the world, rural people are moving to cities, so the population in the countryside is decreasing.

Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?' 
 'Text': 'In many countries worldwide, there is a noticeable trend of people leaving rural areas to live in cities, which leads to a decrease in the population of the countryside. This phenomenon has both positive and negative effects, and it's important to consider them carefully. In this essay, I will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this movement from rural to urban areas.

On the one hand, moving to the city can bring new opportunities. Cities usually have better schools and more jobs, so people who move there may have a chance to get a better education and find better-paying jobs. Also, cities are often more exciting places to live with lots of things to do, like going to concerts, museums, or sports events. This can make life more interesting and enjoyable for those who move from the countryside.

On the other hand, there are some downsides to this trend. As more people move to cities, they become more crowded, and some problems like traffic and pollution can become worse. It may also be harder for people to find affordable housing in cities, especially if they don't have a lot of money. Moreover, when people leave rural areas, it can mean fewer customers for local businesses, which can hurt the economy in those areas.

In conclusion, the movement of people from rural areas to cities has its pros and cons. While it can offer new opportunities and excitement in cities, it can also bring challenges such as overcrowding and economic difficulties. Therefore, it's essential for governments to find ways to support both rural and urban areas to ensure that everyone has access to education, jobs, and a good quality of life, regardless of where they live.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Having more money and less free time is better than earning less money and having more free time. Discuss both views and state your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'One of the most prevalent trends in the contemporary world is the cumulative increase in millionaires. While some folk argue that less money and  more free time is better, others believe that more money and less time keeps you busy and away from the wrong things. Both sides of this topic will be carefully analysed before constructing an inference.

On the one hand, more free time and less money, the main reason is that if you have excess  time you can utilise it with  family and community welfare. No doubt, you can make good friends and take part in events. Another factor is you can relax at your home and look after your health. For example, a number of people are doing charity work in New South Wales and meet different populations. As a result, it is evident that meeting with  different ethnics mankind will bring you more opportunities in their lives.

On the other hand, more wealth and less time, the primary reason is that you will earn more revenue for your family, so they can buy luxury things. In addition, if you are wealthy , it will give you internal satisfaction and you can use extra money to buy more properties for your upcoming generations, so they may not face any difficulties in the future. For instance, Asian nations buy homes and buildings for their children so they can enjoy a better life. As a consequence, it is apparent why many Chinese buy properties all over the world.

In conclusion, following the analysis of both sides, it is clear free  time can bring the public together and keep them healthy but we cannot ignore it if we have money  we can enjoy it and less time will keep us always busy, instead of involved in useless tasks. In my opinion, if you have money you can enjoy any time, so more money and less time is good for  humans. Furthermore, it is predicted that this development is going to continue in the future as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'These days, we are seeing an increasing amount of violence on television,

and this is having a negative impact on children's behaviour. Do you agree or

disagree?' 
 'Text': 'One of the most recent trends in today’s world is the upsurge in watching a growing amount of violence in media, and it is having negative impacts on youngsters’ routines. There is a wild split of belief that this is a popular subject of debate.  In my perspective, this has more negative than positive impacts and I will demonstrate it with the reasons in this essay.

On the one hand, critics may point out some drawbacks. They might say that even children need to be updated about the ongoing situation in a country. For example, who are studying such as logic, sociology and political science, it is vital to learn about violence, and crime to enhance their education. Most of the time they are learning by doing research therefore it helps them to know those things.

On the other hand, there are number of arguments in favour of my stance. Mainly, the children are usually interested in doing experiments. For example, Seeing those programs on television might inspire trying those things and due to hectic lifestyles, parents are also not aware of them. That is the most preponderant one, and it has several consequences in various ways. Secondly, childhood is the stage of beginning to explore things in their life. As an example, if they see good programs such as mind-relaxing, educational or religious their behavior will be good as well. Never will they be aggressive.

In my opinion, the whole world is focusing on educating teenagers to watch meaningful programs to make their future successful. In my opinion, the whole world is focusing on educating teenagers to watch meaningful programs to have good behaviour.

Given the arguments outlined above, one might conclude that, despite having certain negatives, the positives of watching meaningful programs on television are indeed too dire to ignore.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In Future, the entire news broadcasting will be onlion and there will be no printed newspapers. Do you agree or disagree.' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, it is inevitable that developed technology has transformed human behaviours, such as the way people get trustworthy data. Some proponents positively believe that all news is going to be available only online rather than printed out papers. From my point of view, I strongly see eye to eye with the opinion.

To begin with, cutting-edge technology, a new phenomenon method, completely facilitates people to get new information more easily than before. This situation has been assisted by the internet, which has been integrated perfectly with the mobile phone, an omnipresent gadget. For instance, over 85% of citizens in Indonesia feel like looking for information using this tool rather than reading a newspaper or printed book due to its impeccable accessibility. Therefore, people can grasp an opportunity to broaden their horizons more conveniently by employing technology.

Moreover, the government must undoubtedly consider the environmental issues that come about when a newspaper has to be produced frequently. For example, based on the data from the Natural Protection Organization of Indonesia, cellulose is not a sustainable ingredient; one plant can only utilize approximately 100 grams of the substance. Meanwhile, producing one book requires over 50 grams of cellulose. Consequently, a formidable habitat issue is going to have a paramount impact on human life.

To sum up, I individually contemplate that there will be two factors in all information being posted online for all residents. They are the advanced facilities that are a dime a dozen in society, and the environmental challenges when the companies still convert a plant to paper.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people assume that the goal of every country should be to produce more materials and goods.

To what extent do you agree or disagree that constantly increasing production is an appropriate goal?' 
 'Text': 'These days, it seems the emphasis on the quantity of  goods has surpassed their quality. There remains some disagreement as to whether it is a positive or negative development. While there are valid arguments to the contrary, in this essay I would contend that there are more crucial issues like education as well as the environment to be prioritized. The reasons for this are as follows.

First of all, evident is the fact that neglecting education, which nurtures specialized workforces would pose some challenges in the process of manufacturing. A salient example of this is Japan, as its concentration on education, has enabled it to rank first in producing the most prominent products for global markets. Thus, rather than paying attention to quantity, emphasizing education could lead to manufacturing superior goods in the long term.

Secondly and even more importantly should be preserving the environment and saving it for the upcoming generations. it is obvious that having produced a high quantity of goods, which entails harnessing natural resources, the depletion of natural resources is likely to occur. Taking Africa as an example, deforestation for industrial purposes, extracting from mines and overfishing have disrupted the natural ecosystem significantly. So, prior to producing any further material, valuing bringing up educated individuals and assessing geographical capabilities should be compulsory.

By way of conclusion, valuing  education as well as the environment as valuable assets is crucial for achieving higher production. Whereas, putting excessive emphasis on such superficial issues like numbers or quantity would undermine the authenticity of the producer country and disrupte the ecological order.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, people of all ages from certain parts of the world spend most time at home rather than going outdoors. Discuss the reasons, is this negative or positive development?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, all the citizens from specific parts of the earth choose to spend their time in their locations rather than outdoors, I think this change is generally negative because gradually we will lose our sense and responsibility for nature and our surroundings will disappear.

To begin with, thanks to  technology this generation does not need extra efforts to find what they want, all your needs will be satisfied just with some clicks. As a result, they are completely safe and convenient in their location so they do not find any point in searching out the earth. For example, some inventions such as VR are giving fascinating experiences to their users and they can simply go through any possibility without any risks and extra consequences. Additionally, in  modern cities there are all kinds of problems such as air, noise, and traffic and people find it much more demanding to go out and be in touch with the world.

On the other hand, all of us are part of nature and to be  human we need to find out about our community so it is vital to go out and upgrade our sense of responsibility to our countries because at  first our global were captured by jungles and lakes and we changed it to this polluted area. Moreover, I agree it is a frustrating process to change our world and being in our safe zone is more convenient, although if we do not repair it in the near future we will have to deal with catastrophic effects.

In conclusion, seems this generation considers being in their homes and avoiding going outside it. I believe this method is simple , however, we have to go out and find out our communities' issues and solve them gradually because if we do not do this in the long term our world we be destroyed'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots.

What is your opinion.

Give reasons for your answer and inclde any relevant examples form your knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'A group of people assume that gradually all occupations will eliminate human involvement and be replaced by intelligent robots. I believe it will not be able to disappear all workers from their positions and some jobs will remain for the population.

 In the following graphs, I will discuss both views and give relevant examples.

 To begin with, technology is changing dramatically and improving all aspects of our lives. Those equipment are upgraded and their skills becoming more advanced, as a result, their ability to work in adult positions is becoming more possible. Some hard and repetitive work such as packing or organizing can simply be done by machines. For example, nowadays the majority of companies (Amazon online shop) use robots for moving products in storage and it is completely beneficial and effortless, additionally, increases productivity and reduces potential risks.

On the other hand, some jobs are sensitive and need human knowledge and also need a sense of feeling and ignoring  individual aid will have catastrophic consequences. For instance, judges and lawyers, these professions need both a keen mind and a deep understanding of evidence and robots or programs can be easily distracted from the main point because those have some order and rules also can not easily adapt to all possibilities. Consequently, I think positions  that can put others ' lives in danger need the involvement of the population to destroy risks.

In conclusion, in my opinion, developing artificial intelligence is an inevitable occurrence and it will work in several locations, however , there will be still a significant number of jobs remaining for  humankind because  of the need for deep knowledge and a keen mind.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Modern technology, such as personal computers and the Internet, have made it possible for many people to do their work from home at least part of the time instead of going to an office every day. What are some of the advantages and disadvantages of this situation?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'One of the most prevalent trends in the contemporary world is the cumulative increase in working from home on computers. It is completely agreed working from residence is time-saving and beneficial for the environment. Both sides of this topic will be carefully analysed before constructing an inference.

On the one hand, more screen time and missing face-to-face meetings. The main reason is that when working from  home, staff must be present in front of the screen, which damages our eyes and brain. Another factor is that employees miss all personal interactions, where they get knowledge from their office people. For example, recently a report printed in the Herald newspaper,  showed that 25% of people suffered from stress and obesity. As a result, it is evident that people are opposed to working from flats.

On the other hand, saves time and cleans the environment. The primary reason is that professionals do not need to get ready early for the office, instead they can utilise that time for personal tasks. In addition, less traffic and savings on fuel and travel expenses, such as fewer commuters using public and private transport   as a result,  will reduce the level of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. For instance, the New South Wales environmental department measured the smoke level in the year 2021 and found a clean air level. As a consequence, companies encourage their engineers to work from home , so they can save on office expenses.

In conclusion, following the analysis of both sides, it is clear that working from home is best for mankind and companies, where they can save time and money, however working men and women lose their confidence and knowledge which they get from their mates. Further, it is predicted that this development will continue in the future as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many countries spend a lot of money on art. Some people think investment in art is necessary, but others say the money is better spent on improving health and education. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'ome say that spending lots of money on art is important, while others also say that many countries should focus on health and education development. This essay will describe both views of these thoughts and how those are essential for the capitals. 

It is thought that many countries investing much  money in the art sector is crucial , which may significantly affect a part of well-being improvement and tourism. For instance, In Italy and Paris, there are a plethora of creative activities established such as lots of museums in Paris. As a consequence, those creative art are appealing to tourists across the world as well as remarkably increasing the amount of income in that section. Moreover, this part also contributes to economic growth and capita income. 

Conversely, some people think that the investment in health and education is much better. It is obvious that those improvements are fundamental to the well-being of their populations. There are free campaigns of public schools and hospitals for the citizens which are organized by the government. For example, studying at a university in Germany is free for  citizens. Furthermore, when people are less concerned about the amount of spending on school fees and  medical expenses. They could be more pleased enjoying their lives, which most  people prefer work-life balance. 

To conclude, I personally think that health and education are fundamental structures of each country. Those are supposed to be crucial parts of national development. In addition, any profession could be capable of supporting  economic growth.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the Future More People Will Choose to Go on Holiday in Their Own Country and Not Travel Abroad on Holiday.

Do You Agree or Disagree?' 
 'Text': 'A common belief is that in the coming years, an increasing number of individuals will opt to spend their vacations domestically rather than overseas. I completely concur with this view as local travel is accessible, more cost-effective, and sustainable.

The main reason for my agreement is domestic tourism is becoming increasingly accessible and appealing. As infrastructure within a country improves and the tourism industry grows, tempting domestic destinations are being developed and promoted. For example, a new high-speed railway in Laos has cut travel times from the capital to the tourist mecca of Luang Prabang down to 3 hours, from a full-day bus journey previously.

In addition to my positive view the cost of travelling domestically is often cheaper than travelling internationally. This is especially true when factors such as exchange rates and airfares are taken into account. With the economy in many countries still recovering from the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, many people are looking for ways to save money on vacations, and choosing to holiday within their own country is an effective way to do so.

My final supporting argument is the trend towards sustainable tourism is also likely to drive more people towards domestic holidays. Choosing to vacation within one’s own country has a smaller carbon footprint than travelling internationally, and is, therefore, more environmentally friendly. As more people become aware of the importance of sustainability, they are likely to choose domestic holidays over international ones in order to reduce their impact on the environment.

In conclusion, in my view, it is crystal clear that in the future, more people will choose to go on holiday within their own country rather than travelling abroad. With the increasing accessibility and appeal of domestic destinations, the cost savings of domestic travel, and the trend towards sustainable tourism, it is only natural that residents will choose to explore the beauty and attractions within their own borders.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think history has nothing or little to tell us, but others think that studying the past history can help us better understand the present.

Discuss both these views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'A group of individuals present the view that studying the past is not useful enough, whereas others believe everyone worldwide should take full advantage of studying the past history. I strongly agree with the latter opinion.

On the one hand, some people justifiably argue that through history lessons, people of all ages can gain valuable life lessons that will strengthen their sense of identity. In other words, from a cultural viewpoint, historical research can provide insight into a better understanding of a society. In other words, learning about historical events can shape our values and beliefs. For example, we can study the past of a developed country and figure out how it has developed and we should follow the example of them.

On the other hand, another group of people claim that the past is gone and can not be changed, so there is no point in dwelling on it. They insist that focusing on historical events can distract us from addressing current issues and challenges. However, I do not find this argument convincing as this knowledge can inform our decision-making processes and help us avoid repeating past errors. For instance, a nation that has been attacked in the past and damaged improves its defence structures and is less likely to be damaged again.

To conclude, in my view, studying history is essential for gaining a comprehensive understanding of the world around us. historical research can provide insight into a better understanding of a society. moreover, this knowledge can inform our decision-making processes and help us avoid repeating past errors.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'nowadays many people complain that they have difficulties having enough sleep 

 what are problems caused by lack of sleep?

what can be done about this lack of sleep?' 
 'Text': 'In today's fast-paced world, many people are struggling to get adequate sleep. sleep deprivation can impact their physical and mental health. This essay will discuss  its negative  impact on the lives of individuals  and solutions to tackle  this issue.

Sleeping for short periods of time can lead to various physical illnesses such as Obesity, hypertension and cardiovascular disease. It also weakens the immune system of individuals. Their professional life would be impacted by a lack of concentration , which leads to a decline in productivity. In addition, their mental health will be hindered, due to prolonged sleep deprivation. They have to deal with anxiety, depression and many more psychological symptoms .If, they are not mentally fit. , then they have to go through tough times to maintain their personal relationships.

It can be solved by taking fruitful steps. Firstly, the Government should implement a rule for working hours. Hence, humans do not have to work for longer hours by sacrificing sleep. Secondly, people should avoid using electronic gadgets such as phones, tablets, social media and more before going to bed. It is believed that if you are not using any electrical device for a couple of hours before your bedtime, then you will get a peaceful amount of sleep. Additionally, individuals should set up their routine schedule to avoid fewer sleeping hours.There are a variety of applications available on smartphones to track their sleep pattern. These can be pretty helpful for them to get proper sleeping hours.

To Conclude, lack of sleep has detrimental effects on physiological, psychological and  personal  life. There should be some kind of awareness of proper sleep patterns.It can be sorted out by adopting a sleep schedule and distancing from gadgets, games and networking sites.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In the past, people ate local food in season. Nowadays, people buy a variety of foods from all over the world. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Previous generations used to eat the local meals in season, although, nowadays, the population purchase different foods from entire the globe. I think this is an advantageous development because humans can experience diverse dishes at any time.

To begin with, our dishes are one the most important features of our daily life and it has reformed over the years. It has become more convenient and any individual can easily order a wanted meal from the nearest local shop and enjoy it without any effort, just need some clicks also money . Additionally, this difference in choice has gathered a large number of ingredients that can improve our hygiene states and support all our vital vitamins to have healthier bodies, as a result, in the long term, we do have not to struggle with the disease. For example, people used to eat milk just when their cow had milk and if they did not have that animal they would not be able to get the benefits of milk and had to wait until the season came, however, for these years you can find  this material in any stores.

On the other hand, some traditional foods are really tasty and contain huge amounts of nutrients and this reform in humankind's diet may put those meals at risk of extinction because may be underestimated for a while . Nonetheless, I think those recipes can easily be written down and  recorded so that any individual can access and find it original simply by searching.

In conclusion, the population's appetite has upgraded and they can effortlessly experience diverse tastes. I believe it is a completely beneficial point because they can consume different tastes and gain needed nutrients simply by ordering their wanted meal.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Across the world, local shops are closing due to losing customers to online competitors. What problems does this produce? And what solutions can you suggest to overcome them?' 
 'Text': 'The usage of new technology in the education sector has surged in recent times and prioritized over the conventional method of teaching to a large number of pupils. Contemporary technology in teaching is very convenient and time-saving for students as well as for teachers. The primary advantages and disadvantages of this phenomenon are discussed in the following passages.

On the one hand, there are various benefits of using new technologies for teaching students. Firstly, through the conventional method, it is very difficult for teachers to explain  complex topics to students. But, after the advent of new audio-visual technology, it is very easy to explain tough topics with the help of animations. Additionally, since most educational institutes have adopted online teaching, students can easily learn from anywhere in the world, which is very convenient and time-saving. 

Despite these advantages, there are many drawbacks of new technologies which not only affect the learning curve of students, but it affects the overall health of pupils. First, it is nearly impossible for teachers to know if students are paying attention while teaching online and as a result, most students can’t score well in exams. Furthermore, new gadgets require pupils to constantly use digital screens which is very harmful for students of all ages. For example, as per a recent study, nearly 50% of children below the age of ten, wear spectacles due to excessive use of digital screens.

In conclusion, new technological advancements in education surely increase students’ ability to grasp  complex subjects, and they are far more convenient and time-saving for teachers and students than traditional methods. However, they negatively affect the learning curve of pupils and their eye sight.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
