For example, the scandal on the US junior navy, published by the New York Times in 2012, showed that almost 70% of them were abused in the training camps. In this percentage, 30% of the ones that answered expressed that the abusive events in question would scar them for life and, in 40% of the cases, they feel that they will not be able to move on from these traumatic experiences. This makes them unable to find a proper job in the future. 

To conclude, I wholeheartedly believe that  mandatory military service would not be good because the sentiments are not always shared by the youth as well as the training has a traumatizing effect on most of the forced subordinates.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'These days, mobile phone and the internet are very important to the ways in which people relate to one another socially. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'In the contemporary world, smartphones and wifi are essential ways in which numerous users can acquire information and interact with peers daily. This tendency leads to many beneficial ways for humans' entertainment and work. Therefore, this leads to more advantages that outweigh the disadvantages. This essay will expound on my views about the statement's pros rather than the cons and conclude the topic.

To commence, the majority of advantages of people using phones and the internet are more convenient for communicating with different countries' users whenever they need it. On top of that, online dating is more trendy nowadays owing to the contribution of extending your social circle. When some online daters utilise gadgets and the wifi connecting dating apps, they can socialise with their partners without face-to-face embarrassing situations. Another advantage is to have better chemistry interaction when people meet their peers online. Thus, mobile phones and the internet are crucial parts of their life socially.

On the other hand, even though there are many benefits to using gadgets for socialising, this also causes some drawbacks in humans using gadgets to communicate. One of the major disadvantages is relying on devices to chat with each one, limiting spending face-to-face meetings for family members. For instance, in my city, dozens of younger generations ignore their grandparents while they just chat with friends online. As a result, older generations and younger generations have a big gap between their bonding and isolation. Hence, this is more likely to pull out their relationships when adolescents focus on their phones with online chatting.

In conclusion, following the statement above, I believe that the advantages of using mobile and the internet outweigh the disadvantages as more user-friendly. Otherwise, if some adolescents can separate their time and be patient with their older ones, I suppose the disadvantage would disappear.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that educational success depends on good teachers. Others think that it is dependent on the attitude of the students.

Discuss both of the views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'In this day and age, it is considered by a plethora of individuals that, academic success is dependent upon  good teachers. Others believe that the attitude of the student is what determines the success. From my point of view, the presence of the right tutor is significant to show the correct path to a learner.

To begin with, there are a plethora of examples for this statement. Firstly, having a good mentor in life is vital as they can point the pupil in the true direction. Good teachers will help to rectify mistakes a learner commits and also provide advice to prevent future mistakes. For instance, an English professor in a university will not only correct the wrong grammar  but also identify the wrong usage of the language students may utilize in the future. They can give the proper practice sessions to the scholar.

On the other hand, student attitude is equally imperative in achieving educational success, as without his will   , there is nothing a tutor can do to make him understand the concepts. If a learner has a positive outlook towards education, only then he can achieve a plethora of achievements. After all, If children are willing to study, they can do self-study.

In a nutshell, it is crucial to have both the correct attitudes as it keeps students motivated towards studies as well as a good teacher as children can  help one in bringing back a learn to the accurate path. Furthermore, I find it more consequential to have a proper guide in student life as it is really sophisticated to correct oneself on one own and identify self-mistakes.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think the best way to learn new things is to study them alone. Others think that it is always better to get help from a skilled teacher. Discuss both views and give your opinion' 
 'Text': 'The debate over whether individual study or learning with the assistance of a skilled tutor is more effective has been longstanding. It is my contention that some individuals cannot study alone without  external interference due to certain factors, however, people who are skilled and motivated enough to conduct their studies should remain committed to their studies. 

First and foremost, proponents of self-study argue that it offers unparalleled flexibility and fuel of motivation to keep them going for long periods. Solo learners have the advantage of establishing a tailored study schedule and plan which is devoid of group or tutor-based limitations, giving them full freedom to drive their own studies as they desire. This autonomy in learning is believed to foster a deeper connection to the subject matter, encouraging critical thinking and self-reliance. Furthermore, presently, advancements accomplished in the field of technology enable  self-learners to benefit from the mass resources available on the internet through AI bots such as Chat GPT. Consequently, by utilizing these tools, individuals will be able to increase the pace of their learning and gain  broader access to  distinctive data resources. 

On the other hand, advocates for learning under the guidance of skilled repetitors highlight the importance of a structured way of studying which can significantly enhance  learning. It goes without saying that teachers not only provide expert insights into complex subjects but also offer immediate feedback on the questions raised by students, thus, increasing  proactive learning. On top of that teachers play a crucial role in disciplining students who are unable to keep themselves committed to their studies. 

In conclusion, both self-study and learning with the assistance of a teacher have their unique advantages. A blended approach that leverages the strengths of both strategies might be the most effective way to learn new things, catering to a wider range of learning preferences and objectives.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'To what extent do you agree that computers and other kinds of digital technology are both a benefit and a problem?' 
 'Text': 'Integrating digital technology into every facet of modern life is a testament to human innovation. The omnipresence of computers and state-of-the-art digital tools has made them as familiar as household appliances. It is agreed that these technological advancements carry advantages and issues that merit a nuanced discussion.

On the one hand, a troubling aspect is cast by the shadow of digital progress, manifested in the form of technologically facilitated crimes. The reach and sophistication of computers and digital technology have lowered the barriers to malicious activities. For instance, access to powerful tools like generative AI has been democratised by entities such as OpenAI. While designed for constructive purposes, they have been misappropriated, with DeepFake videos being created, inadvertently escalating sexual exploitation crimes. This exemplifies how the pathway for criminal endeavours can be inadvertently eased by technological strides, consequently fomenting societal challenges.

On the other hand, the evolution of computers and digital technologies has undeniably streamlined our lives, transforming mundane tasks into seamless interactions. The lineage of computers, beginning with ENIAC, has morphed our work and lifestyle into a tapestry of efficiency and convenience. For example, a wallet-free existence has been made feasible in South Korea by converging functionalities such as transit, identification, credit transactions, and e-commerce within a single device, illustrating the enriching impact of digital advancements on daily life.

In conclusion, a world stripped of robots, the internet, smartphones, and other digital technologies we have grown accustomed to is nearly impossible to envision. Yet, societal issues, such as increased avenues for crime, have been highlighted by media outlets and cannot be ignored. In sum, it has concurred that digital technologies offer remarkable benefits and significant problems are posed, making it imperative for this dual-edged sword to be navigated with vigilance and foresight.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'while some keep pets for personal pleasure and other purpose, other feel that it is a selfish decision. discuss both the views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Whether people keep pets for personal pleasure and other purposes or it is a selfish decision is a source of controversy.I will shed light on both views and reveal my personal perspective regarding this issue.

On the one hand, those who think that keeping pets is a selfish decision have their own respective arguments. First of all, all species have a right to be free and enjoy their life without human intervention or other kinds of human factors, so restricting them with limited living areas and halting their enjoyment of life can be considered as a kind of wicked manner. To cite an example, today it is an observable fact that many animals are kept in captivity, which directly affects their both mental and physical health adversely. Secondly, pets at home can not do enough physical exercises, leading them to be  poorly immune and develop some undesirable illnesses, which can end their life.

On the other hand, I, like many others tend to believe that people usually keep pets at home due to several reasons that can not be overlooked. To begin, people, especially the elderly and the ones who live alone at home, keep pets in order to make their lives more colourful and enjoyable. For instance, pets at home can ,sometimes, help them to get rid of stress by playing with them and immersing those people in activities which strengthen their bond with life. Furthermore, pets, such as dogs, can safeguard their owners and homes. Therefore, in almost every part of the world, dogs are mainly kept for the purpose of protection

To sum up, while some individuals believe that keeping pets is a selfish decision, I hold the view that people have understandable reasons for keeping pets at home or living places.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that with the increasing use of mobile phones and computers, people lose the ability to communicate face to face. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'In the digital era, one school of thought holds that the prevalent appearance of smartphones and computers is to blame for the lower ability to communicate face-to-face. While I accept that perception is somewhat justified, I believe that there are other important factors that might logically contribute to opposition.

On the one hand, it is understandable why modern devices could harm communication skills. First and foremost, it could decrease the frequency of conversation. For instance, many students who are addicted to video games prefer to play alone at home rather than hang out with their friends in person, which reduces their social time as well as makes them less talkative and more introverted in daily life. Furthermore, electronic gadgets might lead their users to become more isolated. For example, numerous IT firms encourage their employees to work from home to cut operational costs. Thus, these workers might face mental health issues such as loneliness and depression due to the lack of physical conversations and eye-to-eye contact.

On the other hand, there are a host of compelling reasons why I am convinced that cell phones and laptops could be advantageous to certain extents. One rationale is that it could strengthen individuals' ties. This is because online applications provide accessible and convenient methods to keep in touch and confide in members of a family, especially citizens who study or work in foreign countries despite the long distance. Another justification is that electronic gadgets could improve the production of employees. To be more specific, with intelligent devices, staff who work for global corporations could quickly exchange information with others in other branches via online platforms such as Zoom, Google Meeting, or Discord, which could enhance their workflows and efficiency.

In conclusion, it is irrefutable that smartphones and computers have some heavy demerits, I would contend that these applications also have several profound merits that the public should take into consideration.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Robots and AI are being developed to replace humans in the workplace

Why is this happening? 

Do you think it will have a positive or negative impact on society?' 
 'Text': 'There is no denying that the ongoing development of autonomous machines and AI can eliminate human involvement in the workplace. This phenomenon can be attributed to the positive outcome of these innovations, therefore positively affecting humankind. 

The proliferation of industrial robots in manufacturing sites plays an essential role in enhancing efficiency and productivity. Unlike the human workforce, which can contract illnesses, life troubles, or boredom that adversely impact their performance at such repetitive tasks, these robots can work tirelessly without fatigue or breaks, resulting in higher output levels. Besides that, companies nowadays tend to prioritize minimizing operational costs; therefore, AI can be a sound option. This is because AI can take responsibility for a heavy workload that requires an overwhelming number of employees to solve with pinpoint accuracy. A prime example is Google, this company saves its financial resources that used to be paid for its personnel, thanks to AI. 

I believe that the persistence of this tendency can be beneficial to human beings. There is a common fallacy that job displacement can occur when automation takes place. In more detail, the emergence of this tool can terminate human intervention in such jobs that individuals traditionally do, potentially resulting in a soaring rate of unemployment. However, this replacement can force these unemployed workers to improve themselves in terms of skill and knowledge to apply for jobs that demand problem-solving skills and creativity. Evidently, the high-skilled workers with degrees contribute to that nation's prosperity. Furthermore, employees can be beneficial as their stress and pressure can be reduced when AI bears that burden by solving repetitive and heavy chores. 

In conclusion, the desire to cut expenses and improve workplace productivity is a primary factor driving the proliferation of AI and automatic robots. Hence, this development advantageously helps humankind.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'As countries develop, their populations tend to live individually or in small family units. What are the causes of this trend and what are the effects on society?' 
 'Text': 'In contemporary times, a host of developed nations witness their citizens prefer to live alone or in small families. This essay attempts to shed light on the driving factors behind this tendency before clarifying its heavy demerits on each household and the entire community.

There are several primary reasons why inhabitants are in favour of independent living or a nuclear family. First and foremost, workplaces have resulted in this trend. For example, numerous students who just graduated are likely to move to big cities rather than stay in their hometowns, which allows them to have more opportunities to find  high-paying jobs as well as develop their career paths. Furthermore, a decent salary  equally contributes to this phenomenon. In fact, with well-earnings, individuals  more focus on their personal hobbies and private lives, thus, the young prefer to have their own houses.

An increase in the number of inhabitants who live individually or in nuclear families could greatly impact various facets of the country. One implication is that it could negatively affect to nation . This is because the enormous costs incurred to take care of the elderly who do not live with their offspring could put a strain on government coffers, thereby leading to budget deficits, tax hikes, or reduced social welfare. As a result, ordinary citizens, especially the underprivileged, would struggle more to make ends meet. Another consequence is that without spending time with family, children's awareness might be harmed. To be more specific, a decrease in the amount of quality time with other relatives means that a rise in the number of children might have mental issues such as isolation, depression, or anxiety.

In conclusion, there are some underlying motives behind this negative tendency, and it is having an adverse bearing on various aspects of individuals and society.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people work long hour, leaving very little time for leisure activities.

Does this situation have more advantages or more disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'One of the most prevalent trends in the contemporary world is the cumulative increase in working hours to live a good life. While  many people argue that long hours make you tired and unable to take part in different activities others believe that making  cash can bring internal happiness. Both sides of this topic will be carefully analysed before constructing an inference.

On the one hand, competition and expenses, due to expensive groceries and other household goods, it  hard to survive. Immigrants’ first priority is to pay rent and buy daily-use goods. Another factor is that folk do not earn enough payment, so they cannot spare time for other activities. For example, a shopkeeper opens his shop from 6a.m. to 9 p.m. on a daily basis and needs to pay rent and outgoings. If he takes a day off, he may not be  able to pay his fixed expenses. As a result, it is evident that showroom owners are always busy with their businesses to survive in the market.

On the other hand, funds and lifestyle, the primary factor is that if a person has good money he can take holidays one time and enjoy for a longer period. In addition, wealthy society never  rest until change their lifestyles. So they do not care about long hours. Their vision is clear do hard work for a few years and relax  to the retirement age. For instance, contractors of  National Broadband Network (NBN) company people do five to ten years of hard work after that they enjoy their whole life  because they already earned lots of money. As a consequence, it is apparent why tradies retire early from their profession.

In conclusion, following the analysis of long hours makes you tired and low in energy but it pays for the rest of your life, so you can enjoy  more wealth and status. However, it is predicted that this trend is going to continue in the future as well.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, a growing number of people with health problems are trying alternative medicines and treatments instead of visiting their usual doctor.

Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?' 
 'Text': 'To begin, there is a trend these days to seek advice from non-medical persons to cure the illness rather than following the doctor's prescription. This is not a good development as it can cause more harm than good.

However, there are many reasons people rely more on alternative medicines. So, he can't afford such a costly regimen and he resorts to other ways of healing. There are many side effects of allopathic drugs. There is a long list of adverse effects written on the pamphlets accompanying the leaflets of drugs. Most health professionals have a very busy schedule. This makes it hard for the sick persons to get an appointment. In addition, very few specialists give ample time for counselling of the diseased persons which causes an increased rate of non-compliance. All these factors support the idea of looking towards hakims for non-allopathic ways of cure.

 For example, the price of an injection of chemotherapy is more than one lac rupees in our country whereas the average monthly income of a common man is less than fifty thousand rupees. 

Nevertheless, it appears fascinating, that non-medical remedies have their drawbacks. Additionally, the quacks provide a remedy which is not scientifically proven. Some people had been using various medications by a hakim to control blood pressure. He later developed blood cancer which was attributed to the gold content in those chemicals. The mechanism of action of many over-the-counter items is not known so, if there is an overdose of any of the content, there is no antidote available to nullify its effects. As a result, a person having a heart attack or trauma rushes to the hospital's emergency for relief. As there are no proper wards for sick people in homoeopathic care, those requiring indoor management have to come to a doctor's clinic for admission.

To conclude, the demerits of alternative medicines are more than their benefits. Governments should pay attention to the rising cost of medical treatment and make health reforms for the timely management of ill people in the best possible ways.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people are now opting to provide technology companies with their personal data in exchange for access to software?

Do advantages outweigh disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'More and more people are giving their personal details to those companies in order to use the services. However, some may opine that this is risky. Others state that this is beneficial for us. I think this is a controversial topic, and I believe that it has more merits than demerits.

On one hand, the reason why companies need our data is that they can use data analysis on it, and they can find more chances to improve their business. Machine learning models require enormous information to do the processing. It may predict the possible future and is good for making business strategies. For example, my previous company Fubon Group which is specialized in using data science to do anti-money laundering prevention. They stopped those happening successfully. Big data can be used in many fields such as marketing, accounting, finance, and so on. 

On the other hand, some companies are not illegal, and they use your data for fraud. This is terrible! Those criminals earned billions of dollars by using these. For instance, some gangsters cooperate with the staff who are working in technology cooperation, because this is an easy way to get others' personal details. Furthermore, they use those citizens' phone numbers to make calls and tell them have to transfer their money to designated accounts. The cases of that have increased recently. The law enforcement departments have found so many types of fraud.

In a nutshell, data analysis is very popular, and people are using it in many things. It is a way to make our lives better. On the contrary, wrongdoers use it in the wrong ways. It is like a double-edged sword. Overall, in my view, it is good to do that.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'A big salary is much more important than job satisfaction. 

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is undeniable that work plays a vital role in human life. This is the reason why many individuals think that a substantial income is much more crucial than the satisfaction of a job. I personally disagree with this viewpoint for many reasons, described in the following paragraphs.

On the one hand, the major reason that some people believe that a high salary is more significant than job satisfaction is that it is true to say that money does not always bring you happiness, but it is essential for survival and having a good quality of life. To illustrate, folks who come from a low-income family opt for a high-paying job instead of the job they love because they must support their families. Furthermore, the amount of money obtained from the job they like cannot afford to buy things they want. In other words, some people have a lot of expenses such as the rent for accommodation, telephone bills, electricity bills, clothes, as well as accessories. As a result, they decided to choose a hire-salary job rather than their preferred jobs but have a lower income.

On the other hand, one of the obvious reasons that I disagree with the idea is that doing unfulfilled work for a long time can have a negative effect on mental health. For example, I know many people who are suffering from burnout and always look forward to holidays and days off because they are dissatisfied with their working life. On top of that, doing what you love can be extremely beneficial to your career progression. That is to say, when you are passionate about your work, you will be motivated to contribute significantly. Therefore, you will receive a higher income due to your achievements.

To summarize, although there are numerous reasons why people say that a significant salary is more essential than job satisfaction, I strongly disagree with this notion for many reasons.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries there are more young people choosing to enroll in work based training instead of attending universities. 

Do the disadvantages of this situation outweigh the advantages?' 
 'Text': 'In our contemporary society, the young generation opts to register for work-based training rather than attending top universities. This phenomenon has its own benefits such as learning and exploring the workplace before your professional career starts and drawbacks like losing a world of opportunities in academic life. In the forthcoming paragraphs, this essay will elucidate both aspects of this tendency and provide a reasonable conclusion.

First and foremost, one of the predominant upsides of choosing vocational training is preparation for future life. To exemplify, when a young starts an apprenticeship in an outstanding company, it may pave the way for self-discovery and innovation at a young age. Furthermore, it is undeniable that they confront some rigours of various work conditions and learn to overcome these obstacles and work under  high levels of pressure. Therefore, on-the-job training offers numerous boons for the young, expanding their horizons and fostering a greater understanding of the world's complexity.

Turning to the other side of the paradigm, there is no doubt that its demerits cannot be underestimated. University life provides students with  like-minded peers and faculty with whom they can easily interact  and impart knowledge. Thus, they can pursue their academic interests while honing their professional skills through a wide range of educational resources and lectures by professors in tertiary education. If they refuse to participate in classes, they lose a chance to develop their personal and professional growth.

In conclusion, after having meticulously discussed both sides of this issue, the advantages of training in a genuine workplace surpass its disadvantages in the wake of the above-mentioned reasons. It is important to emphasize that understanding the predominance of educational influence in our lives is essential, while a plethora of potential consequences of experiencing a real work environment cannot be ignored.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'University students are increasingly studying abroad as part of their studies. Do the advantages of studying abroad outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Various controversies have emerged as to whether studying overseas is necessary for college students. Some people claim that it is a waste of money. From my perspective, however, the merits of overseas studies far outweigh its drawbacks.

One primary benefit for students is the opportunity to experience various cultures. This can force them to adapt to totally different lifestyles and broaden their horizons. When people are in a new place, they usually encounter obstacles that force them to find solutions to tackle these problems. For instance, international students are usually shocked by local customs that are significantly different from their country; nevertheless, such experience will equip an individual with the capability to handle many circumstances.

On the other hand, if someone wants to go to another country to acquire knowledge, they need to have more responsibility and money. The living cost overseas tends to be more expensive than their origin hometown. However, the salary can be much higher as well as the cost in these foreign areas. Take soft engineering as an example; To get an engineering degree, people need five times more money to study in the US, while the rewards of work can be ten times than those who work in Taiwan. Therefore, if people can find a well-paid job after graduating, it can easily cover the money they have spent.

By way of conclusion, I firmly believe that studying abroad is beneficial to students. Not only can they broaden their horizons, but they can also earn considerable incomes. Everyone should give it a try if they have this great opportunity.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Health and fitness levels of children and teenagers are declining these days. Therefore, physical education and sport should be compulsory for all students in all schools. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'It is often argued that these days youth's immune system is declining so schools should mandatory subjects like physical education and sport.This essay agrees with this statement as it will make them physically active and allow them to explore new fields.

First of all, playing sports will make their body more active physically and mentally . To explicate ,  in faculty students spend most of their time  sitting and studying and do not get a chance to do physical movement which makes them obese and leads to poor health. In addition to this,young minds now spend most of their time playing with phones and do not play any bodily games which is also an invitation to a lot of illnesses.For instance,in 2023 WHO(World Health Organisation)conducted a survey  of university students in America and found 6 out of 10 kids have movement disorder and these pupils are found with gaming tablets and playing online.Hence,  taking physical education as a required subject will help children to do some movement at the institution.

Secondly,through teaching them athletics, they can enter  new areas of interest.To elaborate , if institutions start teaching  games in academies it will create interest  among children and they get a chance to take a look at different sectors.As,there are many individuals who are not good in academics through these  courses they will get a chance to go and create a bright future.For example, 'Sania Mirza' (Badminton sports player)  studied till only grade 12 .She was not great in academics but brilliant at sports .So she started playing at the age of 12 and made a career in this field and today she is an international player.Thus, these paths will give students new opportunities.

To conclude,I strongly believe that presenting play and physical education subjects will be beneficial for teenagers as it will make them physically strong and new pathways for their future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think it's better to choose friends who always have the same opinions as them. Other people believe it's good to have friends who sometimes disagree with them.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion' 
 'Text': 'Some believe it is best to have friends who share the same opinions, while others say it is better to have some who do not believe in the same matters. This essay discusses both sides and explains why I agree with the first group.

Many believe it is better to be in a social group that agrees on the same ideas all the time. The main reason for this is because it prevents arguing and conflicts. By agreeing with each other, people can have more peaceful and fruitful conversations. For instance, my friends and I usually enjoy chatting casually about light-hearted subjects, instead of arguing about ideal differences. Additionally, having friends who share the same beliefs provides a closer bond. This is due to them seeing others as part of themselves and, as a consequence, treasuring and taking better care of their relationship.

On the other hand, others feel it is better to have friends who share the same beliefs. This is because it might promote personal growth within the group. When friends expose different opinions, individuals have the opportunity to learn something new and change their ideals. For example, colleagues who do not share the same religion might discuss their beliefs' differences and similarities. Moreover, hearing different points of view makes individuals go out of their intellectual comfort zone. This is due to learning a wider variety of perspectives related to the subject, and therefore, expanding one's knowledge about it.

In conclusion, I believe both sides of the argument have merits. However, overall, I think the advantages of having light-hearted chats and developing a stronger bond outweigh the disadvantages of sometimes being stuck on the same ideas and having a limited perspective on a subject. Furthermore, in my opinion, different ideas and opinions can be acquired by talking to family members and work colleagues.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that watching TV programs and movies related to crime are popular. What do you think it's popular and how does it affect to society?' 
 'Text': 'In our contemporary society, people are more likely to watch films that are related to crime. In the forthcoming paragraphs, this essay will delve into the underlying reasons for this penchant and its profound impacts on individuals and societies as a whole and provide a reasonable conclusion.

One of the predominant causes of this interest was the complexity of the program and its demands for a greater understanding of the world around us. To exemplify, some people have a notion that it may seem fascinating to them to unravel some puzzles or mysteries within the movie. Furthermore, from a different standpoint, others can be fed by chaos and violence in certain episodes if they consider it as a source of joy and fulfilment. 

The possible effects of this predisposition are manifold and alarming. Initially, when these kinds of movies are watched by adolescents, they can evoke a sense of horror, placing humans at a heightened risk of harm and even mortality. Conversely, there is no doubt that its upsides cannot be ignored due to the fact that TV programs and movies that contain some crime and legislative events can improve critical thinking and decision-making skills under a high level of pressure. 

In conclusion, after this essay has manifested all the aspects of the phenomenon, the acute 

consequences of watching crime films extend beyond individuals to broader society. It is evident that communities should take into account both the benefits and drawbacks of this propensity. Addressing this issue requires comprehensive efforts, mitigating the potential risks of the dire ramifications while harnessing its boons.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some believe the government spends too much money on space research while there are still a lot of problems on the Earth. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'According to some, the millions spent annually on government-funded space projects would be better invested in addressing urgent issues on this planet. Although there are undoubtedly many problems on Earth that need tackling, I firmly believe that diverting financial resources from space exploration would be a mistake. These projects have brought, and will continue to bring, great benefits to humanity.

An outstanding example of this is the remarkable improvements in our lives due to the developments of satellite technology, a direct result of space exploration. Over several generations, satellites orbiting the Earth have not only facilitated scientific advances in areas such as weather monitoring and navigation but have also transformed our daily lives. Thanks to the satellites, we have witnessed profound changes in the way we connect with each other, using the internet to bridge distances and accessing international news and TV broadcasts with unprecedented convenience. Satellite technology has interconnected the world, shaping the way we live today.

Furthermore, cutting-edge technologies initially developed for space exploration have been successfully adapted and turned into everyday products for use on Earth. These spin-offs cover a wide range, from comfortable memory foam mattresses to tiny cameras in mobile phones, which were developed from efforts to make cameras smaller for use in spacecraft. These examples illustrate how innovations originally intended for space exploration continue to yield practical benefits to humankind.

To sum up, there is no doubt that expenditure on space research is enormous. Yet, upon examining the numerous ways humanity has benefited from it, I am convinced that it is money well spent. The positive impact spans all aspects of human life, from earth monitoring and industrial production to improving the quality of our lives and revolutionizing our leisure time.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'More and more serious crimes seem to be committed each year. Some think that the death penalty is the best way to deal with this problem while other people think different measures are more likely to be successful. Discuss both options.' 
 'Text': 'Security is one of the basic elements of a human being's life. every year a great amount of catastrophic violations occur and several groups of people believe that the execution is the most efficient way of handling these issues whereas others assume alternative actions will have better outcomes. This essay is going to discuss both of these perspectives.

One of the main factors that each country is measured to be a safe and secure one, is the rate of crime in that region. Therefore, numerous people consider it hazardous and claim that those criminals have to be hanged or sentenced to death or they will make streets unsafe for residents. For instance,violations that take place in  public make the atmosphere heavily unapproved for tourists and even for local people. Additionally, these unsafe conditions lower the credibility and reputation of any country in the world in the blink of an eye and act as a barrier to foreign investment.

Given the circumstances, wrongdoing and illegality are blamed by the majority of people throughout the world and doers should be punished and reformed. In this regard, many suppose that there are other options for criminals apart from death and placing these people in specific rehabilitation centres like the one for addicts  will result in better and some of them may be able to return to  society. Moreover, eliminating them will leave  adverse effects on families and may emerge as revenge in another form of crime so using them in compulsory labor will attain success.

In conclusion, self-evidently, crime in  society jeopardises  safety and security and can omit the comfort of the public. this essay discussed both ideas including those who propose execution for criminals and those who believe otherwise.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'More and more people tend to watch foreign movies, so the local government should encourage the development of local film industry. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Watching movies is one of the most favourable parts of life for human beings. To do so, numerous people are now inclined to see movies made in other countries. In this regard, states should try to strengthen their film industry which I totally believe will be a proper idea to preserve culture.

Despite  having some drawbacks, some are willing to watch foreign movies. They claim that they see some novel aspects of the universe and attitudes when they observe those of foreign ones. For instance, they see the world from the foreigner's perspective which differs from the local one. Also, they justify that the equipment and facilities to produce a movie are not the same in all areas and special countries such as the US are pioneers in this regard. Therefore, they disagree with watching only native movies.

However, various films are new schools of thought and penetrate new ideologies which can be positive or negative. Local movies should be at the centre of attention by the governments so that they can develop them as time passes. The reason is to keep the culture and traditions alive and to illustrate it to the public and make revenue. In addition, states can introduce themselves to the world through their modern film industry. In a nutshell, one of the ways to be known in the world goes through movie-making which many countries do currently.

In conclusion, the importance of getting a diverse range of cultures to know is obvious but, I strongly suppose that governments should not ignore the significance of movie's effects on others in the world as well as the potential income it can generate for the country.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Children spend a lot of time watching TV and playing computer games; however, it does not help in improving their mental abilities.

Do you agree or disagree.' 
 'Text': 'In the contemporary world, the effects of electronic devices on our health play such a controversial part in our lives. It is asserted that young people spend a wide range of time on computers and TVs. The writer wholeheartedly agrees with this statement because they will neglect their studies and negatively affect their strength.

It is significant to be aware that education will not be seriously focused on owing to the fact that they use almost their time for playing games and watching programs on TV. By this, the author means that addicts tend to play games instead of studying new lessons or reviewing old ones which makes their knowledge disappear day by day. Furthermore, children's education plays a very essential role in the country’s development potential, the knowledge of today’s young generation is the premise that determines the future development of a country. As a result, the more time they use, the worse academic accomplishments they get.

Another vital ingredient of the case for not using computerized appliances is that it will cause a growing number of adverse effects on mental well-being. It should be obvious that they just want to have private space with their appliances and do not need anyone to talk with. In other words, children will become autistic and gradually isolate themselves from everyone around them. It is unquestionably true to say that their behaviour will also be worse if they are separated from computerized devices. It must also be noted that electronic addicts get bad mental easily.

To sum up, although some people claim that electronic appliances help their mental to improve, I firmly believe that using computerized devices is a useless way to improve mental health.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, a growing number of people with health problems are trying alternative medicines and treatments instead of visiting their usual doctor.

Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?' 
 'Text': 'Currently, many individuals who are dealing with physical and mental issues are taking medications on their own in the replacement of going to the doctor. I personally believe that this statement is a terrible development and will bring great sequences in the long run.

Firstly, regarding the growth of technology, each person owns a smartphone that can have access to widespread information through them, however, not all the information provided is accurate and reliable, as some people are giving some information with no scientific base. As a result, many individuals can be fooled by them and tend to rely on some treatments and medicines to feel better not knowing the consequences of them, which can also be the reason for their future difficulties. For example, there are a variety of physical movements available on social media regarding workouts to prevent backache, but the bones in our back are crucial to our life, and with a sudden wrong movement, the ability to walk might be lost for the rest of our lifetime.

On the contrary, using these supplements without professional help will eventually make the immune system weak day by day so that the white blood cells in our body will not be able to fight against viruses. For instance, a majority of people use anti-biotics on a daily basis when they feel a tiny cold, therefore, studies show that this behaviour has made our blood cells lose their ability to recognize the strange cells and as a result of it, they will attack the beneficial cells, and will cause some serious problems.

To sum up, from my perspective, visiting a doctor often can have several benefits rather than home personal treatments, since these techniques may lead to irreplaceable difficulties in the future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'some people beileve that it is essential to learn a foreign language in school, while others believes that it is not necessary. Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'It is often argued by a few people that it is important to learn a foreign language in institutions. However, others opine that it is not a necessity. This essay will discuss both views as far as I am concerned I am in favour of the former notion.

To commence with,it is significant to study international languages. To explain ,  acquiring  knowledge of overseas languages  will not only broaden up horizon of knowledge but also open up new pathways for the future of pupils.In addition to this,attaining a particular vocabulary creates another option for them if they want to go to that  country where the style is spoken then they do not have to worry about communicating.  For instance,  these days a lot of human beings are moving to Canada and America for further studies and for that they have to take IELTS(International English Learning Test) in which there are speaking, writing, reading and listening tests and there are huge individuals who didn't study English in schools because schooling is in their native speech and they are paying a chunk of money to learn this accent but if school start giving education in English or provide extra classes for that it will help present youth in terms of communication and money too. Learning the basics of languages can be a beneficial factor for some masses.

Shifting toward the final view, why it should be not important because of the stress and extra work. To elaborate , in today's competitive era, learners already have a lot of assignments and  they have to focus on important subjects  ,putting in additional things can create a worrying atmosphere. Hence, they will not be able to concentrate on their studies.

In conclusion, although, schooling outside accent can be a pressure. Yet, I believe it can be  valuable for some individuals.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The grownth of online shopping will one day lead to all shops in towns and cities closing.

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'There is a suggestion that the rise of shopping on the internet will eventually force the closure of all stores in urban areas. I believe it is highly unlikely that it will completely replace physical retail and lead to the closure of all stores in towns and cities.

One reason why I consider this  unthinkable is the value of personal interaction and customer service in retail. Physical stores offer the opportunity for customers to ask questions and receive recommendations from sales staff, which is something that cannot be replicated through online shopping. For instance, clothing and other items that require fitting or trying on are often best purchased in person with guidance from trained professionals. This personal interaction is important to many consumers and is likely to keep them coming back to physical stores.

Another explanation for my negative view that the disappearance of retail outlets is unlikely is the issue of delivery delays and problems. While online shopping can be convenient, there is always the risk of delays or issues with the delivery of purchases. This can be frustrating for customers and may prevent them from choosing online shopping over physical retail. Additionally, certain products, such as fresh produce or flowers, are not well suited to being shipped and may be damaged in transit.

In conclusion, I reaffirm my stance that it is inconceivable that the rise of online shopping will lead to the closure of all stores in towns and cities. This is because online shopping cannot completely replace the value of personal interaction and customer service, or the convenience of being able to purchase certain products in person without unexpected delays or damage from deliveries. Physical retail will continue to have a place in the modern economy, alongside the growth of online shopping.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'International travel is becoming cheaper and countries are opening their door to more and more tourists. Do the advantages of increased tourists outweigh disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'In recent years, the tourism industry has experienced significant growth on an international scale. It is important to maintain a balanced view towards the benefits and drawbacks of this trend,giving the necessary attention to potential issues it may cause, along with viable solutions, in order to enhance the joy of travelling around the globe.

On one hand, the benefits of increased tourism can be seen both economically and socially. Initially, the rise in the number of travellers creates more job opportunities in sectors such as hospitality, catering, and recreational activities, providing essential services to tourists. Additionally, this flow of tourists brings in a substantial amount of money that can help improve and maintain current infrastructure, as well as develop new ones in the destination country. Finally, from a social viewpoint, interactions between people from diverse backgrounds and cultures at tourist attractions can foster positive behaviours like respect, tolerance, and adaptability to different situations and individuals, contributing to efficient social development. Visiting foreign countries and experiencing different cultures can broaden the horizons of the travelling community.

On the other hand, there are also drawbacks and negative effects to consider. Environmental issues such as increased pollution from exhaust fumes emitted by various means of transportation due to more travel, and the generation of waste by tourists during their visits, pose significant threats to the environment . It is essential to implement and  enforce relevant laws and restrictions to prevent irreversible damage to the planet’s nature and wildlife.

In conclusion, the most effective approach to this trend is to maintain a fair attitude towards both its advantages and disadvantages simultaneously.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that professional such as doctors and engineers, should be required to work in the country where they did their training.Others believe they should be free to work in another country if they wish.

Discuss both these views and give yoyr own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Many people opine that the country which trains  health professionals and engineers should bind them to work in their native areas for the betterment of their countrymen.Some folks may not agree with this idea and emphasize  the freedom of employment in the country of their choice.Both these viewpoints have their own merits but I think that the sponsoring society deserves the most to reap the harvest.

Those favouring the jobs of skilled persons in their host states cite many advantages of this proposition.First of all, it helps  a lot in nation-building.If there 

are more doctors in a particular region, it will help in improving the overall public health by providing better patient care.Similarly, the engineers may help in developing good infrastructure thus promoting the standard of living.Secondly, this is useful for the indigenous population who are looking up to such intellectuals for their problem-solving.Because the villagers in many resource-poor areas cannot afford to go abroad for treatment,  it is a big sigh of relief, when their own doctors provide services at their doorsteps.Thirdly, jobs in local areas enable the learned person to practice their skills in the same population on which they were trained.For example, going to another state will pose major challenges to communication and language barriers.On the contrary, serving in native regions would not require new linguistic skills.Fourthly, the idea of working for own community promotes a sense of patriotism and the will to bring positive reforms.

                The view of going abroad for a bright future is also appealing to many individuals.It helps in securing good jobs and handsome salaries.For instance, my colleagues who went to the United States after graduation are earning millions of dollars while those staying back in Pakistan are barely making  ends meet.In addition, migration to resource-rich countries helps improve their skill set as they are exposed to more advanced equipment.Furthermore, shifting abroad provides an opportunity to learn about different cultural and traditional values.

               To summarize, I support the idea of mandatory working of specialist doctors and engineers in a country where they were trained, for the benefit of  society.However, the governments should provide ample facilities to keep the genius minds motivated in their work.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.

Discuss both sides and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'It is said that computers are necessary in order to simply live in the modern world and should be implemented in scholastic teachings. I believe that the presence of personal computerized devices at school should be mandatory and then the reason why it should not. 

Some people believe that electronic devices are now part of our lifestyle and should be introduced in classes because they allow  students to learn things faster. Furthermore, children are fascinated by technology so, efficiently , of course, iPads and laptops are useful to allow them to be more performant. For instance, the College University of Michigan’s study in 2018 showed that using technology in American secondary  grades is, nowadays, 45% more effective than only using books as teaching material. Additionally, 65% of them are used to them in everyday situations, making the offspring learn faster in every subject that uses these technologies. 

Ipads as well as laptops should not be used in class due to the fact that they manipulate the students’ minds, making them not useful for learning. Moreover, by allowing the electronics in classrooms, students tend to not pay attention to the teacher anymore causing the teachings to not be understood properly. For example, Harvard University conducted  research in 2024 on  children’s behaviour in the presence of laptops. The results illustrated that  70% of the time, the presence of electronic devices in classes is prone to distract the offspring’s attention, making the usage of computers in class inefficient. 

To conclude, I personally think that computers should not be introduced into classrooms since they can disrupt the teachings and make the classes ineffective.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays, people have developed poor eating habits and do not eat a balanced diet. What are the reasons behind this? Suggest possible solutions to control this.' 
 'Text': 'Today, many people have adopted irregular and unbalanced diets. There are multiple reasons for this, budget constraints and a busy lifestyle being the most important. These can be mended by avoiding unhealthy food and adopting a nutritious eating routine.

From one point of view, there are various reasons contributing to the prevalence of imbalanced diets, such as demanding work schedules and limited incomes. Many people are deeply occupied with their professional commitments, leaving them with inadequate time for proper meals of hydration. Additionally, low-income individuals are constrained in their ability to afford wholesome food options, thereby affecting their dietary patterns. For instance, the Ministry of Health in Indonesia has reported an increasing proneness to diabetes and heart-related conditions among its citizens.

Some solutions that can be done to this problem are establishing a regular nutrition plan and reducing the consumption of fast food. Maintaining a consistent meal plan that includes a balanced selection of proteins and vegetables is essential. Moreover, the intake of instant noodles, pizza, burgers, and other junk foods should be diminished, as excessive consumption of processed food can elevate the risk of various illnesses. To exemplify, some companies have implemented structured eating timetables for their employees, offering healthy menu options are part of their wellness initiatives.

In conclusion, the modern era’s rapid advancements have produced many issues in our daily lives, including unbalanced dietary intake due to heavy work hours and low earnings. Consequently, there is a need to manage and improve these habits by promoting the consumption of healthy meals.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'As more and more information is available online, the role of textbooks has become obsolete. Therefore, universities should replace traditional books with digital materials. Do the advantages of this situation outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, the accessibility of information on the internet has led to the importance of books on the verge of diminishing. Many people believe that textbooks should be replaced with technological ones. This essay will argue that the benefits of the situation exceed the drawbacks due to its practicality and eco-friendly improvement.

On the one hand, the main advantage of using digital books for college students is its accessibility. People can access books on their mobile phones or computers, which lets them study autonomously with just a click. As a result, the students can cut their expenditures on buying textbooks, which brings opportunities to allot the money to other necessary expenses. In addition, since digital books are paperless, this situation is also beneficial for the environment, hence reducing logging activities. For instance, a 2019 BBC study showed that Indonesia's paper industries have dwindled by around 15% over the last three years. 

Despite the advantages, some people believe that e-books can cause eyestrain. The amount of time spent on screen exposes the retina to ultraviolet rays from the devices. Although radiation is likely to cause farsightedness, it can be prevented using anti-radiation glasses. Moreover, it is a challenging issue for underprivileged university students who cannot afford a particular gadget for e-learning, but in this matter, the institutions or government can resolve it with their financial aid.

In conclusion, while digital material has drawbacks, such as weakening eye vision, that can be avoided by utilizing special glasses, its benefits, including flexibility, convenience, and environmental friendliness, outweigh its disadvantages.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'A healthy person is often described as someone who has a good diet, gets plenty of exercise and avoids stress.

What should people do to stay healthy in your country?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.' 
 'Text': 'A definition of healthy people  these days is  one with a healthy diet and  exercise in their daily routine which helps to release  stress. Mentioned that  here in Venezuela there is a new trend to living in a healthy environment where a combination of lower-fat food with yoga, jogging, swimming or any other kind of sports and/or mindset therapy that could help to release or avoid stress are the strategies taken on the last few years. In this essay, I will explain in more detail how Venezuelan people stay healthy.

First of all, the geography of the country where cities are rounded by mountains allows the citizens to practice highking as a daily exercise, which is  excellent cardiovascular training for the youngest and elder generations. Other options like swimming, yoga and all salon classes  could be practised at the gym. Considering the sports above mentioned, in Valencia we have two spectacular mountains for hiking, \'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'It is better to go out for a live performance (a show or concert) than stay at home watching TV or using the computer. To what extent do you agree or disagree' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, people can enjoy movies and music through personal devices such as laptops or even  smartphones due to information technology developments. However, there are some people who would put effort into watching an art show's direct shows such as opera or live music events. In my opinion, I would prefer to attend the on-site performance despite looking at it on the screen for several reasons.

Live-action theatricals or music concerts give exceptional experiences for some reason. We can enjoy the actors or singers presenting their artwork directly. There is no edited scene or tuned vocals while they performed it in real-time shows so we would see their talent. Then, watching the artist's performance on-site could be a good appreciation for their works because people usually pay more and put more effort into seeing their actions directly through live shows. Enjoying the shows with other fans with similar enthusiasm also gives another impression rather than watching it at home.

Watching an event through an entertainment platform could be more efficient since we can access it whenever we like. Nevertheless, it has a drawback such as the movies or songs might be adjusted to eliminate certain mistakes that could occur during the production, so the viewers were not able to judge their actions.

In conclusion, I agree that attending live action would give a better experience rather than watching it through your personal devices, even though there will be additional effort to enjoy it. In addition, we could assess an artist's talent through their live performance objectively and accurately as a fan.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that professionals, such as doctors and engineers, should be required to work in the country where they did their training. Others believe they should be free to work in another country if they wish.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'There is a controversial discussion going on between notions, as a group of them believe that the ones who have high-class careers such as doctors or engineers have to stay in the actual area where they have been born and trained. On the other hand, others hold the belief that they should have the freedom to choose their working environment. I personally agree with the latter opinion, and I think that each individual has to have a chance to choose their working place.

To begin with, some individuals think that you have to remain in your own country in order to help your own society, as it may bring a sense of belonging and personal culture and identity. They may believe that leaving your hometown to help other societies is not an acceptable manner and it is crucial to be dedicated to your land. Another reason behind this statement is due to the poor economic situation which will lead youngsters to leave the country, as this will put nations in a terrible situation. Furthermore, they may insist on keeping professionals where they were born.

On the other hand, some others argue that each person has to be free to work wherever they want, in order to have a better career path in the future. Some countries are not able to provide the appropriate environment for professional careers to grow, and they would not get the opportunity to meet their needs properly, as a consequence, doctors have no chance other than leaving their town for their personal growth and the feathers provided by other developed countries. For instance, in poor countries, the brain drain is significantly growing due to the lack of support by the government, putting the area in a serious issue. Therefore, individuals have to get the freedom to follow their dreams and get a chance to be better in their chosen path.

To sum up, I strongly believe that each human has the right to choose their path to build a better future for themselves, furthermore, if a society does not provide great chances for professionals, they have to have the freedom to leave that place.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'More and more people want to buy famous brands in clothes cars and other items . What are the reasons behind this trend? Do you think it is a positive or negative development' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays, people increasingly tend to purchase luxury brands in all sorts of goods that are produced. This trend is more likely to be a result of strong advertisements and the impacts of influencers on social media. In my own perspective, it can bring about more negative consequences than positive ones.

Initially, the power of marketing and advertisements of well-known brands should be taken into consideration. They promote their astonishing and luxurious products that benefit from well-defined slogans and eye-catching billboards, which manipulate various minds and persuade them to place orders for any new release of their product lines as soon as possible. Additionally, social media accounts with millions of followers can facilitate the encouraging phase of different targeted consumers and lead to more engaging potential customers apart from existing ones. For example, when Rihanna, a famous celebrity, posts about a particular cosmetic brand on her social media pages like Instagram, the number of people who look for that brand just seconds following, can illustrate the strength of social accounts and the relevant marketing on those platforms.

As a result of this growing number of advocates, there are various implicit and explicit consequences that should be mentioned. Firstly, it can cause a range of disappointing feelings in those who cannot afford to purchase these materials, especially people who live in deprived areas. Secondly, it can convey the notion that experiencing a joyful life only happens when you have a life similar to the community who follow, purchase, and consume these branded products.

In conclusion, it is true that the demand for famous trademarks has seen a rapid increase in recent years. However, it is worth noting that it should be viewed with both its advantages and drawbacks.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'n social situations, some people believe that it is better to be a good listener than a good talker. Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Communication is a key aspect between people, especially so in a social setting. A handful of people hold the opinion that it is vital to be a person who listens well as compared to someone who speaks well. In this essay, I will delve into both sides of the coin before presenting the reason why I think that it is crucial to strike a balance and be the best of both worlds.

To begin, a good listener is someone who takes in the information attentively while the other party is talking. They also give the speaker the opportunity to talk without any interruption. This not only allows the person presenting the information to speak with no pressure but also makes them feel heard. Adding on, a person who listens well always provides a response relative to what they have heard which goes to show they are indeed listening and not just nodding their heads in agreement, making them a great company to be with  A great example would be allowing a friend who has had a bad day to express his grievances without any judgement.

Next, on the other side of the coin, there are the good talkers. They are able to converse fluently with any given topic with anyone who's willing to lend them a listening ear. These people are usually, if not, always, the catalyst of the social event and the people pleaser. A good talker is essential for breaking the ice at any event and is the one with the most connections. For instance, my close friend, Justin is someone who is very well connected due to the fact that he is always the one who initiates conversations. This has opened doors for him to go from job to job with ease due to his wide social circle.

In conclusion, I agree to a certain extent that being a great listening ear is vital but I felt that being a great speaker is also crucial in a social convention as well, due to the limitless possibility of expanding horizons.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'People can eat a wide variety of food that can be grown in other areas. As a result, people eat more food produced in other regions than local food. 

Do you think the advantages of this trend outweigh the disadvantages?' 
 'Text': 'Human beings and all other creatures' hearts beat because they consume something that generates energy and power. People have access to different types of things to eat from other places. Therefore they significantly eat more products from other lands than domestic ones. This essay is going to reveal  how this action is not privileged but rather brings about abnormalities.

There are some people who are not willing to use  native foods and rather choose the non-native ones. For instance, the Turkish Kebab is being consumed by  many Iranian people and these groups believe it is more tasteful than local Kebab. In addition, a diverse range of  fruits being eaten in  most areas does not even belong to those countries. There are advantages regarding this issue on the one hand and some disadvantages on the other hand. When local people are not interested in their original food the producers will be disappointed in producing them due to lack of income and rate of selling and rather will make non-native food in the locality which is not introducing them well.

Besides, some traditional foods which are being cooked in order to preserve the ancient traditions will be exacerbated and eliminated gradually just because there is no demand for them and one day they will see they have completely changed their tastes. What is beneficial is that miscellaneous foods are available everywhere and everyone including the tourists can choose their favourites. Moreover, it has to be approved that some foods are more delicious than others and will be accessible to the whole community. By way of illustration,  fast food is a Western food which is presented all over the world by different names such as KFC, McDonald and so on.

In conclusion, even though there are some advantages to consuming  non-local foods, using the original ones by the local people will maintain culture and tradition as well as improve their qualities by changing  people's tastes over time. Therefore using native foods somehow outweighs utilizing non-native ones.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In some countries, an increasing number of people are suffering from health problems as a result of eating too much fast food. It is therefore necessary for the government to impose a higher tax on this kind of food.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?' 
 'Text': 'Fast food is getting more and more popular in some nations. Thus, the amount of people who are considered overweight is growing. Some people opine that authorities should put taxes on those foods. I agree with this point of view wholeheartedly and I will explain why in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, obesity is a very serious problem and we need to cope with it as soon as possible. When I was a kid, only a few of people looked chubby. Currently, fat people are everywhere. It is terrible! What is the main factor of this problem? I believe fast food contributes to this the most. Fast food such as fried chicken, hamburgers, french fries and so on are quite delicious and people all over the world are crazy about them. However, those foods are unhealthy for human beings, and it is not a good idea to order them fairly often. In my perspective, putting taxes on junk food is a good idea so that we can reduce our desire to eat them and governments can earn more money from this policy, killing two birds with one stone. Otherwise, more and more people are facing weight gain problems. People who are overweight usually have so many problems such as high blood pressure, heart attack, moving slowly, and the like. Therefore, it is not good for our bodies.

In a nutshell, using taxes to stop fast food eating is a good concept, because eating those are detrimental. We may cause many diseases if we eat a lot lot of them and eat them very often.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people in poor countries die from diseases that are curable because they cannot afford the medication required.

Do you believe that drug companies should make their products available at reduced prices in these countries?'
