instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Under British and Australian laws a jury in a criminal case has no access to information about the defendant's past criminal record. This protects the person who is being accused of the crime.

Some lawyers have suggested that this practice should be changed and that a jury should be given all the past facts before they reach their decision about the case.

Do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'According to the British and Australian legislation judge members are not allowed to access the past defendant misdeeds to safeguard the convicts, However, some connoisseurs proposed the change of the rule, permitting the jury to know the outlaws' past life for sake of better judgment. Personally, I agree with the view owing to the fact that shortfall in information could condemn innocents. Although it has its adverse side effects. This essay will shed light on the matter and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, convicts' previous information saves innocents. In other words, it gathers relevant previous records, which help the judge members to take a better decision. Over the past years, 70% of defendants were imprisoned innocently in Australia due to lack of proof, and solely past records could solve the conundrum for instance. As a result, naive individuals were confined, and the criminal justice system was not fair enough. But after the ruling power taking in regard to the expert's suggestion not to blame were acquitted.

On the other hand, the defendant's past facts revive the false past image. Because of what one had done in the past, he could simply be regarded guilt in case of ambiguity in a panel opinion. For example, recent research carried out by the University of Oxford showcased that a considerable number of guiltless were detained only for being in  jail before. Hence, guiltless were jailed. Furthermore, it is the overriding reason for tenure in a plethora of nations.

In conclusion, notwithstanding some drawbacks the proposed change could result in judge members' decision, they should be allowed to access all convicts' past misdeeds for sake of removing all possible misunderstandings. Therefore I still agree with the view and I recommend the local ruling power takes into regard to these experts' proposal.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that everyone has a right to have access to university education and that governments should make it free for all students no matter what financial background they have.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that university education should not have any tuition fees and it should be open for everyone. I strongly agree with this view because  this will provide equality to the poor students as a result of this higher educated citizen will increase and  it can make any country wealthy.

Some meritorious students cannot study in a university is  because they come from poor families. It is a burden for them to maintain the basic necessities for living and consequently, they cannot think about higher studies. For example, a renowned private NGO named 'Brac' did a survey on mass primary literacy in Bangladesh in 1992 and the top reason parents answered regarding not sending their offspring to elementary schools is poor economical conditions. In response to this Bangladesh Primary and Mass Education Ministry made free of tuition fees till the secondary level and now  it has around seventy per cent secondary passed population. Thus, it is obvious that if higher education authorities make after higher secondary level free, that state will become rich in highly educated individuals.

Bachelor, master and research degrees among the mass population can make a nation wealthy. People study to make money for their won and country gets benefited by it too. When any society has more educated people, the authority could involve them in scientific research, send them to other countries where skilled workers are needed which might be helped the government to earn foreign currency. For instance, Bangladesh and the Philippines are two nations that send thousands of skilled workers in middle -east and other countries and around forty per cent of the revenues come from remittances. Hence, free higher studies will encourage individuals to study and a country can reserve foreign dollars. 

In conclusion, university graduation should be free to everyone, it is, therefore, I am convinced that this will make a nation wealthy and provide equality in learning.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Today family members eat fewer meals together.

Why is this?

Is this a positive or negative trend?' 
 'Text': 'Nowadays it is very uncommon in families to meet at a certain time and have breakfast, lunch or dinner together. I believe that this trend has happened because of the ways people balance between work and life and although busy professional activities provide us financial security, it takes the toll on an ideal family life where children might take the wrong path  living.

One of the principal reasons why all the members of a family are not sitting together at the supper table is because individuals have been working more than the normal working hours since the last few decades. As  time progress competitions are increasing tremendously and to survive human need to work harder than their ancestors. For example, in the past citizen's job hours were not more than six  a day but now they need to spend at least nine hours. Therefore, when the breadwinner comes  home , other members might be sleeping already and  it is difficult to find an hour for the family meal.

Hard work pays fortune and thus it is good for the financial stability of a family. When people wake up early before their children, they miss  breakfast and parents usually do this to fulfil the main necessities of the family member. However, offsprings need attention and care from their parents.  Fulfilling the demand is not everything that a parent should do, they should also need to spend some periods with their family members. Sometimes if a child does not get proper attention, they take the wrong route  such as  start smoking, drinking alcohol and even sometimes they take life-threatening drugs like afim and heroine. Hence, it is a moral obligation for every father and mother to speak frankly with children and the best place can be at the dinner table.

In conclusion, while parents a busy making money for the future of their offspring, they miss the precious time that can be easily achievable in an eating place and as a result of it, no child will take an evil road in life.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that it is good to share as much information as possible ina scientific research, bussiness and the acedemic world. Others believe that some information is too important or too valuable to be shared freely.\n\n\nDicuss both the views and give your own opinion?' 
 'Text': 'In today's generation knowledge is the greatest treasure of an individual  life though some human beings say that the distribution of information related to experiments , corporations and educational backgrounds is virtuous. However, further population find this sharing  unpleasant as some facts are quite precious and essential . In my ,opinion this division of data is generally beneficial such as sharing brings a lot of extra ideas and guidance.

Firstly, sharing our input can benefit us with a certain direction and solution which can help us or our occupation to grow. For instance, when I was in class 11 our teacher gave us a project while doing that task I came across a problem , so I eventually told my colleagues about that issue and  after a few minutes they all shower me with a lot of ideas . Therefore, it's good to illustrate our statistics with other people.

Secondly, as we all know nothing in this world is free as a lot of hard work and determination is added to achieve that certain goal . Additionally, our knowledge can be misused by other fellows.For example, if a person is involved in  certain research then the distribution of information regarding that task can disbenefits them as many people may copy this data. Consequently, the providence of knowledge about works can bring  misfortune to a field.

To conclude, mankind views vary like some thinks it's good to share data while others say some figures should be kept hidden but significantly sharing  our work-related info can help a person to improvise its task.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people prefer activities and lifestyles in hot climates while others prefer living in cold climates.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Some would argue that warm and sunny weather is better for living, while others believe that cold climate is perfect for doing activities and lifestyle. Although the freezing season produces different types of green vegetables which are beneficial for health, I personally believe that the summertime brings out the best of living because humans have emotions.

On the one hand, winter is one of the best seasons when new vegetables and fruits grow tremendously. At this time healthy, leafy green vegetables  such as broccoli, cauliflower, beans, and carrots become cheaper and poor people can effort them easily. Hence, This reduces the risk of becoming malnourished for nations. For example, in Bangladesh, in the winter season, farmers grow potatoes, broccoli, lemons, carrots and tomatoes and the price is almost ninety per cent less compared to the market value in other seasons. However, I personally think that cold,foggy and hazy environments do not bring the bright side of the human mood.

On the other hand, whilst in the summer season individuals suffer from extreme sweating and  use air conditioning, this time gives the best emotional state. On  bright sunny days individuals do not need to stay inside, they can work out outside and can have a family picnic somewhere on a lovely beach. For instance, it has been seen that the number of visitors to the world largest sea beach Cox's Bazar is higher just after the winter and it show that people love to break the monotonous life of the cold period.Therefore, I am convinced that everybody wants to move freely and become active with their family members on a beautiful hot blue sunny day.  

In conclusion, a bright sunny day brings the best psychological sides of humans, while freezing haze produces healthy food and it is, thus, I choose hot weather to cold.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.
Discuss both sides and give your opinion.' 
 'Text': 'People hold conflicting views about whether computers are an essential tool in the developed world. While some believe classrooms should be equipped with technologies and their programs are set up for direct lectures functions, others consider that using them can bring drawback effects to teenagers. I would argue that they should be included in the process of teaching because of their benefits.

On the one hand, I believe that there is a range of advantages in teaching through modern technologies. It could be explained that pupils can use laptops in order to search for useful information from appropriate websites, so they can broaden their knowledge as well as update materials quickly. To do that, teachers also need to guide students using it properly. Moreover, teachers may slideshow teaching contents through presentations on laptops or gadgets instead of traditional methods so that the lectures will become lively, attractive and make youngsters remember lessons better. For example, in Europe, many schools are required to install projectors, PC in the classroom and it is mandatory that students have to know how to use them in the studying process.

On the other hand, people think that technologies cause disadvantaged influences to pupils if we depend on them when teaching. It is because using computers regularly will lead to a sedentary lifestyle in the reality of youngsters, as a result, teenagers suffer from school diseases such as nearsightedness, obesity and isolation. For instance, case studies in the USA show that about 50% of pupils are having problems related to their eyes. In addition to learning purposes, students may spend a lot of time on online games without the control or using time balance by parents. 

In conclusion, some people state classrooms should be established with computers and the curriculum need to have teaching direction, others think that they can be certainly troubles for teenagers. In my point of view, I still believe that modern equipment is convenient and supports us with various usefulness in an ever-evolving world.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Museums should display art of their own country, or they should display art from all
over the world. To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'Museums and art galleries are very crucial for the new generation. Like, it can provide a wider perspective of own culture. It is completely agreed that museums should present the art of their own nation as well as of a global village. In this essay, I will try to draw a conclusion with the help of relevant examples. 

Firstly, people can able to look for different kinds of sculptures, monuments and paintings. Above all, it represents the heritage culture of ancient folks. For instance, it can boost forceful bonding with  different communities. Furthermore, pupils can know about different organizations without travelling to a foreign land. Likely, it is vital to portray ancient art of the different regions. It can help particular land to generate revenue and that can be used in renovating museums and in the same way expanding them. 

Secondly, a union should ask for permission before displaying other regional arts in the museum. Also, this exchange will introduce diversity with the region itself, local people will get to explore the history and culture of another place without going to a particular state. For example, the European king was started to colonize throughout Asia and they used the opportunity and took crucial jewellery and historical documents with them. Moreover, some countries consider their arts as national treasures. That is, in a report recently released by WHO, London national museum has 90% of its arts originally from other regions. 

In conclusion, it would be beneficial for the country and their population to know about different heritage cultures of other countries. Government should create more salons that are easily accessible for everyone, however, they should be well maintained and untouchable.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.\n Discuss both views and give your opinion' 
 'Text': 'These days children have a number of activities to become engaged with. While some people are of the view that teachers should not give home exercises for school kids, others are of the opinion that homework is very essential for youngsters. In this essay, I will be discussing both the views and state my opinion that homework is very important in the education of children. There are two primary reasons for this.

To begin with, there are many reasons why school kids should be assigned  daily tasks. Firstly, teenagers nowadays are very occupied with entertainment such as playing video games, using social media to name a few. As a result of which they give less importance to studies. For instance, when teachers start giving day to day tasks, youths effectively utilize their time and complete the targets efficiently. Secondly, assignments aid in helping the students to understand the concepts clearly. Hence kids will practically learn the theoretical concepts by doing the small tasks at home.

On the other hand, there are many disadvantages in delegating children with an assignment as the younger generation find it very stressful. Additionally, they think it is too much burden on them to study not only in their university but also to revise the chapters at home. For example, a recent study done in India showed that youths who are not asked to complete the daily education task in their houses, feel very relaxed and concentrate on studies effectively. Subsequently, they find it less stressful.

By way of conclusion, I reaffirm my position that although there are many drawbacks of assigning younger one's homework, it is very essential because it helps them in understanding the concepts better and utilizing their time effectively.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.

Television dominates the free-time of too many people. It can make people lazy and prevent them from socialising with others.

Do you agree or disagree?

You should write at least 250 words.' 
 'Text': 'A considerable proportion of citizens consumes most of the leisure period on telecasts which deprive them of an active and conversational lifestyle. I strongly coincide with the former declaration, and this essay will hold the reasons for my view.

To commence, the idea of a sedentary life enhanced by television has numerous negative repercussions on the physical aspect of an individual. In other words, people are normally addicted to certain habits where allow them to sit for long hours without moving a single finger. Moreover, they may encounter severe health problems due to uncautious consumption hours for television. As reported in the Stay Fit magazine, the majority of obesity cases are originated from visual advertisements that incentivise consumers to eat frequently. Thus, there are various detrimental effects for seated life systems in front of a screen.

Another compelling reason to support my view is that digital channels embrace the notion of public separation. This means that each person creates a personal space that abandons relationships and social interactions with familiar surroundings. Furthermore, some media programs publish specific materials related to violence in order to favorise human isolation toward others. To demonstrate, my family possesses three televisions because every member generally prefers to see his private show instead of exercising group activities. Hence, television divides expansive communities into tiny units.

To summarize, a convenient number of people is replacing physical activities and moral relationships with a flat electronic machine. I totally agree with this statement because they are digitally seduced by individual immobility and social discrimination.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Many people like unhealthy food although they know it is bad for them. Why? What are the effective ways to improve people's eating habits?' 
 'Text': 'In the modern world where convenience takes priority, more concerns are stemmed from people's consumerism of fast food. Even at the expense of health, people still opt for these unhealthy meals. This essay outlines some possible explanations for this phenomenon and gives out some ways to improve unwholesome eating practices.

 

To begin with, there are many factors lie that account for the general obsessive cravings. Scientific research has discovered that there is a high amount of sugar and saturated fat in these flavourful meals. For these elements, when we consume fast food, our brains generate chemicals stimulating a feeling of happiness and relaxation. Thus, constantly eating food is a way for our brain mechanism to seek pleasure. Moreover, these fat-laden food contains high calories counts so they provide lots of energy for a busy day. This convenience  has led many people with hectic schedules to choose fast food as their favourite meal. Therefore, despite being harmful, fast food is sought after in every meal of the day.

In terms of being healthy, there are some feasible ways to have a salutary eating habit. The crucial thing is substituting high calories food with low energy but a big portion. In order to make this process less painful, people are recommended to find a dish that shares a similar taste . For example, salted nuts and grains can replace crunchy, tasty fried chicken or brown rice with vegetables and sauce can be more delectable than fried rice. In addition to food choices, busy workers are also encouraged to choose eateries providing organic and healthy meals over fast food joints. By strictly adhering to carefully choosing your food, there will be a great enhancement in one's health and invigorates.

To conclude, unhealthy food is undoubtedly palatable because of the aforementioned reasons. However, by changing daily food choices, people can still enjoy the appetizing of dishes while improving their health.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The free movement of goods across national borders has long been a controversial issue. Some people argue that it is necessary for economic growth, while others claim that it damages local industries.\r \r Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'It is true that the free movement of items in most national borders is known as a controversial issue. Many claimes that this is one of the most essential things for economic growth ,however, some people opine that this could be dangerous for domestic products and industries. From my point of ,view, I completely believe that the close economic connection is dispensable for all countries around the world.

Firstly , in my ,opinion, one of the conspicuous reasons for this argument is creating an economic relationship among all countries around the world. For example ,when each area exports its domestic goods to other regions around the globe this could cause countries are not required to produce all items for consumption. It means that all areas on the earth could fulfil the needs of each other and move this stuff to other districts without receiving money. This would create a space where countries could build good communication with each other. Therefore ,this makes it clear why most of the population claims this is necessary to conduct and this should be increased.

By contrast ,others believe that this could close our factories and cease to produce local goods. For instance ,when a particular country import all items that the society needs people do not accept to work in factories and workshops to produce local substances. This could create a dire situation for employers besides they regularly go bust in addition to losing money. As a result ,it becomes apparent this is a noticeable reason behind each claim via the community 

To summarise ,I strongly believe that this trend would create a noteworthy interplay among all districts on the earth. It is predicted that to continue this trend the number of close relationships among areas will proceed to increase in the near future.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.

Write about the following topic.

The only way to reduce the amount of traffic in cities today is by reducing the need for people to travel from home for work, education or shopping.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

You should write at least 250 words.' 
 'Text': 'Arguably, it is commented that the unique and effective measure to shrink traffic congestion these days in cities is to diminish the individuals' necessities in trip, job, schooling or purchasing items in bazaars or supermarket. Personally, I strongly disagree with the view since the ruling power should enhance public facilities. Although shortfall in financial resources hinders  willpower. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, local authorities should build more public expressways. In other words, more alternative roads are needed to respond the today's demand. 70% of wet lanes existing today in  Brazil were made 50 years ago, it is pointed out by the recent investigation done by the local press for instance. As a result, the number of cars has soared causing traffic congestion. Moreover, it is the prime reason for vehicles accidents in many nations throughout the earth.

On the other hand, the shortfall in finances hinders roads renovation. Because of lack of financial resources the local ruling power does not extend the number of ways to suffice the demand. For example,  last year Florida University's investigation showcased that approximately four-fifths of the Africa government does not have money for street maintenance. Hence, the overwhelming majority of the local roads are lanes and bumpy resulting in a plethora of street issues.

In conclusion, notwithstanding money issues being the overriding reason for lack of progress in a myriad of regions, the local cabinets should escalate public expressways and autobahns to tackle the problem. Therefore, I still strongly disagree with the view.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'In their advertising, business nowadays usually emphasize that their products are new in some way. 

Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?' 
 'Text': 'Advertisement is an inseparable process in any kind of business. These strategies include highlighting  goods or services in a refreshed way. In my opinion, it has a positive impact and shows effectiveness in advertising. Thus, companies may increase incomes and we see new advantages of sales.

 Firstly, the main goal of any businessman is the achievement of a better lifestyle and progress in earnings. However, the modern market is highly competitive and challenging, especially if we need to invent something new. For instance, social media ads manager is the most useful tool for sellers in the social media market. As a result, a public notice of sale with unique spots is a proven method to find new customers and reach a bigger profit. The bigger amount of money leads to  economic growth around the world.

 Secondly,  successful advertisers should know how to present an item in such as distinguished and attractive way. As being a client, I need to believe I bought  an incredible and new thing, and take it from a fresh perspective. This is an amazing and creative job as a being promoter, moreover, is not a simple one and must be paid well. 

To sum up, the whole market uses these advertising methods to grow a business, even if it is a new or already famous company. Advertisements help with economic developments and can be supportive for every old and young business. You need to be extremely talented, work under pressure and be able always how to  make an old thing a new one again. Finally, due to past experiences, I can predict that this approach will exist for the next centuries.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The leaders or directors of organizations are often elderly people. However, some sat that young people can also take the lead of organizations or companies.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'A certain number of  current employees adopt a convenient notion that the new generation can play a substantial role in business management. I strongly coincide with the former declaration, and this essay will hold the reasons for my view.

To commence, millennials increases the tendency of a workplace that is more ethical and environmentally friendly. In other words, all social boundaries will be eliminated among the staff because of the slight discrepancies in the age which will lead to a common sense of comprehension and cooperation. Moreover, young directors lean to be more comfortable with the professional atmosphere wherever it is located. For instance, my formal manager prefered to work in an open space office in order to assist his team directly. Thus, younger leaders represent a valuable and genial  element in companies. 

Another compelling reason to support my view is that millenniums embraced change and exhibited significant skills at marketing fresh ideas. This means that they have the courage to make difficult decisions, possibly because their lack of experience causes them to be more optimistic about their proposals for improvement.Furthermore, They knew how to get others energized and excited about accomplishing objectives. As reported in  Forbes magazine, the incentive of Mark Zuckerberg,the founder of Facebook, guide to create an application that reflects an initiative for further innovations in social media platforms. Hence, the desire to involve is an influential character for the early generation.

To summarize, young persons possess all the essential tools in order to take control of the business. I totally agree with this statement because they are more amicable and innovative.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that universities should provide graduates with the knowledge and skills needed in the workplace. Others think that the true function of a University should be to give access to knowledge for its own sake regardless of whether the course is useful to an employer. \nWhat, in your opinion, should be the main function of a University?' 
 'Text': 'Recently, an educational issue related to the main function of a university has been widely discussed among people the world over. Some argue that universities should only provide students with the knowledge and skills needed in the workplace. I disagree with this viewpoint almost entirely. As far as effectiveness, technology development, and finance are concerned, I strongly hold that university should teach all kinds of technology regardless of whether the course is useful to the work.

To begin with, there are complex relativities among different subjects. It is hard for students to learn the knowledge without learning pre-courses. For instance, To study physics, we must learn mathematics first. Secondly, it is universally acknowledged that some of the state-of-the-art knowledge is hardly used in the workplace. If universities do not teach them may stop the technology from developing. 

Last but important, it is undeniable that reducing the teaching items would benefit the economy in the short term. However, It is at the expense of preventing technology and labour development. For example, my neighbour Yu Qian has learned the repairment of pager, which was eliminated to lose his jobs and live in poverty. Therefore, the wrong teaching orient of universities is harmful to technological progress and economic development.

In conclusion, the teaching contexts of universities should not be at the orient of employment. On the opposite, they should give access to knowledge for their sake. And students also should be well-advised to pay more attention to those which basis but important knowledge.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.\nTo what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?' 
 'Text': 'People recently are face lots of celebrities whom most of them are known for their beautiful face and huge money which they owe ,rather than their abilities.That is a wrong perception for others specifically youths who tend to mimic  celebrities.I agree with this statement somewhat but I think it is not totally true.

In my opinion,celebrities such as Hollywood actors who are rich obtained most of their wealth from working however,after being famous people only see their money.Unfortunately,the process of advertising do not focus on their abilities and shows them as a person who has lots of money and attracts people in this way. Many  celebrities introduce commercial products and encourage people to follow them and purchase manufacturers.As a result, they do not show  their talent at these parts of their work.Additionally,youngers who like to be at this  level of wealth be confused about the right way of progressing .

On the other hand,teenagers who often have a favour to be famous try to make themself like celebrities.Consequently,they wear clothes and make up the same as their favourite actor or singer,therefore,these younger people will expose to some vulnerable results .we hear from news about youths who wanted to be famous unfortunately,they involved in  gang groups who are shown by some celebrities for benefits.Moreover, the celebrities should be aware fans to know their life story in order to promote their training and hardworking.

In conclusion,seeing celebrities on the media is not their real life.It is unquestionable that  famous persons did lots of efforts to achieve their position but  they do not have a desire to express that to others.The teachers and parents need to educate their children to study celebrities achievements in addition to their income and appearance.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays university education is considered very important for people's future. However, there are a lot of successful people who didn't get higher education.\n\nDo you think that higher education is necessary to succeed in life?' 
 'Text': 'Having  higher schooling from university   plays a brighter role in person future and this thing is popular currently in the world. But, there are countable successful people, who didn't get higher study. From my perspective higher education is as vital as anything else to be successful in life. And my position is argued further.

To begin with, some groups of folk said that higher education is not important to be successful. In that case, if someone is popular in their fields doesn't mean they did all the hard work but there are some educated people who helped them to be in that position. For instance, the most popular platforms like Instagram or WhatsApp in that business there are engineers who designed codes to work properly in that application and even regular checking of the data and perfection which only maintained by IT technicians. Hence, they are successful in life but this is all because of people who did higher studies.

Besides this, while having an idea doesn't mean anybody can make anything but for ,that you need to have skills and knowledge and that will be only achieved by higher study. For example, the Ubar cab maker does have an idea and they did start a smaller start-up through 20 cars but they provide their position to the engineer to run and grow that business while he stayed down for some time until  are they popular worldwide. So having knowledge and but for perfect implication is always comes from studies.

Thus to conclude that having higher education in the current time is much needed because having that skills and degree on your side means someone definitely feels your value even successful ones too.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.

‘Failure is proof that the desire wasn’t strong enough’

To what extent do you agree with this statement?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

You should write at least 250 words.' 
 'Text': 'Some individuals commented that flaw is the evidence that the willpower to be successful was not there. Personally, I strongly disagree with the view since it is a shortfall in time management, and inappropriate techniques to accomplish the mission. Although sometimes luck and the holy spirit must be there. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, allocation of time and appropriate techniques lead to victory. In the other words, to avoid failure individuals should adopt the right skills and spend the necessary time for it. For instance, the recent investigation carried out by the University Zambeze last year showcased that solely the IELTS takers who followed their tutors' instructions and spent at least three hours on computer screen approved. As a result, a plethora of them was delighted and successful in their activities. Furthermore, it is pointed out as the prime reason for high approval in schools and Universities.

On the other hand, the presence of God glosses over failure. Because of his ubiquity, no matter the time allocated and the abilities one has if he is out of God's protection the chance to be unsuccessful escalates. 40% of Universities students who devoted their time studying to exams with skilled tutors were reported not to be approved due to lack of connection with holy spirits for example. Hence, despite a lot of efforts they made, it was diminished to nill. Moreover, this is the overriding purpose for widespread prays in stadiums, hospitals, and before any activity goes on.

In conclusion, notwithstanding the need for Jesus' blessing to one be well-succeeded, the hours' administration and the right capabilities proved to be the most pivotal Therefore, I still strongly disagree with the statement.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people think that the government should take care of disadvantaged people such as the unemployed and the homeless.\nDo you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'A considerable proportion of citizens adopt the notion that social deficiencies such as deflation and unsettlement request state intervention. I strongly coincide with the former declaration, and this essay will hold the reasons for my view.  

To commence, leaving refugees, in rural areas, without any resources has numerous negative repercussions on national security. In other words, it would lead to major crime in the public because homeless people may attempt to steal essential merchandise from grocery stores in order to survive the day. Moreover, they could disturb tourists by demanding some financial assistance like money or clothing which will encroach their personal privacies. To demonstrate, I was visiting Istanbul last summer when certain destitute persons appeared in my way requesting a couple of dollars. Thus, countries that possess a number of deprived individuals is suffering from harmful effects on their safety.     

Another compelling reason to support my view is disadvantaged communities are very similar to other social groups. This means that retired employees and patients with special disabilities are being suitably treated by the government, however, they paid taxes or not. Furthermore, the majority of well-being are affected by ethics and moral values which motivate to reduce global poverty through charities and campaigns. As reported in UNICEF in 2020, one dollar per capita is sufficient to produce one meal which represents a fair cost to be contributed from each nation. Hence, deficient personals resemble every member of society.

To summarize, every human living without accommodation or financial support is under public responsibility. I totally agree with this statement because the public sector should remove him from the streets to avoid disorder and should provide equal life opportunities among citizens.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Young people who commit crimes should be treated in the same way as adults who commit crimes. To what extend do you agree or disagree?' 
 'Text': 'A considerable proportion of citizens adopt a preconceived notion that atrocities are considered equal in the eyes of justice despite the legal category age. I strongly oppose  the former declaration, and this essay will hold the reasons for my view.

To commence, leading a minor to an equivalent prison for adults has numerous negative repercussions on the generic development of a human. In other words, the type of nutrition that generally includes insufficient nutritional elements is not appropriate in terms of adequate body’s growth. Moreover, there are certain rules inside the jail that oblige prisoners to adjust their daily routines which will affect various physical aspects such as sleeping hours and though works. As reported in the Times magazine in 2015, a significant number of suicide cases under legal age has been registered in police records due to detrimental treatment inside penal institutions. Hence, the experience of balanced punishment facilities has proved harmful effects on the healthy involvements of a young individual. 

Another compelling reason to support my view is that the mind of a juvenile did not attend a complete maturity in order to be convicted similarly to grown persons. This means that special tribunals are allocated for juniors. Additionally, numerous countries rely on rehabilitation centres because they believe that minors need  special care that will provide a second opportunity  for a prosperous future. To demonstrate, I had my relative who was addicted to drugs,however, the Canadian government procured required assistance which led him to the way of salvation. Thus, conviction is treated differently according to the mental level of each person.

In conclusion, some people consider that crimes people must be evaluated identically among social groups. I totally disagree with this statement because of unfavourable consequences on the natural growth and mental completion of an adolescent.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'The tendency of human beings to copy one another is shown in the popularity of areas such as fashion and consumer goods.

To what extent do you agree?' 
 'Text': 'It is argued that there is a copying tendency in fashion and consumer products among humans where they mimic another person. I strongly agree with this statement because people follow celebrities and are motivated by  advertisements.

One of the main reasons why individuals follow someone else's fashion is because those well-known individuals are their idols. Usually, Hollywood actors bring new  trend and their followers buy  similar design clothes. It is not only in the film industry but also in sports. For example, in every news media there was one particular topic when the world greatest footballer Mr Lionel Messi joined  the France football club Paris Saint Germain is how much profit PSG is going by selling Messi's kit. This is happened because of the personal image and charismatic skills of Messi. However, there are persons who still believe that comfort is the basis for  fashion and they do not run after any celebrity design.

Another reason I agree with this view is that most   people love advertisements.  It has been seen that  good advert attracts consumers and companies pay a high amount of money in promoting their goods. For instance, there was an incident in Bangladesh where  citizens saw advertisements regarding an online shopping platform named Evaly and its discounted offers. They  ordered and suffered due to the companies wrong business policy. Nonetheless, individuals need to know which products or offers are good instead of copying from the advert.

In conclusion, people love to mimic their celebrity idol's dresses, lifestyles and even if they buy products if these celebrities promote.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'international tourism has brought enormous benefit to many places. At the same time, there is concern about its impact on local inhabitants and the environment.

Do the disadvantages of international tourism outweigh the advantages?' 
 'Text': 'Connoisseurs throughout the earth have debated whether the benefits of  worldwide travel outweigh  its  pitfalls or not. Personally, I believe that the drawbacks do not outweigh the boons since it is the source of  revenues  for a wide variety of nations.  Although  it  has  its disadvantages. This essay will shed light on both sides of the matter and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, international touristry is a source of countries' incomes. In other words,  many  nations survive through it. The touristry industry contributed  10-15% of  PIB for 32 European, African , and American countries in the last 5 years, facts confirmed by the UN overhaul  made recently for instance. As a result,   individuals' social life enhanced and their economies have grown up. Moreover,  a significant  number of   the world-ruling power are creating  natural  beauty spots  to  rise tourism attraction in their lands.

On the other hand, the travelling industry brings human traffic. Because of  its straightforwardness  to connect  people  around the world,  a myriad of tourists deceives local citizens promising them employment and a high standard of life.  For example,  the recent investigation by UNICEF showcased that  one in ten commuters throughout the world   were involved in children traffic. Hence,  the local communities saw travellers as deceivers.  Furthermore,   it is the overriding reason for police  criminal records internationally.

In conclusion, notwithstanding its downsides, international touristry  is the future of  the earth folk. Therefore I still believe that its  benefits outweigh the disadvantages.  I recommend world authorities  soar the number of  tourism facilities for sake of their economic growth.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Nowadays longer distances are travelled by people to work and study on a daily basis. Some considered it to be a negative development.  While others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'Recently, a societal issue related to commuting distance has been widely discussed among people the world over. Some argue that it brings negative effects while others disagree. As far as urbanization, economy and health are concerned, I strongly hold that the advantages of longer travel distances far outweigh the disadvantages.

On the one hand, It is undeniable that longer travel length brings some disadvantages. For instance, individuals have to spend more time commuting. It does harm to the efficiency. In addition, longer length means more expenditure on commute. In the present society, there are many individuals who still suffer from chronic poverty. They cannot afford the commute cost so that they are hard to get appropriate jobs.

On the other hand, longer commute distance also has benefits to individuals and society. First of all, although the commute is extending, the cost would not increase too much because public traffic is  developing too. Secondly, with the development of urbanization, the environment of the city centre is gradually deteriorating. According to a recent survey, four million people die each year from diseases linked to environmental problems. Therefore, many people migrate to the countryside at expense of extending the commute time to living in a healthy environment. For example, my friend Yu Qian resident in the city centre who was diagnosed with cancer. He supposed that the terrible environment was the cause of his disease.

In conclusion, I suppose that longer travel distance has more advantages than disadvantages as long as resolving some problems such as traffic cost and commute time. Government should be well-advised to give priority to developing public traffic.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'During our careers, we work with many different kinds of people.  All of them have unique characteristics and personality traits. In your opinion, which of the following is the most important characteristic of a coworker?
•  a serious attitude regarding their work obligations
•  a willingness to learn new things
•  the ability to make other people laugh' 
 'Text': 'In lifespan, individuals have opportunities to work with a plethora of  job-mates with a particular character.  Personally, I believe that attitude considering job obligations is the most pivotal  a coworker should have since it  increases companies' profits and helps with career growth. Although  the willpower to know new things and to be hilarious  plays their role. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, a serious attitude regarding companies' obligations  soars  enterprise income. In other words,  devoted professionals grow a team, which is the ultimate goal for employees.  60% of employees were reported  fascinated by  working with  dedicated inmates because they  accomplished their duties on time for instance.  Furthermore,  they were responsible for the increased salary  inside these enterprises.  As a result, workers' social life was enhanced and communities were delighted.

On the other hand, the desire to learn new duties and the capabilities to make others  laugh was the source of the community staff unit. Because of the interest in learning new activities  along with being connected through laughter,  workers were more united and  it advanced the enterprise environment. For  example,  the recent  investigation carried out by the University Zambeze pointed out  that  40% of the staff of  a reputable consortium were more closed due to their inmates' techniques to  make fun and  learn new  tasks. Hence, stakeholders  were hilarious to work with the company. Moreover,  it  escalated the  consortium income.

In conclusion,  despite all of the three  aspects pointed out being relevant  to  enterprise growth, I still believe that  the first is the most advantageous. Therefore, I  recommend  group top staff to  hire  employees with these skills for sake of  the increased yield and  happy environment.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that the best way to improve public health is by increasing the number of sports facilities.Others, however, say that this would have little effect on public health and that other measures are required.\nDiscuss both the views and give your own opinion.' 
 'Text': 'The public health topic has always sparked heated debates among society. It is believed by many that, in order to enhance the shape of a given community, the number of sports facilities got to be increased since it will encourage a healthy lifestyle. From my perspective, I believe that other measures could be more beneficial for this public system, such as building new hospitals. 

First and foremost, prevention is undoubtedly an excellent measure to stay fit and in a good mental state. Consequently, several persons assert that sport has many benefits, though it keeps the cardio-vascular system trained and prevents heart strokes. Moreover, creating new sports facilities  will certainly encourage younger generations to adopt a healthy lifestyle. For example, it was noticed by a sociologist that in neighbourhoods where several swimming pools and basketball fields were available, the inhabitants of those areas contracted fewer heart failures, and pupils were less obese .

However, the aforementioned reasons will only lead to scant results. Indeed, the Coronavirus pandemic we have been suffering from the last 2 years have proved that our care organization suffers a huge shortage in terms of hospital beds and public infrastructure in general. For this reason, governments have the urge to build new health facilities. Furthermore, persons that suffer from chronic diseases frequently reported that daily medication cost an arm and a leg, politicians and experts should endow those people with free medication. 

In conclusion, it is undeniable that prevention is a fundamental step to keep in shape. Despite ,that, the public organization needs more profound reforms in order to improve the well being of citizens.'

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
'Question': 'Some people say that public sports facilities improve people health problems. Others argue that this development has insignificant effects on public health.\nDiscuss both views and give your opinion' 
 'Text': 'Some people commented that the best way to enhance folk medical problems is done by soaring game infra-structures. However, others believe that this advancement would lead to an insignificant impact on individuals' health. Personally, I advocate the second view opposing the first since, industrialized food and tightened work schedule is behind this. Although, these furnishings could contribute significantly to boosting their lifestyle. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence to prove the arguments.

On the one hand, industrialized meals are responsible for crowd medical issues. In other words, these days people consume factory based meals like hot dogs, and sandwiches, which are not  healthy diets, it leads to a plethora of clinical diseases such as obesity and heart attack. Let us take sugar as an example, the World Health Organization recommends only a teacup spoon daily, that said, 90% of Women and  Men eat three times more than the quantity endorsed. As a result, a myriad of them has high cholesterol leading to illnesses. 

On other hand, sports infra-structures shrink people's work stress. Because of high demanded jobs, individuals need public facilities to warm and exercise to relax. 60% of full-time employees were found out  relaxed after spending a day per week in gyms, according to the University Zambeze overhaul carried out last year for instance. Hence, workers were more encompassed in their employments and it soared profits. Furthermore, it is seen as the overriding reason for reduced hospitalization for supporters of the idea.

In conclusion, notwithstanding some benefits coming from sports settlement, it does not play a relevant role on folk lifestyle because lately what they are eating does. Therefore, I still believe that the quality of individuals' food defines their medical condition. I recommend ruling power economize financial resources that should be used to construct these facilities to allocate to other social projects.'
